Heading.TitleText: Presentation of Additional Information — Infants Six Months of Age or Older but Less Than One Year of Age

Subsection.Text: This section applies to a prepackaged product that is intended solely for infants six months of age or older but less than one year of age.

If information referred to in column 1 of the table to section B.01.402 is included in a nutrition facts table that is set out in a version consisting of a table in English and a table in French or a table in English or French, that information shall be displayed

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in accordance with the order of presentation, the use of indents and the presentation of footnotes illustrated in Figures 33.1(E) and (F) of the Directory of NFT Formats; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of matters other than those referred to in paragraph (a), in accordance with the format that is specified in the applicable figure in the Directory of NFT Formats.

Subsection.Text: If information referred to in column 1 of the table to section B.01.402 is included in a nutrition facts table that is set out in a version consisting of a table in both English and French, that information shall be displayed

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in accordance with the order of presentation, the use of indents and the presentation of footnotes illustrated in Figure 34.1(B) of the Directory of NFT Formats; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of matters other than those referred to in paragraph (a), in accordance with the format that is specified in the applicable figure in the Directory of NFT Formats.

Subsection.Text: Despite paragraph (2)(a), the use of indents illustrated in Figures 33.1(E) and (F) of the Directory of NFT Formats is not applicable if information referred to in column 1 of the table to section B.01.402 is set out in the linear format referred to in paragraph B.01.461(3)(c) or the simplified linear format referred to in paragraph B.01.462(3)(c).

Despite section A.01.016, the nutrition facts table of a prepackaged product that meets the condition specified in subsection B.01.454(3) or B.01.455(3), paragraph B.01.457(2)(b), subsection B.01.461(3) or B.01.462(3) or paragraph B.01.463(2)(b) may be set out on

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a tag attached to the package;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a package insert;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the inner side of a label;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a fold-out label; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: an outer sleeve, overwrap or collar.

Subsection.Text: If the nutrition facts table is set out in a manner described in paragraph (1)(b) or (c), the outer side of the label of the package shall indicate in a type size of not less than 8 points where the nutrition facts table is located.
If the nutrition facts table is set out in a manner described in subsection (1), it shall be set out

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a product described in subsection B.01.454(3), in a version that is described in paragraph B.01.454(3)(a), (b) or (c) or that is listed in column 1 of the table to section B.01.454;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a product described in subsection B.01.455(3), in a version that is described in paragraph B.01.455(3)(a), (b) or (c) or that is listed in column 1 of the table to section B.01.455;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a product described in paragraph B.01.457(2)(b), in a version that is described in subparagraph B.01.457(2)(b)(i) or that is listed in column 1 of the table to section B.01.457;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a product described in subsection B.01.461(3), in a version that is described in paragraph B.01.461(3)(a), (b) or (c) or that is listed in column 1 of the table to section B.01.461;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a product described in subsection B.01.462(3), in a version that is described in paragraph B.01.462(3)(a), (b) or (c) or that is listed in column 1 of the table to section B.01.462; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a product described in paragraph B.01.463(2)(b), in a version that is described in subparagraph B.01.463(2)(b)(i) or that is listed in column 1 of the table to section B.01.463.

Subsection.Text: Despite section A.01.016 and subject to subsection (2), if the available display surface of a prepackaged product is less than 100 cm2, the label of the product need not carry a nutrition facts table if the outer side of the label contains an indication of how a purchaser or consumer may obtain the nutrition information that would otherwise be required to be set out in a nutrition facts table on the label of the product.
Subsection (1) does not apply to a prepackaged product that is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: described in paragraph B.01.401(3)(a), (b), (c) or (e); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: contained in a package to which a label cannot be physically applied or on which information cannot be legibly set out and easily viewed by the purchaser or consumer under the customary conditions of purchase.

Subsection.Text: However, subsection (1) applies to a prepackaged product that is referred to in paragraph B.01.401(3)(c) and subparagraph B.01.401(3)(e)(ii) and that meets the conditions set out in column 2 of item 37 of the table following section B.01.513 for the subject “Free of sugars” set out in column 1 if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the product does not contain an added vitamin or mineral nutrient;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the energy value expressed in Calories per serving of stated size and the amount of sugar alcohols expressed in grams per serving of stated size are shown immediately following the list of ingredients or the food allergen source, gluten source and added sulphites statement, as defined in subsection B.01.010.1(1), or the declaration referred to in subsection B.01.010.4(1), if that statement or declaration appears on the label; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the product referred to in subparagraph B.01.401(3)(e)(ii), a statement or claim set out in column 4 of item 37 of the table following section B.01.513 for the subject “Free of sugars” set out in column 1 that appears on the label is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: legibly set out on the principal display panel,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in lower case letters except for the first letter of each word of the statement or claim, which may be an upper case letter,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: of at least the same size and prominence as the letters used in the numerical portion of the declaration of net quantity as required under paragraph 229(1)(a) and subsections 229(2) and (3) of the Safe Food for Canadians Regulations, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: displayed in a colour contrasting with the background of the label.

Subsection.Text: An indication referred to in subsection (1)

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be set out in a type size of not less than 8 points;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall include a postal address or a toll-free telephone number; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall be

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in English and French, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in one of those languages, if in accordance with subsection B.01.012(3) or (7) the information that is required by these Regulations to be shown on the label of the product may be shown in that language only and is shown on the label in that language.

Subsection.Text: The manufacturer of the prepackaged product shall provide the information referred to in subsection (1) to a purchaser or consumer on request

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: without charge;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the following manner, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the official language in which the information is requested or, if specified by the purchaser or consumer, in both official languages, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in one of the official languages, if in accordance with subsection B.01.012(3) or (7) the information that is required by these Regulations to be shown on the label of the product may be shown in that language only and is shown on the label in that language; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the form of a nutrition facts table that is set out

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in a format, other than a horizontal format, that is specified in any of sections B.01.454 to B.01.459 or B.01.461 to B.01.464 and that would otherwise be carried on the label of the product in accordance with these Regulations, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in a version of that format that is listed in column 1 of item 1 of any Part of the table to the applicable section referred to in subparagraph (i).

Subsection.Text: In this section, official languages means the English language and the French language.
Subject to subsection (2), if a prepackaged product has an available display surface of less than 100 cm2 and has a nutrition facts table on its label, the nutrition facts table need only include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the serving of stated size;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the energy value and, subject to subsection (2), the amount of nutrients referred to in column 1 of items 2 to 15 of the table to section B.01.401 if the amount shown in the nutrition facts table may not be expressed as “0” according to the manner set out in column 4; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of any sugar alcohol, vitamin or mineral nutrient added to the prepackaged product.

Subsection.Text: If the label of a prepackaged product, or any advertisement for the product that is made or placed by or on the direction of the manufacturer of the product, contains a representation, express or implied, that includes information that is set out in column 1 of the table to section B.01.401 or B.01.402, that information shall also be in the nutrition facts table.

Section.Label: B.01.469
Section.Text: Despite subsection B.01.401(1), the label of a prepackaged product that has an available display surface of less than 15 cm2 need not carry a nutrition facts table.

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in this section and in the table following section B.01.513.

Definition.Text: combination foods means the category of food to which belong foods that contain as ingredients foods from more than one food group, or foods from one or more food groups mixed with foods from the category of other foods, such as pizza or lasagna. (aliments composés)
food group means one of the following categories of foods:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: milk products, and milk product alternatives such as fortified plant-based beverages;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: meat, poultry and fish, and alternatives such as legumes, eggs, tofu or peanut butter;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: bread and grain products; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: vegetables and fruit. (groupe alimentaire)

Definition.Text: other foods means the category of food to which belong foods that are not part of any food group, including

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: foods that are mostly fats, such as butter, margarine, oil or lard;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: foods that are mostly sugars, such as jam, honey, syrup or confectionery;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: snack foods, such as potato chips or pretzels;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: beverages, such as water, tea, coffee or soft drinks; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: herbs, spices and condiments, such as pickles, mustard or ketchup. (autres aliments)

Definition.Text: reference food of the same food group means a food that can be substituted in the diet for the food to which it is compared and that belongs to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the same food group as the food to which it is compared, such as cheese as a reference food for milk, or chicken as a reference food for tofu;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the category of other foods, if the food to which it is compared also belongs to that category, such as pretzels as a reference food for potato chips; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the category of combination foods, if the food to which it is compared also belongs to that category, such as pizza as a reference food for lasagna. (aliment de référence du même groupe alimentaire)

Definition.Text: similar reference food means a food of the same type as the food to which it is compared and that has not been processed, formulated, reformulated or otherwise modified in a manner that increases or decreases the energy value or the amount of a nutrient that is the subject of the comparison, such as whole milk as a similar reference food for partly skimmed milk or regular chocolate chip cookies as a similar reference food for fat-reduced chocolate chip cookies. (aliment de référence similaire)

Subsection.Text: The similar reference food referred to in column 3 of item 45 of the table following section B.01.513, with respect to the subject “light in energy or fat” set out in column 1, shall have a nutrient value that is representative of foods of that type that have not been processed, formulated, reformulated or otherwise modified in a manner that increases the energy value or the amount of fat.

Section.Label: B.01.501
Section.Text: The representations provided for in sections B.01.503 to B.01.513 that appear on the label of a food shall be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in English and French; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in one of those languages, if in accordance with subsection B.01.012(3) or (7) the information that is required by these Regulations to be shown on the label of the food may be shown in that language only and is shown on the label in that language.

Subsection.Text: No person shall, on the label of or in any advertisement for a food, make a representation, express or implied, that characterizes the energy value of the food or the amount of a nutrient contained in the food.
Subsection (1) does not apply to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a representation otherwise provided for in these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a representation provided for by paragraph 272(1)(f) or section 273 of the Safe Food for Canadians Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a representation provided for by column 1 of Table 2 to Volume 7 of the document entitled Canadian Standards of Identity, prepared by the Canadian Food Inspection Agency and published on its website, as amended from time to time;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a representation that characterizes the amount of lactose in a food;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a representation that characterizes the addition of salt to a food, other than any statement or claim set out in column 4 of the table following section B.01.513;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a representation that characterizes the addition of sugars to a food, other than any statement or claim set out in column 4 of the table following section B.01.513;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a representation that characterizes the amount of starch in a food, if the food is intended solely for children under two years of age;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the representations “defatted (naming the food)”, “demineralized (naming the food)” and “high (naming the monosaccharide or disaccharide) (naming the syrup)”;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: a representation that characterizes the amount of a fatty acid in a vegetable oil and forms part of its common name;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: a representation that characterizes the amount of alcohol in beverages that contain more than 0.5% alcohol;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: the representation “light salted” with respect to fish; or

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: the English representation “lean” with respect to a prepackaged meal represented for use in a weight reduction diet or a weight maintenance diet.

Subsection.Text: A person may, on the label of or in any advertisement for a food, make a statement or claim set out in column 4 of the table following section B.01.513, with respect to a subject set out in column 1, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the food meets the applicable conditions set out in column 2;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the label or advertisement meets the conditions, if any, set out in column 3, in accordance with sections B.01.504 to B.01.506; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a food that is not a prepackaged product, or a prepackaged product for which an advertisement is not made or placed by or on the direction of the manufacturer of the product, the label or advertisement includes, per serving of stated size, and in accordance with section B.01.505 or B.01.506 if applicable,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the declaration of the energy value, if the energy value is the subject of the statement or claim, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the amount of the nutrient, if a nutrient is the subject of the statement or claim.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (1), no person shall, on the label of or in any advertisement for a food that is intended solely for children under two years of age, make a statement or claim set out in column 4 of the table following section B.01.513, unless it is a statement or claim respecting one of the following subjects set out in column 1:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: “source of protein”, set out in item 8;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: “excellent source of protein”, set out in item 9;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: “more protein”, set out in item 10;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: “no added sodium or salt”, set out in item 35; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: “no added sugars”, set out in item 40.

Subsection.Text: The information required by paragraph (1)(c) need not be included on the label of or in any advertisement for a fresh vegetable or fruit or any combination of fresh vegetables or fruits without any added ingredients, an orange with added food colour or a fresh vegetable or fruit coated with mineral oil, paraffin wax, petrolatum or any other protective coating, if a statement or claim set out in column 4 of the table following section B.01.513 is made on the label or advertisement.

If a statement or claim set out in column 4 of the table following section B.01.513 is made on the label of or in any advertisement for a food, all the words, numbers, signs or symbols that constitute the statement or claim shall be of the same size and prominence.
In the English version of the statements or claims, the word “fibre” may be spelled as “fiber”.

Section.Label: B.01.504
Section.Text: If a statement or claim set out in column 4 of the table following section B.01.513 is made on the label of a food, the information required under the conditions set out in column 3 shall be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: adjacent to, without any intervening printed, written or graphic material,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the most prominent statement or claim on the principal display panel or, if none appears there, the most prominent statement or claim elsewhere on the label, if the statement or claim is made more than once; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shown in letters of at least the same size and prominence as

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: those of the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: those of the most prominent statement or claim on the principal display panel or, if none appears there, the most prominent statement or claim elsewhere on the label, if the statement or claim is made more than once.

Section.Label: B.01.505
Section.Text: If a statement or claim set out in column 4 of the table following section B.01.513 is made in an advertisement for a food, other than a radio or television advertisement, the information required under the conditions set out in column 3 and, if applicable, the information required by paragraph B.01.503(1)(c), shall be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: adjacent to, without any intervening printed, written or graphic material, the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or the most prominent statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made more than once; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shown in letters of at least the same size and prominence as those of the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or the most prominent statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made more than once.

Subsection.Text: If a statement or claim set out in column 4 of the table following section B.01.513 is made in a radio or television advertisement, the information required under the conditions set out in column 3 and, if applicable, the information required by paragraph B.01.503(1)(c), shall be provided in the advertisement, except for the information required under the condition set out in paragraph (a) of column 3, in respect of the following subjects set out in column 1, which may be on the label:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: “reduced in energy”, set out in item 3;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: “reduced in fat”, set out in item 13;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: “reduced in saturated fatty acids”, set out in item 20;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: “reduced in trans fatty acids”, set out in item 23;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: “reduced in cholesterol”, set out in item 29;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: “reduced in sodium or salt”, set out in item 33;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: “lightly salted”, set out in item 36;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: “reduced in sugars”, set out in item 38; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: “light in energy or fat”, set out in item 45.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (1), if the statement or claim is made in a radio or television advertisement that is not made or placed by or on the direction of the manufacturer of the food, the information required under the condition set out in paragraph (a) of column 3 of the table following section B.01.513, in respect of the subjects set out in paragraphs (1)(a) to (i), shall be provided in the advertisement.

If the information required under the conditions set out in column 3 of the table following section B.01.513 and the information required by paragraph B.01.503(1)(c) is provided in a radio advertisement or in the audio portion of a television advertisement, that information shall immediately precede or follow the statement or claim.

In the case of a television advertisement, the information required under the conditions set out in column 3 of the table following section B.01.513 and, if applicable, the information required by paragraph B.01.503(1)(c), shall be communicated

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the audio mode, if the statement or claim is made only in the audio portion of the advertisement or in both the audio and visual portions; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the audio or visual mode, if the statement or claim is made only in the visual portion of the advertisement.

Subsection.Text: If the information required under the conditions set out in column 3 of the table following section B.01.513 and the information required by paragraph B.01.503(1)(c) is communicated in the visual mode of a television advertisement, it shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: appear concurrently with and for at least the same amount of time as the statement or claim;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: be adjacent to, without any intervening printed, written or graphic material, the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or the most prominent statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made more than once; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: be shown in letters of at least the same size and prominence as those of the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or the most prominent statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made more than once.

Section.Label: B.01.507
Section.Text: A person may, on the label of or in any advertisement for a food, make a representation, express or implied, that the food is for use in an energy-reduced diet, if a statement or claim set out in column 4 of the table following section B.01.513, in respect of any of the following subjects set out in column 1, is made on the label of or in the advertisement for the food, in accordance with section B.01.503:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: “free of energy”, set out in item 1;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: “low in energy”, set out in item 2;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: “reduced in energy”, set out in item 3;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: “lower in energy”, set out in item 4; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: “free of sugars”, set out in item 37.

Section.Label: B.01.508
Section.Text: A person may, on the label of or in any advertisement for a food, make a representation, express or implied, that the food is for use in a sodium-restricted diet, if a statement or claim set out in column 4 of the table following section B.01.513, in respect of any of the following subjects set out in column 1, is made on the label of or in the advertisement for the food, in accordance with section B.01.503:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: “free of sodium or salt”, set out in item 31;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: “low in sodium or salt”, set out in item 32;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: “reduced in sodium or salt”, set out in item 33; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: “lower in sodium or salt”, set out in item 34.

Section.Label: B.01.509
Section.Text: A person may, on the label of or in any advertisement for a food, make the statement or claim that the food is “unsweetened” if the food meets the conditions set out in column 2 of item 40 of the table following section B.01.513 for the subject “no added sugars” set out in column 1 and the food does not contain a sweetener set out in column I of Table IX to section B.16.100.

Section.Label: B.01.510
Section.Text: A statement or claim set out in column 4 of the table following section B.01.513, respecting the following subjects set out in column 1, that is made on the label of or in an advertisement for a breakfast cereal with milk, shall be accompanied by an indication that it refers to 30 g of the breakfast cereal combined with 125 mL of milk:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: “source of protein”, set out in item 8;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: “excellent source of protein”, set out in item 9; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: “more protein”, set out in item 10.

Subsection.Text: For greater certainty and subject to subsections (2) to (4), a statement or claim set out in column 4 of the table following section B.01.513 that is made on the label of or in any advertisement for a food may be preceded or followed by other words, numbers, signs or symbols, but none of those shall be interposed between the words, numbers, signs or symbols of the statement or claim.
The words “very”, “ultra” and “extra”, and all other words, numbers, signs or symbols that modify the nature of a statement or claim, shall not precede or follow the statement or claim.

A statement or claim that is made on the label of or in any advertisement for a food that has not been processed, formulated, reformulated or otherwise modified to meet the conditions set out in column 2 of the table following section B.01.513 shall not be accompanied by the brand name of the food.

Any words, numbers, signs or symbols preceding or following the statement or claim referred to in subsection (3) shall accompany the statement or claim in such a manner that the statement or claim characterizes all foods of that type, and not only the specific food.

Section.Label: B.01.512
Section.Text: If a food meets the conditions set out in column 2 of the table following section B.01.513 for more than one of the subjects set out in column 1, it is not necessary to repeat the common element of the statements or claims set out in column 4 that are used on the label of or in the advertisement for the food, and the remaining elements may be joined by means of a conjunction or punctuation, as appropriate.

Subsection.Text: No person shall, on the label of or in any advertisement for a food, make the statement or claim “light” or “léger” — including any phonetic rendering of that statement or claim — respecting a sensory characteristic of the food unless the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the statement or claim “light” or “léger” is made on the label of a food, the sensory characteristic shall be

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: adjacent to, without any intervening printed, written or graphic material,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the most prominent statement or claim on the principal display panel or, if none appears there, the most prominent statement or claim elsewhere on the label, if the statement or claim is made more than once, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: shown in letters of at least the same size and prominence as

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: those of the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: those of the most prominent statement or claim on the principal display panel or, if none appears there, the most prominent statement or claim elsewhere on the label, if the statement or claim is made more than once;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the statement or claim “light” or “léger” is made in an advertisement for a food, other than a radio or television advertisement, the sensory characteristic shall be

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: adjacent to, without any intervening printed, written or graphic material, the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or the most prominent statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made more than once, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: shown in letters of at least the same size and prominence as those of the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or the most prominent statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made more than once;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the statement or claim “light” or “léger” is made in a radio advertisement or in the audio portion of a television advertisement, the sensory characteristic shall immediately precede or follow the statement or claim; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if the statement or claim “light” or “léger” is made in the visual portion of a television advertisement, the sensory characteristic shall

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: appear concurrently with and for the same amount of time as the statement or claim,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: be adjacent to, without any intervening printed, written or graphic material, the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or the most prominent statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made more than once, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: be shown in letters of at least the same size and prominence as those of the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or the most prominent statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made more than once.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply to the statement or claim “light” or “léger” when it is used with respect to rum.

Section.Label: B.01.600
Section.Text: A statement or claim set out in column 1 of the table following section B.01.603 that appears on the label of a food shall be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in English and French; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in one of those languages, if in accordance with subsection B.01.012(3) or (7) the information that is required by these Regulations to be shown on the label of the food may be shown in that language only and is shown on the label in that language.

Subsection.Text: A food with a label or advertisement that carries a statement or claim set out in column 1 of the table following section B.01.603 is exempt from the provisions of the Act and its Regulations with respect to drugs, and from subsections 3(1) and (2) of the Act, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the food meets the applicable conditions set out in column 2;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the label of or the advertisement for the food meets the applicable conditions set out in column 3; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the food is not

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: intended solely for children under two years of age, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a food represented for use in a very low energy diet.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply to a food that comes within the definition of drug as defined in section 2 of the Act for a reason other than the fact that its label or advertisement carries a statement or claim referred to in that subsection.
Subsection (1) applies even if the word “graisses” in the French version of the statement or claim is replaced by the word “lipides”.

The information required under the conditions set out in column 3 of the table following section B.01.603 that appears in an advertisement for a food that is not a prepackaged product, or in an advertisement for a prepackaged product that is not made or placed by or on the direction of the manufacturer of the product, shall,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an advertisement, other than a radio or television advertisement, be

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: adjacent to, without any intervening printed, written or graphic material, the statement or claim set out in column 1, if the statement or claim is made only once, or the most prominent statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made more than once, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: shown in letters of at least the same size and prominence as those of the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or the most prominent statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made more than once;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a radio advertisement or the audio portion of a television advertisement, immediately precede or follow the statement or claim set out in column 1; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a television advertisement, be communicated

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the audio mode, if the statement or claim set out in column 1 is made only in the audio portion of the advertisement or in both the audio and visual portions, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the audio or visual mode, if the statement or claim set out in column 1 is made only in the visual portion of the advertisement.

Subsection.Text: The information that is communicated in the visual mode of a television advertisement in accordance with subparagraph (1)(c)(ii) shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: appear concurrently with and for at least the same amount of time as the statement or claim;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: be adjacent to, without any intervening printed, written or graphic material, the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or the most prominent statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made more than once; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: be shown in letters of at least the same size and prominence as those of the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or the most prominent statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made more than once.

Subsection.Text: For greater certainty, a statement or claim set out in column 1 of the table following this section that is made on the label of or in any advertisement for a food may be preceded or followed by other words, numbers, signs or symbols, but none of those shall be interposed between the words, numbers, signs or symbols of the statement or claim.

If a food meets the conditions set out in column 2 of the table following this section for more than one item of that table, it is not necessary to repeat the common element of the statements or claims set out in column 1 that are used on the label of or in the advertisement for the food, and the remaining elements may be joined by means of a conjunction or punctuation, as appropriate.

Provision.Text: meets the conditions set out in column 2 of item 32 of the table following section B.01.513 for the subject “low in sodium or salt” set out in column 1, if the label of or advertisement for the food carries statement or claim (2), (4) or (6) set out in column 1 of this item; and

Provision.Label: (g)
Provision.Text: contains 350 mg or more of potassium, if the label of or advertisement for the food carries statement or claim (3), (4), (5) or (6) set out in column 1 of this item,

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: per reference amount and per serving of stated size, or

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: per serving of stated size, if the food is a prepackaged meal.

If the statement or claim is made on the label of or in the advertisement for a food that is not a prepackaged product, or in the advertisement for a prepackaged product that is not made or placed by or on the direction of the manufacturer of the product, the label or advertisement shall include the amount of sodium and potassium per serving of stated size, in accordance with section B.01.602, if applicable. However, this requirement does not apply if the statement or claim is made on the label of or in the advertisement for a fresh vegetable or fruit or any combination of fresh vegetables or fruits without any added ingredients, an orange with added food colour or a fresh vegetable or fruit coated with mineral oil, paraffin wax, petrolatum or any other protective coating.

“A healthy diet with adequate calcium and vitamin D, and regular physical activity, help to achieve strong bones and may reduce the risk of osteoporosis. (Naming the food) is a good source of calcium.”
“A healthy diet with adequate calcium and vitamin D, and regular physical activity, help to achieve strong bones and may reduce the risk of osteoporosis. (Naming the food) is high in calcium.”

“A healthy diet with adequate calcium and vitamin D, and regular physical activity, help to achieve strong bones and may reduce the risk of osteoporosis. (Naming the food) is an excellent source of calcium.”
“A healthy diet with adequate calcium and vitamin D, and regular physical activity, help to achieve strong bones and may reduce the risk of osteoporosis. (Naming the food) is very high in calcium.”

“A healthy diet with adequate calcium and vitamin D, and regular physical activity, help to achieve strong bones and may reduce the risk of osteoporosis. (Naming the food) is an excellent source of calcium and vitamin D.”

“A healthy diet with adequate calcium and vitamin D, and regular physical activity, help to achieve strong bones and may reduce the risk of osteoporosis. (Naming the food) is very high in calcium and vitamin D.”
The food

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: other than a vegetable or fruit, does not meet the conditions set out in column 2 of item 2 of the table following section B.01.513 for the subject “low in energy” set out in column 1;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: contains no more phosphorus, excluding that provided by phytate, than calcium;

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: contains 0.5% or less alcohol;

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: contains, if the label of or advertisement for the food carries statement or claim (1) or (2) set out in column 1 of this item,

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: 200 mg or more of calcium per reference amount and per serving of stated size, or

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: 300 mg or more of calcium per serving of stated size, if the food is a prepackaged meal;

Provision.Label: (e)
Provision.Text: contains, if the label of or advertisement for the food carries statement or claim (3), (4), (5) or (6) set out in column 1 of this item,

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: 275 mg or more of calcium per reference amount and per serving of stated size, or

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: 400 mg or more of calcium per serving of stated size, if the food is a prepackaged meal; and

Provision.Label: (f)
Provision.Text: contains 1.25 µg or more of vitamin D, if the label of or advertisement for the food carries statement or claim (5) or (6) set out in column 1 of this item,

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: per reference amount and per serving of stated size, or

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: per serving of stated size, if the food is a prepackaged meal.

If the statement or claim is made on the label of or in the advertisement for a prepackaged product, by or on the direction of the manufacturer of the product, the nutrition facts table shall include the amount of vitamin D and phosphorus, in accordance with subsection B.01.402(2).

If the statement or claim is made on the label of or in the advertisement for a food that is not a prepackaged product, or in the advertisement for a prepackaged product that is not made or placed by or on the direction of the manufacturer of the product, the label or advertisement shall include the amount of vitamin D, calcium and phosphorus per serving of stated size, in accordance with section B.01.602, if applicable. However, this requirement does not apply if the statement or claim is made on the label of or in the advertisement for a fresh vegetable or fruit or any combination of fresh vegetables or fruits without any added ingredients, an orange with added food colour or a fresh vegetable or fruit coated with mineral oil, paraffin wax, petrolatum or any other protective coating.
“A healthy diet low in saturated and trans fats may reduce the risk of heart disease. (Naming the food) is free of saturated and trans fats.”
“A healthy diet low in saturated and trans fats may reduce the risk of heart disease. (Naming the food) is low in saturated and trans fats.”
The food

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: other than a vegetable or fruit, does not meet the conditions set out in column 2 of item 2 of the table following section B.01.513 for the subject “low in energy” set out in column 1;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: contains at least 10% of the weighted recommended nutrient intake of a vitamin or a mineral nutrient

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: per reference amount and per serving of stated size, or

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: per serving of stated size, if the food is a prepackaged meal;

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: contains 100 mg or less of cholesterol per 100 g of food;

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: contains 0.5% or less alcohol;

Provision.Label: (e)
Provision.Text: if it is a fat or an oil, meets the conditions set out in

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: column 2 of item 25 of the table following section B.01.513 for the subject “source of omega-3 polyunsaturated fatty acids” set out in column 1,

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: column 2 of item 26 of the table following section B.01.513 for the subject “source of omega-6 polyunsaturated fatty acids” set out in column 1, or

Provision.Label: (iii)
Provision.Text: subparagraphs (i) and (ii);

Provision.Label: (f)
Provision.Text: contains

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: 480 mg or less of sodium per reference amount and per serving of stated size, and per 50 g if the reference amount is 30 g or 30 mL or less, or

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: 960 mg or less of sodium per serving of stated size, if the food is a prepackaged meal;

Provision.Label: (g)
Provision.Text: meets the conditions set out in column 2 of item 18 of the table following section B.01.513 for the subject “free of saturated fatty acids” set out in column 1, if the label of or advertisement for the food carries statement or claim (1) set out in column 1 of this item; and

Provision.Label: (h)
Provision.Text: meets the conditions set out in column 2 of item 19 of the table following section B.01.513 for the subject “low in saturated fatty acids” set out in column 1, if the label of or advertisement for the food carries statement or claim (2) set out in column 1 of this item.

If the statement or claim is made on the label of or in the advertisement for a food that is not a prepackaged product, or in the advertisement for a prepackaged product that is not made or placed by or on the direction of the manufacturer of the product, the label or advertisement shall include the amount of saturated fatty acids and trans fatty acids per serving of stated size, in accordance with section B.01.602, if applicable. However, this requirement does not apply if the statement or claim is made on the label of or in the advertisement for a fresh vegetable or fruit or any combination of fresh vegetables or fruits without any added ingredients, an orange with added food colour or a fresh vegetable or fruit coated with mineral oil, paraffin wax, petrolatum or any other protective coating.
“A healthy diet rich in a variety of vegetables and fruit may help reduce the risk of some types of cancer.”
The food

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: is one of the following vegetables, fruits or juices and may contain only food additives that are referred to in section 2 of a marketing authorization, sweetening agents, salt, herbs, spices, seasonings and water:

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: a fresh, frozen, canned or dried vegetable,

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: a fresh, frozen, canned or dried fruit,

Provision.Label: (iii)
Provision.Text: a vegetable or fruit juice, or

Provision.Label: (iv)
Provision.Text: a combination of the foods set out in subparagraphs (i) to (iii);

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: is not one of the following:

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: potatoes, yams, cassava, plantain, corn, mushrooms, mature legumes and their juices,

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: vegetables or fruit used as condiments, garnishes or flavourings, including maraschino cherries, glacé fruit, candied fruit and onion flakes,

Provision.Label: (iii)
Provision.Text: jams or jam-type spreads, marmalades, preserves and jellies,

Provision.Label: (iv)
Provision.Text: olives, or

Provision.Label: (v)
Provision.Text: powdered vegetables or fruit; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: contains 0.5% or less alcohol.
“A healthy diet rich in a variety of vegetables and fruit may help reduce the risk of heart disease.”
The food

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: is one of the following vegetables or fruits and may contain only food additives that are referred to in section 2 of a marketing authorization, salt, herbs, spices, seasonings and water:

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: a fresh, frozen, canned or dried vegetable,

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: a fresh, frozen, canned or dried fruit,

Provision.Label: (iii)
Provision.Text: a vegetable juice or vegetable drink, or

Provision.Label: (iv)
Provision.Text: a combination of the foods set out in any of subparagraphs (i) to (iii);

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: is not one of or does not contain any of the following:

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: potatoes, yams, cassava, plantain, mature legumes and their juices,

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: vegetables or fruit used as condiments, garnishes or flavourings, including maraschino cherries, glacé fruit, candied fruit and onion flakes,

Provision.Label: (iii)
Provision.Text: jams or jam-type spreads, marmalades, preserves and jellies,

Provision.Label: (iv)
Provision.Text: olives,

Provision.Label: (v)
Provision.Text: a fruit juice or fruit drink,

Provision.Label: (vi)
Provision.Text: powdered vegetables or fruit, or

Provision.Label: (vii)
Provision.Text: the seed of a fruit known as a drupe, including almonds, cashews and coconuts;

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: contains 0.5% or less alcohol; and

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: contains less than 15% of the daily value of sodium per reference amount and per serving of stated size, and per 50 g if the reference amount is 30 g or 30 mL or less.
“Won’t cause cavities.”
“Does not promote tooth decay.”
“Does not promote dental caries.”
“Non-cariogenic.”
The food is a chewing gum, hard candy or breath freshener product that

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: contains 0.25% or less starch, dextrins, mono-, di- and oligosaccharides or other fermentable carbohydrates combined; or

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: does not, if it contains more than 0.25% fermentable carbohydrates, lower plaque pH below 5.7 by bacterial fermentation during 30 minutes after consumption as measured by the indwelling plaque pH test, referred to in “Identification of Low Caries Risk Dietary Components” by T.N. Imfeld, Volume 11, Monographs in Oral Science, 1983.

If the statement or claim is made on the label of or in the advertisement for a prepackaged product, by or on the direction of the manufacturer of the product, the nutrition facts table shall include the amount of sugar alcohols, if present, in accordance with subsection B.01.402(2).

Section.Label: B.02.001
Section.Text: The foods referred to in this Division are included in the term alcoholic beverage.

Section.Label: B.02.002
Section.Text: In this Division,

Definition.Text: absolute alcohol means alcohol of a strength of 100 per cent; (alcool absolu)
age means the period during which an alcoholic beverage is kept under such conditions of storage as may be necessary to develop its characteristic flavour and bouquet; (âge)
alcohol means ethyl alcohol; (alcool)
flavouring means, in respect of a spirit, any other spirit or wine, domestic or imported, added as a flavouring to that spirit as authorized under the Excise Act; (substance aromatique)

grain spirit means an alcoholic distillate, obtained from a mash of cereal grain or cereal grain products saccharified by the diastase of malt or by other enzymes and fermented by the action of yeast or a mixture of yeast and other micro-organisms, and from which all or nearly all of the naturally occurring substances other than alcohol and water have been removed; (esprit de grain)

malt spirit means an alcoholic distillate, obtained by pot-still distillation from a mash of cereal grain or cereal grain products saccharified by the diastase of malt and fermented by the action of yeast or a mixture of yeast and other micro-organisms; (esprit de malt)

molasses spirit means an alcoholic distillate, obtained from sugar-cane or sugar-cane products fermented by the action of yeast or a mixture of yeast and other micro-organisms, from which all or nearly all of the naturally occurring substances other than alcohol and water have been removed; (esprit de mélasse)
small wood means wood casks or barrels of not greater than 700 L capacity; (petit fût)
sweetening agent means glucose-fructose, fructose syrup or any food for which a standard is provided in Division 18, or any combination thereof. (agent édulcorant)

Section.Label: B.02.003
Section.Text: If an alcoholic beverage contains 1.1% or more alcohol by volume, the percentage by volume of alcohol present in the alcoholic beverage shall be shown on the principal display panel

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: followed by the words “alcohol by volume” or the abbreviation “alc./vol.” or “alc/vol”; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: preceded by the abbreviation “alc.” or “alc” and followed by the abbreviation “vol.” or “vol”.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell flavoured purified alcohol in a container with a capacity of 1,000 mL or less unless it contains 25.6 mL or less of alcohol.
Subsection (1) does not apply to flavoured purified alcohol that is sold in a glass container with a capacity of at least 750 mL.
For the purposes of this section, flavoured purified alcohol means an alcoholic beverage

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that is obtained from an alcohol base that has been purified during the course of manufacture through a process other than distillation and from which most of the naturally occurring substances other than alcohol and water have been removed; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to which has been added during the course of manufacture any substance or mixture of substances that imparts flavour.

Section.Label: B.02.010
Section.Text: [S]. Whisky or Whiskey, other than Malt Whisky, Scotch Whisky, Irish Whisky, Canadian Whisky, Canadian Rye Whisky, Rye Whisky, Highland Whisky, Bourbon Whisky and Tennessee Whisky,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be a potable alcoholic distillate, or a mixture of potable alcoholic distillates, obtained from a mash of cereal grain or cereal grain products saccharified by the diastase of malt or by other enzymes and fermented by the action of yeast or a mixture of yeast and other micro-organisms; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain caramel and flavouring.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be a potable alcoholic distillate, or a mixture of potable alcoholic distillates, obtained by the distillation of a mash of malted grain fermented by the action of yeast or a mixture of yeast and other micro-organisms;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall possess the aroma, taste and character generally attributed to malt whisky; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: may contain caramel and flavouring.

Section.Label: B.02.016
Section.Text: [S]. Scotch Whisky shall be whisky distilled in Scotland as Scotch whisky for domestic consumption in accordance with the laws of the United Kingdom.

Section.Label: B.02.017
Section.Text: No person shall blend or modify in any manner any Scotch whisky that is imported in bulk for the purpose of bottling and sale in Canada as Scotch whisky except by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: blending with other Scotch whisky,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the addition of distilled or otherwise purified water to adjust to a required strength, or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the addition of caramel.

Section.Label: B.02.018
Section.Text: [S]. Irish Whisky shall be whisky distilled in Northern Ireland or in the Republic of Ireland as Irish whisky for domestic consumption in accordance with the laws of Northern Ireland or the Republic of Ireland.

Section.Label: B.02.019
Section.Text: No person shall blend or modify in any manner any Irish whisky that is imported in bulk for the purpose of bottling and sale in Canada as Irish whisky except by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: blending with other Irish whisky,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the addition of distilled or otherwise purified water to adjust to a required strength, or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the addition of caramel.

Subsection.Label: [S]. (1)
Subsection.Text: Canadian Whisky, Canadian Rye Whisky or Rye Whisky

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: be a potable alcoholic distillate, or a mixture of potable alcoholic distillates, obtained from a mash of cereal grain or cereal grain products saccharified by the diastase of malt or by other enzymes and fermented by the action of yeast or a mixture of yeast and other micro-organisms,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: be aged in small wood for not less than three years,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: possess the aroma, taste and character generally attributed to Canadian whisky,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: be manufactured in accordance with the requirements of the Excise Act and the regulations made thereunder,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: be mashed, distilled and aged in Canada, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: contain not less than 40 per cent alcohol by volume; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain caramel and flavouring.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (3), no person shall make any claim with respect to the age of Canadian whisky, other than for the period during which the whisky has been held in small wood.

Where Canadian whisky has been aged in small wood for a period of at least three years, any period not exceeding six months during which that whisky was held in other containers may be claimed as age.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be a potable alcoholic beverage blended in Canada from

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 25 per cent malt whisky calculated on an absolute alcohol basis, distilled in Canada or Scotland, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: whisky; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may, if it contains 51 per cent or more malt whisky distilled in Scotland, be labelled or advertised as containing malt whisky distilled in Scotland.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), no person shall label, package, sell or advertise any food as Bourbon Whisky, or in such a manner that it is likely to be mistaken for Bourbon whisky unless it is whisky manufactured in the United States as Bourbon whisky in accordance with the laws of the United States applicable in respect of Bourbon whisky for consumption in the United States.

A person may modify Bourbon whisky that is imported for the purpose of bottling and sale in Canada as Bourbon whisky by the addition of distilled or otherwise purified water to adjust the Bourbon whisky to a required strength.

Subject to subsection (2), no person shall label, package, sell or advertise any food as Tennessee Whisky, or in such a manner that it is likely to be mistaken for Tennessee whisky unless it is a straight Bourbon whisky produced in the State of Tennessee and manufactured in the United States as Tennessee whisky in accordance with the laws of the United States applicable in respect of Tennessee whisky for consumption in the United States.

A person may modify Tennessee whisky that is imported for the purpose of bottling and sale in Canada as Tennessee whisky by the addition of distilled or otherwise purified water to adjust the Tennessee whisky to a required strength.
Subject to sections B.02.022 and B.02.022.1, no person shall sell for consumption in Canada any whisky that has not been aged for a period of at least three years in small wood.

Nothing in subsection (1) applies in respect of flavouring contained in whisky, but no person shall sell for consumption in Canada whisky containing any flavouring, other than wine, that has not been aged for a period of at least two years in small wood.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be a potable alcoholic distillate, or a mixture of potable alcoholic distillates, obtained from sugar-cane or sugar-cane products fermented by the action of yeast or a mixture of yeast and other micro-organisms;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: caramel,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: fruit and other botanical substances, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: flavouring and flavouring preparations; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if it is imported in bulk for the purpose of bottling and sale in Canada as imported rum, may only be

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: modified by adding distilled or otherwise purified water to adjust the rum to the strength stated on the label applied to the container,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: modified by adding caramel, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: blended with other imported rum or, in the case of rum sold as Caribbean rum, with other rum.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell for consumption in Canada any rum that has not been aged for a period of at least one year in small wood.

Nothing in subsection (1) applies in respect of flavouring contained in rum, but no person shall sell for consumption in Canada rum containing any flavouring, other than wine, that has not been aged for a period of at least one year in small wood.

Section.Label: B.02.040
Section.Text: [S]. Hollands, Hollands Gin, Geneva, Geneva Gin, Genever, Genever Gin or Dutch-type Gin

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be a potable alcoholic beverage obtained

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: by the redistillation of malt spirit with or over juniper berries, or by a mixture of the products of more than one such redistillation,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: by the redistillation of a combination of malt spirit and not more than four times its volume on an absolute alcohol basis of grain spirit with or over juniper berries, or by a mixture of the products of more than one such redistillation, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: by the blending of malt spirit, redistilled with or over juniper berries, with not more than four times its volume on an absolute alcohol basis of grain spirit or molasses spirit, or by a mixture of the products of more than one such blending;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: other aromatic botanical substances, added during the redistillation process, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: caramel;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall not contain more than two per cent sweetening agent;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: may be labelled or advertised as being distilled, where subparagraph (a)(i) or (ii) is complied with; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: shall be described on the principal display panel of its label and in any advertisements as blended gin, where subparagraph (a)(iii) is complied with.

Section.Label: B.02.041
Section.Text: [S]. Gin, other than Hollands, Hollands Gin, Geneva, Geneva Gin, Genever, Genever Gin or Dutch-type Gin,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be a potable alcoholic beverage obtained

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: by the redistillation of alcohol from food sources with or over juniper berries, or by a mixture of the products of more than one such redistillation, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: by the blending of alcohol from food sources, redistilled with or over juniper berries, with alcohol from food sources or by a mixture of the products of more than one such blending;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: other aromatic botanical substances, added during the redistillation process,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a sweetening agent, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a flavouring preparation for the purpose of maintaining a uniform flavour profile; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: may be labelled or advertised as Dry Gin or London Dry Gin if sweetening agents have not been added.

Section.Label: B.02.043
Section.Text: No person shall make any claim for age for gin but gin that has been held in suitable containers may bear a label declaration to that effect.

Section.Label: B.02.050
Section.Text: [S]. Brandy, other than Armagnac Brandy or Armagnac, Canadian Brandy, Cognac Brandy or Cognac, Dried Fruit Brandy, Fruit Brandy, Grappa, Lees Brandy and Pomace or Marc,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be a potable alcoholic distillate, or a mixture of potable alcoholic distillates, obtained by the distillation of wine; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: caramel,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: fruit and other botanical substances, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: flavouring and flavouring preparations.

Section.Label: B.02.051
Section.Text: [S]. Armagnac Brandy or Armagnac shall be brandy manufactured in the Armagnac district of France in accordance with the laws of the French Republic for consumption in that country.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be a potable alcoholic distillate, or a mixture of potable alcoholic distillates, obtained by the distillation of wine that has been fermented in Canada; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: caramel,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: fruit and other botanical substances, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: flavouring and flavouring preparations.

Section.Label: B.02.053
Section.Text: [S]. Cognac Brandy or Cognac shall be brandy manufactured in the Cognac district of France in accordance with the laws of the French Republic for consumption in that country.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be a potable alcoholic distillate, or a mixture of potable alcoholic distillates, obtained from sound dried fruit; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: caramel,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: fruit and other botanical substances, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: flavouring and flavouring preparations.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be a potable alcoholic distillate, or a mixture of potable alcoholic distillates, obtained by the distillation of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: fruit wine or a mixture of fruit wines, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a fermented mash of sound ripe fruit other than grapes, or a mixture of sound ripe fruits other than grapes;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: caramel,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: fruit and other botanical substances, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: flavouring and flavouring preparations; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: may be described on its label as “(naming the fruit) brandy” if all of the fruit or fruit wine used to make the brandy originates from the named fruit.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be a potable alcoholic distillate, or a mixture of potable alcoholic distillates, obtained by the distillation of the pomace from sound ripe grapes after the removal of the juice or wine; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: caramel

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: fruit and other botanical substances, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: flavouring and flavouring preparations.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be a potable alcoholic distillate, or a mixture of potable alcoholic distillates, obtained by the distillation of the lees of wine or fruit wine;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: caramel,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: fruit and other botanical substances, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: flavouring and flavouring preparations; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: may be described on its label as “(naming the fruit) Lees Brandy” if all of the lees used to make the brandy originate from the named fruit.

Section.Label: B.02.058
Section.Text: [S]. Pomace or Marc

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be a potable alcoholic distillate, or a mixture of potable alcoholic distillates, obtained by the distillation of the skin and pulp of sound ripe fruit after the removal of the fruit juice, wine or fruit wine;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: caramel,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: fruit and other botanical substances, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: flavouring and flavouring preparations; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: may be described on its label as “(naming the fruit) Pomace” or “(naming the fruit) Marc” if all of the skin and pulp used to make the brandy originate from the named fruit.

Section.Label: B.02.059
Section.Text: No person shall blend or modify in any manner any brandy that is imported in bulk for the purpose of bottling and sale in Canada as imported brandy, except by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: blending with other imported brandy;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the addition of caramel; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the addition of distilled or otherwise purified water to adjust the brandy to a required strength.

Section.Label: B.02.060
Section.Text: Where brandy is wholly distilled in a country other than Canada, the label shall indicate the country of origin.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell any brandy that has not been aged for a period of at least one year in wooden containers or at least six months in small wood.

Nothing in subsection (1) applies in respect of flavouring contained in brandy, but no person shall sell brandy containing any flavouring, other than wine, that has not been aged for a period of at least one year in wooden containers or at least six months in small wood.
Nothing in subsection (1) or (2) applies in respect of brandy that meets the standards prescribed by any of sections B.02.051 to B.02.058.
No person shall make any claim with respect to the age of brandy other than for the period during which the brandy has been held in wooden containers or in small wood.

Section.Label: B.02.070
Section.Text: [S]. Liqueur or Spirituous Cordial

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be a product obtained by the mixing or distillation of alcohol from food sources with or over fruits, flowers, leaves or other botanical substances or their juices or with extracts derived by the infusion, percolation or maceration of those botanical substances;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall have added, during the course of manufacture, a sweetening agent in an amount that is not less than 2.5 per cent of the finished product;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not less than 23 per cent absolute alcohol by volume; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: natural and artificial flavouring preparations, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: colour.

Subsection.Label: [S]. (1)
Subsection.Text: Vodka shall be a potable alcoholic distillate obtained from potatoes, cereal grain or any other material of agricultural origin fermented by the action of yeast or a mixture of yeast and other micro-organisms.
The distillate shall be treated with charcoal or other means so that the vodka is without distinctive character, aroma or taste.

Vodka produced, in whole or in part, from material of agricultural origin other than potatoes or cereal grain, shall carry in close proximity to the common name, the statement “produced from” followed by the name of all material of agricultural origin used.

Subject to subsection (2), no person shall label, package, sell or advertise any food as Tequila, or in such a manner that it is likely to be mistaken for Tequila unless it is Tequila manufactured in Mexico as Tequila in accordance with the laws of Mexico applicable in respect of Tequila for consumption in Mexico.

A person may modify Tequila that is imported for the purpose of bottling and sale in Canada as Tequila by the addition of distilled or otherwise purified water to adjust the Tequila to a required strength.

Subject to subsection (2), no person shall label, package, sell or advertise any food as Mezcal, or in such a manner that it is likely to be mistaken for Mezcal unless it is Mezcal manufactured in Mexico as Mezcal in accordance with the laws of Mexico applicable in respect of Mezcal for consumption in Mexico.

A person may modify Mezcal that is imported for the purpose of bottling and sale in Canada as Mezcal by the addition of distilled or otherwise purified water to adjust the Mezcal to a required strength.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be an alcoholic beverage that is produced by the complete or partial alcoholic fermentation of fresh grapes, grape must, products derived solely from fresh grapes, or any combination of them;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may have added to it during the course of the manufacture

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: yeast,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: concentrated grape juice,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: dextrose, fructose, glucose or glucose solids, invert sugar, sugar, or aqueous solutions of any of them,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: yeast foods, in accordance with Table XIV to section B.16.100,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: calcium sulphate in such quantity that the content of soluble sulphates in the finished wine shall not exceed 0.2 per cent weight by volume calculated as potassium sulphate,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: calcium carbonate in such quantity that the content of tartaric acid in the finished wine shall not be less than 0.15 per cent weight by volume,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: sulphurous acid, including salts thereof, in such quantity that its content in the finished wine shall not exceed

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: 70 parts per million in the free state, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: 350 parts per million in the combined state, calculated as sulphur dioxide,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: any of the following substances:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: citric acid, fumaric acid, lactic acid, malic acid, potassium bicarbonate, potassium carbonate, potassium citrate and tartaric acid, at a maximum level of use consistent with good manufacturing practice,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: metatartaric acid at a maximum level of use of 0.01 per cent, and

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: potassium acid tartrate at a maximum level of use of 0.42 per cent,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: amylase and pectinase at a maximum level of use consistent with good manufacturing practice,

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: ascorbic acid or erythorbic acid, or their salts, at a maximum level of use consistent with good manufacturing practice,

Subparagraph.Label: (xi)
Subparagraph.Text: antifoaming agents, in accordance with Table VIII to section B.16.100,

Subparagraph.Label: (xii)
Subparagraph.Text: any of the following fining agents:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: activated carbon, albumen, casein, clay, diatomaceous earth, egg-white, isinglass, polyvinylpolypyrrolidone and silicon dioxide,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: acacia gum, agar, gelatin and potassium ferrocyanide, at a maximum level of use consistent with good manufacturing practice,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: tannic acid at a maximum level of use of 200 parts per million, and

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: polyvinylpyrrolidone in an amount that does not exceed 2 parts per million in the finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (xiii)
Subparagraph.Text: caramel at a maximum level of use consistent with good manufacturing practice,

Subparagraph.Label: (xiv)
Subparagraph.Text: brandy, fruit spirit or alcohol derived from the alcoholic fermentation of a food source distilled to not less than 94 per cent alcohol by volume,

Subparagraph.Label: (xv)
Subparagraph.Text: any of the following substances:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: carbon dioxide and ozone at a maximum level of use consistent with good manufacturing practice, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: oxygen,

Subparagraph.Label: (xvi)
Subparagraph.Text: sorbic acid or salts thereof, not exceeding 500 parts per million calculated as sorbic acid,

Subparagraph.Label: (xvii)
Subparagraph.Text: malolactic bacteria from the genera Lactobacillus, Leuconostoc and Pediococcus,

Subparagraph.Label: (xviii)
Subparagraph.Text: copper sulphate in such a quantity that the content of copper in the finished product shall not exceed 0.0001 per cent,

Subparagraph.Label: (xix)
Subparagraph.Text: nitrogen, and

Subparagraph.Label: (xx)
Subparagraph.Text: oak chips and particles; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: prior to final filtration may be treated with

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a strongly acid cation exchange resin in the sodium ion form, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a weakly basic anion exchange resin in the hydroxyl ion form.

Section.Label: B.02.101
Section.Text: No person shall sell wine that contains more than 0.24 per cent weight by volume of volatile acidity calculated as acetic acid, as determined by official method FO-2, Determination of Volatile Acidity of Wine, Cider and Champagne Cider, October 15, 1981.

Section.Label: B.02.102
Section.Text: [S]. Fruit spirit shall be an alcoholic distillate obtained from wine, fruit wine, grape pomace or fruit pomace.

Section.Label: B.02.103
Section.Text: [S]. Fruit Wine, or (naming the fruit) Wine shall be the product of the alcoholic fermentation of the juice of sound ripe fruit other than grape, and in all other respects shall meet the requirements of the standard for wine as prescribed by section B.02.100.

Section.Label: B.02.104
Section.Text: [S]. Vermouth shall be wine to which has been added bitters, aromatics or other botanical substances or a flavouring preparation, and shall contain not more than 20 per cent absolute alcohol by volume.

Section.Label: B.02.105
Section.Text: [S]. Flavoured Wine, Wine Cocktail, Aperitif Wine shall be wine to which has been added herbs, spices, other botanical substances, fruit juices or a flavouring preparation, and shall contain not more than 20 per cent absolute alcohol by volume.

Section.Label: B.02.105A
Section.Text: [S]. Flavoured (naming the fruit) Wine, (naming the fruit) Wine Cocktail, or Aperitif (naming the fruit) Wine shall be fruit wine, a mixture of fruit wines, or a mixture of fruit wine and wine to which has been added herbs, spices, other botanical substances, fruit juices or a flavouring preparation, and shall contain not more than 20 per cent absolute alcohol by volume.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the product of the alcoholic fermentation of an aqueous solution of honey; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may have added to it during the course of manufacture any of the following substances:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: yeast;

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: yeast foods;

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: sulphurous acid, including salts thereof, in such quantity that its content in the finished wine shall not exceed

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: 70 p.p.m. in the free state, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: 350 p.p.m. in the combined state, calculated as sulphur dioxide;

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: tartaric or citric acid;

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: potassium acid tartrate;
