Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: natural botanical flavours;

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: fruit spirit or alcohol derived from the alcoholic fermentation of a food source distilled to not less than 94 per cent alcohol by volume;

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: caramel;

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: carbon dioxide;

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: activated carbon, clay or tannic acid as fining agents; or

Subparagraph.Label: (xi)
Subparagraph.Text: sorbic acid, and any salts thereof, calculated as sorbic acid, in a quantity such that the content of sorbic acid and its salts in the finished wine does not exceed 500 parts per million.

Section.Label: B.02.107
Section.Text: [S]. May Wine shall be wine to which has been added artificial woodruff flavouring preparation.

Section.Label: B.02.108
Section.Text: A clear indication of the country of origin shall be shown on the principal display panel of a wine.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: be the product of the alcoholic fermentation of apple juice, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: contain not less than 2.5 per cent and not more than 13.0 per cent absolute alcohol by volume; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may have added to it during the course of manufacture

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: yeast,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: concentrated apple juice,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: sugar, dextrose, invert sugar, glucose, glucose solids, or aqueous solutions thereof,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: yeast foods,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: sulphurous acid, including salts thereof, in such quantity that its content in the finished cider shall not exceed

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: 70 parts per million in the free state, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: 350 parts per million in the combined state, calculated as sulphur dioxide,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: tartaric acid and potassium tartrate,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: citric acid,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: lactic acid,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: pectinase and amylase,

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: ascorbic or erythorbic acid, or salts thereof,

Subparagraph.Label: (xi)
Subparagraph.Text: any of the following fining agents:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: activated carbon,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: clay,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: diatomaceous earth,

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: gelatin,

Clause.Label: (E)
Clause.Text: albumen,

Clause.Label: (F)
Clause.Text: sodium chloride,

Clause.Label: (G)
Clause.Text: silica gel,

Clause.Label: (H)
Clause.Text: casein,

Clause.Label: (I)
Clause.Text: tannic acid not exceeding 200 parts per million, or

Clause.Label: (J)
Clause.Text: polyvinylpyrrolidone not exceeding two parts per million in the finished product,

Subparagraph.Label: (xii)
Subparagraph.Text: caramel,

Subparagraph.Label: (xiii)
Subparagraph.Text: brandy, fruit spirit or alcohol derived from the alcoholic fermentation of a food source distilled to not less than 94 per cent alcohol by volume,

Subparagraph.Label: (xiv)
Subparagraph.Text: carbon dioxide,

Subparagraph.Label: (xv)
Subparagraph.Text: oxygen,

Subparagraph.Label: (xvi)
Subparagraph.Text: ozone, or

Subparagraph.Label: (xvii)
Subparagraph.Text: sorbic acid or salts thereof, not exceeding 500 parts per million, calculated as sorbic acid.

Section.Label: B.02.122
Section.Text: [S]. Champagne Cider shall be cider that is impregnated with carbon dioxide under pressure by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: conducting the afterpart of the fermentation in closed vessels, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: secondary fermentation in closed vessels with or without the addition of sugar, dextrose, invert sugar, glucose or glucose solids or aqueous solutions thereof,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: and shall contain not less than seven per cent absolute alcohol by volume.

Section.Label: B.02.123
Section.Text: No person shall sell cider or champagne cider that has more than 0.2 per cent weight by volume of volatile acidity calculated as acetic acid, as determined by official method FO-2, Determination of Volatile Acidity of Wine, Cider and Champagne Cider, October 15, 1981.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the product of the alcoholic fermentation by yeast, or a mixture of yeast and other micro-organisms, an infusion of barley or wheat malt and hops or hop extract in potable water;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain at most 4% of residual sugars; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: may have added to it during the course of manufacture any of the following ingredients:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: cereal grain,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: honey, maple syrup, fruit, fruit juice or any other source of carbohydrates,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: herbs and spices,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: salt,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: flavouring preparations,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: pre-isomerized hop extract,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: reduced isomerized hop extract, and

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: food additives to which a marketing authorization applies and that are set out in the Lists of Permitted Food Additives published on the Health Canada website.

Subsection.Text: The name of any flavouring preparation added to a beer shall form part of the common name of the beer.

Section.Label: B.02.132
Section.Text: The qualified common name or common name set out in column II of the table to this section shall be used in any advertisement and on the label of a beer that contains the percentage of alcohol by volume set out in column I.

row.entry: Qualified Common Name or Common Name

Section.Label: B.02.133
Section.Text: [S]. In this Division, hop extract means an extract derived from hops by a process employing the solvent

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: hexane, methanol, or methylene chloride in such a manner that the hop extract does not contain more than 2.2 per cent of the solvent used; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: carbon dioxide or ethyl alcohol in an amount consistent with good manufacturing practice.

Subsection.Label: [S]. (1)
Subsection.Text: In this Division, pre-isomerized hop extract means an extract derived from hops by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the use of one of the following solvents:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: hexane,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: carbon dioxide, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: ethanol; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the subsequent isolation of the alpha acids and their conversion to isomerized alpha acids by means of diluted alkali and heat.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of paragraph (1)(b), the residues of hexane shall not exceed 1.5 parts per million per per cent iso-alpha acid content of the pre-isomerized hop extract.

Section.Label: B.02.135
Section.Text: [S]. In this Division, reduced isomerized hop extract means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: tetrahydroisohumulones derived from hops

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: by isomerization and reduction of humulones (alpha-acids) by means of hydrogen and a catalyst, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: by reduction of lupulones (beta-acids) by means of hydrogen and a catalyst, followed by oxidation and isomerization;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: hexahydroisohumulones derived from hops by reduction of tetrahydroisohumulones by means of sodium borohydride; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: dihydroisohumulones derived from hops by reduction of isoalpha acids by means of sodium borohydride.

Section.Label: B.03.001
Section.Text: In this Division, acid-reacting material means one or any combination of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: lactic acid or its salts;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: tartaric acid or its salts;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: acid salts of phosphoric acid; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: acid compounds of aluminum.

Section.Label: B.03.002
Section.Text: [S]. Baking Powder shall be a combination of sodium or potassium bicarbonate, an acid-reacting material, starch or other neutral material, may contain an anticaking agent and shall yield not less than 10 per cent of its weight of carbon dioxide, as determined by official method FO-3, Determination of Carbon Dioxide in Baking Powder, October 15, 1981.

Section.Label: B.04.001
Section.Text: The definitions in this section apply in this Division.

Definition.Text: chocolate product means a product derived from one or more cocoa products and includes chocolate, bittersweet chocolate, semi-sweet chocolate, dark chocolate, sweet chocolate, milk chocolate and white chocolate. (produit de chocolat)

cocoa product means a product derived from cocoa beans and includes cocoa nibs, cocoa liquor, cocoa mass, unsweetened chocolate, bitter chocolate, chocolate liquor, cocoa, low fat cocoa, cocoa powder and low fat cocoa powder. (produit du cacao)
milk ingredient means one or any combination of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the following products for which a standard is prescribed in this Part, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: milk or whole milk,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: skim milk,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: partly skimmed milk or partially skimmed milk,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: sterilized milk,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: condensed milk or sweetened condensed milk,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: evaporated milk,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: evaporated skim milk or concentrated skim milk,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: evaporated partly skimmed milk or concentrated partly skimmed milk,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: milk powder or whole milk powder or dry whole milk or powdered whole milk,

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: skim milk powder or dry skim milk,

Subparagraph.Label: (xi)
Subparagraph.Text: skim milk with added milk solids,

Subparagraph.Label: (xii)
Subparagraph.Text: partly skimmed milk with added milk solids or partially skimmed milk with added milk solids,

Subparagraph.Label: (xiii)
Subparagraph.Text: malted milk or malted milk powder,

Subparagraph.Label: (xiv)
Subparagraph.Text: butter, and

Subparagraph.Label: (xv)
Subparagraph.Text: cream; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the following products for which a standard is not prescribed by this Part, namely

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: reconstituted milk or whole milk,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: reconstituted skim milk,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: reconstitued partly skimmed milk,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: partly skimmed milk powder,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: buttermilk,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: butter oil, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: reconstituted cream. (ingrédient laitier)

Definition.Text: sweetening ingredient means any one or any combination of sweetening agents, except for icing sugar. (ingrédient édulcorant)

Section.Label: B.04.002
Section.Text: [S]. Cocoa Beans shall be the seeds of Theobroma cacao L. or a closely related species.

Section.Label: B.04.003
Section.Text: [S]. Cocoa Nibs shall be the product prepared by removing the shell from cleaned cocoa beans, of which the residual shell content may not exceed 1.75 per cent by mass, calculated to an alkali free basis if the nibs or the cocoa beans from which the nibs were prepared have been processed with alkali, as determined by the method prescribed in the Official Methods of Analysis of the Association of Official Analytical Chemists, 12th Ed. (1975), sections 13.010 to 13.014, under the heading “Shell in Cacao Nibs — Official Final Action”, published by the Association of Official Analytical Chemists, in Washington.

Section.Label: B.04.004
Section.Text: [S]. Cocoa Liquor, Cocoa Mass, Unsweetened Chocolate, Bitter Chocolate or Chocolate Liquor shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be the product obtained from the mechanical disintegration of the cocoa nib with or without removal or addition of any of its constituents; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: contain not less than 50 per cent cocoa butter.

Subsection.Text: Cocoa products may be processed with one or more of the following pH-adjusting or alkalizing agents:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: hydroxides of ammonia, carbonates of ammonia, bicarbonates of ammonia, hydroxides of sodium, carbonates of sodium, bicarbonates of sodium, hydroxides of potassium, carbonates of potassium or bicarbonates of potassium;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: carbonates of magnesium or hydroxides of magnesium; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: carbonates of calcium.

Subsection.Text: The quantity of any one pH-adjusting agent referred to in paragraphs (1)(a) to (c) shall not exceed the maximum level of use for that agent set out in column III of an item of Table X to section B.16.100.

The total mass of the pH-adjusting agents referred to in paragraphs (1)(a) to (c) shall not be greater in neutralizing value, calculated from the respective masses of those agents, than the neutralizing value of five parts by mass of anhydrous potassium carbonate for each 100 parts by mass of cocoa product, calculated on a fat-free basis.
Cocoa products may be processed with one or more of the following pH-adjusting or neutralizing agents, added as such or in aqueous solution:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: phosphoric acid;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: citric acid; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: tartaric acid.

Subsection.Text: The total mass of pH-adjusting agents referred to in subsection (4) shall not exceed in neutralizing value, calculated from the respective masses of those agents, the appropriate maximum levels of use set out in column III of Table X to section B.16.100.
For the purpose of subsection (5),

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the total quantity of phosphoric acid shall not be greater than 0.5 part by mass, expressed as P2O5, for each 100 parts by mass of cocoa product, calculated on a fat-free basis; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the total quantity of citric acid and tartaric acid, singly or in combination, shall not be greater than 1.0 part by mass for each 100 parts by mass of cocoa product, calculated on a fat-free basis.

Section.Label: B.04.006
Section.Text: [S]. Chocolate, Bittersweet Chocolate, Semi-sweet Chocolate or Dark Chocolate

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be one or more of the following combined with a sweetening ingredient, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: cocoa liquor,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: cocoa liquor and cocoa butter, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: cocoa butter and cocoa powder;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not less than 35 per cent total cocoa solids, of which

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 18 per cent is cocoa butter, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 14 per cent is fat-free cocoa solids; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: less than 5 per cent total milk solids from milk ingredients,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: spices,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: flavouring preparations, other than those that imitate the flavour of chocolate or milk, to balance flavour,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: salt, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: any of the following emulsifying agents, which singly shall not exceed the maximum level of use set out in column III of Table IV to section B.16.100, and in combination shall not exceed 1.5 per cent by mass of chocolate product, namely,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: mono-glycerides and mono- and diglycerides,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: lecithin and hydroxylated lecithin,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: ammonium salts of phosphorylated glycerides,

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: polyglycerol esters of interesterified castor oil fatty acids, and

Clause.Label: (E)
Clause.Text: sorbitan monostearate.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be one or more of the following combined with a sweetening ingredient, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: cocoa liquor,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: cocoa liquor and cocoa butter, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: cocoa butter and cocoa powder;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not less than 30 per cent total cocoa solids, of which

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 18 per cent is cocoa butter, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 12 per cent is fat-free cocoa solids; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: less than 12 per cent total milk solids from milk ingredients,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: spices,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: flavouring preparations, other than those that imitate the flavour of chocolate or milk, to balance flavour,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: salt, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: any of the following emulsifying agents, which singly shall not exceed the maximum level of use set out in column III of Table IV to section B.16.100, and in combination shall not exceed 1.5 per cent by mass of chocolate product, namely,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: mono-glycerides and mono- and diglycerides,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: lecithin and hydroxylated lecithin,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: ammonium salts of phosphorylated glycerides,

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: polyglycerol esters of interesterified castor oil fatty acids, and

Clause.Label: (E)
Clause.Text: sorbitan monostearate.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be one or more of the following combined with a sweetening ingredient, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: cocoa liquor,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: cocoa liquor and cocoa butter, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: cocoa butter and cocoa powder;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not less than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 25 per cent total cocoa solids, of which

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: not less than 15 per cent is cocoa butter, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: not less than 2.5 per cent is fat-free cocoa solids,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 12 per cent total milk solids from milk ingredients, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: 3.39 per cent milk fat; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: less than 5 per cent whey or whey products,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: spices,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: flavouring preparations, other than those that imitate the flavour of chocolate or milk, to balance flavour,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: salt, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: any of the following emulsifying agents, which singly shall not exceed the maximum level of use set out in column III of Table IV to section B.16.100, and in combination shall not exceed 1.5 per cent by mass of chocolate product, namely,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: mono-glycerides and mono- and diglycerides,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: lecithin and hydroxylated lecithin,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: ammonium salts of phosphorylated glycerides,

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: polyglycerol esters of interesterified castor oil fatty acids, and

Clause.Label: (E)
Clause.Text: sorbitan monostearate.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain the following combined together, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 20 per cent cocoa butter,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 14 per cent total milk solids from milk ingredients, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 3.5 per cent milk fat; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: less than 5 per cent whey or whey products,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: spices,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: flavouring preparations, other than those that imitate the flavour of chocolate or milk, to balance flavour,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: salt, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: any of the following emulsifying agents, which singly shall not exceed the maximum level of use set out in column III of Table IV to section B.16.100, and in combination shall not exceed 1.5 per cent by mass of chocolate product, namely,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: mono-glycerides and mono- and diglycerides,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: lecithin and hydroxylated lecithin,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: ammonium salts of phosphorylated glycerides,

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: polyglycerol esters of interesterified castor oil fatty acids, and

Clause.Label: (E)
Clause.Text: sorbitan monostearate.

Section.Label: B.04.010
Section.Text: [S]. Cocoa or Cocoa Powder

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the product that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: is obtained by pulverising the remaining material from partially defatted cocoa liquor by mechanical means, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: contains not less than 10 per cent cocoa butter; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: spices,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: flavouring preparations, other than those that imitate the flavour of chocolate or milk, to balance flavour,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: salt, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: any of the following emulsifying agents, which singly shall not exceed the maximum level of use set out in column III of Table IV to section B.16.100, and in combination shall not exceed 1.5 per cent by mass of cocoa product, namely,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: mono-glycerides and mono- and diglycerides,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: lecithin and hydroxylated lecithin, and

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: ammonium salts of phosphorylated glycerides.

Section.Label: B.04.011
Section.Text: [S]. Low Fat Cocoa or Low Fat Cocoa Powder

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the product that:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: is obtained by pulverising the remaining material from partially defatted cocoa liquor by mechanical means, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: contains less than 10 per cent cocoa butter; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: spices,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: flavouring preparations, other than those that imitate the flavour of chocolate or milk, to balance flavour,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: salt, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: any of the following emulsifying agents, which singly shall not exceed the maximum level of use set out in column III of Table IV to section B.16.100, and in combination shall not exceed 1.5 per cent by mass of cocoa product, namely,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: mono-glycerides and mono- and diglycerides,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: lecithin and hydroxylated lecithin, and

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: ammonium salts of phosphorylated glycerides.

Section.Label: B.04.012
Section.Text: No person shall sell a cocoa product or a chocolate product unless it is free from bacteria of the genus Salmonella as determined by official method MFO-11, Microbiological Examination of Cocoa and Chocolate, November 30, 1981.

Section.Label: B.05.001
Section.Text: [S]. Green Coffee, Raw Coffee or Unroasted Coffee shall be the seed of Coffee arabica L., C. liberica Hiern, or C. robusta Chev., freed from all but a small portion of its spermoderm.

Section.Label: B.05.002
Section.Text: [S]. Roasted Coffee or Coffee shall be roasted green coffee, and shall contain not less than 10 per cent fat, and may contain not more than six per cent total ash.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be coffee of the type indicated, from which caffeine has been removed and that, as a result of the removal, contains not more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 0.1 per cent caffeine, in the case of decaffeinated raw coffee and decaffeinated coffee, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 0.3 per cent caffeine, in the case of decaffeinated instant coffee; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may have been decaffeinated by means of extraction solvents set out in Table XV to Division 16.

Section.Label: B.06.001
Section.Text: In this Division,

Definition.Text: diluent means any substance other than a synthetic colour present in a colour mixture or preparation; (diluant)
dye means the principal dye and associated subsidiary and isomeric dyes contained in a synthetic colour; (pigment)
mixture means a mixture of two or more synthetic colours or a mixture of one or more synthetic colours with one or more diluents; (mélange)
preparation means a preparation of one or more synthetic colours containing less than three per cent dye and sold for household use; (préparation)
synthetic colour means any organic food colour, other than caramel, that is produced by chemical synthesis and that has no counterpart in nature. (colorant synthétique)

Section.Label: B.06.002
Section.Text: No person shall sell a food, other than a synthetic colour, mixture, preparation or flavouring preparation, that contains, when prepared for consumption according to label directions, more than

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: 300 parts per million of Allura Red, Amaranth, Erythrosine, Indigotine, Sunset Yellow FCF or Tartrazine or any combination of those colours unless a higher maximum level of use is specified in column III of item 3 of Table III to section B.16.100;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 100 parts per million of Fast Green FCF or Brilliant Blue FCF or any combination of those colours;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: 300 parts per million of any combination of the synthetic colours named in paragraphs (a) and (b) within the limits set by those paragraphs; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: 150 parts per million of Ponceau SX.

Section.Label: B.06.007
Section.Text: No person shall sell a preparation for use in or upon food unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the label carries the words “Food Colour Preparation” on its principal display panel; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a liquid preparation, the container has a capacity of 60 ml or less and will permit dropwise discharge only.

Section.Label: B.06.043
Section.Text: [S]. Ponceau SX shall be the disodium salt of 2-(5-sulpho-2,4-xylylazo)-1-naphthol-4-sulphonic acid, shall contain not less than 85% dye and may contain not more than

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: 0.2% water insoluble matter;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 0.2% combined ether extracts;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: 1.0% subsidiary dyes;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: 0.5% intermediates;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: 3 parts per million of arsenic; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: 10 parts per million of lead.

Section.Label: B.06.053
Section.Text: [S]. Citrus Red No. 2 shall be 1-(2,5-dimethoxyphenylazo)-2-naphthol, shall contain not less than 98% dye and may contain not more than

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: 0.5% volatile matter (at 100°C);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 0.3% sulphated ash;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: 0.3% water soluble matter;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: 0.5% carbon tetrachloride insoluble matter;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: 0.05% uncombined intermediates;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: 2.0% subsidiary dyes;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: 1 part per million of arsenic; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: 10 parts per million of lead.

Section.Label: B.06.061
Section.Text: The lake of any water soluble synthetic colour that is referred to in section 2 of the Marketing Authorization for Food Additives That May Be Used as Colouring Agents shall be the calcium or aluminum salt of the respective colour extended on alumina.

Section.Label: B.07.001
Section.Text: [S]. Allspice or Pimento, whole or ground, shall be the dried, full but unripe whole berries of Pimenta dioica (L) Merr. and shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 25 per cent crude fibre,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 5.5 per cent total ash,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: 0.4 per cent ash insoluble in hydrochloric acid, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: 12 per cent moisture; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 2.5 millilitres volatile oil per 100 grams of spice.

Section.Label: B.07.002
Section.Text: [S]. Anise or Anise Seed, whole or ground, shall be the dried fruit of Pimpinella anisum L. and shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: nine per cent total ash,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: one per cent ash insoluble in hydrochloric acid, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: 10 per cent moisture; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not less than two millilitres volatile oil per 100 grams of spice.

Section.Label: B.07.003
Section.Text: [S]. Basil or Sweet Basil, whole or ground, shall be the dried leaves of Ocimum basilicum L. and shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 15 per cent total ash,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: two per cent ash insoluble in hydrochloric acid, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: nine per cent moisture; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 0.2 millilitre volatile oil per 100 grams of spice.

Section.Label: B.07.004
Section.Text: [S]. Bay Leaves or Laurel Leaves, whole or ground, shall be the dried leaves of Laurus nobilis L. and shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 4.5 per cent total ash,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 0.5 per cent ash insoluble in hydrochloric acid, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: seven per cent moisture; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not less than one millilitre volatile oil per 100 grams of spice.

Section.Label: B.07.005
Section.Text: [S]. Caraway or Caraway Seed, whole or ground, shall be the dried fruit of the caraway plant, Carum carvi L. and shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: eight per cent total ash,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: one per cent ash insoluble in hydrochloric acid, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: 11.5 per cent moisture; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not less than two millilitres volatile oil per 100 grams of spice.

Section.Label: B.07.006
Section.Text: [S]. Cardamom or Cardamom Seed, bleached or green, whole or ground, shall be the dried ripe fruit of Elettaria cardamomum Maton and shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: eight per cent total ash,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: three per cent ash insoluble in hydrochloric acid, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: 13 per cent moisture; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not less than three millilitres volatile oil per 100 grams of spice.

Section.Label: B.07.007
Section.Text: [S]. Cayenne Pepper or Cayenne, whole or ground,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the dried ripe fruit of Capsicum frutescens L., Capsicum baccatum L., or other small-fruited species of Capsicum and shall contain not more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 1.5 per cent starch,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 28 per cent crude fibre,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: 10 per cent total ash,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: 1.5 per cent ash insoluble in hydrochloric acid, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: 10 per cent moisture; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain silicon dioxide as an anti-caking agent in an amount not exceeding 2.0 per cent.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be a combination of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: ground celery seed or ground dehydrated celery, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: salt in an amount not exceeding 75 per cent; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain silicon dioxide as an anticaking agent in an amount not exceeding 0.5 per cent.

Section.Label: B.07.009
Section.Text: [S]. Celery Seed, whole or ground, shall be the dried ripe fruit of Apium graveolens L. and shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 12 per cent total ash,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: two per cent ash insoluble in hydrochloric acid, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: 10 per cent moisture; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 1.5 millilitres volatile oil per 100 grams of spice.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be a combination of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: ground celery seed or ground dehydrated celery, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: ground black pepper in an amount not exceeding 70 per cent; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain silicon dioxide as an anticaking agent in an amount not exceeding 0.5 per cent.

Section.Label: B.07.011
Section.Text: [S]. Cinnamon or Cassia, whole or ground, shall be the dried bark of trees of the genus Cinnamomum of Species C. burmanni Blume, C. loureirii Nees or C. Cassia Blume and shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: six per cent total ash,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: two per cent ash insoluble in hydrochloric acid, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: 13 per cent moisture; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 1.2 millilitres volatile oil per 100 grams of spice.

Section.Label: B.07.012
Section.Text: [S]. Ceylon Cinnamon, whole or ground, shall be cinnamon obtained exclusively from Cinnamomum zeylanicum Nees.

Section.Label: B.07.013
Section.Text: [S]. Cloves, whole or ground, shall be the dried unopened flower buds of Eugenia caryophyllus (Spreng) and shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: five per cent clove stems,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: six per cent total ash,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: 0.5 per cent ash insoluble in hydrochloric acid,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: 10 per cent crude fibre, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: eight per cent moisture; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 13 millilitres volatile oil per 100 grams of spice.

Section.Label: B.07.014
Section.Text: [S]. Coriander or Coriander Seed, whole or ground, shall be the dried fruit of Coriandrum sativum L. and shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: seven per cent total ash,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: one per cent ash insoluble in hydrochloric acid, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: nine per cent moisture; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 0.3 millilitre volatile oil per 100 grams of spice.

Section.Label: B.07.015
Section.Text: [S]. Cumin or Cumin Seed, whole or ground, shall be the dried seeds of Cuminum cyminum L. and shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 9.5 per cent total ash,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 1.5 per cent ash insoluble in hydrochloric acid, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: nine per cent moisture; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 2.5 millilitres volatile oil per 100 grams of spice.

Section.Label: B.07.016
Section.Text: [S]. Curry Powder shall be any combination of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: turmeric with spices and seasoning; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: salt in an amount not exceeding five per cent.

Section.Label: B.07.017
Section.Text: [S]. Dill Seed, whole or ground, shall be the dried fruit of Anethum graveolens L., or Anethum sowa D.C. and shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 10 per cent total ash,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: two per cent ash insoluble in hydrochloric acid, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: nine per cent moisture; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not less than two millilitres volatile oil per 100 grams of spice.

Section.Label: B.07.018
Section.Text: [S]. Fennel or Fennel Seed, whole or ground, shall be the dried ripe fruit of Foeniculum vulgare Mill. and shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 10 per cent total ash,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: one per cent ash insoluble in hydrochloric acid, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: 10 per cent moisture; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not less than one millilitre volatile oil per 100 grams of spice.

Section.Label: B.07.019
Section.Text: [S]. Fenugreek, whole or ground, shall be the dried ripe fruit of Trigonella foenumgraecum L. and shall contain not more than

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: five per cent total ash;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: one per cent ash insoluble in hydrochloric acid; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: 10 per cent moisture.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be a combination of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: powdered dehydrated garlic, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: salt in an amount not exceeding 75 per cent; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain one or more of the following anticaking agents in a total amount not exceeding two per cent:

Provision.Text: calcium aluminum silicate, calcium phosphate tribasic, calcium silicate, calcium stearate, magnesium carbonate, magnesium silicate, magnesium stearate, silicone dioxide in an amount not exceeding one per cent and sodium aluminum silicate.

Section.Label: B.07.021
Section.Text: [S]. Ginger whole or ground, shall be the washed and dried or decorticated rhizome of Zingiber officinale Roscoe and shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: seven per cent total ash,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: one per cent ash insoluble in hydrochloric acid, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: 12.5 per cent moisture; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 1.5 millilitres volatile oil per 100 grams of spice.

Section.Label: B.07.022
Section.Text: [S]. Mace, whole or ground, shall be the dried arillus of Myristica fragrans Houttyn and shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 3.5 per cent total ash,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 0.5 per cent ash insoluble in hydrochloric acid, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: eight per cent moisture, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 11 millilitres volatile oil per 100 grams of spice,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: and the total non-volatile extracts obtainable therefrom by

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: ethyl ether, shall not be less than 20 per cent nor more than 35 per cent, and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: ethyl ether, after preliminary extraction with petroleum ether, shall not exceed five per cent.

Section.Label: B.07.023
Section.Text: [S]. Marjoram, whole or ground, shall be the dried leaves, with or without a small proportion of the flowering tops, of Marjorana hortensis Moench and shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 10 per cent stems and foreign material of plant origin,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 13.5 per cent total ash,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: 4.5 per cent ash insoluble in hydrochloric acid, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: 10 per cent moisture; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 0.7 millilitre volatile oil per 100 grams of spice.

Section.Label: B.07.024
Section.Text: [S]. Mustard Seed shall be the seed of Sinapis alba, Brassica hirta Moench, Brassica juncea (L) Cosson or Brassica nigra and shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: seven per cent total ash,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: one per cent ash insoluble in hydrochloric acid, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: 11 per cent moisture; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 25 per cent non-volatile ether extract.

Section.Label: B.07.025
Section.Text: [S]. Mustard, Mustard Flour or Ground Mustard shall be powdered mustard seed

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: made from mustard seed from which

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: most of the hulls have been removed, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a portion of the fixed oil may have been removed; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that contains not more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 1.5 per cent starch, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: eight per cent total ash, on an oil-free basis.

Section.Label: B.07.026
Section.Text: [S]. Nutmeg, whole or ground, shall be the dried seed of Myristica fragrans Houttyn and may, prior to grinding, have a thin coating of lime and shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: three per cent total ash,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 0.5 per cent ash insoluble in hydrochloric acid, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: eight per cent moisture; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not less than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 25 per cent non-volatile ether extract, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 6.5 millilitres volatile oil per 100 grams of spice.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be a combination of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: powdered dehydrated onion, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: salt in an amount not exceeding 75 per cent; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain one or more of the following anticaking agents in a total amount not exceeding two per cent:

Provision.Text: calcium aluminum silicate, calcium phosphate tribasic, calcium silicate, calcium stearate, magnesium carbonate, magnesium silicate, magnesium stearate, silicon dioxide in an amount not exceeding one per cent and sodium aluminum silicate.

Section.Label: B.07.028
Section.Text: [S]. Oregano, whole or ground, shall be the dried leaves of Origanum vulgar L. or Origanum Spp. and shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 10 per cent total ash,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: two per cent ash insoluble in hydrochloric acid, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: 10 per cent moisture; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 2.5 millilitres volatile oil per 100 grams of spice.

Section.Label: B.07.029
Section.Text: [S]. Paprika shall be the dried, ground ripe fruit of Capsicum annuum L. and

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 23 per cent crude fibre,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 8.5 per cent total ash,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: one per cent ash insoluble in hydrochloric acid, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: 12 per cent moisture; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain silicon dioxide as an anti-caking agent in an amount not exceeding 2.0 per cent.

Section.Label: B.07.030
Section.Text: [S]. Black Pepper or Peppercorn, whole or ground, shall be the dried, immature berry of Piper nigrum L. and shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: seven per cent total ash,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: one per cent ash insoluble in hydrochloric acid, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: 12 per cent moisture;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not less than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: six per cent non-volatile methylene chloride extract,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 30 per cent pepper starch, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: 2.0 millilitres volatile oil per 100 grams of spice; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: when ground, all the parts of the berry in their normal proportions.

Section.Label: B.07.031
Section.Text: [S]. White Pepper, whole or ground, shall be the dried, mature berry of Piper nigrum L., from which the outer coating is and the inner coating may be removed and shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: five per cent crude fibre,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 2.5 per cent total ash,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: 0.3 per cent ash insoluble in hydrochloric acid, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: 15 per cent moisture; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not less than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: six per cent non-volatile methylene chloride extract,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 52 per cent pepper starch, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: one millilitre volatile oil per 100 grams of spice.

Section.Label: B.07.032
Section.Text: [S]. Poppy seed shall be the dried seed of Papaver somniferum L. and shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: seven per cent total ash, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: one per cent ash insoluble in hydrochloric acid; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 40 per cent non-volatile ether extract.

Section.Label: B.07.033
Section.Text: [S]. Rosemary, whole or ground, shall be the dried leaves of Rosemarinus officinalis L. and shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 7.5 per cent total ash,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: one per cent ash insoluble in hydrochloric acid, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: nine per cent moisture; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 1.2 millilitres volatile oil per 100 grams of spice.

Section.Label: B.07.034
Section.Text: [S]. Sage, whole or ground, shall be the dried leaves of the sage plant Salvia officinalis L., Salvia triloba L. or Salvia lavandulaefolia Vahl. and shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 12 per cent stems excluding petioles and foreign material of plant origin,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 10 per cent total ash,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: one per cent ash insoluble in hydrochloric acid, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: 10 per cent moisture; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not less than one millilitre volatile oil per 100 grams of spice.

Section.Label: B.07.035
Section.Text: [S]. Savory, whole or ground, shall be the dried leaves and flowering tops of Satureja hortensis L. or Satureja montana L. and shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 11 per cent total ash,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: two per cent ash insoluble in hydrochloric acid, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: 14 per cent moisture; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 0.8 millilitre volatile oil per 100 grams of spice.

Section.Label: B.07.036
Section.Text: [S]. Sesame Seed shall be the dried hulled seed of Sesamum indicum L. and shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not more than eight per cent moisture; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 50 per cent non-volatile ether extract.

Section.Label: B.07.037
Section.Text: [S]. Tarragon, whole or ground, shall be the dried leaves and flowering tops of Artemisia dracunculus L. and shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 15 per cent total ash,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 1.5 per cent ash insoluble in hydrochloric acid, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: 10 per cent moisture; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 0.3 millilitre volatile oil per 100 grams of spice.

Section.Label: B.07.038
Section.Text: [S]. Thyme, whole or ground, shall be the dried leaves and flowering tops of the thyme plant Thymus vulgaris L. or Thymus zygis L. and shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 12 per cent total ash,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: five per cent ash insoluble in hydrochloric acid, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: nine per cent moisture; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 0.9 millilitre volatile oil per 100 grams of spice.

Section.Label: B.07.039
Section.Text: [S]. Turmeric, whole or ground, shall be the dried rhizome of Curcuma longa L. and shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: seven per cent total ash,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 1.5 per cent ash insoluble in hydrochloric acid, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: 10 per cent moisture; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 3.5 millilitres volatile oil per 100 grams of spice.

Section.Label: B.07.040
Section.Text: [S]. Mayonnaise, Mayonnaise Dressing or Mayonnaise Salad Dressing

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be a combination of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: vegetable oil,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: whole egg or egg yolk, in liquid, frozen or dried form, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: vinegar or lemon juice;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: water,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: salt,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a sweetening agent,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: spice or other seasoning except turmeric or saffron,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: citric, tartaric or lactic acid, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: a sequestering agent; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not less than 65 per cent vegetable oil.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be a combination of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: vegetable oil, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: vinegar or lemon juice;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: water,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: salt,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a sweetening agent,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: spice, tomato or other seasoning,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: an emulsifying agent,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: whole egg or egg yolk, in liquid, frozen or dried form,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: citric, tartaric or lactic acid, and

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: a sequestering agent; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not less than 35 per cent vegetable oil.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be a combination of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: vegetable oil,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: whole egg or egg yolk, in liquid, frozen or dried form,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: vinegar or lemon juice, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: starch, flour, rye flour or tapioca flour or any combination thereof;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: water,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: salt,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a sweetening agent,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: spice or other seasoning,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: an emulsifying agent,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: citric, tartaric or lactic acid, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: a sequestering agent; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not less than 35 per cent vegetable oil.

Section.Label: B.07.043
Section.Text: No person shall sell a dressing that contains more than five per cent C22 Monoenoic Fatty Acids calculated as a proportion of the total fatty acids contained in the dressing.

Section.Label: B.08.001
Section.Text: The foods referred to in this Division are dairy products.

Section.Label: B.08.001.1
Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Division.

Definition.Text: milk product means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to butter or whey butter, any of the following products, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: partly skimmed milk, skim milk, cream, buttermilk and whey cream, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: milk in concentrated, dried or reconstituted form and any product referred to in subparagraph (i) in concentrated, dried or reconstituted form;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to cheese, any of the following products, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: partly skimmed milk, skim milk, cream, buttermilk, whey and whey cream,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: milk in concentrated, dried, frozen or reconstituted form and any product referred to in subparagraph (i) in concentrated, dried, frozen or reconstituted form,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: butter, butter oil and whey butter,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: any constituent of milk — other than water — singly or in combination with other constituents of milk, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: whey protein concentrate;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to cold-pack cheese food, cold-pack cheese food with (naming the added ingredients), cream cheese spread, cream cheese spread with (naming the added ingredients), processed cheese food, processed cheese food with (naming the added ingredients), processed cheese spread or processed cheese spread with (naming the added ingredients), any of the following products, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: butter, whey butter and whey,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: whey protein concentrate, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: any product referred to in subparagraph (i) in concentrated or dried form; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to ice milk mix, ice cream mix or sherbet, any of the products referred to in subparagraph (a)(i) or (ii) or (c)(i), (ii) or (iii). (produit du lait)

Definition.Text: ultrafiltered, in relation to milk, partly skimmed milk or skim milk, means that the milk, partly skimmed milk or skim milk has been subjected to a process in which it is passed over one or more semi-permeable membranes to partially remove water, lactose, minerals and water-soluble vitamins without altering the whey protein to casein ratio and that results in a liquid product. (ultrafiltré)

Section.Label: B.08.002
Section.Text: Except as provided in these Regulations, a dairy product that contains a fat other than milk fat is adulterated.

Section.Label: B.08.002.1
Section.Text: Sections B.08.003 to B.08.028 do not apply to a lacteal secretion obtained from the mammary gland of any animal other than a cow, genus Bos, or a product or derivative of such secretion.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), no person shall sell the normal lacteal secretion obtained from the mammary gland of the cow, genus Bos, or of any other animal, or sell a dairy product made with any such secretion, unless the secretion or dairy product has been pasteurized by being held at a temperature and for a period that ensure the reduction of the alkaline phosphatase activity so as to meet the tolerances specified in official method MFO-3, Determination of Phosphatase Activity in Dairy Products, dated November 30, 1981.
Subsection (1) does not apply to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: cheese; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any food that is sold for further manufacturing or processing in order to pasteurize it in the manner described in subsection (1).

Section.Label: B.08.003
Section.Text: [S]. Milk or Whole Milk

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the normal lacteal secretion obtained from the mammary gland of the cow, genus Bos; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain added vitamin D in such an amount that a reasonable daily intake of the milk contains not less than 300 International Units and not more than 400 International Units of vitamin D.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be milk that contains not more than 0.3 per cent milk fat;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall, notwithstanding sections D.01.009 and D.01.010, contain added vitamin A in such an amount that a reasonable daily intake of the milk contains not less than 1,200 International Units and not more than 2,500 International Units of vitamin A; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain vitamin D in such an amount that a reasonable daily intake of the milk contains not less than 300 International Units and not more than 400 International Units of vitamin D.

Section.Label: B.08.005
Section.Text: [S]. Partly Skimmed Milk or Partially Skimmed Milk

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be derived from milk that has had its fat content reduced by mechanical separation or adjusted by the addition of cream, milk, partly skimmed milk or skim milk, either singly or in combination;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall, notwithstanding sections D.01.009 and D.01.010, contain added vitamin A in such an amount that a reasonable intake of the milk contains not less than 1,200 International Units and not more than 2,500 International Units of vitamin A; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain vitamin D in such an amount that a reasonable daily intake of the milk contains not less than 300 International Units and not more than 400 International Units of vitamin D.

Section.Label: B.08.006
Section.Text: [S]. Milk Fat or Butter Fat shall be the fat of cow’s milk, and shall have

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a specific gravity of not less than 0.905 at a temperature of 40°,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a tocopherol content not greater than 50 micrograms per gram, as determined by official method FO-16, Determination of Tocopherol in Milk Fat or Butter Fat, October 15, 1981,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a Reichert-Meissl number not less than 24, and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a Polenske number not exceeding 10 per cent of the Reichert-Meissl number and in no case shall the Polenske number exceed 3.5, and

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: where the tocopherol content is greater than 50 micrograms per gram or the Polenske number exceeds 10 per cent of the Reichert-Meissl number, there shall be deemed to have been an addition to the milk fat of fat other than that of cow’s milk.

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not less than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 11.75 per cent milk solids, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 3.25 per cent milk fat; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain added vitamin D in such an amount that a reasonable daily intake of the milk contains not less than 300 International Units and not more than 400 International Units of vitamin D.

Section.Label: B.08.008
Section.Text: The percentage of milk fat contained in

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: partly skimmed milk or partially skimmed milk,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: partly skimmed milk with added milk solids or partially skimmed milk with added milk solids, or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: evaporated partly skimmed milk or concentrated partly skimmed milk

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: shall be shown on the principal display panel followed by the words “milk fat” or the abbreviation “B.F.” or “M.F.”.

Section.Label: B.08.009
Section.Text: [S]. Condensed Milk or Sweetened Condensed Milk shall be milk from which water has been evaporated and to which has been added sugar, dextrose, glucose, glucose solids or lactose, or any combination thereof, may contain added vitamin D and shall contain not less than

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: 28 per cent milk solids; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: eight per cent milk fat.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be milk from which water has been evaporated;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not less than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 25.0 per cent milk solids, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 7.5 per cent milk fat;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall, notwithstanding sections D.01.009 to D.01.011, contain added vitamin C in such an amount that a reasonable daily intake of the milk contains not less than 60 milligrams and not more than 75 milligrams of vitamin C;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain vitamin D in such an amount that a reasonable daily intake of the milk contains not less than 300 International Units and not more than 400 International Units of vitamin D; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: added disodium phosphate or sodium citrate, or both, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: an emulsifying agent.

Section.Label: B.08.011
Section.Text: [S]. Evaporated Skim Milk or Concentrated Skim Milk

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be milk that has been concentrated to at least one-half of its original volume by the removal of water;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than 0.3 per cent milk fat, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 17.0 per cent milk solids other than fat;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall, notwithstanding sections D.01.009 and D.01.010, contain added vitamin A in such an amount that a reasonable daily intake of the milk contains not less than 1,200 International Units and not more than 2,500 International Units of vitamin A;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: shall, notwithstanding sections D.01.009 to D.01.011, contain added vitamin C in such an amount that a reasonable daily intake of the milk contains not less than 60 milligrams and not more than 75 milligrams of vitamin C;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain added vitamin D in such an amount that a reasonable daily intake of the milk contains not less than 300 International Units and not more than 400 International Units of vitamin D; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: may contain added disodium phosphate or sodium citrate, or both.

Section.Label: B.08.012
Section.Text: [S]. Evaporated Partly Skimmed Milk or Concentrated Partly Skimmed Milk

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be milk from which part of the milk fat has been removed;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall be concentrated to at least one-half its original volume by the removal of water;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not less than 17.0 per cent milk solids other than fat; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: shall, notwithstanding sections D.01.009 and D.01.010, contain added vitamin A in such an amount that a reasonable daily intake of the milk contains not less than 1,200 International Units and not more than 2,500 International Units of vitamin A;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: shall, notwithstanding sections D.01.009 to D.01.011, contain added vitamin C in such an amount that a reasonable daily intake of the milk contains not less than 60 milligrams and not more than 75 milligrams of vitamin C;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain added vitamin D in such an amount that a reasonable daily intake of the milk contains not less than 300 International Units and not more than 400 International Units of vitamin D; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: an emulsifying agent, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: added disodium phosphate or sodium citrate, or both.

Section.Label: B.08.013
Section.Text: [S]. Milk Powder, Whole Milk Powder, Dry Whole Milk, or Powdered Whole Milk

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be dried milk;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not less than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 95 per cent milk solids, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 26 per cent milk fat;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain added vitamin D in such an amount that a reasonable daily intake of the milk contains not less than 300 International Units and not more than 400 International Units of vitamin D; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: may contain the emulsifying agent lecithin in an amount not exceeding 0.5 per cent.

Text.Emphasis: [S]. Skim Milk Powder or Dry Skim Milk

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be dried skim milk;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not less than 95 per cent milk solids; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall, notwithstanding sections D.01.009 and D.01.010, contain added vitamin A in such an amount that a reasonable daily intake of the milk contains not less than 1,200 International Units and not more than 2,500 International Units of vitamin A;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain added vitamin D in such an amount that a reasonable daily intake of the milk contains not less than 300 International Units and not more than 400 International Units of vitamin D; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: may contain an anti-foaming agent.

Section.Label: B.08.014A
Section.Text: No person shall sell milk powder, whole milk powder, dry whole milk, powdered whole milk, skim milk powder or dry skim milk unless it is free from bacteria of the genus Salmonella, as determined by official method MFO-12, Microbiological Examination of Milk Powder, November 30, 1981.

Section.Label: B.08.015
Section.Text: No person shall sell milk, skim milk, partly skimmed milk, (naming the flavour) milk, (naming the flavour) skim milk, (naming the flavour) partly skimmed milk, skim milk with added milk solids, partly skimmed milk with added milk solids, (naming the flavour) skim milk with added milk solids, (naming the flavour) partly skimmed milk with added milk solids, condensed milk, evaporated milk, evaporated skim milk, evaporated partly skimmed milk, milk powder or skim milk powder, in which the vitamin content has been increased by either irradiation or addition unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the addition of vitamin D, the menstruum containing the vitamin D contributes not more than 0.01 per cent fat foreign to milk; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in cases where the vitamin D content is increased by irradiation, the principal display panel of the label carries the statement “Vitamin D Increased” immediately preceding or following the name of the food, without intervening written, printed or graphic matter.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the product made from

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: milk, milk powder, skim milk, skim milk powder, partly skimmed milk, evaporated milk, evaporated partly skimmed milk, evaporated skim milk or cream or any combination thereof,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a flavouring preparation, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a sweetening agent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not less than three per cent milk fat;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain added vitamin D in such an amount that a reasonable intake of the milk contains not less than 300 International Units and not more than 400 International Units of vitamin D;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: may contain salt, food colour, lactase, stabilizing agent and not more than 0.5 per cent starch; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: may contain not more than 50,000 total aerobic bacteria per cubic centimetre, as determined by official method MFO-7, Microbiological Examination of Milk, November 30, 1981.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the product made from

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: skim milk, skim milk powder or evaporated skim milk or any combination thereof,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a flavouring preparation, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a sweetening agent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not more than 0.3 per cent milk fat;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall, notwithstanding sections D.01.009 and D.01.010, contain added vitamin A in such an amount that a reasonable daily intake of the milk contains not less than 1,200 International Units and not more than 2,500 International Units of vitamin A;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain added vitamin D in such an amount that a reasonable daily intake of the milk contains not less than 300 International Units and not more than 400 International Units of vitamin D; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: may contain salt, food colour, lactase, stabilizing agent and not more than 0.5 per cent starch.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the product made from

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: milk, milk powder, skim milk, skim milk powder, partly skimmed milk, evaporated milk, evaporated partly skimmed milk, evaporated skim milk or cream or any combination thereof,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a flavouring preparation, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a sweetening agent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain more than 0.3 per cent and less than 3.0 per cent milk fat;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall, notwithstanding sections D.01.009 and D.01.010, contain added vitamin A in such an amount that a reasonable daily intake of the milk contains not less than 1,200 International Units and not more than 2,500 International Units of vitamin A;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain added vitamin D in such an amount that a reasonable daily intake of the milk contains not less than 300 International Units and not more than 400 International Units of vitamin D;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: may contain salt, food colour, lactase, stabilizing agent and not more than 0.5 per cent starch; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: may contain not more than 50,000 total aerobic bacteria per cubic centimetre, as determined by official method MFO-7, Microbiological Examination of Milk, November 30, 1981.

Text.Emphasis: [S]. Skim Milk with Added Milk Solids

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be skim milk to which has been added skim milk powder or evaporated skim milk or both;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not less than 10 per cent milk solids;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not more than 0.3 per cent milk fat;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: shall, notwithstanding sections D.01.009 and D.01.010, contain added vitamin A in such an amount that a reasonable daily intake of the dairy product contains not less than 1,200 International Units and not more than 2,500 International Units of vitamin A; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain added vitamin D in such an amount that a reasonable daily intake of the milk contains not less than 300 International Units and not more than 400 International Units of vitamin D.

Section.Label: B.08.020
Section.Text: [S]. Partly Skimmed Milk with Added Milk Solids or Partially Skimmed Milk with Added Milk Solids

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be partly skimmed milk to which has been added skim milk powder, milk powder, evaporated milk, evaporated partly skimmed milk or evaporated skim milk or any combination thereof;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not less than 10 per cent milk solids not including fat; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall, notwithstanding sections D.01.009 and D.01.010, contain added vitamin A in such an amount that a reasonable daily intake of the milk contains not less than 1,200 International Units and not more than 2,500 International Units of vitamin A; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain added vitamin D in such an amount that a reasonable daily intake of the milk contains not less than 300 International Units and not more than 400 International Units of vitamin D.

Section.Label: B.08.021
Section.Text: [S]. Malted Milk or Malted Milk Powder

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the product made by combining milk with the liquid separated from a mash of ground barley malt and meal;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may have added to it, in such manner as to secure the full enzyme action of the malt extract, salt and sodium bicarbonate or potassium bicarbonate;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: may have water removed from it; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 7.5 per cent milk fat, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than 3.5 per cent moisture.

Section.Label: B.08.022
Section.Text: [S]. (naming the flavour) Malted Milk or (naming the flavour) Malted Milk Powder

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be malted milk or malted milk powder containing a flavouring preparation; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain lactase.

Text.Emphasis: [S]. (naming the flavour) Skim Milk with Added Milk Solids

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the product made from

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: skim milk, skim milk powder, or evaporated skim milk or any combination thereof,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a flavouring preparation, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a sweetening agent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not less than 10 per cent milk solids not including fat;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not more than 0.3 per cent milk fat;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: shall, notwithstanding sections D.01.009 and D.01.010, contain added vitamin A in such an amount that a reasonable daily intake of the milk contains not less than 1,200 International Units and not more than 2,500 International Units of vitamin A;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain added vitamin D in such an amount that a reasonable daily intake of the milk contains not less than 300 International Units and not more than 400 International Units of vitamin D; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: may contain salt, food colour, lactase, stabilizing agent and not more than 0.5 per cent starch.

Section.Label: B.08.024
Section.Text: No person shall sell milk for manufacture into dairy products if it contains more than

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: two million total aerobic bacteria per millilitre, as determined by official method MFO-7, Microbiological Examination of Milk, November 30, 1981; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: two milligrams of sediment per 16 fluid ounces, as determined by official method MFO-8, Determination of Sediment in Milk, November 30, 1981.

Section.Label: B.08.025
Section.Text: No manufacturer shall purchase milk for manufacture or manufacture milk into other dairy products if he has reason to believe it does not meet the requirements of section B.08.024.

Text.Emphasis: [S]. (naming the flavour) Partly (Partially) Skimmed Milk with Added Milk Solids

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the product made from

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: milk, milk powder, skim milk, skim milk powder, partly skimmed milk, evaporated milk, evaporated partly skimmed milk, evaporated skim milk or cream or any combination thereof,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a flavouring preparation, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a sweetening agent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not less than 10 per cent milk solids not including fat;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain more than 0.3 per cent and less than 3.0 per cent milk fat;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: shall, notwithstanding sections D.01.009 and D.01.010, contain added vitamin A in such an amount that a reasonable daily intake of the milk contains not less than 1,200 International Units and not more than 2,500 International Units of vitamin A;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain added vitamin D in such an amount that a reasonable daily intake of the milk contains not less than 300 International Units and not more than 400 International Units of vitamin D;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: may contain salt, food colour, lactase, stabilizing agent and not more than 0.5 per cent starch; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: may contain not more than 50,000 total aerobic bacteria per cubic centimetre, as determined by official method MFO-7, Microbiological Examination of Milk, November 30, 1981.

Section.Label: B.08.027
