Section.Text: Notwithstanding anything contained in these Regulations, the following dairy products that are used in or sold for the manufacture of other foods are not required to contain added vitamins: milk; partly skimmed milk; partially skimmed milk; skim milk; sterilized milk; evaporated milk; evaporated skim milk; concentrated skim milk; evaporated partly skimmed milk; concentrated partly skimmed milk; milk powder; dry whole milk; powdered whole milk; skim milk powder; dry skim milk; partly skimmed milk powder; partially skimmed milk powder; skim milk with added milk solids; partly skimmed milk with added milk solids; and partially skimmed milk with added milk solids.

Subsection.Text: The percentage of milk fat contained in

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: (naming the flavour) milk,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: (naming the flavour) partly (partially) skimmed milk,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: (naming the flavour) partly (partially) skimmed milk with added milk solids,

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: cream, and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: sour cream,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: shall be shown on the principal display panel followed by the words “milk fat” or the abbreviation “B.F.” or “M.F.”.

Subsection.Text: In addition to the statement referred to in subsection (1), a person may, on the label of a food referred to in that subsection, make a declaration of the fat content of the food, expressed in grams per serving of stated size.

Section.Label: B.08.028.1
Section.Text: A lacteal secretion obtained from themammary gland of any animal other than a cow, genus Bos, and a product or derivative of such secretion shall be labelled so as to identify that animal.

Subsection.Text: Notwithstanding sections D.01.009 to D.01.011, no person shall sell goat’s milk or goat’s milk powder to which vitamin D has been added unless the goat’s milk or goat’s milk powder contains not less than 35 International Units and not more than 45 International Units of vitamin D per 100 mL of the food when ready-to-serve.

Notwithstanding sections D.01.009 to D.01.011, no person shall sell partly skimmed goat’s milk, skimmed goat’s milk, partly skimmed goat’s milk powder or skimmed goat’s milk powder to which vitamins have been added unless the product contains not less than 35 International Units of vitamin D and 140 International Units of vitamin A and not more than 45 International Units of vitamin D and 300 International Units of vitamin A per 100 mL of food when ready-to-serve.

Notwithstanding sections D.01.009 to D.01.011, no person shall sell evaporated goat’s milk to which vitamins have been added unless 100 mL of the evaporated goat’s milk, when reconstituted according to directions for use, contains not less than seven milligrams of vitamin C, 35 International Units of vitamin D and 10 micrograms of folic acid and not more than nine milligrams of vitamin C, 45 International Units of vitamin D and 20 micrograms of folic acid.

Notwithstanding sections D.01.009 to D.01.011, no person shall sell evaporated partly skimmed goat’s milk or evaporated skimmed goat’s milk to which vitamins have been added unless 100 mL of the evaporated partly skimmed goat’s milk or the evaporated skimmed goat’s milk, when reconstituted according to directions for use, contains not less than 140 International Units of vitamin A, seven milligrams of vitamin C, 35 International Units of vitamin D and 10 micrograms of folic acid and not more than 300 International Units of vitamin A, nine milligrams of vitamin C, 45 International Units of vitamin D and 20 micrograms of folic acid.
In this Division, when used with respect to cheese,

Definition.Text: pasteurized source means milk, skim milk, cream, reconstituted milk powder, reconstituted skim milk powder or any combination thereof that has been pasteurized by being held at a temperature of not less than 61.6°C for a period of not less than 30 minutes, or for a time and a temperature that is equivalent thereto in phosphatase destruction, as determined by official method MFO-3, Determination of Phosphatase Activity in Dairy Products, November 30, 1981; (matière première pasteurisée)
pickles and relishes means foods that meet the standard prescribed in section B.11.051; (cornichons et achards)
stored means to have been kept or held at a temperature of 2°C or more for a period of 60 days or more from the date of the beginning of the manufacturing process; (entreposé)
whole means of the original size and shape as manufactured. (entier)

Subsection.Text: The word “process” may be used in the place of the word “processed” in the following common names: processed (naming the variety) cheese, processed (naming the variety) cheese with (naming the added ingredients), processed cheese food, processed cheese food with (naming the added ingredients), processed cheese spread, and processed cheese spread with (naming the added ingredients).

Section.Label: B.08.031
Section.Text: A cheese made from milk that is the normal lacteal secretion of the mammary gland of animals other than the cow, genus Bos, shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: conform to all requirements in this Division applicable to the variety; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: be labelled to show the source of the milk on the principal display panel.

Subsection.Text: Each of the following foods for which a standard is prescribed, namely,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: (naming the variety) cheese,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: cheddar cheese,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: cream cheese,

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: whey cheese,

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: (naming the variety) whey cheese,

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: cream cheese with (naming the added ingredients),

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: cream cheese spread,

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: cream cheese spread with (naming the added ingredients),

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: processed (naming the variety) cheese,

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: processed (naming the variety) cheese with (naming the added ingredients),

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: processed cheese food,

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: processed cheese food with (naming the added ingredients),

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: processed cheese spread,

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: processed cheese spread with (naming the added ingredients),

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: cold-pack (naming the variety) cheese,

Paragraph.Label: (p)
Paragraph.Text: cold-pack (naming the variety) cheese with (naming the added ingredients),

Paragraph.Label: (q)
Paragraph.Text: cold-pack cheese food, and

Paragraph.Label: (r)
Paragraph.Text: cold-pack cheese food with (naming the added ingredients),

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: shall be labelled to show on the principal display panel a statement of the percentage of milk fat in the food followed by the words “milk fat” or the abbreviation “B.F.” or “M.F.”, and the percentage of moisture in the food followed by the word “moisture” or “water”.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (3), no person shall make any direct or indirect reference on the label of a food referred to in subsection (1) to the milk fat content or moisture content of the food except as required by subsection (1).

In addition to the statements referred to in subsection (1), a person may, on the label of a food referred to in that subsection, make a declaration of the fat content of the food, expressed in grams per serving of a stated size.

[S]. (Naming the variety) Cheese, other than cheddar cheese, cream cheese, whey cheese, cream cheese with (naming the added ingredients), cream cheese spread, cream cheese spread with (naming the added ingredients), processed (naming the variety) cheese, processed (naming the variety) cheese with (naming the added ingredients), processed cheese food, processed cheese food with (naming the added ingredients), processed cheese spread, processed cheese spread with (naming the added ingredients), cold-pack (naming the variety) cheese, cold-pack (naming the variety) cheese with (naming the added ingredients), cold-pack cheese food, cold-pack cheese food with (naming the added ingredients), cottage cheese and creamed cottage cheese,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: be the product made by coagulating milk, milk products or a combination thereof with the aid of bacteria to form a curd and forming the curd into a homogeneous mass after draining the whey,

Subparagraph.Label: (i.1)
Subparagraph.Text: except for feta cheese, have a casein content that is derived from milk or from ultrafiltered milk, partly skimmed milk, ultrafiltered partly skimmed milk, skim milk, ultrafiltered skim milk or cream, rather than from other milk products,that is at least the following percentage of the total protein content of the cheese, namely,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: 63 per cent in the case of Pizza Mozzarella cheese and Part Skim Pizza Mozzarella cheese,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: 83 per cent, in the case of Brick cheese, Canadian Style Brick cheese, Canadian Style Munster cheese, Colby cheese, Farmer’s cheese, Jack cheese, Monterey (Monterey Jack) cheese, Mozzarella (Scamorza) cheese, Part Skim Mozzarella (Part Skim Scamorza) cheese, Part Skim Pizza cheese, Pizza cheese, Skim milk cheese and any other variety of cheese not referred to in clause (A) or (C), and

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: 95 per cent, in the case of any other variety of cheese named in the table to this section,

Subparagraph.Label: (i.2)
Subparagraph.Text: have a whey protein to casein ratio that does not exceed the whey protein to casein ratio of milk,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: possess the physical, chemical and organoleptic properties typical for the variety,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: where it is a cheese of variety named in the table to this section, contain no more than the maximum percentage of moisture shown in Column II thereof for that variety,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: where it is a cheese of a variety named in Part I of the table to this section, contain no less than the minimum percentage of milk fat shown in Column III for that variety, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: where it is cheese of a variety named in Part II of the table to this section, contain no more than the maximum percentage of milk fat shown in Column III for that variety; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: salt, seasonings, condiments and spices,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: flavouring preparations other than cheese flavouring,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: micro-organisms to aid further ripening,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: one or more of the following colouring agents:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: in an amount consistent with good manufacturing practice, annatto, beta-carotene, chlorophyll, paprika, riboflavin or turmeric,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: in an amount not exceeding 35 parts per million, beta-apo-8’-carotenal, ethyl beta-apo-8’-carotenoate or a combination thereof, and

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: in an amount not exceeding 0.10 parts per million, brilliant blue FCF in feta cheese only,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: calcium chloride as a firming agent in an amount not exceeding 0.02 per cent of the milk and milk products used,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: paraffin wax as a coating in an amount consistent with good manufacturing practice,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: where potassium nitrate, sodium nitrate or a combination thereof are used for the purpose and in the manner described in subsection (2), residues of potassium nitrate, sodium nitrate or a combination thereof in an amount not exceeding 50 parts per million,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: wood smoke as a preservative in an amount consistent with good manufacturing practice,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: the following preservatives:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: propionic acid, calcium propionate, sodium propionate or any combination thereof in an amount not exceeding 2,000 parts per million, calculated as propionic acid,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: sorbic acid, calcium sorbate, potassium sorbate, sodium sorbate, or any combination thereof in an amount not exceeding 3,000 parts per million, calculated as sorbic acid,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: any combination of the preservatives named in clauses (A) and (B) in an amount not exceeding 3,000 parts per million, calculated as propionic acid and sorbic acid respectively, or

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: natamycin applied to the surface of the cheese in an amount that does not exceed 20 parts per million or, if the cheese is grated or shredded, 10 parts per million,

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of grated or shredded cheese, calcium silicate, microcrystalline cellulose or cellulose, or a combination of them, as an anticaking agent, the total amount not to exceed 2.0 per cent, and

Subparagraph.Label: (xi)
Subparagraph.Text: carbon dioxide as a pH adjusting agent in milk for cheese production, in an amount consistent with good manufacturing practice.

Subsection.Text: A cheese of a variety set out in column I of Part I of the table to this section may contain more than the maximum percentage of moisture set out in column II and less than the minimum percentage of milk fat set out in column III if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a statement or claim set out in column 4 of any of items 12 to 14, 16, 20, 21 and 45 of the table following section B.01.513 is shown on the label of the product as part of the common name; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the cheese has the characteristic flavour and texture of the named variety of cheese.

Subsection.Text: The reference to “83 per cent” in clause (1)(a)(i.1)(B) shall be read as “78 per cent”, and the reference to “95 per cent” in clause (1)(a)(i.1)(C) shall be read as “90 per cent”, with respect to the named variety of cheese if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a statement or claim set out in column 4 of any of items 12 to 14, 16, 20, 21 and 45 of the table following section B.01.513 is shown on the label of the product as part of the common name; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the cheese has the characteristic flavour and texture of the named variety of cheese.

Subsection.Text: Potassium nitrate, sodium nitrate or a combination thereof may be used as a preservative in cheese providing the following requirements are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of the salt or combination of salts does not exceed 200 parts per million of the milk and milk products used to make the cheese;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the cheese in which the preservative is used is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: mold ripened cheese packed in a hermetically sealed container, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: ripened cheese

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: that contains not more than 68 per cent moisture on a fat free basis, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: during the manufacture of which the lactic acid fermentation and salting was completed more than 12 hours after coagulation of the curd by enzymes; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the salting is, in the case of the cheese described in subparagraph (b)(ii), applied externally as a dry salt or in the form of a brine.

Subsection.Text: No person shall use an enzyme other than

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: aminopeptidase derived from Lactococcus lactis, bovine rennet derived from aqueous extracts from the fourth stomach of adult bovine animals, sheep and goats, chymosin A derived from Escherichia coli K-12, GE81 (pPFZ87A), chymosin B derived from Aspergillus niger var. awamori, GCC0349 (pGAMpR) or from Kluyveromyces marxianus var. lactis, DS1182 (pKS105), lipase derived from Animal pancreatic tissue; Aspergillus niger var.; Aspergillus oryzae var.; Edible forestomach tissue of calves, kids or lambs; Rhizopus oryzae var. or from Aspergillus oryzae (MLT-2) (pRML 787) (p3SR2); Rhizomucor miehei (Cooney and Emerson) (previous name: Mucor miehei (Cooney and Emerson)); Rhizopus niveus, milk coagulating enzyme derived from Rhizomucor miehei (Cooney and Emerson) (previous name: Mucor miehei (Cooney and Emerson)), from Mucor pusillus Lindt by pure culture fermentation process or from Aspergillus oryzae RET-1 (pBoel777), pepsin derived from glandular layer of porcine stomach, phospholipase derived from Aspergillus oryzae (pPFJo142), protease derived from Micrococcus caseolyticus var. or rennet derived from aqueous extracts from the fourth stomach of calves, kids or lambs, in the manufacture of any cheese to which subsection (1) applies;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a milk coagulating enzyme derived from Endothia parasitica and enzymes described in paragraph (a), in the manufacture of Emmentaler (Emmental, Swiss) cheese, Mozzarella (Scamorza) cheese and Part Skim Mozzarella (Part Skim Scamorza) cheese;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a milk coagulating enzyme derived from Endothia parasitica and enzymes described in paragraph (a), in the manufacture of Parmesan cheese and Romano cheese;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: protease derived from Aspergillus oryzae var., Aspergillus niger var. or Bacillus subtilis var., in the manufacture of Colby cheese; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: lysozyme derived from egg-white.

Subsection.Text: No person shall use an enzyme referred to in subsection (3) at a level of use above that consistent with good manufacturing practice.

Where a flavouring preparation, other than a flavouring preparation that has been traditionally used in the variety, is added to a cheese as permitted in subsection (1), the words “with (naming the flavouring preparation)” shall be added to the common name on any label.
Only a cheese to which wood smoke has been added as permitted in subsection (1) may be described by the term “smoked” on a label.
Where a cheese is labelled as permitted in subsection (5), the word “smoked” shall be shown on the principal display panel.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: be the product that is made by coagulating milk, milk products or a combination of those things with the aid of bacteria to form a curd and subjecting the curd to the cheddar process or any process other than the cheddar process that produces a cheese having the same physical, chemical and organoleptic properties as those of cheese produced by the cheddar process,

Subparagraph.Label: (i.1)
Subparagraph.Text: have a casein content that is derived from milk or from ultrafiltered milk, partly skimmed milk, ultrafiltered partly skimmed milk, skim milk, ultrafiltered skim milk or cream, rather than from other milk products, that is at least 83 per cent of the total protein content of the cheese,

Subparagraph.Label: (i.2)
Subparagraph.Text: have a whey protein to casein ratio that does not exceed the whey protein to casein ratio of milk, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: contain

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: not more than 39 per cent moisture, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: not less than 31 per cent milk fat;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: salt,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: flavouring preparations other than cheese flavouring,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: bacterial cultures to aid further ripening,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: one or more of the following colouring agents:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: in an amount consistent with good manufacturing practice, annatto, beta-carotene, chlorophyll, paprika, riboflavin, turmeric, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: in an amount not exceeding 35 parts per million, either singly or in combination thereof, beta-apo-8’-carotenal, ethyl beta-apo-8’-carotenoate,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: calcium chloride as a firming agent in an amount not exceeding 0.02 per cent of the milk and milk products used,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: wood smoke as a preservative in an amount consistent with good manufacturing practice,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: the following preservatives:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: propionic acid, calcium propionate, sodium propionate or a combination thereof in an amount not exceeding 2,000 parts per million calculated as propionic acid,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: sorbic acid, calcium sorbate, potassium sorbate, sodium sorbate or a combination thereof in an amount not exceeding 3,000 parts per million calculated as sorbic acid,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: any combination of the preservatives named in clauses (A) and (B) in an amount not exceeding 3,000 parts per million calculated as propionic acid and sorbic acid respectively, or

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: natamycin applied to the surface of the cheese in an amount that does not exceed 20 parts per million or, if the cheese is grated or shredded, 10 parts per million, and

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of grated or shredded cheddar cheese, calcium silicate, microcrystalline cellulose or cellulose, or a combination of them, as an anticaking agent, the total amount not to exceed 2.0 per cent; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall not be labelled or advertised as cheddar cheese that has been aged unless

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: it is made solely with milk, ultrafiltered milk, partly skimmed milk, ultrafiltered partly skimmed milk, skim milk, ultrafiltered skim milk or cream or a combination of those things, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: it has been aged for at least nine months and the period for which it has been aged is specified on the principal display panel of that label or in that advertising.

Subsection.Text: Cheddar cheese may contain more than the maximum percentage of moisture set out in clause (1)(a)(ii)(A) and less than the minimum percentage of milk fat set out in clause (1)(a)(ii)(B) if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a statement or claim set out in column 4 of any of items 12 to 14, 16, 20, 21 and 45 of the table following section B.01.513 is shown on the label of the product as part of the common name; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the cheese has the characteristic flavour and texture of cheddar cheese.

Subsection.Text: The reference to “83 per cent” in subparagraph (1)(a)(i.1) shall be read as “78 per cent” if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a statement or claim set out in column 4 of any of items 12 to 14, 16, 20, 21 and 45 of the table following section B.01.513 is shown on the label of the product as part of the common name; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the cheese has the characteristic flavour and texture of cheddar cheese.

Subsection.Text: No person shall, in the manufacture of the cheddar cheese, use any enzyme other than

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: aminopeptidase derived from Lactococcus lactis, chymosin A derived from Escherichia coli K-12, GE81 (pPFZ87A), chymosin B derived from Aspergillus niger var. awamori, GCC0349 (pGAMpR) or from Kluyveromyces marxianus var. lactis, DS1182 (pKS105), lipase derived from Animal pancreatic tissue; Aspergillus niger var.; Aspergillus oryzae var.; Edible forestomach tissue of calves, kids or lambs; Rhizopus oryzae var. or from Aspergillus oryzae (MLT-2) (pRML 787) (p3SR2); Rhizomucor miehei (Cooney and Emerson) (previous name: Mucor miehei (Cooney and Emerson)); Rhizopus niveus, milk coagulating enzyme derived from Rhizomucor miehei (Cooney and Emerson) (previous name: Mucor miehei (Cooney and Emerson)), from Mucor pusillus Lindt by pure culture fermentation process or from Aspergillus oryzae RET-1 (pBoel777), pepsin derived from glandular layer of porcine stomach, phospholipase derived from Aspergillus oryzae (pPFJo142) or rennet derived from aqueous extracts from the fourth stomach of calves, kids or lambs;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: protease derived from Aspergillus oryzae; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: lysozyme derived from egg-white.

Subsection.Text: No person shall use an enzyme referred to in subsection (2) at a level of use above that consistent with good manufacturing practice.
Where a flavouring preparation is added to a cheese as permitted in subsection (1), the words “with (naming the flavouring preparation)” shall be added to the common name in any label.
Only a cheese to which wood smoke has been added as permitted in subsection (1) may be described by the term “smoked” on a label.
Where a cheese is labelled as permitted in subsection (4), the word “smoked” shall be shown on the principal display panel.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: be the product made by coagulating cream with the aid of bacteria to form a curd and forming the curd into a homogeneous mass after draining the whey, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: contain

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: not more than 55 per cent moisture, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: not less than 30 per cent milk fat; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: cream added to adjust the milk fat content,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: salt,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: nitrogen to improve spreadability in an amount consistent with good manufacturing practice,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the following emulsifying, gelling, stabilizing and thickening agents:

Provision.Text: ammonium carrageenan, calcium carrageenan, carob bean gum (locust bean gum), carrageenan, gelatin, guar gum, Irish Moss Gelose, potassium carrageenan, propylene glycol alginate, sodium carboxymethyl cellulose (carboxymethyl cellulose, cellulose gum, sodium cellulose glycolate), sodium carrageenan, tragacanth gum, xanthan gum or any combination thereof in an amount not exceeding 0.5 per cent, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the following preservatives:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: propionic acid, calcium propionate, sodium propionate or any combination thereof in an amount not exceeding 2,000 parts per million, calculated as propionic acid,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: sorbic acid, calcium sorbate, potassium sorbate, sodium sorbate or any combination thereof in an amount not exceeding 3,000 parts per million, calculated as sorbic acid, or

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: any combination of the preservatives named in clauses (A) and (B) in an amount not exceeding 3,000 parts per million, calculated as propionic acid and sorbic acid respectively.

Subsection.Text: No person shall use any enzyme

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: other than chymosin A derived from Escherichia coli K-12, GE81 (pPFZ87A), chymosin B derived from Aspergillus niger var. awamori, GCC0349 (pGAMpR) or from Kluyveromyces marxianus var. lactis, DS1182 (pKS 105), pepsin derived from glandular layer of porcine stomach or rennet derived from aqueous extracts from the fourth stomach of calves, kids or lambs, in the manufacture of cream cheese; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: at a level of use above that consistent with good manufacturing practice.

Text.Emphasis: [S]. Whey Cheese or (naming the variety) Whey Cheese

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the product made by coagulating whey or concentrated whey with the aid of heat to form a curd and shaping the curd; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: micro-organisms to aid further ripening,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: added milk and milk products, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: acetic acid, calcium carbonate, citric acid, lactic acid, malic acid, phosphoric acid, potassium bicarbonate, potassium carbonate, sodium bicarbonate, sodium carbonate, sodium hydroxide and tartaric acid as pH adjusting agents in an amount consistent with good manufacturing practice.

Subsection.Text: No person shall use, to aid coagulation of whey in the manufacture of whey cheese, a substance other than vinegar or sour whey.

Text.Emphasis: [S]. Cream Cheese with (naming the added ingredients)

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: be the product made by coagulating cream with the aid of bacteria to form a curd and forming the curd into a homogeneous mass after draining the whey, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: contain the named added ingredients which shall be one or more of the following ingredients in amounts sufficient to differentiate the product from cream cheese but not in amounts so large as to change the basic nature of the product:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: cheese other than cream cheese,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: chocolate, condiments, flavouring preparations, seasonings or spices,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: fruits, nuts, pickles, relishes or vegetables,

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: prepared or preserved meat, or

Clause.Label: (E)
Clause.Text: prepared or preserved fish, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: contain

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: not more than 60 per cent moisture, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: not less than 26 per cent milk fat; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: cream added to adjust the milk fat content,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: salt,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: nitrogen to improve spreadability in an amount consistent with good manufacturing practice,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: one or more of the following colouring agents:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: in an amount consistent with good manufacturing practice, annatto, beta-carotene, chlorophyll, paprika, riboflavin, turmeric, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: in an amount not exceeding 35 parts per million, either singly or in combination thereof, beta-apo-8’-carotenal, ethyl beta-apo-8’-carotenoate,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the following emulsifying, gelling, stabilizing and thickening agents:

Provision.Text: ammonium carrageenan, calcium carrageenan, carob bean gum (locust bean gum), carrageenan, gelatin, guar gum, Irish Moss Gelose, potassium carrageenan, propylene glycol alginate, sodium carboxymethyl cellulose (carboxymethyl cellulose, cellulose gum, sodium cellulose glycolate), sodium carrageenan, tragacanth gum, xanthan gum or any combination thereof in an amount not exceeding 0.5 per cent, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the following preservatives:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: propionic acid, calcium propionate, sodium propionate or any combination thereof in an amount not exceeding 2,000 parts per million, calculated as propionic acid,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: sorbic acid, calcium sorbate, potassium sorbate, sodium sorbate, or any combination thereof in an amount not exceeding 3,000 parts per million, calculated as sorbic acid, or

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: any combination of the preservatives named in clauses (A) and (B) in an amount not exceeding 3,000 parts per million, calculated as propionic acid and sorbic acid respectively.

Subsection.Text: No person shall use any enzyme

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: other than chymosin A derived from Escherichia coli K-12, GE81 (pPFZ87A), chymosin B derived from Aspergillus niger var. awamori, GCC0349 (pGAMpR) or from Kluyveromyces marxianus var. lactis, DS1182 (pKS 105), pepsin derived from glandular layer of porcine stomach or rennet derived from aqueous extracts from the fourth stomach of calves, kids or lambs, in the manufacture of a product to which subsection (1) applies; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: at a level of use above that consistent with good manufacturing practice.

Paragraph.Text: shall

Subparagraph.Label: (v)

Clause.Label: (A)

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: calcium phosphate dibasic, potassium phosphate dibasic, sodium acid pyrophosphate, sodium aluminum phosphate, sodium hexametaphosphate, sodium phosphate dibasic, sodium phosphate monobasic, sodium phosphate tribasic, sodium pyrophosphate tetrabasic, calcium citrate, potassium citrate, sodium citrate, sodium potassium tartrate, sodium tartrate, sodium gluconate or any combination thereof in an amount, when calculated as anhydrous salts, not exceeding 3.5 per cent in the case of phosphate salts and 4.0 per cent in total,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: the following preservatives:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: propionic acid, calcium propionate, sodium propionate or any combination thereof in an amount not exceeding 2,000 parts per million, calculated as propionic acid,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: sorbic acid, calcium sorbate, potassium sorbate, sodium sorbate, or any combination thereof in an amount not exceeding 3,000 parts per million, calculated as sorbic acid, or

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: any combination of the preservatives named in clauses (A) and (B) in an amount not exceeding 3,000 parts per million, calculated as propionic acid and sorbic acid respectively.

Subsection.Text: No person shall use any enzyme

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: other than chymosin A derived from Escherichia coli K-12, GE81 (pPFZ87A), chymosin B derived from Aspergillus niger var. awamori, GCC0349 (pGAMpR) or from Kluyveromyces marxianus var. lactis, DS1182 (pKS 105), pepsin derived from glandular layer of porcine stomach or rennet derived from aqueous extracts from the fourth stomach of calves, kids or lambs, in the manufacture of a product to which subsection (1) applies; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: at a level of use above that consistent with good manufacturing practice.

Clause.Text: not more than 60 per cent moisture, and

Clause.Label: (C)

Subparagraph.Label: (i)

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: salt, vinegar and sweetening agents,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)

Clause.Label: (A)

Clause.Label: (B)

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: in an amount not exceeding 1.5%, caramel,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the following emulsifying, gelling, stabilizing and thickening agents:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: ammonium carrageenan, calcium carrageenan, carob bean gum (locust bean gum), carrageenan, gelatin, guar gum, Irish Moss Gelose, potassium carrageenan, propylene glycol alginate, sodium carboxymethyl cellulose (carboxymethyl cellulose, cellulose gum, sodium cellulose glycolate), sodium carrageenan, tragacanth gum, xanthan gum or a combination thereof in an amount not exceeding 0.5 per cent, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: calcium phosphate dibasic, potassium phosphate dibasic, sodium acid pyrophosphate, sodium aluminum phosphate, sodium hexametaphosphate, sodium phosphate dibasic, sodium phosphate monobasic, sodium phosphate tribasic, sodium pyrophosphate tetrabasic, calcium citrate, potassium citrate, sodium citrate, sodium potassium tartrate, sodium tartrate, sodium gluconate or any combination thereof in an amount, when calculated as anhydrous salts, not exceeding 3.5 per cent in the case of phosphate salts and 4.0 per cent in total,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: acetic acid, calcium carbonate, citric acid, lactic acid, malic acid, phosphoric acid, potassium bicarbonate, potassium carbonate, sodium bicarbonate, sodium carbonate and tartaric acid as pH adjusting agents in an amount consistent with good manufacturing practice, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: the following preservatives:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: propionic acid, calcium propionate, sodium propionate or any combination thereof in an amount not exceeding 2,000 parts per million, calculated as propionic acid,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: sorbic acid, calcium sorbate, potassium sorbate, sodium sorbate, or any combination thereof in an amount not exceeding 3,000 parts per million, calculated as sorbic acid, or

Clause.Label: (C)

Subsection.Text: No person shall use any enzyme

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: other than chymosin A derived from Escherichia coli K-12, GE81 (pPFZ87A), chymosin B derived from Aspergillus niger var. awamori, GCC0349 (pGAMpR) or from Kluyveromyces marxianus var. lactis, DS1182 (pKS 105), pepsin derived from glandular layer of porcine stomach or rennet derived from aqueous extracts from the fourth stomach of calves, kids or lambs, in the manufacture of a product to which subsection (1) applies; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: at a level of use above that consistent with good manufacturing practice.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (ii), be the product made by comminuting and mixing the named variety or varieties of cheese, other than cream cheese, cottage cheese or whey cheese, into a homogeneous mass with the aid of heat,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of processed cheddar cheese, be the product made by comminuting and mixing one or more of the following:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: cheddar cheese,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: stirred curd cheese,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: granular curd cheese, or

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: washed curd cheese

ContinuedSubparagraph.Text: into a homogeneous mass with the aid of heat,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: have, where it is made from

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: one variety of cheese, in which the maximum amount of moisture permitted is less than 40 per cent, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: two or more varieties of cheese, in which the average maximum amount of moisture permitted is less than 40 per cent,

ContinuedSubparagraph.Text: a moisture content that does not exceed, by more than five per cent, the amount referred to in clause (A) or (B), as the case may be, and a milk fat content that is not less, by more than three per cent, than the minimum milk fat content or average minimum milk fat content permitted for that variety or those varieties, as the case may be,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subparagraph (v), have, where it is made from

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: one variety of cheese, in which the maximum amount of moisture permitted is 40 per cent or more, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: more than one variety of cheese, in which the average maximum amount of moisture permitted is 40 per cent or more,

ContinuedSubparagraph.Text: a moisture content that does not exceed, by more than three per cent, the amount referred to in clause (A) or (B), as the case may be, and a milk fat content that is not less, by more than two per cent, than the minimum milk fat content or average minimum milk fat content permitted for that variety or those varieties, as the case may be, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of processed skim milk cheese, contain not more than

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: 55 per cent moisture, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: seven per cent milk fat; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: water added to adjust the moisture content,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: added milk fat,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of processed skim milk cheese, added skim milk powder, buttermilk powder and whey powder,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: salt, vinegar and sweetening agents,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: one or more of the following colouring agents:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: in an amount consistent with good manufacturing practice, annatto, beta-carotene, chlorophyll, paprika, riboflavin, turmeric, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: in an amount not exceeding 35 parts per million, either singly or in combination thereof, beta-apo-8′-carotenal, ethyl beta-apo-8′-carotenoate,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the following emulsifying, gelling, stabilizing and thickening agents:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: sodium carboxymethyl cellulose (carboxymethyl cellulose, cellulose gum, sodium cellulose glycolate) in an amount not exceeding 0.5 per cent,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: calcium phosphate dibasic, potassium phosphate dibasic, sodium acid pyrophosphate, sodium aluminum phosphate, sodium hexametaphosphate, sodium phosphate dibasic, sodium phosphate monobasic, sodium phosphate tribasic, sodium pyrophosphate tetrabasic, calcium citrate, potassium citrate, sodium citrate, sodium potassium tartrate, sodium tartrate, sodium gluconate or any combination thereof in an amount, when calculated as anhydrous salts, not exceeding 3.5 per cent in the case of phosphate salts and 4.0 per cent in total,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: lecithin in an amount not exceeding 0.2 per cent, and

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: monoglycerides, mono- and diglycerides or any combination thereof in an amount not exceeding 0.5 per cent,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi.1)
Subparagraph.Text: calcium phosphate tribasic as an agent to improve colour, texture, consistency and spreadability, in an amount not exceeding 1 per cent,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: acetic acid, calcium carbonate, citric acid, lactic acid, malic acid, phosphoric acid, potassium bicarbonate, potassium carbonate, sodium bicarbonate, sodium carbonate and tartaric acid as pH adjusting agents in an amount consistent with good manufacturing practice,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: wood smoke as a preservative in an amount consistent with good manufacturing practice, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: the following preservatives:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: propionic acid, calcium propionate, sodium propionate or any combination thereof in an amount not exceeding 2,000 parts per million, calculated as propionic acid,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: sorbic acid, calcium sorbate, potassium sorbate, sodium sorbate, or any combination thereof in an amount not exceeding 3,000 parts per million, calculated as sorbic acid, or

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: any combination of the preservatives named in clauses (A) and (B) in an amount not exceeding 3,000 parts per million, calculated as propionic acid and sorbic acid respectively.

Subsection.Text: Only a cheese to which wood smoke has been added as permitted in subsection (1) may be described by the term “smoked” on a label.
Where a cheese is labelled as permitted in subsection (2), the word “smoked” shall be shown on the principal display panel.

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the following emulsifying, gelling, stabilizing and thickening agents:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: sodium carboxymethyl cellulose (carboxymethyl cellulose, cellulose gum, sodium cellulose glycolate) in an amount not exceeding 0.5 per cent,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: calcium phosphate dibasic, potassium phosphate dibasic, sodium acid pyrophosphate, sodium aluminum phosphate, sodium hexametaphosphate, sodium phosphate dibasic, sodium phosphate monobasic, sodium phosphate tribasic, sodium pyrophosphate tetrabasic, calcium citrate, potassium citrate, sodium citrate, sodium potassium tartrate, sodium tartrate, sodium gluconate or any combination thereof in an amount, when calculated as anhydrous salts, not exceeding 3.5 per cent in the case of phosphate salts and 4.0 per cent in total,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: lecithin in an amount not exceeding 0.2 per cent, and

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: monoglycerides, mono- and diglycerides or any combination thereof in an amount not exceeding 0.5 per cent,

Subparagraph.Label: (v.1)
Subparagraph.Text: calcium phosphate tribasic as an agent to improve colour, texture, consistency and spreadability, in an amount not exceeding 1 per cent,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: acetic acid, calcium carbonate, citric acid, lactic acid, malic acid, phosphoric acid, potassium bicarbonate, potassium carbonate, sodium bicarbonate, sodium carbonate and tartaric acid as pH adjusting agents in an amount consistent with good manufacturing practice,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: wood smoke as a preservative in an amount consistent with good manufacturing practice, and

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: the following preservatives:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: propionic acid, calcium propionate, sodium propionate or any combination thereof in an amount not exceeding 2,000 parts per million, calculated as propionic acid,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: sorbic acid, calcium sorbate, potassium sorbate, sodium sorbate, or any combination thereof in an amount not exceeding 3,000 parts per million, calculated as sorbic acid, or

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: any combination of the preservatives named in clauses (A) and (B) in an amount not exceeding 3,000 parts per million, calculated as propionic acid and sorbic acid respectively.

Subsection.Text: Only a cheese to which wood smoke has been added as permitted in subsection (1) may be described by the term “smoked” on a label.

Clause.Text: propionic acid, calcium propionate, sodium propionate or any combination thereof in an amount not exceeding 2,000 parts per million, calculated as propionic acid,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: sorbic acid, calcium sorbate, potassium sorbate, sodium sorbate, or any combination thereof in an amount not exceeding 3,000 parts per million, calculated as sorbic acid, or

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: any combination of the preservatives named in clauses (A) and (B) in an amount not exceeding 3,000 parts per million, calculated as propionic acid and sorbic acid respectively.

Subsection.Text: Only a cheese to which wood smoke has been added as permitted in subsection (1) may be described by the term “smoked” on a label.
Where a cheese is labelled as permitted in subsection (2), the word “smoked” shall be shown on the principal display panel.

Text.Emphasis: [S]. Cold-Pack Cheese Food with (naming the added ingredients)

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: be the product made by comminuting and mixing one or more varieties of cheese, other than cream cheese, cottage cheese or whey cheese, into a homogeneous mass without the aid of heat,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: contain the named added ingredients which shall be one or more of the following ingredients in amounts sufficient to differentiate the product from cold-pack cheese food but not in amounts so large as to change the basic nature of the product:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: chocolate, condiments, flavouring preparations, seasonings or spices,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: fruits, nuts, pickles, relishes or vegetables,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: prepared or preserved meat, or

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: prepared or preserved fish, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: contain

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: added milk or milk products,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: not more than 46 per cent moisture, and

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: not less than 22 per cent milk fat; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: water added to adjust moisture content,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: added milk fat,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: sweetening agents, salt and vinegar,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: one or more of the following colouring agents:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: in an amount consistent with good manufacturing practice, annatto, beta-carotene, chlorophyll, paprika, riboflavin, turmeric, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: in an amount not exceeding 35 parts per million, either singly or in combination thereof, beta-apo-8′-carotenal, ethyl beta-apo-8′-carotenoate,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the following emulsifying, gelling, stabilizing and thickening agents:

Provision.Text: ammonium carrageenan, calcium carrageenan, carob bean gum (locust bean gum), carrageenan, gelatin, guar gum, Irish Moss Gelose, potassium carrageenan, propylene glycol alginate, sodium carboxymethyl cellulose (carboxymethyl cellulose, cellulose gum, sodium cellulose glycolate), sodium carrageenan, tragacanth gum, xanthan gum or a combination thereof in an amount not exceeding 0.5 per cent,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: acetic acid, calcium carbonate, citric acid, lactic acid, malic acid, phosphoric acid, potassium bicarbonate, potassium carbonate, sodium bicarbonate, sodium carbonate and tartaric acid as pH adjusting agents in an amount consistent with good manufacturing practice,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: wood smoke as a preservative in an amount consistent with good manufacturing practice, and

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: the following preservatives:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: propionic acid, calcium propionate, sodium propionate or any combination thereof in an amount not exceeding 2,000 parts per million, calculated as propionic acid,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: sorbic acid, calcium sorbate, potassium sorbate, sodium sorbate, or any combination thereof in an amount not exceeding 3,000 parts per million, calculated as sorbic acid, or

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: any combination of the preservatives named in clauses (A) and (B) in an amount not exceeding 3,000 parts per million, calculated as propionic acid and sorbic acid respectively.

Subsection.Text: Only a cheese to which wood smoke has been added as permitted in subsection (1) may be described by the term “smoked” on a label.
Where a cheese is labelled as permitted in subsection (2), the word “smoked” shall be shown on the principal display panel.

Section.Label: B.08.042
Section.Text: No manufacturer shall sell whole cheese that is not made from a pasteurized source unless the date of the beginning of the manufacturing process is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: marked or branded thereon within three days thereof; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: marked on the label at the time of packaging, if the cheese is such that, because of its texture, consistency, or physical structure, such date cannot be effectively branded or marked on the cheese.

Section.Label: B.08.043
Section.Text: No manufacturer shall sell any cheese that is not made from a pasteurized source if it has been cut into smaller portions, unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it has been duly stored; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: each portion of cut cheese is marked, branded or labelled with the date of the beginning of the manufacturing process.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), no person shall sell cheese, including cheese curd, that is not made from a pasteurized source unless it has been stored.

Cheese, including cheese curd, that is not made from a pasteurized source may be used as an ingredient in any food providing such food is manufactured or processed so as to pasteurize the cheese in the manner described in the definition pasteurized source in section B.08.030(1).

Section.Label: B.08.045
Section.Text: Notwithstanding B.08.044, cheese that has not been manufactured from a pasteurized source and has not been stored but is marked or branded with the date of the beginning of the manufacturing process, may be sold to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a wholesaler;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a jobber; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in quantities of not less than 900 pounds, to a retailer.

Section.Label: B.08.046
Section.Text: No person shall sell any whole cheese that has not been made from a pasteurized source unless there is stamped thereon the date of the beginning of the manufacturing process.

Section.Label: B.08.047
Section.Text: Every manufacturer, wholesaler, or jobber who sells cheese not made from a pasteurized source and which has not been stored shall keep a record of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the registered number of the cheese factory,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date of manufacture of the cheese,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the vat number or vat numbers,

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the person to whom the cheese is sold, and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the weight sold from each vat,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: for each lot of cheese sold.

Subsection.Text: Subject to section B.08.054, no person shall sell cheese, including cheese curd, made from a pasteurized source if the cheese contains more than

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: 100 Escherichia coli, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 100 Staphylococcus aureus

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: per gram, as determined by official method MFO-14, Microbiological Examination of Cheese, November 30, 1983.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell cheese, made from an unpasteurized source if the cheese contains more than

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: 500 Escherichia coli, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 1,000 Staphylococcus aureus

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: per gram, as determined by official method MFO-14, Microbiological Examination of Cheese, November 30, 1983.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the product remaining after the curd has been removed from milk in the process of making cheese; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: catalase, in the case of liquid whey that has been treated with hydrogen peroxide,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: lactase,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: hydrogen peroxide, in the case of liquid whey destined for the manufacture of dried whey products,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: benzoyl peroxide, and calcium phosphate tribasic and calcium sulphate as carriers of the benzoyl peroxide, in the case of liquid whey destined for the manufacture of dried whey products other than those for use in infant formula, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: sodium hexametaphosphate, in the case of liquid whey destined for the manufacture of concentrated or dried whey products.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the product, in the form of discrete curd particles, prepared from skim milk, evaporated skim milk or skim milk powder and harmless acid-producing bacterial cultures;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not more than 80 per cent moisture;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: may contain not more than 0.5 per cent stabilizing agent; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: milk,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: cream,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: milk powder,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: rennet derived from aqueous extracts from the fourth stomach of calves, kids or lambs,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a milk coagulating enzyme derived from Rhizomucor miehei (Cooney and Emerson) (previous name: Mucor miehei (Cooney and Emerson)), from Mucor pusillus Lindt by pure culture fermentation process or from Aspergillus oryzae RET-1 (pBoel777), in an amount consistent with good manufacturing practice,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: chymosin A derived from Escherichia coli K-12, GE81 (pPFZ87A), in an amount consistent with good manufacturing practice,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi.1)
Subparagraph.Text: chymosin B derived from Aspergillus niger var. awamori, GCC0349 (pGAMpR) or from Kluyveromyces marxianus var. lactis, DS1182 (pKS105), in an amount consistent with good manufacturing practice,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi.2)
Subparagraph.Text: pepsin derived from glandular layer of porcine stomach,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: salt,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: calcium chloride,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: added lactose,

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: pH adjusting agents,

Subparagraph.Label: (xi)
Subparagraph.Text: relishes,

Subparagraph.Label: (xii)
Subparagraph.Text: fruits,

Subparagraph.Label: (xiii)
Subparagraph.Text: vegetables, and

Subparagraph.Label: (xiv)
Subparagraph.Text: carbon dioxide.

Section.Label: B.08.052
Section.Text: [S]. Creamed Cottage Cheese shall be cottage cheese containing cream or a mixture of cream with milk or skim milk, or both, in such quantity that the final product shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not less than four per cent milk fat; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not more than 80 per cent moisture and may contain emulsifying, gelling, stabilizing and thickening agents.

Section.Label: B.08.053
Section.Text: All dairy products used in the preparation of cottage cheese shall be from a pasteurized source.

Section.Label: B.08.054
Section.Text: No person shall sell cottage cheese or creamed cottage cheese that contains more than 10 coliform bacteria per gram, as determined by official method MFO-4, Microbiological Examination of Cottage Cheese, November 30, 1981.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: be the food prepared in accordance with good manufacturing practices from milk or milk products, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: contain not less than 80 per cent milk fat; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: milk solids,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: bacterial culture,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: salt, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: food colour.

Section.Label: B.08.057
Section.Text: [S]. Whey Butter shall be butter made from whey cream.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the unfrozen, pasteurized combination of cream, milk or other milk products, sweetened with sugar, liquid sugar, invert sugar, honey, dextrose, glucose, corn syrup, corn syrup solids or any combination of such sweeteners;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: egg,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a flavouring preparation,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: cocoa or chocolate syrup,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a food colour,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: pH adjusting agents,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: microcrystalline cellulose or a stabilizing agent or both in an amount that will not exceed 0.5 per cent of the ice cream made from the mix,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: a sequestering agent,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: salt,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than one per cent added edible casein or edible caseinates; and

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: propylene glycol mono fatty acid esters in an amount that will not exceed 0.35 per cent of the ice cream made from the mix and sorbitan tristearate in an amount that will not exceed 0.035 per cent of the ice cream made from the mix; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not less than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 36 per cent solids, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 10 per cent milk fat or, where cocoa or chocolate syrup has been added, eight per cent milk fat.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the frozen food obtained by freezing an ice cream mix, with or without the incorporation of air;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain cocoa or chocolate syrup, fruit, nuts or confections;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not less than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 36 per cent solids,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 10 per cent milk fat, or, where cocoa or chocolate syrup, fruit, nuts, or confections have been added, eight per cent milk fat, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: 180 grams of solids per litre of which amount not less than 50 grams shall be milk fat, or, where cocoa or chocolate syrup, fruit, nuts or confections have been added, 180 grams of solids per litre of which amount not less than 40 grams shall be milk fat; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 100,000 bacteria per gram, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 10 coliform organisms per gram,

ContinuedParagraph.Text: as determined by official method MFO-2, Microbiological Examination of Ice Cream or Ice Milk, November 30, 1981.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the frozen food, other than ice cream or ice milk, made from a milk product;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: water,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a sweetening agent,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: fruit or fruit juice,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: citric or tartaric acid,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a flavouring preparation,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: a food colour,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than 0.75 per cent stabilizing agent,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: a sequestering agent,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: lactose,

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than 0.5 per cent microcrystalline cellulose, and

Subparagraph.Label: (xi)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than one per cent added edible casein or edible caseinates; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than five per cent milk solids, including milk fat, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 0.35 per cent acid determined by titration and expressed as lactic acid.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the unfrozen, pasteurized combination of cream, milk or other milk products, sweetened with sugar, liquid sugar, invert sugar, honey, dextrose, glucose, corn syrup, corn syrup solids or any combination of such sweeteners;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: egg,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a flavouring preparation,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: cocoa or chocolate syrup,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a food colour,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a pH adjusting agent,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: a stabilizing agent, in an amount that will not result in more than 0.5 per cent stabilizing agent in the ice milk,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: a sequestering agent,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: added lactose, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than 1.5 per cent microcrystalline cellulose,

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: salt, and

Subparagraph.Label: (xi)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than one per cent added edible casein or edible caseinates; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 33 per cent solids, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than three per cent and not more than five per cent milk fat.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the frozen food obtained by freezing an ice milk mix, with or without the incorporation of air;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain cocoa or chocolate syrup, fruit, nuts or confections;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 33 per cent solids,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than three per cent and not more than five per cent milk fat, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 160 grams of solids per litre of which amount not less than 14 grams shall be milk fat; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 100,000 bacteria per gram, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 10 coliform organisms per gram,

ContinuedParagraph.Text: as determined by official method MFO-2, Microbiological Examination of Ice Cream or Ice Milk, November 30, 1981.

Subsection.Text: The percentage of milk fat contained in

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: yogurt,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: cottage cheese, and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: creamed cottage cheese,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: shall be shown on the principal display panel followed by the words “milk fat” or the abbreviation “B.F.” or “M.F.”.

Subsection.Text: In addition to the statement referred to in subsection (1), a person may, on the label of a food referred to in subsection (1), make a declaration of the fat content of the food, expressed in grams per serving of stated size.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the fatty liquid prepared from milk by separating the milk constituents in such a manner as to increase the milk fat content; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a pH adjusting agent,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a stabilizing agent,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of cream for whipping that has been heat-treated above 100°C, the following ingredients and food additives:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: skim milk powder in an amount not exceeding 0.25 per cent,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: glucose solids in an amount not exceeding 0.1 per cent,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: calcium sulphate in an amount not exceeding 0.005 per cent, and

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: xanthan gum in an amount not exceeding 0.02 per cent, and

Paragraph.Label: (iv)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of cream for whipping, microcrystalline cellulose in an amount not exceeding 0.2 per cent.

Subsection.Text: The percentage of milk fat contained in canned cream shall be shown on the principal display panel followed by the words “milk fat” or the abbreviation “B.F.” or “M.F.”.

In addition to the statement referred to in subsection (1), a person may, on the label of canned cream, make a declaration of the fat content of the cream, expressed in grams per serving of stated size.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the product prepared by the souring of pasteurized cream with acid-producing bacterial culture and shall contain not less than 14 per cent milk fat; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: milk solids,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: whey solids,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: buttermilk,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: starch in an amount not exceeding one per cent,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: salt,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: rennet derived from aqueous extracts from the fourth stomach of calves, kids or lambs, in an amount consistent with good manufacturing practice,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: the following emulsifying, gelling, stabilizing and thickening agents:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: algin, carob bean gum (locust bean gum), carrageenan, gelatin, guar gum, pectin or propylene glycol alginate or any combination thereof in an amount not exceeding 0.5 per cent,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: monoglycerides, mono- and diglycerides, or any combination thereof, in an amount not exceeding 0.3 per cent, and

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: sodium phosphate dibasic in an amount not exceeding 0.05 per cent,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: sodium citrate as a flavour precursor in an amount not exceeding 0.1 per cent,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: a milk coagulating enzyme derived from Rhizomucor miehei (Cooney and Emerson) (previous name: Mucor miehei (Cooney and Emerson)), from Mucor pusillus Lindt by pure culture fermentation process or from Aspergillus oryzae RET-1 (pBoel777), in an amount consistent with good manufacturing practice,

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: chymosin A derived from Escherichia coli K-12, GE81 (pPFZ87A), in an amount consistent with good manufacturing practice, and

Subparagraph.Label: (xi)
Subparagraph.Text: chymosin B derived from Aspergillus niger var. awamori, GCC0349 (pGAMpR) or from Kluyveromyces marxianus var. lactis, DS1182 (pKS105), in an amount consistent with good manufacturing practice.

Section.Label: B.09.001
Section.Text: [S]. Vegetable fats and oils shall be fats and oils obtained entirely from the botanical source after which they are named, shall be dry and sweet in flavour and odour and, with the exception of olive oil, may contain emulsifying agents, Class IV preservatives, an antifoaming agent, and B-carotene in a quantity sufficient to replace that lost during processing, if such an addition is declared on the label.

Section.Label: B.09.002
Section.Text: [S]. Animal fats and oils shall be fats and oils obtained entirely from animals healthy at the time of slaughter, shall be dry and sweet in flavour and odour and may contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: with the exception of milk fat and suet, Class IV preservatives; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with the exception of lard, milk fat and suet, an antifoaming agent.

Section.Label: B.09.003
Section.Text: [S]. Olive Oil or Sweet Oil

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the oil obtained from the fruit of the olive tree (Olea europaea L);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall have a fatty acid content that is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 56.0 and not more than 83.0 per cent oleic acid,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 7.5 and not more than 20.0 per cent palmitic acid,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 3.5 and not more than 20.0 per cent linoleic acid,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 0.5 and not more than 3.5 per cent stearic acid,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 0.3 and not more than 3.5 per cent palmitoleic acid,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than 1.5 per cent linolenic acid, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than 0.05 per cent myristic acid, calculated as methyl esters;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall not contain more than minute amounts of arachidic acid, behenic acid, gadoleic acid or lignoceric acid;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: shall have

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a relative density of not less than 0.910 and not more than 0.916, calculated with the oil at 20°C and water at 20°C (20°C/water at 20°C),

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a refractive index of not less than 1.4677 and not more than 1.4705, calculated using the sodium D-line as the light source and with the oil at 20°C (nD20°C),

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: an iodine value of not less than 75 and not more than 94, calculated using the Wijs test,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a saponification value of not less than 184 and not more than 196, expressed as milligrams of potassium hydroxide per gram of oil,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: an acid value of not more than 6.6 milligrams potassium hydroxide per gram of oil,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: a free acidity of not more than 3.3 per cent expressed as oleic acid,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: a peroxide value of not more than 20 milliequivalents peroxide oxygen per kilogram of oil,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: an unsaponifiable matter content of not more than 15 grams per kilogram, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: a Bellier index of not more than 17;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: shall show negative results when tested for semi-siccative oil, olive-residue oil, cotton-seed oil, tea-seed oil or sesame seed oil; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: notwithstanding section B.09.001, may contain alpha-tocopherol in a quantity sufficient to replace that lost during refining, if such an addition is declared on the label.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the oil of seeds of cultivated Gossypium spp.;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall have

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a relative density (20°C/water at 20°C) of not less than 0.918 and not more than 0.926,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a refractive index (nD40°C) of not less than 1.458 and not more than 1.466,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a saponification value (milligrams potassium hydroxide per gram of oil) of not less than 189 and not more than 198,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: an iodine value (Wijs) of not less than 99 and not more than 119,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: an unsaponifiable matter content of not more than 15 grams per kilogram,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: a positive Halphen test,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: an acid value of not more than 0.6 milligram potassium hydroxide per gram of oil, and

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: a peroxide value of not more than 10 milliequivalents peroxide oxygen per kilogram of oil; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: may contain oxystearin.

Section.Label: B.09.005
Section.Text: [S]. Cocoa Butter shall be the fat from cocoa nibs, obtained either before or after roasting, or cocoa liquor, and shall have

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a refractive index (40°C) of not less than 1.453 and not more than 1.458;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a saponification value of not less than 188 and not more than 202;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an iodine value (Hanus) of not less than 32 and not more than 41; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an acid value of not more than five.

Section.Label: B.09.006
Section.Text: [S]. Corn Oil or Maize Oil

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the oil of the germ or embryo of Zea mays L.; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall have

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a relative density of (20°C/water at 20°C) of not less than 0.917 and not more than 0.925,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a refractive index (nD40°C) of not less than 1.465 and not more than 1.468,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a saponification value (milligrams potassium hydroxide per gram of oil) of not less than 187 and not more than 195,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: an iodine value (Wijs) of not less than 103 and not more than 128,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: an unsaponifiable matter content of not more than 28 grams per kilogram,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: an acid value of not more than 0.6 milligram potassium hydroxide per gram of oil, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: a peroxide value of not more than 10 milliequivalents peroxide oxygen per kilogram of oil.

Section.Label: B.09.007
Section.Text: [S]. Peanut Oil or Arachis Oil

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the oil of the seeds of Arachis hypogaea L.;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall have

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a relative density of (20°C/water at 20°C) of not less than 0.914 and not more than 0.917,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a refractive index (nD40°C) of not less than 1.460 and not more than 1.465,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a saponification value (milligrams potassium hydroxide per gram of oil) of not less than 187 and not more than 196,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: an iodine value (Wijs) of not less than 80 and not more than 106,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: an unsaponifiable matter content of not more than 10 grams per kilogram,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: an arachidic and higher fatty acids content of not less than 48 grams per kilogram,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: an acid value of not more than 0.6 milligram potassium hydroxide per gram of oil, and

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: a peroxide value of not more than 10 milliequivalents peroxide oxygen per kilogram of oil; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: not contain oxystearin.

Section.Label: B.09.008
Section.Text: [S]. Soybean Oil, Soya Bean Oil, Soja Oil or Soya Oil

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the oil of the seeds of Glycine max (L.) Merr.;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall have

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a relative density of (20°C/water at 20°C) of not less than 0.919 and not more than 0.925,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a refractive index (nD40°C) of not less than 1.466 and not more than 1.470,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a saponification value (milligrams potassium hydroxide per gram of oil) of not less than 189 and not more than 195,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: an iodine value (Wijs) of not less than 120 and not more than 143,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: an unsaponifiable matter content of not more than 15 grams per kilogram,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: an acid value of not more than 0.6 milligram potassium hydroxide per gram of oil, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: a peroxide value of not more than 10 milliequivalents peroxide oxygen per kilogram of oil; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: may contain oxystearin.

Section.Label: B.09.009
Section.Text: [S]. Sunflowerseed Oil or Sunflower Oil

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the oil of the seeds of Helianthus annuus L.; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall have

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a relative density of (20°C/water at 20°C) of not less than 0.918 and not more than 0.923,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a refractive index (nD40°C) of not less than 1.467 and not more than 1.469,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: an iodine value (Wijs) of not less than 110 and not more than 143,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a saponification value (milligrams potassium hydroxide per gram of oil) of not less than 188 and not more than 194,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: an unsaponifiable matter content of not more than 15 grams per kilogram,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: an acid value of not more than 0.6 milligram potassium hydroxide per gram of oil, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: a peroxide value of not more than 10 milliequivalents peroxide oxygen per kilogram of oil.

Section.Label: B.09.009A
Section.Text: [S]. Safflowerseed Oil or Safflower Oil

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the oil of the seeds of Carthamus tinctorius L.;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall have
