Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a relative density of (20°C/water at 20°C) of not less than 0.922 and not more than 0.927,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a refractive index (nD40°C) of not less than 1.467 and not more than 1.470,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a saponification value (milligrams potassium hydroxide per gram of oil) of not less than 186 and not more than 198,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: an iodine value (Wijs) of not less than 135 and not more than 150,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: an unsaponifiable matter content of not more than 15 grams per kilogram,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: an acid value of not more than 0.6 milligram potassium hydroxide per gram of oil, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: a peroxide value of not more than 10 milliequivalents peroxide oxygen per kilogram of oil.

Section.Label: B.09.010
Section.Text: Notwithstanding item 1 of the table to paragraph B.01.010(3)(b), where a vegetable fat or oil is an ingredient of any cooking oil, salad oil or table oil, the fat or oil shall be shown in the list of ingredients by its common name.

Section.Label: B.09.011
Section.Text: [S]. Shortening, other than butter or lard, shall be the semi-solid food prepared from fats, oils or a combination of fats and oils, may be processed by hydrogenation and may contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: Class IV preservatives,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an antifoaming agent,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: stearyl monoglyceridyl citrate,

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: monoglycerides or a combination of monoglycerides and diglycerides of fat forming fatty acids, the weight of the monoglycerides being not more than 10 per cent and the total weight of monoglycerides and diglycerides being not more than 20 per cent of the weight of the shortening,

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: lactylated monoglycerides, or a combination of lactylated monoglycerides and diglycerides of fat forming fatty acids, the total weight being not more than eight per cent of the weight of the shortening, and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: sorbitan tristearate,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: except that the total weight of the ingredients permitted under paragraphs (d) and (e) shall not be greater than 20 per cent of the weight of the shortening.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the rendered fat from hogs;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall have

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a relative density of not less than 0.894 and not more than 0.906, calculated with the lard at 40°C and water at 20°C (40°C/water at 20°C),

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a refractive index of not less than 1.448 and not more than 1.461, calculated using the sodium D-line as the light source and with the lard at 40°C (nD40°C),

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a titre of not less than 32°C and not more than 45°C,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a saponification value of not less than 192 and not more than 203, expressed as milligrams potassium hydroxide per gram of fat,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: an iodine value of not less than 45 and not more than 70, calculated using the Wijs test,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: an unsaponifiable matter content of not more than 12 grams per kilogram,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: an acid value of not more than 2.5 milligrams potassium hydroxide per gram of fat, and

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: a peroxide value of not more than 16 milliequivalents peroxide oxygen per kilogram of fat; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: lard stearine or hydrogenated lard,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a Class IV preservative, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than one per cent of substances resulting from the rendering process, other than fatty acids and fat.

Section.Label: B.09.014
Section.Text: [S]. Leaf Lard shall be lard that has been rendered at a moderately high temperature from the internal fat of the abdomen of the hog, excluding that adhering to the intestines, and shall have an iodine value (Hanus) of not more than 65.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the fat taken from the region of the kidney or loin or caul fat of a beef carcass;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall have

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a relative density of not less than 0.893 and not more than 0.898, calculated with the suet at 40°C and water at 20°C (40°C/water at 20°C),

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a refractive index of not less than 1.448 and not more than 1.460, calculated using the sodium D-line as the light source and with the suet at 40°C (nD40°C),

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a titre of not less than 42.5°C and not more than 47°C,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a saponification value of not less than 190 and not more than 200, expressed as milligrams of potassium hydroxide per gram of fat,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: an iodine value of not less than 32 and not more than 47, calculated using the Wijs test,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: an unsaponifiable matter content of not more than 10 grams per kilogram,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: an acid value of not more than 2.0 milligrams potassium hydroxide per gram of fat, and

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: a peroxide value of not more than 10 milliequivalents peroxide oxygen per kilogram of fat; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: where sold in comminuted form, shall contain not more than three per cent cereal and one per cent salt.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be a plastic or fluid emulsion of water in fats, oil or fats and oil that are not derived from milk and may have been subjected to hydrogenation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 80 per cent fat, oil or fat and oil calculated as fat, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: notwithstanding section D.01.009, not less than

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: 3,300 International Units of vitamin A, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: 530 International Units of vitamin D

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: skim milk powder, buttermilk powder or liquid buttermilk,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: whey solids or modified whey solids,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: protein,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: water,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: vitamin E, if added in such an amount as will result in the finished product containing not less than 0.6 International Unit of alphatocopherol per gram of linoleic acid present in the margarine,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: a flavouring agent,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: a sweetening agent,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: potassium chloride and sodium chloride,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: the following colouring agents: annatto, ß-apo-8′- carotenal, canthaxanthin, carotene, ethyl ß-apo-8′-carotenoate and turmeric, as set out in Table III to section B.16.100,

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: the following emulsifying agents: lecithin, mono- and di-glycerides, mono-glycerides and sorbitan tristearate, as set out in Table IV to section B.16.100,

Subparagraph.Label: (xi)
Subparagraph.Text: the following pH adjusting agents: citric acid, lactic acid, potassium bicarbonate, sodium bicarbonate, potassium carbonate, sodium carbonate, sodium citrate, sodium lactate, potassium citrate, potassium hydroxide, sodium hydroxide, potassium lactate, sodium potassium tartrate and tartaric acid, as set out in Table X to section B.16.100,

Subparagraph.Label: (xii)
Subparagraph.Text: the following Class II and Class IV preservatives: ascorbyl palmitate, ascorbyl stearate, benzoic acid, butylated hydroxyanisole, butylated hydroxytoluene, calcium sorbate, citric acid esters of mono- and di-glycerides, monoglyceride citrate, monoisopropyl citrate, potassium benzoate, potassium sorbate, propyl gallate, sodium benzoate, sodium sorbate and sorbic acid, as set out in Table XI to section B.16.100, and

Subparagraph.Label: (xiii)
Subparagraph.Text: the following sequestering agents: calcium disodium ethylenediaminetetraacetate and stearyl citrate, as set out in Table XII to section B.16.100.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall conform to the standard for margarine except it shall contain not more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 40 per cent fat, oil or fat and oil calculated as fat, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 50 per cent of the calories that would be normally present in the product if it were not calorie-reduced;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: subject to paragraph (c), may contain, either singly or in combination, in an amount not exceeding 0.5 per cent,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: acacia gum,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: agar,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: algin,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: carob bean gum,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: carrageenan,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: furcelleran,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: gellan gum,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: guar gum,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: karaya gum,

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: propylene glycol alginate,

Subparagraph.Label: (xi)
Subparagraph.Text: tragacanth gum, and

Subparagraph.Label: (xii)
Subparagraph.Text: xanthan gum;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: may

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if it contains none of the ingredients mentioned in paragraph (b), contain polyglycerol esters of fatty acids in an amount not exceeding 0.2 per cent, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it contains a combination of one or more of the ingredients mentioned in paragraph (b) and polyglycerol esters of fatty acids, contain such esters in an amount not exceeding 0.2 per cent, provided that the total combination of such esters and ingredients does not exceed an amount of 0.5 per cent;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: notwithstanding subparagraph B.09.016(c)(x), may contain lecithin in an amount not exceeding 0.5 per cent; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: vegetable starch,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: modified vegetable starch, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: maltodextrin.

Section.Label: B.09.022
Section.Text: No person shall sell cooking oil, margarine, salad oil, simulated dairy product, shortening or food that resembles margarine or shortening, if the product contains more than five per cent C22 Monoenoic Fatty Acids calculated as a proportion of the total fatty acids contained in the product.

Section.Label: B.10.003
Section.Text: [S]. (naming the flavour) Extract or (naming the flavour) Essence shall be a solution in ethyl alcohol, glycerol, propylene glycol or any combination of these, of sapid or odorous principles, or both, derived from the plant after which the flavouring extract or essence is named, and may contain water, a sweetening agent, food colour and a Class II preservative or Class IV preservative.

Section.Label: B.10.004
Section.Text: [S]. Artificial (naming the flavour) Extract, Artificial (naming the flavour) Essence, Imitation (naming the flavour) Extract or Imitation (naming the flavour) Essence shall be a flavouring extract or essence except that the flavouring principles shall be derived in whole, or in part, from sources other than the aromatic plant after which it is named, and if such extract or essence is defined in these Regulations, the flavouring strength of the artificial or imitation extract or essence shall be not less than that of the extract or essence.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be a preparation, other than a flavouring preparation described in section B.10.003, of sapid or odorous principles, or both, derived from the aromatic plant after which the flavour is named;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain a sweetening agent, food colour, Class II preservative, thaumatin, Class IV preservative or emulsifying agent; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: may have added to it the following liquids only:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: water,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any of, or any combination of, the following: benzyl alcohol; 1, 3-butylene glycol, ethyl acetate, ethyl alcohol, glycerol, glyceryl diacetate, glyceryl triacetate, glyceryl tributyrate, isopropyl alcohol, monoglycerides and diglycerides; 1, 2-propylene glycol or triethylcitrate,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: edible vegetable oil, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: brominated vegetable oil, sucrose acetate isobutyrate or mixtures thereof, when such flavour is used in beverages containing citrus or spruce oils.

Section.Label: B.10.006
Section.Text: [S]. Artificial (naming the flavour) Flavour or Imitation (naming the flavour) Flavour shall be a flavour except that the flavouring principles may be derived in whole or in part from sources other than the aromatic plant after which it is named, and if such flavour is defined in these Regulations, the flavouring strength of the artificial or imitation flavour shall be not less than that of the flavour.

Section.Label: B.10.007
Section.Text: [S]. Notwithstanding sections B.10.003 and B.10.005, a (naming the fruit) Extract Naturally Fortified, (naming the fruit) Essence Naturally Fortified or (naming the fruit) Flavour Naturally Fortified shall be an extract, essence or flavour derived from the named fruit to which other natural extractives have been added and 51 per cent of the flavouring strength shall be derived from the named fruit.

Section.Label: B.10.008
Section.Text: On any label of or in any advertisement for an artificial or imitation flavouring preparation, the word “artificial”, or “imitation” shall be an integral part of the name of such flavouring preparation and shall be set out in identical type and identically displayed with such name.

Section.Label: B.10.009
Section.Text: [S]. Almond Essence, Almond Extract or Almond Flavour shall be the essence, extract or flavour derived from the kernels of the bitter almond, apricot or peach and shall contain not less than one per cent by volume of hydrocyanic acid-free volatile oil obtained therefrom.

Section.Label: B.10.010
Section.Text: [S]. Anise Essence, Anise Extract or Anise Flavour shall be the essence, extract or flavour derived from natural or terpeneless oil of anise and shall correspond in flavouring strength to an alcoholic solution containing not less than three per cent by volume of oil of anise, the volatile oil obtained from the fruit of Pimpinella anisum L. or Illicium verum Hook.

Section.Label: B.10.011
Section.Text: [S]. Celery Seed Essence, Celery Seed Extract or Celery Seed Flavour shall be the essence, extract or flavour derived from celery seed, or oil of celery seed, or terpeneless oil of celery seed and shall correspond in flavouring strength to an alcoholic solution containing not less than 0.3 per cent by volume of volatile oil of celery seed.

Section.Label: B.10.012
Section.Text: [S]. Cassia Essence, Cassia Extract, Cassia Cinnamon Essence, Cassia Cinnamon Extract, Cassia Flavour or Cassia Cinnamon Flavour shall be the essence, extract or flavour derived from natural or terpeneless oil, obtained from leaves and twigs of Cinnamomum cassia L. containing not less than 80 per cent cinnamic aldehyde, and shall correspond in flavouring strength to an alcoholic solution containing not less than two per cent by volume of volatile oil of cassia cinnamon.

Section.Label: B.10.013
Section.Text: [S]. Ceylon Cinnamon Essence, Ceylon Cinnamon Extract or Ceylon Cinnamon Flavour shall be the essence, extract or flavour derived from the volatile oil obtained from the bark of Cinnamomum zeylanicum Nees, and shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not less than two per cent by volume of oil of Ceylon cinnamon;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 65 per cent cinnamic aldehyde; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: not more than 10 per cent eugenol.

Section.Label: B.10.014
Section.Text: [S]. Clove Essence, Clove Extract or Clove Flavour shall be the essence, extract or flavour derived from the volatile oil obtained from clove buds, and shall contain not less than two per cent by volume of oil of clove.

Section.Label: B.10.015
Section.Text: [S]. Ginger Essence, Ginger Extract or Ginger Flavour shall be the essence, extract or flavour derived from ginger and shall contain in 100 millilitres the alcohol-soluble matter from not less than 20 grams of ginger.

Section.Label: B.10.016
Section.Text: [S]. Lemon Essence, Lemon Extract or Lemon Flavour shall be the essence, extract or flavour prepared from natural or terpeneless oil of lemon or from lemon peel and shall contain not less than 0.2 per cent citral derived from oil of lemon.

Section.Label: B.10.017
Section.Text: [S]. Nutmeg Essence, Nutmeg Extract or Nutmeg Flavour shall be the essence, extract or flavour prepared from natural or terpeneless oil of nutmeg and shall correspond in flavouring strength to an alcoholic solution containing not less than two per cent by volume of oil of nutmeg.

Section.Label: B.10.018
Section.Text: [S]. Orange Essence, Orange Extract or Orange Flavour shall be the essence, extract or flavour prepared from sweet orange peel, oil of sweet orange or terpeneless oil of sweet orange, and shall correspond in flavouring strength to an alcoholic solution containing five per cent by volume of oil of sweet orange, the volatile oil obtained from the fresh peel of Citrus aurantium L., that shall have an optical rotation, at a temperature of 25°C, of not less than +95° using a tube 100 millimetres in length.

Section.Label: B.10.019
Section.Text: [S]. Peppermint Essence, Peppermint Extract or Peppermint Flavour shall be the essence, extract or flavour prepared from peppermint or oil of peppermint, obtained from the leaves and flowering tops of Mentha piperita L., or of Mentha arvensis De.C., var. piperascens Holmes, and shall correspond in flavouring strength to an alcoholic solution of not less than three per cent by volume of oil of peppermint, containing not less than 50 per cent free and combined menthol.

Section.Label: B.10.020
Section.Text: [S]. Rose Essence, Rose Extract or Rose Flavour shall be the essence, extract or flavour prepared from the volatile oil obtained from the petals of Rosa damascena Mill., R. centajolia L., or R. moschata Herrm, and shall contain not less than 0.4 per cent by volume of attar of rose.

Section.Label: B.10.021
Section.Text: [S]. Savory Essence, Savory Extract or Savory Flavour shall be the essence, extract or flavour prepared from savory or oil of savory and shall contain not less than 0.35 per cent by volume oil of savory.

Section.Label: B.10.022
Section.Text: [S]. Spearmint Essence, Spearmint Extract or Spearmint Flavour shall be the essence, extract or flavour prepared from spearmint or from oil of spearmint, obtained from the leaves and flowering tops of Mentha spicata L. and shall contain not less than three per cent by volume of oil of spearmint.

Section.Label: B.10.023
Section.Text: [S]. Sweet Basil Essence, Sweet Basil Extract or Sweet Basil Flavour shall be the essence, extract or flavour prepared from sweet basil or from oil of sweet basil, obtained from the leaves and tops of Ocymum basilicum L. and shall contain not less than 0.1 per cent by volume of oil of sweet basil.

Section.Label: B.10.024
Section.Text: [S]. Sweet Marjoram Essence, Sweet Marjoram Extract, Marjoram Essence, Marjoram Extract, Sweet Marjoram Flavour or Marjoram Flavour shall be the essence, extract or flavour prepared from marjoram or from oil of marjoram and shall contain not less than one per cent by volume of oil of marjoram.

Section.Label: B.10.025
Section.Text: [S]. Thyme Essence, Thyme Extract or Thyme Flavour shall be the essence, extract or flavour prepared from thyme or from oil of thyme and shall contain not less than 0.2 per cent by volume of oil of thyme.

Section.Label: B.10.026
Section.Text: [S]. Vanilla Extract, Vanilla Essence or Vanilla Flavour

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the essence, extract or flavour prepared from the vanilla bean, the dried, cured fruit of Vanilla planifolia, Andrews, or Vanilla tahitensia, J. W. Moore;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain in 100 ml, regardless of the method of extraction, at least the quantity of soluble substances in their natural proportions that are extractable, according to official method FO-17, Extraction of Soluble Substances from Vanilla Beans, dated September 15, 1989, from

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 10 g of vanilla beans, where the beans contain 25 per cent or less moisture, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 7.5 g of vanilla beans on the moisture-free basis, where the beans contain more than 25 per cent moisture; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: notwithstanding sections B.10.003 and B.10.005, shall not contain added colour.

Section.Label: B.10.027
Section.Text: [S]. Wintergreen Essence, Wintergreen Extract or Wintergreen Flavour shall be the essence, extract or flavour prepared from oil of wintergreen, the volatile oil distilled from the leaves of Gaultheria procumbens L. or from Betula lenta L. and shall contain not less than three per cent by volume of oil of wintergreen.

Heading.Label: DIVISION 11
Heading.TitleText: Fruits, Vegetables, Their Products and Substitutes

Section.Label: B.11.001
Section.Text: In this Division,

Definition.Text: acid ingredient means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: citric, malic or tartaric acid,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: lemon or lime juice, or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: vinegar; (ingrédient acide)

Definition.Text: fruit juice means the unfermented liquid expressed from sound ripe fresh fruit, and includes any such liquid that is heat treated and chilled; (jus de fruit)
sweetening ingredient means sugar, invert sugar, honey, dextrose, glucose or glucose solids or any combination thereof in dry or liquid form. (ingrédient édulcorant)

Section.Label: B.11.001.1
Section.Text: No person shall sell any fresh fruit or vegetable that is intended to be consumed raw, except grapes, if sulphurous acid or any salt thereof has been added thereto.

Section.Label: B.11.002
Section.Text: [S]. Canned (naming the vegetable)

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the product obtained by heat processing the named fresh vegetable after it has been properly prepared;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall be packed in hermetically sealed containers;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a sweetening ingredient,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: salt,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: water,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a firming agent, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: citric acid; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of canned green beans and canned wax beans, pieces of green peppers, red peppers and tomato in an amount not exceeding 15 per cent of the final product, and dill seasonings and vinegar,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of canned peas, garnishes composed of one or more of lettuce, onions, carrots, and pieces of green or red peppers in an amount not exceeding 15 per cent of the total drained vegetable ingredient, aromatic herbs, spices and seasonings, stock or juice of vegetables and aromatic herbs, calcium hydroxide in an amount not exceeding 0.01 per cent of the final product and magnesium hydroxide in an amount not exceeding 0.05 per cent of the final product,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: canned asparagus, acetic acid, malic acid and tartaric acid in an amount consistent with good manufacturing practice, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: canned white asparagus, acetic acid, ascorbic acid, malic acid and tartaric acid in an amount consistent with good manufacturing practice,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of asparagus packed in glass containers or fully lined (lacquered) cans, stannous chloride in an amount not exceeding 25 parts per million, calculated as tin,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of canned legumes, other than canned green beans, canned peas and canned wax beans, calcium disodium ethylenediaminetetraacetate in an amount not exceeding 365 parts per million calculated as the anhydrous form, or disodium ethylenediaminetetraacetate in an amount not exceeding 165 parts per million, and

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of canned asparagus, canned green beans, canned wax beans and canned peas

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: butter or other edible animal or vegetable fats or oils, but if butter is added it shall be not less than three per cent of the final product,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: natural or enzymatically or physically modified starches when used with butter or other edible animal or vegetable fats and oils,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: acacia gum, algin, carrageenan, furcelleran, guar gum and propylene glycol alginate used with butter or other edible animal or vegetable fats or oils in an amount not exceeding one per cent, singly or in any combination, of the final product, and

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: characterizing sauces, seasonings or flavouring agents if it is included in the common name of the product.

Section.Label: B.11.003
Section.Text: [S]. Canned Mushrooms

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the product obtained by heat-processing properly prepared mushrooms of the cultivated type;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall be packed in hermetically sealed containers; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: may contain ascorbic acid, citric acid and salt.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the product obtained by freezing properly prepared mushrooms of the cultivated type; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain citric acid, sodium metabisulphite, sodium phosphate, dibasic, sodium sulphate and salt.

Section.Label: B.11.004
Section.Text: [S]. Frozen (naming the vegetable) shall be the product obtained by freezing the named fresh vegetable after it has been prepared and subjected to a blanching treatment and may contain citric acid and added salt.

Section.Label: B.11.005
Section.Text: [S]. Tomatoes or Canned Tomatoes

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the product made by heat processing properly prepared fresh ripe tomatoes;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a sweetening ingredient in dry form,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: salt,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a firming agent,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: citric acid, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: spice or other seasoning; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not less than 50 per cent drained tomato solids, as determined by official method FO-18, Determination of Drained Tomato Solids, October 15, 1981.

Section.Label: B.11.007
Section.Text: [S]. Tomato Juice shall be the unconcentrated, pasteurized liquid containing a substantial portion of fine tomato pulp extracted from sound, ripe, whole tomatoes from which all stems and other portions unfit for consumption have been removed by any method that does not add water to the liquid and may contain citric acid, salt and a sweetening ingredient in dry form.

Section.Label: B.11.009
Section.Text: [S]. Tomato Paste shall be the product made by evaporating a portion of the water from tomatoes or sound tomato trimmings, may contain citric acid, salt and a Class II preservative and shall contain not less than 20 per cent tomato solids as determined by official method FO-19, Determination of Tomato Solids, October 15, 1981.

Section.Label: B.11.010
Section.Text: [S]. Concentrated Tomato Paste shall be tomato paste containing not less than 30 per cent tomato solids, as determined by official method FO-19, Determination of Tomato Solids, October 15, 1981.

Section.Label: B.11.011
Section.Text: [S]. Tomato Pulp shall be the heat-processed product made from sound, whole and ripe tomatoes or sound tomato trimmings, concentrated to yield a product with a specific gravity of not less than 1.050 (20°C/20°C) and may contain citric acid, salt and a Class II preservative.

Section.Label: B.11.012
Section.Text: [S]. Tomato Puree shall be the heat-processed product made from sound, whole and ripe tomatoes with the skins and seeds removed, concentrated to yield a product with a specific gravity of not less than 1.050 (20°C/20°C) and may contain citric acid, salt and a Class II preservative.

Section.Label: B.11.014
Section.Text: [S]. Tomato Catsup, Catsup or products whose common names are variants of the word Catsup

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the heat processed product made from the juice of red-ripe tomatoes or sound tomato trimmings from which skins and seeds have been removed;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: vinegar,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: salt,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: seasoning, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a sweetening ingredient; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a Class II preservative, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: food colour.

Section.Label: B.11.016
Section.Text: No person shall sell canned tomatoes, tomato juice or vegetable juice that contains mould filaments in more than 25 per cent of the microscopic fields, when examined by official method MFO-5, Examination of Canned Tomatoes, Tomato Juice and Vegetable Juice, Tomato Puree, Tomato Paste, Tomato Pulp and Tomato Catsup for Mould Filaments, November 30, 1981.

Section.Label: B.11.017
Section.Text: No person shall sell tomato puree, tomato paste, tomato pulp or tomato catsup that contains mould filaments in more than 50 per cent of the microscopic fields, when examined by official method MFO-5, Examination of Canned Tomatoes, Tomato Juice and Vegetable Juice, Tomato Puree, Tomato Paste, Tomato Pulp and Tomato Catsup for Mould Filaments, November 30, 1981.

Section.Label: B.11.025
Section.Text: No person shall sell potatoes, sweet potatoes or yams that have been artificially coloured.

Section.Label: B.11.040
Section.Text: [S]. Beans with Pork or Beans and Pork shall be the food prepared from dried beans and pork, may contain calcium disodium ethylenediaminetetraacetate, citric acid, disodium ethylenediaminetetraacetate, sauce, seasoning, spices or a sweetening agent and shall contain not less than 60 per cent drained solids as determined by official method FO-20, Determination of Drained Solids of Beans with Pork or Beans and Pork and Beans or Vegetarian Beans, October 15, 1981.

Section.Label: B.11.041
Section.Text: [S]. Beans or Vegetarian Beans shall be the food prepared from dried beans, may contain calcium disodium ethylenediaminetetraacetate, citric acid, disodium ethylenediaminetetraacetate, sauce, seasoning, spices or a sweetening agent and shall contain not less than 60 per cent drained solids as determined by official method FO-20, Determination of Drained Solids of Beans with Pork or Beans and Pork and Beans or Vegetarian Beans, October 15, 1981.

Section.Label: B.11.050
Section.Text: [S]. Olives shall be the plain or stuffed fruit of the olive tree, and may contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: vinegar;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: salt;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a sweetening ingredient;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: spices;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: seasonings;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: lactic acid;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: sorbic acid or its potassium or sodium salt;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: calcium chloride;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: citric acid; and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of ripe olives, ferrous gluconate.

Section.Label: B.11.051
Section.Text: [S]. Pickles and relishes shall be the product prepared from vegetables or fruits with salt and vinegar, and may contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: spices;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: seasonings;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: sugar, invert sugar, dextrose or glucose, in dry or liquid form;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: food colour;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a Class II preservative;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a firming agent;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: polyoxyethylene (20) sorbitan monooleate in an amount not exceeding 0.05 per cent;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: lactic acid;

Paragraph.Label: (h.1)
Paragraph.Text: citric acid;

Paragraph.Label: (h.2)
Paragraph.Text: sucralose;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: vegetable oils; and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of relishes and mustard pickles, a thickening agent.

Section.Label: B.11.101
Section.Text: [S]. Canned (naming the fruit)

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the product prepared by heat processing the named fresh fruit after it has been properly prepared;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall be packed in hermetically sealed containers;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a sweetening ingredient,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: water,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: concentrated (naming the fruit) juice, (naming the fruit) juice, (naming the fruits) juice, (naming the fruit) juice from concentrate or any combination thereof,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: citric acid,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: acesulfame-potassium, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: sucralose; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of canned pears, lactic acid, lemon juice, malic acid, mint, spice oils, spices, tartaric acid and a flavouring preparation other than that which simulates the flavour of canned pears,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of canned apples, a firming agent,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of canned applesauce, ascorbic acid, isoascorbic acid, malic acid, salt, spices and a flavouring preparation other than that which simulates the flavour of canned applesauce,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of canned grapefruit, calcium chloride, calcium lactate, lemon juice, spices and a flavouring preparation other than that which simulates the flavour of canned grapefruit,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of canned mandarin oranges, ascorbic acid,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of canned peaches, peach kernels, peach pits and spices intended for flavour development, ascorbic acid and a flavouring preparation other than that which simulates the flavour of canned peaches,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of canned pineapple, dimethylpolysiloxane when pineapple juice is used as a packing medium, mint, spice oils, spices and a flavouring preparation other than that which simulates the flavour of canned pineapple,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of canned plums, a flavouring preparation other than that which simulates the flavour of canned plums,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of canned strawberries, lactic acid, malic acid or tartaric acid, and

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of canned apricots, calcium chloride.

Section.Label: B.11.102
Section.Text: [S]. Frozen (naming the fruit) shall be the product obtained by freezing the named fresh fruit after it has been properly prepared and may contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a sweetening ingredient;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: water;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: fruit juice, fruit juice from concentrate, concentrated fruit juice or any combination thereof;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: ascorbic acid, citric acid, erythorbic acid or malic acid to prevent discolouration; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of frozen sliced apples,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a firming agent, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: sulphurous acid.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the juice obtained from the named fruit; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain a sweetening ingredient in dry form, a Class II preservative, amylase, cellulase and pectinase.

Section.Label: B.11.121
Section.Text: Notwithstanding section B.11.120, the fruit juice prepared from any fruit named in any of sections B.11.123 to B.11.128A shall conform to the standard prescribed for that fruit juice in that section.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the fruit juice obtained from apples;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain a Class II preservative, vitamin C, amylase, cellulase and pectinase;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall have a specific gravity of not less than 1.041 and not more than 1.065 (20°C/20°C); and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain, in 100 millilitres measured at a temperature of 20°C, not less than 0.24 gram and not more than 0.60 gram of ash of which not less than 50 per cent shall be potassium carbonate.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the fruit juice obtained from grapes;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall have a specific gravity of not less than 1.040 and not more than 1.124 (20°C/20°C);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain, before the addition of a sweetening ingredient, in 100 millilitres measured at a temperature of 20°C,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 0.20 gram and not more than 0.55 gram of ash, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 0.015 gram and not more than 0.070 gram of phosphoric acid calculated as phosphorous pentoxide; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: may contain a pH-adjusting agent, a sweetening ingredient in dry form, a Class II preservative, vitamin C, amylase, cellulase and pectinase.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be fruit juice obtained from clean, sound, mature grapefruit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: contain not less than 1.15 milliequivalents of free amino acid per 100 millilitres, as determined by official method FO-21, Determination of Amino Acids in Grapefruit Juice and Orange Juice, October 15, 1981,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: contain not less than 70 milligrams of potassium per 100 millilitres, as determined by official method FO-22, Determination of Potassium in Grapefruit Juice and Orange Juice, October 15, 1981, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: have an absorbance value for total polyphenolics of not less than 0.310, as determined by official method FO-23, Determination of Absorbance Value for Total Polyphenolics in Grapefruit Juice and Orange Juice, October 15, 1981;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall, before the addition of sugar, invert sugar, dextrose or glucose solids,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: have a Brix reading of not less than 9.3°, as determined by official method FO-24, Determination of Brix Reading for Grapefruit Juice and Orange Juice, October 15, 1981, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: contain not less than 0.7 per cent and not more than 2.1 per cent of acid by weight calculated as anhydrous citric acid, as determined by official method FO-25, Determination of Acid in Grapefruit Juice or Orange Juice, October 15, 1981; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: may contain sugar, invert sugar, dextrose in dry form, glucose solids, a Class II preservative, amylase, cellulase and pectinase.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the fruit juice obtained from lemons;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain, before the addition of a sweetening ingredient, in 100 millilitres measured at a temperature of 20°C, not less than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 8.0 grams of soluble solids, as determined by official method FO-26, Determination of Soluble Solids in Lemon Juice, Lime Juice or Lime Fruit Juice, October 15, 1981, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 5.0 grams of acid calculated as anhydrous citric acid, as determined by official method FO-27, Determination of Acid in Lemon Juice, Lime Juice, or Lime Fruit Juice, October 15, 1981;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: may contain stannous chloride; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: may contain a sweetening ingredient in a dry form, a Class II preservative, amylase, cellulase and pectinase.

Section.Label: B.11.127
Section.Text: [S]. Lime Juice or Lime Fruit Juice

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the fruit juice obtained from limes;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall have

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a specific gravity of not less than 1.030 and not more than 1.040 (20°C/20°C),

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its optical rotation between +0.5 and -1.5 degrees Ventzke, determined at a temperature of 20°C, using a tube 200 millimetres in length;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain, before the addition of a sweetening ingredient, in 100 millilitres measured at a temperature of 20°C, not less than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 8.0 grams of soluble solids, as determined by official method FO-26, Determination of Soluble Solids in Lemon Juice, Lime Juice or Lime Fruit Juice, October 15, 1981, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 5.5 grams of acid calculated as anhydrous citric acid, as determined by official method FO-27, Determination of Acid in Lemon Juice, Lime Juice or Lime Fruit Juice, October 15, 1981;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: may contain stannous chloride; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: may contain a sweetening ingredient in a dry form, a Class II preservative, amylase, cellulase and pectinase.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be fruit juice obtained from clean, sound, mature oranges;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: contain not less than 1.20 milliequivalents of free amino acids per 100 millilitres, as determined by official method FO-21, Determination of Amino Acids in Grapefruit Juice and Orange Juice, October 15, 1981,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: contain not less than 115 milligrams of potassium per 100 millilitres, as determined by official method FO-22, Determination of Potassium in Grapefruit Juice and Orange Juice, October 15, 1981, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: have an absorbance value for total polyphenolics of not less than 0.380, as determined by official method FO-23, Determination of Absorbance Value for Total Polyphenolics in Grapefruit Juice and Orange Juice, October 15, 1981;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall, before the addition of sugar, invert sugar, dextrose or glucose solids,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: have a Brix reading of not less than 9.7°, as determined by official method FO-24, Determination of Brix Reading for Grapefruit Juice and Orange Juice, October 15, 1981, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: contain not less than 0.5 per cent and not more than 1.8 per cent of acid by weight calculated as anhydrous citric acid, as determined by official method FO-25, Determination of Acid in Grapefruit Juice or Orange Juice, October 15, 1981;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: may contain orange essences, orange oils and orange pulp adjusted in accordance with good manufacturing practice; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: may contain sugar, invert sugar, dextrose in dry form, glucose solids, a Class II preservative, amylase, cellulase and pectinase.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the fruit juice obtained from pineapple; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain a sweetening ingredient in dry form, a Class II preservative, vitamin C, amylase, cellulase, pectinase and an antifoaming agent.

Section.Label: B.11.129
Section.Text: [S]. Carbonated (naming the fruit) Juice or Sparkling (naming the fruit) Juice shall be the named fruit juice impregnated with carbon dioxide under pressure.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be fruit juice that is concentrated to at least one half of its original volume by the removal of water;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: vitamin C,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: food colour,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: stannous chloride,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a sweetening ingredient, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a class II preservative; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: may have added to it, for the purpose of adjustment in accordance with good manufacturing practice, all or any of the following, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: essence, oil and pulp from the named fruit, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: water.

Subsection.Text: Subparagraphs (1)(b)(i), (ii), (iii) and (v) do not apply in respect of frozen concentrated orange juice.

Section.Label: B.11.131
Section.Text: [S]. (Naming the fruits) Juice shall be a mixture of fruit juices each of which meets the standard prescribed for that fruit juice in this Division.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be a mixture of apple juice and another fruit juice, each of which meets the standard, if any, prescribed for that fruit juice in this Division; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain added vitamin C.

Section.Label: B.11.133
Section.Text: [S]. Reconstituted (naming the fruit) Juice or (naming the fruit) Juice from Concentrate

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be fruit juice that has been prepared by the addition of water to fruit juice of the same name from which water has been removed;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain juice of the same name, a sweetening ingredient, and natural pulp, oils and esters of the named fruit;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall conform to the standards for the named fruit juices as prescribed in this Division; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: may contain, in the case of reconstituted lemon or lime juice, not more than 10 parts per million dimethylpolysiloxane.

Text.Emphasis: [S]. Apricot Nectar, Peach Nectar or Pear Nectar

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the unfermented but fermentable pulpy product, intended for direct consumption, obtained by blending the total edible part of sound and ripe apricots, peaches and pears, as the case may be, concentrated or unconcentrated with water and, subject to subparagraph (e)(i), a sweetening ingredient;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of peach nectar and pear nectar, not less than 40 per cent by weight of the fruit or the equivalent derived from the concentrated fruit, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of apricot nectar, not less than 35 per cent by weight of the fruit or the equivalent derived from the concentrated fruit;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not less than 13 per cent soluble solids by weight expressed as °Brix on the International Sucrose Scales and calculated by refractometer at 20°C and uncorrected for acidity;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: shall not contain more than 3 g/kg (3000 p.p.m.) of ethanol and 10 mg/kg (10 p.p.m.) of hydroxy methyl furfural; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: honey if no other sweetening ingredient is employed,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: citric acid and malic acid at levels consistent with good manufacturing practice,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: lemon juice, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: vitamin C.

Section.Label: B.11.150
Section.Text: No person shall label, package, sell or advertise a fruit flavoured drink in a manner that is likely to create an impression that the fruit flavoured drink contains vitamins or has any other nutritional value commonly associated with any fruit juice unless the following requirements are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it is sold as a substitute for fruit juice or as a breakfast drink;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it is not carbonated;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: it is not represented to be or is not commonly known as

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a soft drink, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a thirst-quenching or refreshment drink; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: notwithstanding sections D.01.009, D.01.011 and D.02.009,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: it contains vitamin C in an amount not less than 24 milligrams and not more than 48 milligrams, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: it contains

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: where folic acid has been added, an amount of folic acid of not less than 40 micrograms and not more than 80 micrograms,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: where thiamine has been added, an amount of thiamine of not less than 0.08 milligram and not more than 0.11 milligram,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: where iron has been added, an amount of iron of not less than 0.56 milligram and not more than 0.80 milligram, or

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: where potassium has been added, an amount of potassium of not less than 100 milligrams and not more than 200 milligrams,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: per 100 millilitres when the drink is ready to serve.

Section.Label: B.11.151
Section.Text: No person shall label, package, sell or advertise a base, concentrate or mix that is used for making a fruit flavoured drink in a manner that is likely to create an impression that the drink made therefrom will contain vitamins or have any other nutritional value commonly associated with fruit juice unless the following requirements are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the base, concentrate or mix

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: is sold for the purpose of making a breakfast drink or a substitute for fruit juice,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: is not represented to be or is not commonly known as a product that is used for making a soft drink or a thirst-quenching or refreshment drink; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where a drink is made therefrom as directed, the drink meets the requirements described in paragraph B.11.150(d).

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the product obtained by processing fruit, fruit pulp, or canned fruit, by boiling to a suitable consistency with water and a sweetening ingredient;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not less than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 45 per cent of the named fruit, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 66 per cent water soluble solids as estimated by the refractometer;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: such amount of added pectin, pectinous preparation, or acid ingredient as reasonably compensates for any deficiency in the natural pectin content or acidity of the named fruit,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a Class II preservative,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a pH adjusting agent, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: an antifoaming agent; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: shall not contain apple or rhubarb.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the product obtained by processing fruit, fruit pulp, or canned fruit by boiling to a suitable consistency with water and a sweetening ingredient;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 27 per cent of the named fruit,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 66 per cent water soluble solids as estimated by the refractometer, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: pectin or pectinous preparations;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: such amount of acid ingredient as reasonably compensates for any deficiency in the natural acidity of the named fruit,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: food colour,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a Class II preservative,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a pH adjusting agent, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: an antifoaming agent; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: shall not contain apple or rhubarb.

Section.Label: B.11.203
Section.Text: [S]. Apple (or Rhubarb) and (naming the fruit) Jam

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the product obtained by processing fruit, fruit pulp or canned fruit by boiling to a suitable consistency with water and a sweetening ingredient;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not less than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 12.5 per cent of the named fruit, except that where the named fruit is strawberry it shall contain not less than 15 per cent strawberries,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 20 per cent apple or rhubarb pulp, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: 66 per cent water soluble solids as estimated by the refractometer; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: pectin or pectinous preparation,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: such amount of acid ingredient as reasonably compensates for any deficiency in the natural acidity of the fruit used in its preparation,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: food colour,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a Class II preservative,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a pH adjusting agent, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: an antifoaming agent.

Section.Label: B.11.204
Section.Text: Where a jam for which a standard is prescribed in section B.11.203 contains added pectin or pectinous preparation, a statement to the effect that pectin or pectinous preparation has been added shall be shown on the principal display panel.

Section.Label: B.11.220
Section.Text: [S]. (Naming the citrus fruit) Marmalade shall be the food of jelly-like consistency made from any combination of peel, pulp or juice of the named citrus fruit by boiling with water and a sweetening ingredient and shall contain not less than 65 per cent water soluble solids as estimated by the refractometer and may contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: such amount of acid ingredient as reasonably compensates for any deficiency in the natural acidity of the named citrus fruit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a pH adjusting agent; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an antifoaming agent.

Text.Emphasis: [S]. (Naming the citrus fruit) Marmalade with Pectin

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the food of jelly-like consistency made from any combination of peel, pulp or juice of the named citrus fruit by boiling with water and a sweetening ingredient;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 27 per cent of any combination of peel, pulp or juice of the named citrus fruit,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 65 per cent water soluble solids as estimated by the refractometer, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: pectin or pectinous preparation; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: such amount of acid ingredient as reasonably compensates for any deficiency in the natural acidity of the citrus fruit used in its preparation,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a Class II preservative,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a pH adjusting agent, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: an antifoaming agent.

Section.Label: B.11.222
Section.Text: [S]. Pineapple Marmalade or Fig Marmalade

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the food of jelly-like consistency made from the pulp of juice of the named fruit by boiling with water and a sweetening ingredient;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not less than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 45 per cent of the named fruit, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 65 per cent water soluble solids, as estimated by the refractometer;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: may contain such amounts of added pectin, pectinous preparation or acid ingredient as reasonably compensates for any deficiency in the natural pectin content or acidity of the named fruit;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a pH adjusting agent; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: an antifoaming agent.

Section.Label: B.11.223
Section.Text: [S]. Pineapple Marmalade with Pectin or Fig Marmalade with Pectin

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the food of jelly-like consistency made from the pulp and juice of the named fruit by boiling with water and a sweetening ingredient;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 27 per cent of the named fruit,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 65 per cent water soluble solids as estimated by the refractometer, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: pectin or pectinous preparation; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: such amount of acid ingredient as reasonably compensates for any deficiency in the natural acidity of the named fruit,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: food colour,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a Class II preservative,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a pH adjusting agent, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: an antifoaming agent.

Section.Label: B.11.224
Section.Text: [S]. (Naming the fruit) Preserve (Conserve) shall be the food made by processing fruit other than apple or rhubarb with a sweetening ingredient and shall contain not less than

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: 45 parts by weight of the named fruit for each 55 parts by weight, on the dry basis, of a sweetening ingredient; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 60 per cent water-soluble solids, as estimated by the refractometer.

Section.Label: B.11.240
Section.Text: [S]. (Naming the fruit) Jelly shall be the gelatinous food, free of seeds and pulp, made from the named fruit, the juice of the named fruit or a concentrate of the juice of the named fruit, which has been boiled with water and a sweetening ingredient, shall contain not less than 62 per cent water soluble solids as estimated by the refractometer and may contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: such amount of added pectin, pectinous preparation or acid ingredient as reasonably compensates for any deficiency of the natural pectin content or acidity of the named fruit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a pH adjusting agent; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an antifoaming agent.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the gelatinous food, free of seeds and pulp, made from the named fruit, the juice of the named fruit or a concentrate of the juice of the named fruit, which has been boiled with water and a sweetening ingredient;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than the equivalent of 32 per cent juice of the named fruit,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 62 per cent water soluble solids, as estimated by the refractometer, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: pectin or pectinous preparation; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: such amount of acid ingredient as reasonably compensates for any deficiency in the natural acidity of the named fruit,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: juice of another fruit,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a gelling agent,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: food colour,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a Class II preservative,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: a pH adjusting agent, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: an antifoaming agent.

Section.Label: B.11.242
Section.Text: The standards prescribed in these Regulations for jam and jelly do not apply to cranberry sauce, jellied cranberry, cranberry jelly, mint jelly and jellied mint.

Section.Label: B.11.250
Section.Text: [S]. Mincemeat, Mince Meat, Mince or Fruit Mince

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the food prepared from

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: fruit or dried fruit,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: suet,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: salt,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: spices, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a sweetening agent; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: vinegar,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: fresh, concentrated or fermented fruit juice,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: spiritous liquor,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: nuts,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: cooked meat,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: a Class II preservative,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: a thickening agent,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: citric acid, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: caramel.

Section.Label: B.11.260
Section.Text: [S]. Boiled Cider shall be the liquid expressed from whole apples, apple cores, apple trimmings or apple culls and concentrated by boiling.

Section.Label: B.12.001
Section.Text: [S]. Water represented as mineral water or spring water,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be potable water obtained from an underground source but not obtained from a public community water supply;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall not contain any coliform bacteria, as determined by official method MFO-9, Microbiological Examination of Mineral Water, November 30, 1981;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall not have its composition modified through the use of any chemicals; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: notwithstanding paragraph (c), may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: added carbon dioxide,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: added fluoride, if the total fluoride ion content thereof does not exceed one part per million, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: added ozone.

Section.Label: B.12.002
Section.Text: The principal display panel of the label on a container of water represented as mineral water or spring water shall carry a statement

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: of the geographical location of the underground source from which it is obtained;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: of the total dissolved mineral salt content expressed in parts per million;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: of the total fluoride ion content expressed in parts per million; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: of any addition of fluoride or ozone thereto.

Section.Label: B.12.003
Section.Text: Where carbon dioxide has been added to water represented as mineral water or spring water, the word “carbonated” (“gazéifiée”) shall appear on the principal display panel of the label on the container thereof, as the first designation in the common name of the water when the added carbon dioxide

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: did not originate from decarbonation of the water upon emergence from the underground source; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is present in a quantity greater than was present originally in the water.

Section.Label: B.12.004
Section.Text: No person shall sell water in sealed containers, other than water represented as mineral water or spring water, if it contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any coliform bacteria, as determined by official method MFO-15, Microbiological Examination of Water in Sealed Containers (Excluding Mineral and Spring Water) and of Prepackaged Ice, November 30, 1981;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: more than 100 total aerobic bacteria per millilitre, as determined by official method MFO-15, Microbiological Examination of Water in Sealed Containers (Excluding Mineral and Spring Water) and of Prepackaged Ice, November 30, 1981;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: naturally occurring fluoride ion in an amount that exceeds its naturally occurring amount; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: added fluoride in such an amount that the total amount therein of added and naturally occurring fluoride ion exceeds one part per million.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell prepackaged ice if it contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any coliform bacteria, as determined by official method MFO-15, Microbiological Examination of Water in Sealed Containers (Excluding Mineral and Spring Water) and of Prepackaged Ice, November 30, 1981;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: naturally occurring fluoride ion in an amount that exceeds its naturally occurring amount; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: added fluoride in such an amount that the total amount therein of added and naturally occurring fluoride ion exceeds one part per million.

Subsection.Text: No person shall manufacture prepackaged ice for sale if the water from which it is made contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any coliform bacteria, as determined by official method MFO-15, Microbiological Examination of Water in Sealed Containers (Excluding Mineral and Spring Water) and of Prepackaged Ice, November 30, 1981;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: naturally occurring fluoride ion in an amount that exceeds its naturally occurring amount; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: added fluoride in such an amount that the total amount therein of added and naturally occurring fluoride ion exceeds one part per million.

Section.Label: B.12.006
Section.Text: The common name of water in sealed containers, other than water represented as mineral water or spring water, shall be “Water”, modified by the word

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: “Distilled” when the treatment of the water includes its vaporization and condensation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: “Demineralized” when the treatment of the water is such that the mineral content of the water is reduced, by means other than distillation, to less than 10 parts per million; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: “Carbonated” when the water contains added carbon dioxide.

Section.Label: B.12.007
Section.Text: Notwithstanding section B.01.008, when chlorine or any compounds of chlorine have been

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: used in the treatment of water in sealed containers, other than water represented as mineral water or spring water, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: subsequently removed from the water together with any chlorine and compounds of chlorine produced in the water,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: chlorine or any compounds of chlorine need not be shown as ingredients on any part of the label on a sealed container of that water.

Section.Label: B.12.008
Section.Text: A statement of the total fluoride ion content expressed in parts per million shall appear on the principal display panel of the label on a sealed container of water, other than water represented as mineral water or spring water and on the label on a container of prepackaged ice.

Section.Label: B.12.009
Section.Text: The label on a sealed container of water, other than water represented as mineral water or spring water, shall bear a description on its principal display panel of any treatment the water has undergone, with the exception of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the addition of an ingredient declared in the list of ingredients;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: chlorination followed by the removal of the agent used for the chlorination together with any chlorine and compounds of chlorine produced in the water;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: decantation; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: filtration.

Section.Label: B.13.001
Section.Text: [S]. Flour, White Flour, Enriched Flour or Enriched White Flour

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the food prepared by the grinding and bolting through cloth having openings not larger than those of woven wire cloth designated “149 microns (No. 100)”, of cleaned milling grades of wheat;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall be free from bran coat and germ to such an extent that the percentage of ash therein, before the addition of any other material permitted by this section, calculated on a moisture-free basis, does not exceed 1.20 per cent;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall have a moisture content of not more than 15 per cent;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain in 100 grams of flour

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 0.64 milligram of thiamine,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 0.40 milligram of riboflavin,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: 5.30 milligrams of niacin or niacinamide,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: 0.15 milligram of folic acid, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: 4.4 milligrams of iron;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: malted wheat flour,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: malted barley flour in an amount not exceeding 0.50 per cent of the weight of the flour,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: amylase, amylase (maltogenic), asparaginase, bromelain, glucoamylase, glucose oxidase, lactase, lipase, lipoxidase, pentosanase, phospholipase, protease, pullulanase or xylanase,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: chlorine,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: chlorine dioxide,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: benzoyl peroxide in an amount not exceeding 150 parts by weight for each one million parts of flour, with or without not more than 900 parts by weight for each one million parts of flour of one or a mixture of two or more of calcium carbonate, calcium sulphate, dicalcium phosphate, magnesium carbonate, potassium aluminum sulphate, sodium aluminum sulphate, starch and tricalcium phosphate as carriers of the benzoyl peroxide,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: ammonium persulphate in an amount not exceeding 250 parts by weight for each one million parts of flour,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: ammonium chloride in an amount not exceeding 2,000 parts by weight for each one million parts of flour,

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: acetone peroxide,

Subparagraph.Label: (xi)
Subparagraph.Text: azodicarbonamide in an amount not exceeding 45 parts by weight for each one million parts of flour,

Subparagraph.Label: (xii)
Subparagraph.Text: ascorbic acid in an amount not exceeding 200 parts by weight for each one million parts of flour,

Subparagraph.Label: (xiii)
Subparagraph.Text: l-cysteine (hydrochloride) in an amount not exceeding 90 parts by weight for each one million parts of flour,

Subparagraph.Label: (xiv)
Subparagraph.Text: monocalcium phosphate in an amount not exceeding 7,500 parts by weight for each one million parts of flour, and

Subparagraph.Label: (xv)
Subparagraph.Text: in 100 grams of flour

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: 0.31 milligram of vitamin B6,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: 1.3 milligrams of d-pantothenic acid, and

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: 190 milligrams of magnesium; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: may contain calcium carbonate, edible bone meal, chalk (B.P.), ground limestone or calcium sulphate in an amount that will provide in 100 grams of flour 140 milligrams of calcium.

Section.Label: B.13.002
Section.Text: Notwithstanding section B.13.001, flour, white flour, enriched flour or enriched white flour, used in or sold for the manufacture of gluten or starch is not required to contain added thiamine, riboflavin, niacin, folic acid or iron.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be flour that has been milled in such a way as to retain a high proportion of the vitamins naturally occurring in the original wheat berry;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall constitute not less than 70 per cent of the wheat from which it is milled;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall be bolted through at least one cloth having openings not larger than those of woven wire cloth designated “149 microns (No. 100)”; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain, on a moisture-free basis,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in one pound an amount of the vitamin B complex that will contribute not less than 1.2 milligrams of thiamine, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than 0.70 per cent and not less than 0.61 per cent ash.

Section.Label: B.13.005
Section.Text: [S]. Whole Wheat Flour or Entire Wheat Flour

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the food prepared by the grinding and bolting of cleaned, milling grades of wheat from which a part of the outer bran or epidermis layer may have been separated;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain the natural constituents of the wheat berry to the extent of not less than 95 per cent of the total weight of the wheat from which it is milled;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall have

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: an ash content, calculated on a moisture-free basis, of not less than 1.25 per cent and not more than 2.25 per cent,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a moisture content of not more than 15 per cent, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: such a degree of fineness that not less than 90 per cent bolts freely through a No. 8 (2 380 micron) sieve, and not less than 50 per cent through a No. 20 (840 micron) sieve; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: malted wheat flour,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: malted barley flour in an amount not exceeding 0.50 per cent of the weight of the flour,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: amylase, amylase (maltogenic), asparaginase, bromelain, glucoamylase, glucose oxidase, lactase, lipase, lipoxidase, pentosanase, phospholipase, protease, pullulanase or xylanase,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: chlorine,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: chlorine dioxide,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: benzoyl peroxide in an amount not exceeding 150 parts by weight for each one million parts of flour, with or without not more than 900 parts by weight for each one million parts of flour of one or a mixture of two or more of calcium carbonate, calcium sulphate, dicalcium phosphate, magnesium carbonate, potassium aluminum sulphate, sodium aluminum sulphate, starch and tricalcium phosphate as carriers of the benzoyl peroxide,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: ammonium persulphate in an amount not exceeding 250 parts by weight for each one million parts of flour,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: ammonium chloride in an amount not exceeding 2,000 parts by weight for each one million parts of flour,

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: azodicarbonamide in an amount not exceeding 45 parts by weight for each one million parts of flour,

Subparagraph.Label: (xi)
Subparagraph.Text: acetone peroxide,

Subparagraph.Label: (xii)
Subparagraph.Text: ascorbic acid in an amount not exceeding 200 parts by weight for each one million parts of flour, and

Subparagraph.Label: (xiii)
Subparagraph.Text: l-cysteine (hydrochloride) in an amount not exceeding 90 parts by weight for each one million parts of flour.

Section.Label: B.13.006
Section.Text: [S]. Graham Flour shall be flour to which has been added part of the bran and other constituents of the wheat berry, and shall have an ash content, calculated on a moisture-free basis, of not less than 1.20 per cent and not more than 2.25 per cent.

Section.Label: B.13.007
Section.Text: [S]. Gluten Flour shall be the food obtained by removing from flour a part of the starch and shall not contain more than

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: 10 per cent moisture, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 44 per cent Starch, calculated on a moisture-free basis, as determined by official method FO-28, Determination of Starch in Gluten Flour, October 15, 1981.

Section.Label: B.13.008
Section.Text: [S]. Crushed Wheat or Coarse Ground Wheat shall be the food prepared by so crushing cleaned wheat that 40 per cent or more passes through a No. 8 (2 380 micron) sieve and less than 50 per cent through a No. 20 (840 micron) sieve, the proportions of the natural constituents of such wheat, other than moisture, remaining unaltered and shall have

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an ash content, calculated on a moisture-free basis, of not less than 1.50 per cent and not more than 2.25 per cent; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a moisture content of not more than 15.5 per cent.

Section.Label: B.13.009
Section.Text: [S]. Cracked Wheat shall be the food prepared by so cracking or cutting cleaned wheat into angular fragments that not less than 90 per cent passes through a No. 8 (2 380 micron) sieve and not more than 20 per cent through a No. 20 (840 micron) sieve, the proportions of the natural constituents of such wheat, other than moisture, remaining unaltered and shall have

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an ash content, calculated on a moisture-free basis, of not less than 1.50 per cent and not more than 2.25 per cent; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a moisture content of not more than 15.5 per cent.

Section.Label: B.13.010
