Section.Text: [S]. Rice shall be the hulled or hulled and polished seed of the rice plant and, in the case of hulled and polished seeds, may be coated with magnesium silicate, talc and glucose.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this Division, precooked rice means polished rice that has been cooked in water or steam and dried in such a manner as to retain the rice grains in a porous and open-structured condition.

Notwithstanding sections D.01.009, D.01.011 and D.02.009, no person shall sell pre-cooked rice to which a vitamin or mineral nutrient set out in Column I of an item of the table to this section has been added, either singly or in any combination, unless each 100 g of the pre-cooked rice as sold contains the added vitamin or mineral nutrient in the amount set out in Column II of that item.

row.entry: Amount per 100 g of Pre-cooked Rice

Subsection.Text: No person shall represent pre-cooked rice as “enriched” unless the food contains added thiamine, niacin and iron.

Section.Label: B.13.011
Section.Text: [S]. Corn starch shall be starch made from maize and shall contain not less than 84% starch.

Section.Label: B.13.014
Section.Text: For the purpose of this Division, moisture, ash and fineness shall be determined by the following applicable official methods:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: FO-29, Determination of Moisture in Grain, October 15, 1981;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: FO-30, Determination of Ash in Grain, October 15, 1981; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: FO-31, Determination of Degree of Fineness of Grain, October 15, 1981.

Section.Label: B.13.015
Section.Text: [S]. Cottonseed Flour or similar products from cottonseed shall be derived from decorticated, defatted or partially defatted, cooked, ground cottonseed kernels and contain not more than 450 parts per million of free gossypol.

Section.Label: B.13.020
Section.Text: In this Division, milk solids means the entire solids content from milk, partly skimmed milk or skim milk or their concentrated, dried or reconstituted form, singly or in any combination.

Section.Label: B.13.021
Section.Text: [S]. Bread or White Bread shall be the food made by baking a yeast-leavened dough prepared with flour and water and may contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: salt;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shortening, lard, butter or margarine;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: milk or milk product;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: whole egg, egg-white; egg-yolk, (fresh, dried, or frozen);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a sweetening agent;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: malt syrup, malt extract or malt flour;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: inactive dried yeast of the genus Saccharomyces cerevisiae in an amount not greater than two parts by weight for each 100 parts of flour used;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: amylase, amylase (maltogenic), asparaginase, bromelain, glucoamylase, glucose oxidase, lactase, lipase, lipoxidase, pentosanase, phospholipase, protease, pullulanase or xylanase;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: subject to section B.13.029, one or more of the following in a total amount not exceeding five parts by weight per 100 parts of flour used, namely, whole wheat flour, entire wheat flour, graham flour, gluten flour, wheat meal, wheat starch, non-wheat flour, non-wheat meal or non-wheat starch, any of which may be wholly or partially dextrinized;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: other parts of the wheat berry;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: lecithin or ammonium salt of phosphorylated glyceride;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: monoglycerides and diglycerides of fat-forming fatty acids,

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: ammonium chloride, ammonium sulphate, calcium carbonate, calcium lactate, diammonium phosphate, dicalcium phosphate, monoammonium phosphate or any combination thereof in an amount not greater than 0.25 parts by weight of all such additives for each 100 parts of flour used;

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: monocalcium phosphate in an amount not greater than 0.75 parts by weight for each 100 parts of flour used;

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: calcium peroxide, ammonium persulphate, potassium persulphate or any combination thereof in an amount not greater than 0.01 part by weight of all such additives for each 100 parts of flour used;

Paragraph.Label: (p)
Paragraph.Text: acetone peroxide;

Paragraph.Label: (q)
Paragraph.Text: vinegar;

Paragraph.Label: (r)
Paragraph.Text: Class III preservative;

Paragraph.Label: (s)
Paragraph.Text: food colour;

Paragraph.Label: (t)
Paragraph.Text: calcium stearoyl-2-lactylate or sodium stearoyl-2-lactylate in an amount not greater than 0.375 parts by weight for each 100 parts of flour used;

Paragraph.Label: (u)
Paragraph.Text: l-cysteine (hydrochloride) in an amount not greater than 0.009 parts by weight for each 100 parts of flour used;

Paragraph.Label: (v)
Paragraph.Text: calcium sulphate in an amount not greater than 0.5 parts by weight for each 100 parts of flour used;

Paragraph.Label: (w)
Paragraph.Text: sodium stearyl fumarate in an amount not greater than 0.5 parts by weight for each 100 parts of flour used;

Paragraph.Label: (x)
Paragraph.Text: ascorbic acid in an amount not greater than 0.02 parts by weight for each 100 parts of flour used;

Paragraph.Label: (y)
Paragraph.Text: lactic acid;

Paragraph.Label: (z)
Paragraph.Text: azodicarbonamide in an amount not exceeding 45 parts by weight for each one million parts of flour;

Paragraph.Label: (aa)
Paragraph.Text: calcium iodate, potassium iodate or any combination thereof in an amount not greater than 45 parts by weight of all such additives for each one million parts of flour;

Paragraph.Label: (bb)
Paragraph.Text: acetylated tartaric acid esters of mono- and diglycerides in an amount not greater than 0.6 parts by weight for each 100 parts of flour used; and

Paragraph.Label: (cc)
Paragraph.Text: guar gum.

Section.Label: B.13.022
Section.Text: [S]. Enriched Bread or Enriched White Bread

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be bread that is baked from a dough in which enriched flour is the only wheat flour used;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: for each 100 parts of flour used, not less than

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: two parts by weight of skim milk solids,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: four parts by weight of dried whey powder, or

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: such amount of the protein product made from peas (Pisum sativum) or soybeans (Glycine max) as will provide 0.5 parts by weight of protein, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in 100 grams of bread,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: 0.40 milligram of thiamine,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: 0.24 milligram of riboflavin,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: 3.3 milligrams of niacin or niacinamide,

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: 0.10 milligram of folic acid, and

Clause.Label: (E)
Clause.Text: 2.76 milligrams of iron;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: may contain, in 100 grams of bread,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 0.14 milligram of vitamin B6,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 0.6 milligram of d-pantothenic acid,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: 90 milligrams of magnesium, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: 66 milligrams of calcium; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: where it contains not less than six parts by weight of milk solids per 100 parts of enriched flour used, may be described by the common name “milk bread”.

Section.Label: B.13.025
Section.Text: [S]. Raisin Bread shall be bread that contains for each 100 parts by weight of flour used not less than 50 parts by weight of seeded or seedless raisins, or raisins and currants of which not less than 35 parts shall be raisins and may contain spices or peel.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: be bread in the making of which the named percentage of the flour used shall be whole wheat flour, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: contain not less than 60 per cent whole wheat flour in relation to the total flour used; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: contain caramel, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: where it contains not less than six parts by weight of milk solids per 100 parts of the total enriched flour and whole wheat flour used, be described by the common name “(naming the percentage) whole wheat milk bread”.

Section.Label: B.13.027
Section.Text: [S]. Brown Bread shall be bread coloured by the use of whole wheat flour, graham flour, bran, molasses or caramel.

Section.Label: B.13.029
Section.Text: A specialty bread may contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: one or more of the ingredients specified in paragraph B.13.021(i) in a total amount greater than the total amount specified in that paragraph; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: fruit, nuts, seeds and flavouring.

Section.Label: B.13.051
Section.Text: No person shall sell macaroni, spaghetti, noodles or similar alimentary pastes, as egg macaroni, egg spaghetti, egg noodles or egg alimentary pastes, respectively, unless they contain, on the dry basis, not less than four per cent, egg-yolk solids derived from whole egg, dried egg, frozen egg or frozen egg-yolk.

Subsection.Text: Notwithstanding sections D.01.009, D.01.011 and D.02.009, no person shall sell an alimentary paste to which a vitamin or a mineral nutrient set out in column I of any item of the table to this section has been added unless each 100 g of the alimentary paste contains the added vitamin or mineral nutrient in an amount not less than the minimum amount set out in column II of that item and not more than the maximum amount set out in column III of that item.
No person shall represent an alimentary paste as “enriched” unless the alimentary paste contains added thiamine, riboflavin, niacin, folic acid and iron, in accordance with the table to this section.

row.entry: Minimum Amount per 100 g of Alimentary Paste
Maximum Amount per 100 g of Alimentary Paste

Section.Label: B.13.060
Section.Text: Notwithstanding sections D.01.009, D.01.011 and D.02.009, no person shall sell a breakfast cereal to which a vitamin or mineral nutrient set out in Column I of an item of the table to this section has been added, either singly or in any combination, unless each 100 g of the breakfast cereal contains the added vitamin or mineral nutrient in the amount set out in Column II of that item.

row.entry: Amount per 100 g of Breakfast Cereal

Section.Label: B.14.001
Section.Text: In this Division,

Definition.Text: animal means any animal used as food, but does not include marine and fresh water animals; (animal)
filler means any vegetable material (except tomato or beetroot), milk, egg, yeast or any derivative or combination thereof that is acceptable as food. (agent de remplissage)

Section.Label: B.14.002
Section.Text: [S]. Meat shall be the edible part of the skeletal muscle of an animal that was healthy at the time of slaughter, or muscle that is found in the tongue, diaphragm, heart or oesophagus, and may contain accompanying and overlying fat together with the portions of bone, skin, sinew, nerve and blood vessels that normally accompany the muscle tissue and are not separated from it in the process of dressing, but does not include muscle found in the lips, snout, scalp or ears.

Section.Label: B.14.003
Section.Text: [S]. Meat by-product shall be any edible part of an animal, other than meat, that has been derived from one or more animals that were healthy at the time of slaughter.

Section.Label: B.14.004
Section.Text: Meat, meat by-products or preparations thereof are adulterated if any of the following substances or class of substances are present therein or have been added thereto:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: mucous membranes, any organ or portions of the genital system, black gut, spleens, udders, lungs or any other organ or portion of animal that is not commonly sold as an article of food;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: preservatives other than those provided for in this Division; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: colour other than annatto, allura red and sunset yellow FCF, where provided for in this Division, and caramel.

Section.Label: B.14.005
Section.Text: [S]. Prepared meat or a prepared meat by-product shall be any meat or any meat by-product, respectively, whether comminuted or not, to which has been added any ingredient permitted by these Regulations, or which has been preserved, placed in a hermetically-sealed container or cooked, and may contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a Class II preservative;

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of prepared hams, shoulders, butts, picnics and backs, gelatin;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of partially defatted pork fatty tissue and partially defatted beef fatty tissue, a Class IV preservative;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: where a minimum total protein content or a minimum meat protein content is prescribed in this Division, phosphate salts that do not when calculated as sodium phosphate, dibasic, exceed the maximum level provided therefor in Table XII to section B.16.100 and that are one or more of the following phosphate salts, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: sodium acid pyrophosphate,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: sodium hexametaphosphate,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: sodium phosphate, dibasic,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: sodium phosphate, monobasic,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: sodium pyrophosphate, tetrabasic,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: sodium tripolyphosphate,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: potassium phosphate, monobasic,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: potassium phosphate, dibasic, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: potassium pyrophosphate, tetrabasic; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of vacuum-packed sliced roast beef and vacuum-packed sliced cooked ham, Carnobacterium maltaromaticum CB1.

Section.Label: B.14.006
Section.Text: Powdered hydrogenated cottonseed oil in an amount not greater than 0.25 per cent of the product may be applied as a release agent to the surface of meat, meat by-product, prepared meat, prepared meat by-product, extended meat product and simulated meat product.

Section.Label: B.14.007
Section.Text: [S]. Meat Binder or (naming the meat product) Binder shall be a filler with any combination of salt, sweetening agents, spices or other seasonings (except tomato), egg, egg albumen, and

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: where sold for use in preserved meat or preserved meat by-product, may contain any of ascorbic acid, calcium ascorbate, erythorbic acid, iso-ascorbic acid, potassium nitrate, potassium nitrite, sodium ascorbate, sodium carbonate, sodium erythorbate, sodium iso-ascorbate, sodium nitrate and sodium nitrite, provided that these nitrates and nitrites, if any, are packaged separately from any spice or seasoning.

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where sold for use in prepared meat or meat by-product in which a gelling agent is a permitted ingredient, may contain a gelling agent;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: where sold for use in fresh, uncooked sausage, may contain artificial maple flavour; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: may contain an anticaking agent.

Section.Label: B.14.008
Section.Text: No person shall sell a meat binder, filler or preparations for pumping pickle, cover pickle or dry cure represented for use in meat products unless the label thereof carries directions for use that when followed will produce a food that will comply with the requirements of section B.14.030 insofar as the filler is concerned and the food will not contain food additives in excess of the maximum levels of use prescribed by these Regulations.

Section.Label: B.14.009
Section.Text: [S]. Pumping pickle, cover pickle and dry cure employed in the curing of preserved meat or preserved meat by-product may contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: Class I preservatives if the nitrate or nitrite salts or both are packaged separately from any spice or seasoning;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: citric acid, sodium citrate or vinegar;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: sweetening agents, including maple sugar and maple syrup;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: liquid smoke flavour, liquid smoke flavour concentrate, salt, seasonings, spices, spice extracts, spice oils or spice oleoresins;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: sodium bicarbonate, sodium hydroxide or potassium hydroxide;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of pumping pickle for cured pork, beef and lamb cuts, disodium phosphate, monosodium phosphate, sodium hexametaphosphate, sodium tripolyphosphate, tetrasodium pyrophosphate and sodium acid pyrophosphate in such amount calculated as disodium phosphate, as will result in the finished product containing not more than 0.5 per cent added phosphate;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of pumping pickle for cured beef cuts, enzymes, if the principal display panel of the label of the cured beef carries, immediately preceding or following the common name, the statement “Tenderized with (naming the proteolytic enzyme or enzymes)”;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of dry cure, an anticaking agent or a humectant; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of pumping pickle

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: for cured pork hams, shoulders and backs, artificial maple flavour, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: for cured pork bellies, artificial maple flavour and an orange flavour that meets the standard prescribed in section B.10.005.

Section.Label: B.14.010
Section.Text: No person shall sell as food a dead animal or any part thereof.

Section.Label: B.14.011
Section.Text: No person shall sell as food, meat, meat by-products, preparations containing meat or meat derivatives obtained, prepared or manufactured from a dead animal.

Section.Label: B.14.012
Section.Text: For the purpose of Sections B.14.010 and B.14.011, dead animal means a dead animal that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: was not killed for the purpose of food in accordance with commonly accepted practice of killing animals for the purpose of food, which shall include exsanguination; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: was affected with disease at the time it was killed.

Section.Label: B.14.015
Section.Text: [S]. Regular Ground Beef shall be beef meat processed by grinding and shall contain not more than 30 per cent beef fat, as determined by official method FO-33, Determination of Fat in Meat and Simulated Meat Products, October 15, 1981.

Section.Label: B.14.015A
Section.Text: [S]. Medium Ground Beef shall be beef meat processed by grinding and shall contain not more than 23 per cent beef fat, as determined by official method FO-33, Determination of Fat in Meat and Simulated Meat Products, October 15, 1981.

Section.Label: B.14.015B
Section.Text: [S]. Lean Ground Beef shall be beef meat processed by grinding and shall contain not more than 17 per cent beef fat, as determined by official method FO-33, Determination of Fat in Meat and Simulated Meat Products, October 15, 1981.

Section.Label: B.14.015C
Section.Text: No person shall sell ground beef that contains more than 30 per cent beef fat, as determined by official method FO-33, Determination of Fat in Meat and Simulated Meat Products, October 15, 1981.

Section.Label: B.14.016
Section.Text: No person shall sell horse-meat or horse-meat by-product, or any food containing horse-meat or horse-meat by-product unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it is labelled as such when offered or exposed for sale; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: when in package form, the principal display panel of the label carries a declaration of the presence of horse-meat or of horse-meat by-product in type at least as legible and conspicuous as any other type upon such principal display panel.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), if a carcass of beef or veal, or a portion of a carcass of beef or veal that weighs 7 kg or more, is advertised for sale, the advertisement shall indicate

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a carcass other than an imported carcass, the grade that was assigned to the carcass under the Safe Food for Canadians Act or a provincial law;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an imported beef carcass, the grade that was assigned to the carcass under the Safe Food for Canadians Act or a provincial law or the grade that was assigned to the carcass by a grading authority established under the laws of the country from which the carcass was imported;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an imported veal carcass, the grade that was assigned to the carcass by a grading authority established under the laws of the country from which the carcass was imported; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a beef carcass, the yield class, if any, that was assigned to the carcass under the Safe Food for Canadians Act.

Subsection.Text: Where, in the case of a carcass referred to in subsection (1), no grade has been assigned thereto as described in that subsection and the carcass or portion thereof that weighs 7 kg or more is advertised for sale, the advertisement shall clearly indicate that the carcass has not been graded.
Where a carcass of beef, veal, pork or lamb or a portion thereof that weighs 7 kg or more is advertised for sale and a selling price is stated in the advertisement, the advertisement shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: contain the words “price per kilogram is based on carcass weight before cutting, boning and trimming” or the words “price per kilogram is based on the weight of the meat after cutting, boning and trimming”, whichever words are applicable; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where in addition to the selling price a charge is payable for cutting, boning, trimming, wrapping or freezing the carcass or portion thereof, indicate

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the amount of the additional charge, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: where the additional charge is payable on a price per unit weight basis, whether the additional charge is based on the weight of the carcass or portion thereof before or after the carcass has been cut, boned and trimmed.

Subsection.Text: Any information required by subsection (1) to appear in an advertisement shall be located therein immediately adjacent to the selling price stated therein, without any intervening written, printed or graphic matter.

Section.Label: B.14.020
Section.Text: [S]. Solid cut meat shall be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a whole cut of meat; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a product consisting of pieces of meat of which at least 80 per cent weigh at least 25 g each.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell solid cut meat to which phosphate salts or water has been added unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of meat, other than side bacon, Wiltshire bacon, pork jowls, salt pork and salt beef, the meat

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: where cooked, contains a meat protein content of not less than 12 per cent, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: where uncooked, contains a meat protein content of not less than 10 per cent; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that meat contains, phosphate salts that do not when calculated as sodium phosphate, dibasic, exceed the maximum level provided therefor in Table XII to section B.16.100 and that are one or more of the following phosphate salts, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: sodium acid pyrophosphate,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: sodium hexametaphosphate,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: sodium phosphate, dibasic,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: sodium phosphate, monobasic,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: sodium pyrophosphate, tetrabasic,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: sodium tripolyphosphate,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: potassium phosphate, monobasic,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: potassium phosphate, dibasic, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: potassium pyrophosphate, tetrabasic.

Subsection.Text: A bone or a visible fat layer shall not be included in any calculation used to determine meat protein content for the purposes of paragraph (1)(a).

Section.Label: B.14.022
Section.Text: No person shall sell mechanically tenderized beef unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the beef is identified as mechanically tenderized when it is offered or exposed for sale; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the beef has a label on it with a principal display panel that, subject to section B.01.012, includes all of the following information:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in type at least as legible and prominent as that of the common name,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the expression “mechanically tenderized” in the English version of the label, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the expression “attendri mécaniquement”, with any necessary grammatical modifications, in the French version of the label, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in type at least as legible and prominent as that of any other information other than the common name,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: in the English version of the label,

Subclause.Label: (I)
Subclause.Text: the message “Cook to a minimum internal temperature of 63°C (145°F).”, and

Subclause.Label: (II)
Subclause.Text: in the case of steak, the additional message “Turn steak over at least twice during cooking.”, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: in the French version of the label,

Subclause.Label: (I)
Subclause.Text: the message “Faire cuire jusqu’à ce que la température interne atteigne au moins 63 °C (145 °F).”, and

Subclause.Label: (II)
Subclause.Text: in the case of steak, the additional message “Retourner le bifteck au moins deux fois durant la cuisson.”.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (2) and (3) and section B.14.030A, no person shall sell a prepared meat or prepared meat by-product with a meat protein content of less than 1.5 percentage points below the total protein requirement for that food.
Subsection (1) does not apply to an extended meat product.

Where gelatin is an ingredient of a prepared meat or prepared meat by-product, that gelatin shall not be included when calculating the total protein content of the prepared meat or prepared meat by-product.

Section.Label: B.14.030A
Section.Text: For the purposes of sections B.14.030, B.14.032, B.14.033, B.14.035, B.14.074, B.14.075, B.14.076 and B.14.077, where any of the non-meat ingredients listed in paragraphs B.14.032A(a) to (g) are present in a prepared meat or prepared meat by-product in separate identifiable pieces or chunks in any amount sufficient to differentiate those ingredients from the prepared meat or prepared meat by-product, those ingredients shall not be included when calculating the fat or protein content of the prepared meat or prepared meat by-product.

Section.Label: B.14.031
Section.Text: [S]. Preserved Meat or Preserved Meat By-product shall be cooked or uncooked meat or meat by-product that is salted, dried, pickled, corned, cured or smoked, may be glazed and may contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a Class I preservative;

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: a Class II preservative;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: sweetening agents;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: spices and seasonings, except tomato;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: vinegar;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: alcohol;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: smoke flavouring or artificial smoke flavouring;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of cured pork hams, shoulders, backs and bellies, artificial maple flavour;

Paragraph.Label: (gg)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of cured pork bellies, an added orange flavour that meets the standard prescribed in section B.10.005;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of cured pork, beef and lamb cuts prepared with the aid of pumping pickle, disodium phosphate, monosodium phosphate, sodium hexametaphosphate, sodium tripolyphosphate, tetrasodium pyrophosphate and sodium acid pyrophosphate in such amount calculated as disodium phosphate, as will result in the finished product containing not more than 0.5 per cent added phosphate;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of tocino, annatto in such amount as will result in the finished product containing not more than 0.1% annatto; and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of vacuum-packed sliced cooked ham, Carnobacterium maltaromaticum CB1.

Section.Label: B.14.032
Section.Text: [S]. Sausage or Sausage Meat

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be fresh or preserved comminuted meat;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may be enclosed in a casing or have an edible coating;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: may be dipped in vinegar, smoked, cooked or dried;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: animal fat,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: filler,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: beef tripe,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: liver,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: fresh or frozen beef and pork blood,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: sweetening agents,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: salt and spices,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: seasoning, other than tomato,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: lactic acid producing starter culture,

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: meat binder,

Subparagraph.Label: (xi)
Subparagraph.Text: beef and pork blood plasma,

Subparagraph.Label: (xi.1)
Subparagraph.Text: a Class II preservative,

Subparagraph.Label: (xii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of preserved comminuted meat, smoke flavouring or artificial smoke flavouring,

Subparagraph.Label: (xiii)
Subparagraph.Text: if cooked

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: glucono delta lactone,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: partially defatted beef fatty tissue or partially defatted pork fatty tissue, and

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: a dried skim milk product, obtained from skim milk by the reduction of its calcium content and a corresponding increase in its sodium content, in an amount not exceeding three per cent of the finished food,

Subparagraph.Label: (xiv)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of fresh uncooked sausage, artificial maple flavour or apple powder as a flavouring ingredient,

Subparagraph.Label: (xv)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of dry sausage or dry sausage meat, glucono delta lactone,

Subparagraph.Label: (xvi)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of longaniza,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: annatto in such amount as will result in the finished product containing not more than 0.1% annatto,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: allura red in such amount as will result in the finished product containing not more than 80 parts per million allura red, and

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: sunset yellow FCF in such amount as will result in the finished product containing not more than 20 parts per million sunset yellow FCF,

Subparagraph.Label: (xvii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of vacuum-packed wieners, Carnobacterium maltaromaticum CB1, and

Subparagraph.Label: (xviii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of sausage having an edible coating, calcium chloride or calcium lactate;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain, in the case of a product sold as fresh sausage, not more than 40 per cent fat, as determined by official method FO-33, Determination of Fat in Meat and Simulated Meat Products, October 15, 1981;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: shall have, if cooked, a total protein content of not less than 11 per cent;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: shall have, in the case of fresh uncooked sausage and fresh uncooked sausage meat, a total protein content of not less than nine per cent.

Section.Label: B.14.032A
Section.Text: [S]. (naming the prepared meat or prepared meat by-product) with (naming the non-meat ingredients) shall be prepared meat to which has been added other non-meat ingredients including

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: fruit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: vegetables;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: nuts;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: cheese or processed cheese;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: macaroni;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: pickles; or

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: olives.

Section.Label: B.14.032AA
Section.Text: Where the non-meat ingredients referred to in section B.14.032A are added to prepared meat in such a manner that they are not present in the final product in separate identifiable pieces or chunks, the final product shall meet the total protein content requirement established for (naming the prepared meat or prepared meat by-product) referred to in section B.14.032A.

Section.Label: B.14.033
Section.Text: [S]. Potted Meat, Meat Paste or Meat Spread shall be fresh or preserved meat that is comminuted and cooked, and may contain meat binder, salt, sweetening agents, spices, other seasonings, a gelling agent, sodium acetate and sodium diacetate and shall have a total protein content of not less than 9%.

Section.Label: B.14.034
Section.Text: [S]. Potted Meat By-product, Meat By-product Paste or Meat By-product Spread shall be a food that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: consists, wholly or in part, of meat by-products and conforms to the standard prescribed for potted meat; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of liverpaste or liverwurst spread, may contain wheat germ and yeast.

Section.Label: B.14.035
Section.Text: [S]. Meat Loaf, Meat Roll, Meat Lunch or Luncheon Meat shall be fresh or preserved meat that is comminuted, cooked and pressed into shape, and may contain a dried skim milk product obtained from skim milk by the reduction of its calcium content and a corresponding increase in its sodium content, in an amount not exceeding 3% of the finished food, as well as filler, meat binder, salt, sweetening agents, glucono delta lactone, spices, other seasonings, milk, eggs, a gelling agent, sodium acetate, sodium diacetate and partially defatted beef fatty tissue or partially defatted pork fatty tissue, and shall have a total protein content of not less than 11%.

Section.Label: B.14.036
Section.Text: [S]. Meat By-product Loaf or Meat and Meat By-product Loaf shall be the food consisting, wholly or in part, of meat by-products and shall otherwise conform to the standard prescribed for meat loaf.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be comminuted cooked meat or comminuted cooked preserved meat,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall not contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: less than 50 per cent head meat, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: skin, other than that naturally adherent to any pork meat used,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: may contain scalps, snouts, beef tripe, salt, spices, seasoning or an added gelling agent, and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a Class I preservative, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a Class II preservative.

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of subsection (1), scalps and snouts are considered to be head meat.

Section.Label: B.14.038
Section.Text: [S]. Brawn shall be headcheese, except that it need not contain 50 per cent head meat.

Section.Label: B.14.039
Section.Text: Where a gelling agent has been added to prepared meat or prepared meat by-product, a statement to the effect that a gelling agent has been added shall be shown on the principal display panel or the word “jellied” shall be shown as an integral part of the common name of the food.

Section.Label: B.14.040
Section.Text: Subject to section B.14.032 and sections B.14.033 to B.14.036, no person shall sell a food that consists of a mixture of ground meat and filler, ground meat by-product and filler or ground meat, ground meat by-product and filler, unless that food

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has a total protein content of not less than 13 per cent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has a fat content of not more than 40 per cent, as determined by official method FO-33, Determination of Fat in Meat and Simulated Meat Products, October 15, 1981, in the case of a mixture containing pork meat or pork meat by-product or both; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has a fat content of not more than 30 per cent, as determined by official method FO-33, Determination of Fat in Meat and Simulated Meat Products, October 15, 1981, in the case of any other meat mixture.

Section.Label: B.14.041
Section.Text: Subject to section B.14.032 and sections B.14.033 to B.14.036, no person shall sell a food that consists of a mixture of ground meat and spices and seasonings, ground meat by-product and spices and seasonings, ground meat, ground meat by-product and spices and seasonings or ground meat and ground meat by-product, unless that food

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has a total protein content of not less than 16 per cent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has a fat content of not more than 40 per cent, as determined by official method FO-33, Determination of Fat in Meat and Simulated Meat Products, October 15, 1981, in the case of a mixture containing pork meat or pork meat by-product or both; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has a fat content of not more than 30 per cent, as determined by official method FO-33, Determination of Fat in Meat and Simulated Meat Products, October 15, 1981, in the case of any other meat mixture.

Section.Label: B.14.061
Section.Text: [S]. Edible Bone Meal or Edible Bone Flour shall be the food prepared by grinding dry, defatted bones, obtained from animals healthy at the time of slaughter and shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 85 per cent ash, as determined by official method FO-34, Determination of Ash in Edible Bone Meal or Edible Bone Flour, October 15, 1981.

Subsection.Label: [S]. (1)
Subsection.Text: Gelatin or Edible Gelatin

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the purified food obtained by the processing of skin, ligaments or bones of animals;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not less than 82 per cent ash-free solids, when tested by official method FO-35, Determination of Ash-Free Solids in Gelatin, October 15, 1981;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall be free from objectionable taste and offensive odour when 2.5 grams thereof are dissolved in 100 millilitres of warm water;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: shall not contain any residues of hydrogen peroxide where it has been used in the course of manufacture; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than 2.6 per cent ash on a dry basis,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than 500 parts per million of sulphurous acid, including the salts thereof, calculated as sulphur dioxide, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: where intended for use in the manufacture of marshmallow, sodium hexametaphosphate or sodium lauryl sulphate.

Subsection.Text: No person shall use, in the course of manufacturing gelatin or edible gelatin,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: acidic or basic compounds other than acetic acid, ammonium hydroxide, citric acid, fumaric acid, hydrochloric acid, lime, magnesium hydroxide, phosphoric acid, sodium carbonate, sodium hydroxide, sodium sulphide, sulphuric acid, sulphurous acid or tartaric acid; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: filtering and clarifying agents other than activated carbon, alumina, aluminum sulphate, calcium phosphate, dibasic, cellulose, diatomaceous earth, perlite, strongly acidic cation exchange resin in the hydrogen ion form or basic anion exchange resins in the chloride ion or free base ion forms.

Section.Label: B.14.063
Section.Text: For the purposes of sections B.14.064 to B.14.068, stew meat means meat that contains when raw not more than

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: 25 per cent fat, in the case of meat in meat ball stews; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 20 per cent fat, in the case of meat in other stews.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain vegetables and the named meat in the following amounts, calculated as raw ingredients:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 12 per cent or more stew meat, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 38 per cent or more vegetables; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain gravy, salt, seasoning and spices.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain vegetables and the named meat in the following amounts, calculated as raw ingredients:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 20 per cent or more stew meat, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 30 per cent or more vegetables; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain gravy, salt, seasoning and spices.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain mutton, lamb or beef, singly or in any combination, and vegetables, in the following amounts, calculated as raw ingredients:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 20 per cent or more stew meat,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 30 per cent or more vegetables; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain gravy, salt, seasoning and spices.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain vegetables and meat balls in the following amounts, calculated as raw ingredients:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 22 per cent or more meat balls,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 30 per cent or more vegetables; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain gravy, salt, seasoning and spices.

Section.Label: B.14.068
Section.Text: [S]. Specialty Meat Stews

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain meat and vegetables in the following amounts, calculated as raw ingredients:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 25 per cent or more stew meat,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 30 per cent or more vegetables; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain gravy, salt, seasoning and spices.

Section.Label: B.14.070
Section.Text: [S]. Wieners and Beans or Wieners with Beans shall be the food prepared from dried beans and wieners, may contain sauce, seasoning, spices and a sweetening agent and shall contain not less than 25 per cent wieners, as determined by official method FO-36, Determination of Wiener Content of Meat Specialties, October 15, 1981.

Section.Label: B.14.071
Section.Text: [S]. Beans and Wieners or Beans with Wieners shall be the food prepared from dried beans and wieners, may contain sauce, seasoning, spices and a sweetening agent and shall contain not less than 10 per cent wieners, as determined by official method FO-36, Determination of Wiener Content of Meat Specialties, October 15, 1981.

Heading.TitleText: Sale of Barbecued, Roasted or Broiled Meat or Meat By-Products

Section.Label: B.14.072
Section.Text: No person shall sell meat or a meat by-product that has been barbecued, roasted or broiled and is ready for consumption unless the cooked meat or meat by-product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: at all times

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: has a temperature of 40°F (4.4°C) or lower, or 140°F (60°C) or higher, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: has been stored at an ambient temperature of 40°F (4.4°C) or lower, or 140°F (60°C) or higher; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: carries on the principal display panel of the label a statement to the effect that the food must be stored at a temperature of 40°F (4.4°C) or lower, or 140°F (60°C) or higher.

Section.Label: B.14.073
Section.Text: No person shall sell a meat product extender intended to be used in a food consisting of a mixture described in section B.14.074, B.14.075, B.14.076, B.14.077 or B.14.078, unless that extender

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has, in the rehydrated state,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a total protein content of not less than 16 per cent, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a protein rating of not less than 40, as determined by official method FO-1, Determination of Protein Rating, October 15, 1981;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: contains, notwithstanding sections D.01.009 and D.02.009, each vitamin and mineral nutrient listed in Column I of the Table to this Division in an amount not less than the amount shown in Column II of that Table opposite each such vitamin and mineral nutrient respectively; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: where isolated essential amino acids have been added, contains those acids in an amount not exceeding an amount that improves the nutritional quality of the protein.

Section.Label: B.14.074
Section.Text: Subject to sections B.14.075 to B.14.079, no person shall sell a food that consists of a mixture of meat product and meat product extender, unless that food

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has a total protein content of not less than 16 per cent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has a fat content of not more than 25 per cent, as determined by official method FO-33, Determination of Fat in Meat and Simulated Meat Products, October 15, 1981; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the meat product extender, meets the requirements of paragraphs B.14.073(a) to (c).

Section.Label: B.14.075
Section.Text: No person shall sell a food that consists of a mixture of meat product and meat product extender and that resembles fresh sausage, unless that food

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has a total protein content of not less than nine per cent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has a fat content of not more than 40 per cent, as determined by official method FO-33, Determination of Fat in Meat and Simulated Meat Products, October 15, 1981; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the meat product extender, meets the requirements of paragraphs B.14.073(a) to (c).

Section.Label: B.14.076
Section.Text: No person shall sell a food that consists of a mixture of meat product and meat product extender and that resembles cooked sausage, meat loaf, meat by-product loaf, meat roll, meat lunch, or luncheon meat, unless that food

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has a total protein content of not less than 11 per cent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has a fat content of not more than 25 per cent, as determined by official method FO-33, Determination of Fat in Meat and Simulated Meat Products, October 15, 1981; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the meat product extender, meets the requirements of paragraphs B.14.073(a) to (c).

Section.Label: B.14.077
Section.Text: No person shall sell a food that consists of a mixture of meat product and meat product extender and that resembles potted meat, potted meat by-product, meat paste, meat by-product paste, meat spread, or meat by-product spread, unless that food

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has a total protein content of not less than nine per cent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has a fat content of not more than 30 per cent, as determined by official method FO-33, Determination of Fat in Meat and Simulated Meat Products, October 15, 1981; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the meat product extender, meets the requirements of paragraphs B.14.073(a) to (c).

Section.Label: B.14.078
Section.Text: No person shall sell a food that consists of a mixture of meat product and meat product extender and that resembles regular ground beef, medium ground beef or lean ground beef, unless that food

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has a total protein content of not less than 16 per cent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has a fat content of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than 30 per cent, as determined by official method FO-33, Determination of Fat in Meat and Simulated Meat Products, October 15, 1981, in the case where the product is represented as being regular,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than 23 per cent, as determined by official method FO-33, Determination of Fat in Meat and Simulated Meat Products, October 15, 1981, in the case where the product is represented as being medium, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than 17 per cent, as determined by official method FO-33, Determination of Fat in Meat and Simulated Meat Products, October 15, 1981, in the case where the product is represented as being lean; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the meat product extender, meets the requirements of paragraphs B.14.073(a) to (c).

Section.Label: B.14.079
Section.Text: No person shall sell a food that consists of a mixture of meat product, filler and meat product extender, unless that food

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has a total protein content of not less than 13 per cent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has a fat content of not more than 25 per cent, as determined by official method FO-33, Determination of Fat in Meat and Simulated Meat Products, October 15, 1981; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the meat product extender, meets the requirements of paragraphs B.14.073(a) to (c).

Section.Label: B.14.085
Section.Text: Subject to sections B.14.086 to B.14.090 no person shall sell a simulated meat product unless that product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has, in the rehydrated state,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a total protein content of not less than 16 per cent,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a protein rating of not less than 40, as determined by official method FO-1, Determination of Protein Rating, October 15, 1981, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a fat content of not more than 25 per cent, as determined by official method FO-33, Determination of Fat in Meat and Simulated Meat Products, October 15, 1981;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: contains, notwithstanding sections D.01.009 and D.02.009, each vitamin and mineral nutrient listed in Column I of the Table to this Division in an amount not less than the amount shown in Column II of that Table opposite each such vitamin and mineral nutrient respectively; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: where isolated essential amino acids have been added, contains those acids in an amount not exceeding an amount that improves the nutritional quality of the protein.

Section.Label: B.14.086
Section.Text: No person shall sell a simulated meat product that resembles fresh sausage, unless that product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has a total protein content of not less than nine per cent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has a protein rating of not less than 23, as determined by official method FO-1, Determination of Protein Rating, October 15, 1981;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has a fat content of not more than 40 per cent, as determined by official method FO-33, Determination of Fat in Meat and Simulated Meat Products, October 15, 1981;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: has, notwithstanding sections D.01.009 and D.02.009, each vitamin and mineral nutrient listed in Column I of the Table to this Division in an amount not less than the amount shown in Column II of that Table opposite each such vitamin and mineral nutrient respectively; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: where isolated essential amino acids have been added, contains those acids in an amount not exceeding an amount that improves the nutritional quality of the protein.

Section.Label: B.14.087
Section.Text: No person shall sell a simulated meat product that resembles cooked sausage, meat loaf, meat by-product loaf, meat roll, meat lunch, or luncheon meat, unless that product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has a total protein content of not less than 11 per cent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has a protein rating of not less than 28, as determined by official method FO-1, Determination of Protein Rating, October 15, 1981;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has a fat content of not more than 25 per cent, as determined by official method FO-33, Determination of Fat in Meat and Simulated Meat Products, October 15, 1981;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: contains, notwithstanding sections D.01.009 and D.02.009, each vitamin and mineral nutrient listed in Column I of the Table to this Division in an amount not less than the amount shown in Column II of that Table opposite each such vitamin and mineral nutrient respectively; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: where isolated essential amino acids have been added, contains those acids in an amount not exceeding an amount that improves the nutritional quality of the protein.

Section.Label: B.14.088
Section.Text: No person shall sell a simulated meat product that resembles potted meat, potted meat by-product, meat paste, meat by-product paste, meat spread, or meat by-product spread, unless that product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has a total protein content of not less than nine per cent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has a protein rating of not less than 23, as determined by official method FO-1, Determination of Protein Rating, October 15, 1981;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has a fat content of not more than 30 per cent, as determined by official method FO-33, Determination of Fat in Meat and Simulated Meat Products, October 15, 1981;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: contains, notwithstanding sections D.01.009 and D.02.009, each vitamin and mineral nutrient listed in Column I of the Table to this Division in an amount not less than the amount shown in Column II of that Table opposite each vitamin and mineral nutrient respectively; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: where isolated essential amino acids have been added, contains those acids in an amount not exceeding an amount that improves the nutritional quality of the protein.

Section.Label: B.14.089
Section.Text: No person shall sell a simulated meat product that resembles regular ground beef, medium ground beef or lean ground beef, unless that product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has a total protein content of not less than 16 per cent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has a protein rating of not less than 40, as determined by official method FO-1, Determination of Protein Rating, October 15, 1981;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has a fat content of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than 30 per cent, as determined by official method FO-33, Determination of Fat in Meat and Simulated Meat Products, October 15, 1981, in the case where the product is represented as being regular,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than 23 per cent, as determined by official method FO-33, Determination of Fat in Meat and Simulated Meat Products, October 15, 1981, in the case where the product is represented as being medium, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than 17 per cent, as determined by official method FO-33, Determination of Fat in Meat and Simulated Meat Products, October 15, 1981, in the case where the product is represented as being lean;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: contains, notwithstanding sections D.01.009 and D.02.009, each vitamin and mineral nutrient listed in Column I of the Table to this Division in an amount not less than the amount shown in Column II of that Table opposite each such vitamin and mineral nutrient, respectively; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: where isolated essential amino acids have been added, contains those acids in an amount not exceeding an amount that improves the nutritional quality of the protein.

Section.Label: B.14.090
Section.Text: No person shall sell a simulated meat product that resembles side bacon, unless that product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has a total protein content of not less than 25 per cent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has a protein rating of not less than 20, as determined by official method FO-1, Determination of Protein Rating, October 15, 1981;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: contains, notwithstanding sections D.01.009 and D.02.009, each vitamin and mineral nutrient listed in Column I of the Table to this Division in an amount not less than the amount shown in Column II of that Table opposite each such vitamin and mineral nutrient respectively; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: where isolated essential amino acids have been added, contains those acids in an amount not exceeding an amount that improves the nutritional quality of the protein.

Subsection.Text: A food referred to in column 2 of Part 1 of the List of Contaminants and Other Adulterating Substances in Foods is adulterated if the corresponding substance referred to, by name or class, in column 1 is present in or on the food.

A food referred to in column 2 of Part 2 of the List of Contaminants and Other Adulterating Substances in Foods is adulterated if the corresponding substance referred to, by name or class, in column 1 is present in or on the food in an amount that exceeds the maximum level set out in column 3.

If a substance referred to, by name or class, in column 1 in Part 2 the List of Contaminants and Other Adulterating Substances in Foods is present in or on the corresponding food referred to in column 2, the food is, in respect of the presence of the substance, exempt from the application of paragraph 4(1)(a) of the Act if the amount of the substance does not exceed the maximum level set out in column 3.
Subsections (1) to (3) do not apply to a substance that is present in or on a food as

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a food additive;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a pest control product as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Pest Control Products Act or its components or derivatives; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a veterinary drug or its metabolites.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), a food is adulterated if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a pest control product as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Pest Control Products Act or its components or derivatives, for which no maximum residue limit has been specified under sections 9 or 10 of that Act for that food, are present in or on the food, singly or in any combination, in an amount exceeding 0.1 part per million; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an agricultural chemical or its components or derivatives, other than a pest control product as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Pest Control Products Act or its components or derivatives, are present in or on the food, singly or in any combination, in an amount exceeding 0.1 part per million.

Subsection.Text: A food is exempt from paragraph 4(1)(d) of the Act if the following agricultural chemicals, or their components or derivatives, are the only agricultural chemicals, or components or derivatives of agricultural chemicals, that are present in or on the food, singly or in any combination:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a fertilizer;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an adjuvant or a carrier of an agricultural chemical;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an inorganic bromide salt;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: silicon dioxide;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: sulphur;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: viable spores of Bacillus thuringiensis Berliner; or

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: Kaolin.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (2) does not apply to a food if there is present in or on the food an agricultural chemical, or a component or derivative of that agricultural chemical, referred to in that subsection that is a pest control product as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Pest Control Products Act, or a component or derivative of that product, in respect of which a maximum residue limit has been specified under sections 9 or 10 of that Act for that food.

Section.Label: B.16.001
Section.Text: A quantitative statement of the amount of each additive present or directions for use that, if followed, will produce a food that will not contain such additives in excess of the maximum levels of use prescribed by these Regulations shall be shown, grouped together with the list of ingredients, of any substance or mixture of substances for use as a food additive.

Section.Label: B.16.002
Section.Text: A request that a food additive be added to or a change made in the Tables following section B.16.100 shall be accompanied by a submission to the Minister in a form, manner and content satisfactory to him and shall include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the food additive, including its chemical name and the name under which it is proposed to be sold, its method of manufacture, its chemical and physical properties, its composition and its specifications and, where that information is not available, a detailed explanation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the amount of the food additive proposed for use, and the purpose for which it is proposed, together with all directions, recommendations and suggestions for use;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: where necessary, in the opinion of the Minister, an acceptable method of analysis suitable for regulatory purposes that will determine the amount of the food additive and of any substance resulting from the use of the food additive in the finished food;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: data establishing that the food additive will have the intended physical or other technical effect;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: detailed reports of tests made to establish the safety of the food additive under the conditions of use recommended;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: data to indicate the residues that may remain in or upon the finished food when the food additive is used in accordance with good manufacturing practice;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a proposed maximum limit for residues of the food additive in or upon the finished food;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: specimens of the labelling proposed for the food additive; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: a sample of the food additive in the form in which it is proposed to be used in foods, a sample of the active ingredient, and, on request a sample of food containing the food additive.

Section.Label: B.16.003
Section.Text: The Minister shall, within 90 days after the filing of a submission in accordance with section B.16.002, notify the person filing the submission whether or not it is his intention to recommend to the Governor-in-Council that the said food additive be so listed and the detail of any listing to be recommended.

Section.Label: B.16.006
Section.Text: Paragraph B.01.042(c) and paragraph B.01.043(a) do not apply to spices, seasonings, flavouring preparations, essential oils, oleoresins and natural extractives.

Section.Label: B.16.007
Section.Text: No person shall sell a food containing a food additive other than a food additive provided for in sections B.01.042, B.01.043 and B.25.062.

Section.Label: B.16.100
Section.Text: No person shall sell any substance as a food additive unless the food additive is listed in one or more of the following Tables:

(1) Meat binder for dry sausage, semi-dry sausage, preserved meat and preserved meat by-products prepared by slow cure processes (Division 14)

(1) When the meat binder is used in accordance with label instructions, whether potassium nitrate is added alone or in combination with sodium nitrate, the total amount of such nitrates thereby added to each batch of dry sausage, semi-dry sausage, preserved meat or preserved meat by-products shall not exceed 0.32 ounce per 100 pounds or 200 parts per million, calculated prior to any smoking, cooking or fermentation
(2) Cover pickle and dry cure employed in the curing of preserved meat and preserved meat by-products prepared by slow cure processes (Division 14)

(2) When the cover pickle or dry cure is used in accordance with label instructions, whether potassium nitrate is added alone or in combination with sodium nitrate, the total amount of such nitrates thereby added to each batch of preserved meat or preserved meat by-products shall not exceed 0.32 ounce per 100 pounds or 200 parts per million, calculated prior to any smoking, cooking or fermentation
(3) Dry sausage, semi-dry sausage, preserved meat and preserved meat by-products prepared by slow cure processes (Division 14)

(3) Where potassium nitrate is added alone or in combination with sodium nitrate, the total amount of such nitrates added to each batch of dry sausage, semi-dry sausage, preserved meat or preserved meat by-products shall not exceed 0.32 ounces per 100 pounds or 200 parts per million, calculated prior to any smoking, cooking or fermentation

(4) Ripened cheese, containing not more than 68% moisture on a fat free basis during manufacture of which the lactic acid fermentation and salting is completed later than 12 hours after coagulation of the curd by food enzymes and where the added salt is applied externally to the cheese as dry salt or in the form of brine
(4) If used singly or in combination with sodium nitrate, the total not to exceed 200 p.p.m. (based in milk). Residue in the finished cheese not to exceed 50 p.p.m.
(5) Mold ripened cheese packed in hermetically sealed containers
(5) If used singly or in combination with sodium nitrate, the total not to exceed 200 p.p.m. (based in milk). Residue in the finished cheese not to exceed 50 p.p.m.
(1) Meat binder, pumping pickle, cover pickle and dry cure employed in the curing of preserved meat and preserved meat by-products (Division 14)

(1) When the meat binder, pumping pickle, cover pickle or dry cure is used in accordance with label instructions, whether potassium nitrite is added alone or in combination with sodium nitrite, the total amount of such nitrites thereby added to each batch of preserved meat or preserved meat by-products shall not exceed 0.32 ounce per 100 pounds or 200 parts per million calculated prior to any smoking, cooking or fermentation
(2) Preserved meat except side bacon and preserved meat by-products (Division 14)

(2) Where potassium nitrite is added alone or in combination with sodium nitrite, the total amount of such nitrites added to each batch of preserved meat, except side bacon or preserved meat by-products, shall not exceed 0.32 ounce per 100 pounds or 200 parts per million, calculated prior to any smoking, cooking or fermentation

(3) Where potassium nitrite is added alone or in combination with sodium nitrite, the total amount of such nitrites added to each batch of side bacon shall not exceed 0.19 ounce per 100 pounds or 120 parts per million, calculated prior to any smoking, cooking or fermentation
(4) Preserved poultry meat and preserved poultry meat by-products (Division 22)

(4) Where potassium nitrite is added alone or in combination with sodium nitrite, the total amount of such nitrites added to each batch of preserved poultry meat or preserved poultry meat by-products shall not exceed 0.32 ounce per 100 pounds or 200 parts per million, calculated prior to any smoking, cooking or fermentation

Subsection.Text: [S]. Salt, other than crude rock salt, shall be crystalline sodium chloride and may contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: one or more of the following anti-caking agents,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: calcium aluminum silicate, calcium phosphate tribasic, calcium silicate, calcium stearate, magnesium carbonate, magnesium silicate, magnesium stearate, silicon dioxide and sodium aluminum silicate, the total amount not to exceed one per cent and, in the case of fine grained salt, the total amount not to exceed two per cent,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: propylene glycol in an amount not exceeding 0.035 per cent, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: sodium ferrocyanide decahydrate in an amount not exceeding 13 parts per million calculated as anhydrous sodium ferrocyanide;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 1.4 per cent, singly or in combination, of calcium sulphate or potassium chloride,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 13 parts per million anhydrous sodium ferrocyanide when added as sodium ferrocyanide decahydrate in the production of dendritic crystals of salt,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: 10 parts per million of polyoxyethylene (20) sorbitan monooleate when used in the production of coarse crystal salt,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: 15 parts per million of sodium alginate when used in the production of coarse crystal salt, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: 0.1 per cent other ingredients; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: notwithstanding paragraphs (a) and (b), the total level of sodium ferrocyanide decahydrate, whether added as an anti-caking agent or as an adjuvant in the production of dendritic salt, shall not exceed 13 parts per million, calculated as anhydrous sodium ferrocyanide.

Section.Label: B.17.003
Section.Text: Notwithstanding section B.17.001, salt for table or general household use shall contain 0.01 per cent potassium iodide, with or without dextrose, sodium thiosulphate or sodium bicarbonate as a stabilizer of the iodide and the presence of iodide shall be shown on the principal display panel.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the food chemically known as sucrose; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not less than 99.8 per cent sucrose.

Section.Label: B.18.002
Section.Text: [S]. Liquid Sugar shall be the food obtained by dissolving sugar in water.

Section.Label: B.18.003
Section.Text: [S]. Invert Sugar shall be the food obtained by the partial or complete hydrolysis of sugar.

Section.Label: B.18.004
Section.Text: [S]. Liquid Invert Sugar shall be the food consisting of a solution of invert sugar in water.

Section.Label: B.18.005
Section.Text: [S]. No person shall sell liquid sugar or liquid invert sugar unless the label carries a statement of the percentage of sugar or invert sugar contained therein.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be powdered sugar; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: food colour, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: either not more than five per cent starch or an anticaking agent.

Section.Label: B.18.007
Section.Text: [S]. Brown Sugar, Yellow Sugar or Golden Sugar

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the food obtained from the syrups originating in the sugar refining process;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain not more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 4.5 per cent moisture, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 3.5 per cent sulphate ash; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall not contain less than 90 per cent sugar and invert sugar.

Section.Label: B.18.008
Section.Text: [S]. Refined Sugar Syrup, Refiners’ Syrup or Golden Syrup

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the food made from syrup originating in the sugar refining process;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may be hydrolyzed; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall not contain more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 35 per cent moisture, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 2.5 per cent sulphated ash.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the syrupy food obtained by the evaporation and partial inversion of the clarified or unclarified sugar cane juice from which sugar has not been previously extracted;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain sulphurous acid or its salts; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall not contain more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 25 per cent moisture, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 3 per cent sulphated ash.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the liquid food obtained in the process of manufacturing raw or refined sugar;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain sulphurous acid or its salts;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall not contain more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 25 per cent moisture, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 3 per cent sulphated ash.

Section.Label: B.18.011
Section.Text: [S]. Refiners’ Molasses, Blackstrap Molasses or Cooking Molasses

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the residual liquid food obtained in the process of manufacturing raw or refined sugar;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain sulphurous acid or its salts;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall not contain more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 25 per cent moisture, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 12 per cent sulphated ash.

Subsection.Label: [S]. (1)
Subsection.Text: Dextrose Anhydrous, for the purpose of Part B of these Regulations

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the food chemically known as dextrose;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not less than 99.5 per cent D-glucose on a dry basis;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not more than 0.25 per cent sulphated ash on a dry basis;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not less than 98 per cent total solids; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: may contain sulphurous acid or its salts.

Subsection.Text: Dextrose Monohydrate, for the purpose of Part B of these Regulations

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the food chemically known as dextrose;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not less than 99.5 per cent D-glucose on a dry basis;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not more than 0.25 per cent sulphated ash on a dry basis;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not less than 90 per cent total solids; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: may contain sulphurous acid or its salts.

Section.Label: B.18.016
Section.Text: [S]. Glucose or Glucose Syrup

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the purified concentrated solution of nutritive saccharides obtained from the incomplete hydrolysis, by means of acid or enzymes, of starch or of a starch-containing substance;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall have a total solids content of not less than 70 per cent;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall have a sulphated ash content of not more than 1.0 per cent on a dry basis;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: shall have a reducing sugar content (dextrose equivalent) of not less than 20 per cent expressed as D-glucose on a dry basis; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: may contain sulphurous acid or its salts.

Section.Label: B.18.017
Section.Text: [S]. Glucose Solids or Dried Glucose Syrup

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be glucose or glucose syrup from which the water has been partially removed;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall have a total solids content of not less than 93 per cent;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall have a sulphated ash content of not more than 1.0 per cent on a dry basis;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: shall have a reducing sugar content (dextrose equivalent) of not less than 20 per cent expressed as D-glucose, on a dry basis; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: may contain sulphurous acid or its salts.

Text.Emphasis: [S]. (Naming the source of the glucose) Syrup

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be glucose;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a sweetening agent,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a flavouring preparation,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: sorbic acid,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: sulphurous acid or its salts,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: salt, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: water; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall not contain more than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 35 per cent moisture; and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 3 per cent ash.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the carbohydrate normally obtained from whey and may

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: be anhydrous,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: contain one molecule of water of crystalization, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: be a mixture of both subparagraphs (i) and (ii);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall not contain less than 99.0 per cent anhydrous lactose on a moisture free basis;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall not contain more than 0.3 per cent sulphated ash on a moisture free basis;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: shall have a weight loss of not more than 6.0 per cent on drying; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: shall have, in a 10 per cent solution, a pH of not less than 4.5 and not more than 7.0.

Section.Label: B.18.025
Section.Text: [S]. Honey shall be the food produced by honey bees and derived from

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the nectar of blossoms,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: secretions of living plants, or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: secretions on living plants,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: and shall have

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a fluid, viscous or partly or wholly crystallized consistency;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a diastase activity, determined after processing and blending, as represented by a diastase figure on the Gothe scale of not less than eight where the hydroxy-methyl-furfural content is not more than 0.004 per cent; or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a diastase activity, determined after processing and blending, as represented by a diastase figure on the Gothe scale of not less than three where the hydroxy-methyl-furfural content is not more than 0.0015 per cent.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), honey derived mainly from nectar of blossoms shall not contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: less than 65 per cent apparent reducing sugar, calculated as invert sugar;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: more than 20 per cent moisture;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: more than 5 per cent apparent sucrose;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: more than 0.1 per cent water insoluble solids, except that pressed honey shall contain not more than 0.5 per cent water insoluble solids;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: more than 0.6 per cent ash; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
