Paragraph.Text: more than 40 milliequivalents acid per 1 000 grams.

Subsection.Text: Honey derived mainly from the nectar of lavender, rubinia, alfalfa, or banksia menziesii shall meet the requirements of paragraphs (1)(a), (b) and (d) to (f) and shall contain not more than 10 per cent apparent sucrose.

Section.Label: B.18.027
Section.Text: Honey derived from secretions of living plants or from secretions on living plants shall not contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: less than 60 per cent apparent reducing sugar, calculated as invert sugar;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: more than 20 per cent moisture;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: more than 10 per cent apparent sucrose;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: more than 0.1 per cent water insoluble solids, except that pressed honey shall contain not more than 0.5 per cent water insoluble solids;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: more than 1.0 per cent ash; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: more than 40 milliequivalents acid per 1 000 grams.

Section.Label: B.19.001
Section.Text: Vinegar shall be the liquid obtained by the acetous fermentation of an alcoholic liquid and shall contain not less than 4.1 per cent and not more than 12.3 per cent acetic acid.

Section.Label: B.19.002
Section.Text: The percentage of acetic acid by volume contained in any vinegar described in Division 19 shall be shown on the principal display panel followed by the words “acetic acid”.

Section.Label: B.19.003
Section.Text: [S]. Wine Vinegar shall be vinegar made from wine and may contain caramel.

Section.Label: B.19.004
Section.Text: [S]. Spirit Vinegar, Alcohol Vinegar, White Vinegar or Grain Vinegar shall be vinegar made from diluted distilled alcohol.

Section.Label: B.19.005
Section.Text: [S]. Malt Vinegar shall be vinegar made from an infusion of malt undistilled prior to acetous fermentation, may contain other cereals or caramel, shall be dextro-rotatory, and shall contain, in 100 millilitres measured at a temperature of 20°C, not less than

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: 1.8 grams of solids, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 0.2 gram of ash.

Section.Label: B.19.006
Section.Text: [S]. Cider Vinegar or Apple Vinegar shall be vinegar made from the liquid expressed from whole apples, apple parts or apple culls and may contain caramel.

Section.Label: B.19.007
Section.Text: [S]. Blended Vinegar shall be a combination of two or more varieties of vinegar of which spirit vinegar shall contribute not more than 55 per cent of the total acetic acid.

Section.Label: B.19.008
Section.Text: No person shall name any of the varieties of vinegar forming a blended vinegar unless the label of such blended vinegar carries a complete list of all the varieties of vinegar present, in descending order of proportionate content, based on acetic acid.

Section.Label: B.19.009
Section.Text: The maximum limits for the acetic acid content of a vinegar described in section B.19.001 do not apply to vinegar sold only for manufacturing use if the words “For Manufacturing Use Only” are shown on the principal display panel and upon all documents pertaining to such vinegar.

Section.Label: B.20.001
Section.Text: [S]. Tea shall be the dried leaves and buds of Thea sinensis (L.) Sims prepared by the usual trade processes.

Section.Label: B.20.002
Section.Text: [S]. Black Tea shall be black tea or a blend of two or more black teas and shall contain, on the dry basis, not less than 30 per cent water-soluble extractive, as determined by official method FO-37, Determination of Water-Soluble Extractive in Tea, October 15, 1981, and not less than four per cent and not more than seven per cent total ash.

Section.Label: B.20.003
Section.Text: The provisions of B.20.002 do not apply to original unblended black tea that contains, on the dry basis, not less than 25 per cent water-soluble extractive, as determined by official method FO-37, Determination of Water-Soluble Extractive in Tea, October 15, 1981, and not less than four per cent and not more than seven per cent total ash, and is packaged according to good commercial practice in the country of origin.

Section.Label: B.20.004
Section.Text: [S]. Green Tea shall contain, on the dry basis, not less than 33 per cent water-soluble extractive, as determined by official method FO-37, Determination of Water-Soluble Extractive in Tea, October 15, 1981, and not less than four per cent and not more than seven per cent total ash.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be tea of the type indicated, from which caffeine has been removed and that, as a result of the removal, contains not more than 0.4 per cent caffeine; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may have been decaffeinated by means of extraction solvents set out in Table XV to Division 16.

Heading.Label: DIVISION 21
Heading.TitleText: Marine and Fresh Water Animal Products

Section.Label: B.21.001
Section.Text: The foods referred to in this Division are included in the term marine and fresh water animal products.

Section.Label: B.21.002
Section.Text: In this Division,

Definition.Text: filler means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: flour or meal prepared from grain or potato, but not from a legume,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: processed wheat flour containing not less than the equivalent of 80 per cent dextrose, as determined by official method FO-32, Determination of Fillers, Binders and Dextrose Equivalent, October 15, 1981,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: bread, biscuit or bakery products, but not those containing or made with a legume,

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: milk powder, skim milk powder, buttermilk powder or whey powder, and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: starch; (remplissage)

Definition.Text: Marine and fresh water animal includes

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: fish,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: crustaceans, molluscs, other marine invertebrates,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: marine mammals, and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: frogs. (animaux marins et animaux d’eau douce)

Section.Label: B.21.003
Section.Text: [S]. Fish shall be the clean, dressed edible portion of fish, with or without salt or seasoning, and may

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of frozen fillets, contain ascorbic acid or its sodium salt, citric acid, or erythorbic acid or its sodium salt, and

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: sodium tripolyphosphate, sodium hexametaphosphate or a combination of sodium tripolyphosphate, sodium acid pyrophosphate and sodium pyrophosphate tetrabasic, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a mixture of sodium hexametaphosphate and sodium carbonate;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if frozen, have a glaze consisting of water, acetylated monoglycerides, calcium chloride, sodium alginate, sodium carboxymethyl cellulose, sodium phosphate (dibasic), corn syrup, dextrose, glucose, glucose solids, ascorbic acid or its sodium salt or erythorbic acid or its sodium salt; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if frozen minced, contain sodium tripolyphosphate, sodium hexametaphosphate, ascorbic acid or its sodium salt, citric acid, erythorbic acid or its sodium salt, or a combination of sodium tripolyphosphate, sodium acid pyrophosphate and sodium pyrophosphate tetrabasic.

Section.Label: B.21.004
Section.Text: [S]. In this Division, meat shall be the clean, dressed flesh of crustaceans, molluscs, other marine invertebrates and marine mammals, whether minced or not, with or without salt or seasoning, and in the case of frozen lobster, frozen crab, frozen shrimp and frozen clams, may contain sodium tripolyphosphate or sodium hexametaphosphate or a combination of sodium 0hexametaphosphate and sodium carbonate or a combination of sodium tripolyphosphate, sodium acid pyrophosphate and sodium pyrophosphate tetrabasic.

Section.Label: B.21.005
Section.Text: Fish, except fish protein, and meat products or preparations thereof are adulterated if any of the following substances or any substance in one of the following classes is present therein or has been added thereto:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: mucous membranes, any organ or portion of the genital system, or any organ or portion of a marine or fresh water animal that is not commonly sold as an article of food;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: preservatives, other than those provided for in this Division, except

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: sorbic acid or its salts in dried fish that has been smoked or salted, and in cold processed smoked and salted fish paste, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: benzoic acid or its salts, methyl-p-hydroxy benzoate and propyl-p-hydroxy benzoate in marinated or similar cold-processed, packaged fish and meat products; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: food colour except as provided for in this Division.

Section.Label: B.21.006
Section.Text: [S]. Prepared fish or prepared meat shall be the whole or minced food prepared from fresh or preserved fish or meat respectively, may be canned or cooked, and may,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of lobster paste and fish roe (caviar), contain food colour;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of canned shellfish, canned spring mackerel and frozen cooked shrimp, contain citric acid or lemon juice;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of fish paste, contain filler, fish binder, monoglycerides or mono and diglycerides;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of canned crabmeat, lobster, salmon, shrimp and tuna, contain aluminum sulphate and calcium disodium ethylenediaminetetraacetate;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of canned tuna, contain ascorbic acid;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of canned seafoods, contain sodium acid pyrophosphate, sodium hexametaphosphate or sodium tripolyphosphate, singly, or in combination, at a maximum level of total added phosphate not to exceed 0.5%, calculated as sodium phosphate, dibasic;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: contain liquid smoke flavour or liquid smoke flavour concentrate;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: contain edible oil, vegetable broth and tomato sauce or puree;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: contain a gelling agent if the principal display panel carries the word “jellied” as an integral part of the common name;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: contain salt;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of canned clams, canned sea snails and canned snails, contain calcium disodium ethylenediaminetetraacetate;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of canned flaked tuna, contain sodium sulphite;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of lumpfish caviar, contain tragacanth gum;

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a blend of prepared fish and prepared meat that has the appearance and taste of the flesh of a marine or freshwater animal, contain filler, fish binder, whole egg, egg-white, egg-yolk, food colour, gelling or stabilizing agents, texture-modifying agents, natural and artificial flavouring preparations, pH-adjusting agents, sweetener and, in a proportion not exceeding two per cent of the blend, a legume;

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of crustaceans, contain potassium bisulphite, potassium metabisulphite, sodium bisulphite, sodium dithionite, sodium metabisulphite, sodium sulphite or sulphurous acid;

Paragraph.Label: (p)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of frozen crustaceans and molluscs, contain calcium oxide and sodium hydroxide;

Paragraph.Label: (q)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of frozen pre-cooked battered or breaded fish products, contain citric acid at a level of use not exceeding 0.1 per cent;

Paragraph.Label: (r)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of canned clams, contain sodium erythorbate at a level of use not exceeding 350 parts per million;

Paragraph.Label: (s)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of minced products, other than lumpfish caviar, contain tragacanth gum at a level of use not exceeding 0.75 per cent; and

Paragraph.Label: (t)
Paragraph.Text: contain a Class II preservative.

Section.Label: B.21.007
Section.Text: [S]. Fish binder for use in or upon prepared fish or prepared meat shall be filler with any combination of salt, sugar, dextrose, glucose, spices and other seasonings.

Section.Label: B.21.008
Section.Text: No person shall sell filler or a fish binder represented for use in fish products either by label or in any advertisement unless the label carries adequate directions for use in accordance with the limits provided in section B.21.020.

Section.Label: B.21.009
Section.Text: Powdered hydrogenated cottonseed oil in an amount not greater than 0.25 per cent of the product may be applied as a release agent to the surface of marine and fresh water animal products.

Section.Label: B.21.020
Section.Text: No person shall sell prepared fish or prepared meat that contains more than

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that amount of filler, fish binder or other ingredients that is represented by four per cent reducing sugars, calculated as dextrose, as determined by official method FO-32, Determination of Fillers, Binders and Dextrose Equivalent, October 15, 1981; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 70 per cent moisture where such prepared fish contains filler.

Section.Label: B.21.021
Section.Text: [S]. Preserved fish or preserved meat shall be cooked or uncooked fish or meat that is dried, salted, pickled, cured or smoked and may contain a Class I preservative, a Class II preservative, dextrose, glucose, spices, sugar and vinegar, and

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: dried fish that has been smoked or salted, and cold-processed smoked and salted fish paste may contain sorbic acid or its salts;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: smoked fish may contain food colour;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: packaged fish and meat products that are marinated or otherwise cold-processed may contain saunderswood (sandalwood), benzoic acid or its salts, methyl-p-hydroxy benzoate and propyl-p-hydroxy benzoate;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: salted anchovy, salted scad and salted shrimp may contain erythrosine in such amount as will result in the finished product containing not more than 125 parts per million of erythrosine; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: minced products may contain tragacanth gum at a level of use not exceeding 0.75 per cent.

Section.Label: B.21.024
Section.Text: Notwithstanding section B.21.020 lobster paste shall not contain more than two per cent filler or fish binder.

Section.Label: B.21.025
Section.Text: No person shall sell marine and fresh water animals, or marine and fresh water animal products, that are packed in a container that has been sealed to exclude air and that are smoked or to which liquid smoke flavour or liquid smoke flavour concentrate has been added, unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the container has been heat-processed after sealing at a temperature and for a time sufficient to destroy all spores of the species Clostridium botulinum;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the contents of the container contain not less than nine per cent salt, as determined by official method FO-38, Determination of Salt in Smoked Fish, dated March 15, 1985;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the contents of the container are customarily cooked before eating; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the contents of the container are frozen and the principal display panel of the label of the container carries the statement “Keep Frozen Prior to Use” in the same size type used for the common name of the contents of the container.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the food prepared by

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: extracting water, fat and other soluble components through the use of isopropyl alcohol from fresh whole edible fish of the order Clupeiformes, families Clupeidae and Osmeridae and the order Gadiformes, family Gadidae, or from trimmings resulting from the filleting of such fish when eviscerated, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: drying and grinding the protein concentrate resulting from the operation described in subparagraph (i);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain a pH adjusting agent; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall not contain

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: less than 75 per cent protein, which protein shall be at least equivalent to casein in protein quality, as determined by official method FO-1, Determination of Protein Rating, October 15, 1981.

Section.Label: B.21.031
Section.Text: No person shall sell fresh or frozen froglegs unless they are free from bacteria of the genus Salmonella, as determined by official method MFO-10, Microbiological Examination of Froglegs, November 30, 1981.

Heading.Label: DIVISION 22
Heading.TitleText: Poultry, Poultry Meat, Their Preparations and Products

Section.Label: B.22.001
Section.Text: [S]. Poultry shall be any bird that is commonly used as food.

Section.Label: B.22.002
Section.Text: [S]. Poultry meat shall be the clean, dressed flesh including the heart and gizzard of eviscerated poultry that is healthy at the time of slaughter.

Section.Label: B.22.003
Section.Text: [S]. Poultry meat by-product shall be the clean parts of poultry other than poultry meat commonly used as food and includes liver and skin but excludes the oesophagus, feet and head.

Section.Label: B.22.004
Section.Text: [S]. Giblets shall be the heart, liver and gizzard of poultry.

Section.Label: B.22.005
Section.Text: Poultry meat, poultry meat by-products or preparations thereof are adultered if any of the following substances or any substance in the following classes is present therein or has been added thereto:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any organ or portion of poultry that is not commonly sold as food;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: preservatives, other than those provided for in this Division; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: colour, other than caramel.

Section.Label: B.22.006
Section.Text: [S]. Prepared poultry meat or a prepared poultry meat by-product shall be any poultry meat or any poultry meat by-product, respectively, whether comminuted or not, to which has been added any ingredient permitted by these Regulations or that has been preserved, placed in a hermetically-sealed container or cooked, and may contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: where a minimum total protein content or minimum meat protein requirement is prescribed in this Division, phosphate salts that do not when calculated as sodium phosphate, dibasic, exceed the maximum level provided therefor in Table XII to section B.16.100 and that are one or more of the following phosphate salts, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: sodium acid pyrophosphate,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: sodium hexametaphosphate,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: sodium phosphate, dibasic,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: sodium phosphate, monobasic,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: sodium pyrophosphate, tetrabasic,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: sodium tripolyphosphate,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: potassium phosphate, monobasic,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: potassium phosphate, dibasic, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: potassium pyrophosphate, tetrabasic;

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: a Class II preservative;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of dried, cooked poultry meat, a Class IV preservative; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of vacuum-packed sliced cooked turkey, Carnobacterium maltaromaticum CB1.

Section.Label: B.22.008
Section.Text: In this Division, filler means any vegetable material (except tomato or beetroot), milk, egg, yeast, or any derivative or combination thereof that is acceptable as food.

Section.Label: B.22.009
Section.Text: No person shall sell

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any poultry intended for consumption as food if any preparation having oestrogenic activity has been administered to the poultry; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: poultry meat or poultry meat by-product that contains any residues of exogenous oestrogenic substances.

Section.Label: B.22.010
Section.Text: Powdered hydrogenated cottonseed oil in an amount not greater than 0.25 per cent of the product may be applied as a release agent to the surface of poultry meat, poultry meat by-product, prepared poultry meat, prepared poultry meat by-product, extended poultry product and simulated poultry product.

Section.Label: B.22.011
Section.Text: [S]. Solid cut poultry meat shall be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a whole cut of poultry meat; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a product consisting of pieces of poultry meat of which at least 80 per cent weigh at least 25 g each.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell solid cut poultry meat to which phosphate salts or water has been added unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that meat

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: where cooked, contains a meat protein content of not less than 12 per cent, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: where uncooked, contains a meat protein content of not less than 10 per cent; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that meat contains, phosphate salts that do not when calculated as sodium phosphate, dibasic, exceed the maximum level provided therefor in Table XII to section B.16.100 and that are one or more of the following phosphate salts, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: sodium acid pyrophosphate,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: sodium hexametaphosphate,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: sodium phosphate, dibasic,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: sodium phosphate, monobasic,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: sodium pyrophosphate, tetrabasic,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: sodium tripolyphosphate,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: potassium phosphate, monobasic,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: potassium phosphate, dibasic, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: potassium pyrophosphate, tetrabasic.

Subsection.Text: A bone or a visible fat layer shall not be included in any calculation used to determine meat protein content for the purposes of paragraph (1)(a).

Section.Label: B.22.013
Section.Text: No person shall sell the whole or any part of a dressed poultry carcass that has been placed in a chilling tank containing fluids to which phosphate salts have been added.

Section.Label: B.22.016
Section.Text: For the purposes of sections B.22.017 to B.22.019, stew poultry meat means cooked or uncooked poultry meat containing not more than 15 per cent fat, calculated on the weight of uncooked stew poultry meat.

Text.Emphasis: [S]. Vegetable Stew with (naming the poultry meat)

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain vegetables and the named poultry meat in the following amounts:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if uncooked, 12 per cent or more of the named stew poultry meat,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if cooked, 6 per cent or more of the named stew poultry meat,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: 38 per cent or more vegetables; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain gravy, salt, seasoning and spices.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain vegetables and the named poultry meat in the following amounts:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if uncooked, 20 per cent or more of the named stew poultry meat,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if cooked, 10 per cent or more of the named stew poultry meat,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: 30 per cent or more vegetables; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain gravy, salt, seasoning and spices.

Section.Label: B.22.019
Section.Text: [S]. Specialty Poultry Meat Stew

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain poultry meat and vegetables in the following amounts:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if uncooked, 25 per cent or more of stew poultry meat,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if cooked, 15 per cent or more of stew poultry meat,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: 30 per cent or more vegetables; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain gravy, salt, seasoning and spices.

Heading.TitleText: Prepared Poultry Meats, Prepared Poultry Meat By-Products

Section.Label: B.22.021
Section.Text: [S]. Preserved poultry meat or poultry meat by-product shall be cooked or uncooked poultry meat or poultry meat by-product that is cured or smoked and may contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a Class I preservative;

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: a Class II preservative;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: liquid smoke flavour, liquid smoke flavour concentrate or spices;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: sweetening agents;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: vinegar;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of cured poultry or poultry meat prepared by means of injection or cover solution, disodium phosphate, monosodium phosphate, sodium hexametaphosphate, sodium tripolyphosphate, tetrasodium pyrophosphate and sodium acid pyrophosphate, in such amount calculated as disodium phosphate, as will result in the finished product containing not more than 0.5 per cent added phosphate; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of vacuum-packed sliced cooked turkey, Carnobacterium maltaromaticum CB1.

Section.Label: B.22.022
Section.Text: [S]. Canned (naming the poultry) shall be prepared from poultry meat and may contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: those bones or pieces of bones attached to the portion of the poultry meat that is being canned;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: broth;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: salt;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: seasoning;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: gelling agents; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: small amounts of fat.

Section.Label: B.22.023
Section.Text: [S]. Broth that is used in canned (naming the poultry) shall be the liquid in which the poultry meat has been cooked.

Section.Label: B.22.024
Section.Text: Where a gelling agent has been added to canned poultry, a statement to the effect that a gelling agent has been added shall be shown on the principal display panel or the word “jellied” shall be shown as an integral part of the common name of the food.

Section.Label: B.22.025
Section.Text: [S]. Boneless (naming the poultry) shall be canned poultry meat from which the bones and skin have been removed, shall contain not less than 50 per cent of the named poultry meat, as determined by official method FO-39, Determination of Meat in Boneless Poultry, October 15, 1981, and may contain broth having a specific gravity of not less than 1.000 at a temperature of 50°C.

Section.Label: B.22.026
Section.Text: No person shall sell poultry, poultry meat or poultry meat by-product that has been barbecued, roasted or broiled and is ready for consumption unless the cooked poultry, poultry meat or poultry meat by-product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: at all times

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: has a temperature of 40°F (4.4°C) or lower, or 140°F (60°C) or higher, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: has been stored at an ambient temperature of 40°F (4.4°C) or lower, or 140°F (60°C) or higher; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: carries on the principal display panel of the label a statement to the effect that the food must be stored at a temperature of 40°F (4.4°C) or lower, or 140°F (60°C) or higher.

Section.Label: B.22.027
Section.Text: No person shall sell a poultry product extender unless that extender

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has, in the rehydrated state,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a total protein content of not less than 16 per cent; and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a protein rating of not less than 40, as determined by official method FO-1, Determination of Protein Rating, October 15, 1981;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has, notwithstanding sections D.01.009 and D.02.009, each vitamin and mineral nutrient listed in Column I of the Table to Division 14 in an amount not less than the amount shown in Column II of that Table opposite each such vitamin and mineral nutrient respectively; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: where isolated essential amino acids have been added, contains those acids in an amount not exceeding an amount that improves the nutritional quality of the protein.

Section.Label: B.22.028
Section.Text: No person shall sell a food that consists of a mixture of poultry product and poultry product extender, unless that food

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has a total protein content of not less than 16 per cent, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has a protein rating of not less than 40, as determined by official method, and unless

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: the poultry product extender meets the requirements of paragraphs B.22.027(a) to (c).

Section.Label: B.22.029
Section.Text: No person shall sell a simulated poultry product unless that product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has a total protein content of not less than 16 per cent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has a protein rating of not less than 40, as determined by official method FO-1, Determination of Protein Rating, October 15, 1981;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has a fat content of not more than 15 per cent;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: contains, notwithstanding sections D.01.009 and D.02.009, each vitamin and mineral nutrient listed in Column I of the Table to Division 14 in an amount not less than the amount shown in Column II of that Table opposite each such vitamin and mineral nutrient respectively; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: where isolated essential amino acids have been added, contains those acids in an amount not exceeding an amount that improves the nutritional quality of the protein.

Section.Label: B.22.032
Section.Text: No person shall sell any product simulating whole egg unless that product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is made from liquid, dried or frozen egg albumen or mixtures thereof;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has a protein rating of not less than 40, as determined by official method FO-1, Determination of Protein Rating, October 15, 1981;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: notwithstanding sections D.01.009 and D.02.009, contains, per 100 grams on a ready-to-use basis,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: 50 milligrams calcium,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: 2.3 milligrams iron,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: 1.5 milligrams zinc,

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: 130 milligrams potassium,

Clause.Label: (E)
Clause.Text: 1000 International Units Vitamin A,

Clause.Label: (F)
Clause.Text: 0.10 milligram thiamine,

Clause.Label: (G)
Clause.Text: 0.30 milligram riboflavin,

Clause.Label: (H)
Clause.Text: 3.60 milligrams niacin,

Clause.Label: (I)
Clause.Text: 1.60 milligrams pantothenic acid,

Clause.Label: (J)
Clause.Text: 0.20 milligram Vitamin B6′,

Clause.Label: (K)
Clause.Text: 0.50 microgram Vitamin B12′,

Clause.Label: (L)
Clause.Text: 0.02 milligram folic acid, and

Clause.Label: (M)
Clause.Text: 2.0 International Units alpha tocopherol, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than 3 milligrams cholesterol;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: has a calcium to phosphorous ratio of not less than one part calcium to four parts phosphorous; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: contains in the total fat of any fat or oil used not less than 40 per cent cis-cis methylene interrupted polyunsaturated fatty acids and not more than 20 per cent saturated fatty acids.

Section.Label: B.22.033
Section.Text: No person shall sell any egg product referred to in sections B.22.032, B.22.034, B.22.035, B.22.036 and B.22.037 for use as food unless it is free from bacteria of the genus Salmonella, as determined by official method MFO-6, Microbiological Examination of Egg Products and Liquid Eggs, November 30, 1981.

Section.Label: B.22.034
Section.Text: [S]. Liquid Whole Egg, Dried Whole Egg or Frozen Whole Egg

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the product obtained by removing the shell from wholesome fresh eggs or wholesome stored eggs, and

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of dried whole egg, drying the product, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of frozen whole egg, freezing the product; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: contain aluminum sulphate, pH adjusting agents and the colour beta carotene,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of liquid whole egg destined for drying, contain yeast autolysate and may be treated with hydrogen peroxide and catalase, glucose oxidase and catalase or yeast and suitable glucose fermenting bacterial culture, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of dried whole egg, contain anti-caking agents.

Section.Label: B.22.035
Section.Text: [S]. Liquid Yolk, Dried Yolk or Frozen Yolk

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the product obtained by removing the shell and egg-white from wholesome fresh eggs or wholesome stored eggs, and

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of dried yolk, drying the product, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of frozen yolk, freezing the product, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: contain aluminum sulphate, pH adjusting agents and the colour beta carotene,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of liquid yolk destined for drying, contain yeast autolysate and may be treated with hydrogen peroxide and catalase, glucose oxidase and catalase or yeast and suitable glucose fermenting bacterial culture, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of dried yolk, contain anti-caking agents.

Section.Label: B.22.036
Section.Text: [S]. Liquid Egg-White, (Liquid Albumen), Dried Egg-White, (Dried Albumen) or Frozen Egg-White (Frozen Albumen)

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the product obtained by removing the shell and yolk from wholesome fresh eggs or wholesome stored eggs, and

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of dried egg-white, drying the product, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of frozen egg-white, freezing the product; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: contain whipping agents, aluminum sulphate and pH adjusting agents,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of liquid egg-white destined for drying, contain yeast autolysate and may be treated with hydrogen peroxide and catalase, glucose oxidase and catalase or yeast and suitable glucose fermenting bacterial culture,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of liquid egg-white and dried egg-white, contain lipase or pancreatin, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of dried egg-white, contain anti-caking agents.

Section.Label: B.22.037
Section.Text: [S]. Liquid Whole Egg Mix, Dried Whole Egg Mix, Frozen Whole Egg Mix, Liquid Yolk Mix, Dried Yolk Mix or Frozen Yolk Mix

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the product obtained by adding salt, sweetening agent or both to Liquid Whole Egg, Dried Whole Egg, Frozen Whole Egg, Liquid Yolk, Dried Yolk or Frozen Yolk; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may, in the case of dried whole egg mix or dried yolk mix, contain anti-caking agents.

Subsection.Text: No person shall use a common name referred to in sections B.22.034 to B.22.037 for an egg product that has been subjected to a process, other than a process referred to in those sections, if that process results in a decrease in the amount of a vitamin or mineral nutrient that before processing was present in 100 g of the egg product in an amount equal to at least 10 per cent of the weighted recommended nutrient intake, unless the amount of the vitamin or mineral nutrient is restored to the amount that was present before processing.

Notwithstanding sections D.01.009, D.01.011 and D.02.009, a person may add any vitamin or mineral nutrient referred to in column II of item 27 of the table to section D.03.002 to any egg product referred to in sections B.22.034 to B.22.037 to restore the vitamin or mineral nutrient to the amount that was present in the egg product before processing.
In this section, weighted recommended nutrient intake has the same meaning as in subsection D.01.001(1).

Section.Label: B.23.001
Section.Text: No person shall sell any food in a package that may yield to its contents any substance that may be injurious to the health of a consumer of the food.

Section.Label: B.23.002
Section.Text: Subject to section B.23.003 no person shall sell any food in a package that has been manufactured from a polyvinyl chloride formulation containing an octyltin chemical.

Section.Label: B.23.003
Section.Text: A person may sell food, other than milk, skim milk, partly skimmed milk, sterilized milk, malt beverages and carbonated non-alcoholic beverage products, in a package that has been manufactured from a polyvinyl chloride formulation containing any or all of the octyltin chemicals, namely, di(n-octyl)tin S,S′-bis(isooctylmercaptoacetate), di(n-octyl)tin maleate polymer and (n-octyl)tin S,S′,S″-tris(isooctylmercaptoacetate) if the proportion of such chemicals, either singly or in combination, does not exceed a total of three per cent of the resin, and the food in contact with the package contains not more than one part per million total octyltin.

Subsection.Text: Di (n-octyl)tin S,S′-bis (isooctylmercaptoacetate) shall be the octyltin chemical made from di (n-octyl)tin dichloride and shall contain 15.1 to 16.4 per cent of tin and 8.1 to 8.9 per cent of mercapto sulfur.

For the purposes of this Division, di (n-octyl)tin dichloride shall be the chemical having an organotin composition of not less than 95 per cent di (n-octyl)tin dichloride and shall contain no more than

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: five per cent total of n-octyltin trichloride or tri(n-octyl)tin chloride or both;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 0.2 per cent total of other eight (8) carbon isomeric alkyltin derivatives; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: 0.1 per cent total of the higher and lower homologous alkyltin derivatives.

Section.Label: B.23.005
Section.Text: Di(n-octyl)tin maleate polymer shall be the octyltin chemical made from di(n-octyl)tin dichloride and shall have the formula ((C8H17)2 SnC4H2O4)n (where n is between 2 and 4 inclusive), and a saponification number of 225 to 255, and shall contain 25.2 to 26.6 per cent of tin.

Subsection.Text: (n-octyl)tin S,S′,S″-tris (isooctylmercaptoacetate), being an octyltin chemical having the formula n-C8H17Sn(SCH2CO2C8H17)3, shall be made from (n-octyl)tin trichloride and shall contain 13.4 to 14.8 per cent of tin and 10.9 to 11.9 per cent of mercapto sulfur.
For the purposes of this Division, (n-octyl)tin trichloride shall be the chemical having an organotin composition of not less than 95 per cent (n-octyl)tin trichloride and shall contain not more than

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: five per cent total of di(n-octyl)tin dichloride, tri(n-octyl)tin chloride or the higher (more than eight (8) carbons) alkyltin chlorides or any combination of the foregoing;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 0.2 per cent total of alkyltin derivatives; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: 0.1 per cent of the lower (less than eight carbons) homologous alkyltin derivatives.

Section.Label: B.23.007
Section.Text: No person shall sell a food in a package than may yield to its contents any amount of vinyl chloride, as determined by official method, FO-40, Determination of Vinyl Chloride in Food, October 15, 1981, in respect of that food.

Section.Label: B.23.008
Section.Text: No person shall sell a food in a package that may yield to its contents any amount of acrylonitrile as determined by official method FO-41, Determination of Acrylonitrile in Food, February 16, 1982, in respect of that food.

Section.Label: B.24.001
Section.Text: In this Division,

Definition.Text: expiration date means, in respect of a formulated liquid diet, a food represented for use in a very low-energy diet, a meal replacement or a nutritional supplement, the date

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: after which the manufacturer does not recommend that it be consumed, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: up to which it maintains its microbiological and physical stability and the nutrient content declared on the label; (date limite d’utilisation)

Definition.Text: food for special dietary use means food that has been specially processed or formulated to meet the particular requirements of a person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in whom a physical or physiological condition exists as a result of a disease, disorder or injury, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for whom a particular effect, including but not limited to weight loss, is to be obtained by a controlled intake of foods; (aliment à usage diététique spécial)

Definition.Text: formulated liquid diet means a food that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is sold for consumption in liquid form, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is sold or represented as a nutritionally complete diet for oral or tube feeding of a person described in paragraph (a) of the definition “food for special dietary use”; (préparation pour régime liquide)

Definition.Text: hospital means a facility

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that is licensed, approved or designated as a hospital by a province, in accordance with the laws of the province, to provide care or treatment to persons suffering from any form of disease or illness, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that is owned or operated by the government of Canada or of a province and that provides health services; (hôpital)

Definition.Text: major change means, in respect of a food that is represented for use in a very low energy diet, any change in any of the following, where the manufacturer’s experience or generally accepted theory would predict an adverse effect on the levels or availability of nutrients in, the microbiological or chemical safety of or the safe use of the food:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an ingredient or the amount of an ingredient in the food,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacturing process or the packaging of the food, or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the directions for the preparation and use of the food; (changement majeur)

Definition.Text: pharmacist means a person who is registered and entitled under the laws of a province to practise pharmacy and who is practising pharmacy under those laws in that province; (pharmacien)
physician means a person who is registered and entitled under the laws of a province to practise medicine and who is practicing medicine under those laws in that province; (médecin)
target body weight means the anticipated body weight at the end of the weight reduction diet, as determined by the physician before the weight reduction diet begins; (poids corporel cible)
very low energy diet means a diet for weight reduction that provides less than 900 kilocalories per day when followed as directed. (régime à très faible teneur en énergie)

Subsection.Text: No person shall label, package, sell or advertise a food in a manner likely to create an impression that it is a food for special dietary use unless the food is

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a formulated liquid diet that meets the requirements contained in sections B.24.101 and B.24.102;

Paragraph.Label: (f.1)
Paragraph.Text: a meal replacement for special dietary use that meets the requirements contained in section B.24.200;

Paragraph.Label: (f.2)
Paragraph.Text: a nutritional supplement that meets the requirements contained in section B.24.201;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a gluten-free food that meets the requirements contained in section B.24.018;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: represented for protein-restricted diets;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: represented for low (naming the amino acid) diets; or

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: a food represented for use in a very low energy diet, where the food meets the requirements contained in section B.24.303.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (1), a person may label, package, sell or advertise a food in a manner likely to create an impression that it is a food for special dietary use if its label carries a statement or claim set out in column 4 of the table following section B.01.513, in accordance with section B.01.503, in respect of any of the following subjects set out in column 1:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: “free of energy”, set out in item 1;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: “low in energy”, set out in item 2;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: “free of sodium or salt”, set out in item 31;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: “low in sodium or salt”, set out in item 32; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: “free of sugars”, set out in item 37.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply to infant formulas.
No person shall label, package, sell or advertise a food in a manner likely to create an impression that it is for use in a weight reduction diet unless that food is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a meal replacement that meets the compositional requirements contained in section B.24.200;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a prepackaged meal;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a food sold by a weight reduction clinic to clients of the clinic for use in a weight reduction program supervised by the staff of the clinic; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a food represented for use in a very low-energy diet that meets the compositional requirements contained in section B.24.303.

Subsection.Text: Except as otherwise permitted by these Regulations, no person shall label, package, sell or advertise a food as “dietetic” or “diet”, or use those words as part of the brand name of the food, unless its label carries a statement or claim set out in column 4 of the table following section B.01.513, in accordance with section B.01.503, in respect of any of the following subjects set out in column 1:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: “free of energy”, set out in item 1;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: “low in energy”, set out in item 2;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: “reduced in energy”, set out in item 3;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: “lower in energy”, set out in item 4; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: “free of sugars”, set out in item 37.

Subsection.Text: Where the manufacturer of a formulated liquid diet, a meal replacement or a food represented for use in a very low energy diet is requested in writing by the Mnister to submit, on or before a specified day, evidence with respect to that product, the manufacturer shall make no further sales of that product after that day unless the manufacturer has submitted the evidence requested.
If the Minister determines that the evidence submitted by a manufacturer under subsection (1) is not sufficient, he or she shall so notify the manufacturer in writing.

Where, pursuant to subsection (2), a manufacturer is notified that the evidence with respect to a formulated liquid diet, a meal replacement or a food represented for use in a very low energy diet is not sufficient, the manufacturer shall make no further sales of that product unless the manufacturer submits further evidence and is notified in writing by the Minister that the further evidence is sufficient.

A reference in this section to evidence with respect to a formulated liquid diet, a meal replacement or a food represented for use in a very low energy diet means evidence to establish that the food is nutritionally adequate to be used as the sole source of nutrition in meeting the nutritional needs of a person for whom it is intended, when the food is consumed in accordance with the directions for use.

Section.Label: B.24.018
Section.Text: It is prohibited to label, package, sell or advertise a food in a manner likely to create an impression that it is a gluten-free food if the food contains any gluten protein or modified gluten protein, including any gluten protein fraction, referred to in the definition gluten in subsection B.01.010.1(1).

Section.Label: B.24.100
Section.Text: No person shall advertise a formulated liquid diet to the general public.

Section.Label: B.24.101
Section.Text: No person shall sell a formulated liquid diet unless the food

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if sold ready to serve, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if not sold ready to serve, when diluted with water, milk, or water and milk,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: is a complete substitute for the total diet in meeting the nutritional requirements of a person.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (4), a formulated liquid diet shall contain, when ready to serve,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: either

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 20 grams of protein of nutritional quality equivalent to casein, as determined by official method FO-1, Determination of Protein Rating, October 15, 1981, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: such an amount and quality of protein, including those proteins to which amino acids are added, that, when the quality of the protein is expressed as a fraction of the quality of casein,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the fraction will not be less than 85/100, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the result obtained by multiplying the fraction by the gram weight of the protein will not be less than 20; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not less than one gram linoleic acid in the form of a glyceride.

Subsection.Text: Notwithstanding sections D.01.009, D.01.011 and D.02.009, a formulated liquid diet shall contain, when ready to serve, the vitamins and minerals named in Column I of the table to this section in amounts,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: where the recommended intake of the food is 2,500 kilocalories per day or less, not less than the amounts set out in Column II and not more than the amounts, if any, set out in Column III of that table opposite those vitamins and minerals; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where the recommended intake of the food is greater than 2,500 kilocalories per day, not less than the amounts set out in Column IV and not more than the amounts, if any, set out in Column V of the table opposite those vitamins and minerals.

Subsection.Text: The amounts of the nutrients specified in paragraphs (1)(a) and (b) and subsection (2) shall be calculated

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: per 1,000 available kilocalories, where the recommended intake of the food is 2,500 kilocalories per day or less; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: per 1,500 available kilocalories, where recommended intake of the food is greater than 2,500 kilocalories per day.

Subsection.Text: Paragraph (1)(a) does not apply to a formulated liquid diet represented as being for a protein restricted diet or a low (named amino acid) diet.

Section.Label: B.24.103
Section.Text: The label of a formulated liquid diet shall carry the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a statement that the food is intended to be consumed orally or by tube feeding;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the energy value of the food, expressed in Calories

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: per 100 grams or per 100 millilitres of the food as offered for sale, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: per unit of ready-to-serve food;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the content in the food of protein or protein equivalent, fat, linoleic acid, available carbohydrate and, where present, crude fibre, expressed in grams

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: per 100 grams or per 100 millilitres of the food as offered for sale, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: per unit of ready-to-serve food;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the content of vitamins and mineral nutrients that are listed in the table to section B.24.102, expressed in International Units or milligrams

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: per 100 grams or per 100 millilitres of the food as offered for sale, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: per unit of ready-to-serve food;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the content of any vitamin or mineral nutrient that is not listed in the table to section B.24.102, expressed in milligrams

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: per 100 grams or per 100 millilitres of the food as offered for sale, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: per unit of ready-to-serve food;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: complete directions for the preparation and use of the food and for its storage after the container has been opened; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the expiration date of the formulated liquid diet.

Heading.TitleText: Meal Replacements, Nutritional Supplements, Prepackaged Meals and Foods Sold by Weight Reduction Clinics

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell or advertise a meal replacement unless, when in a ready-to-serve form or when prepared according to directions for use, with water, milk, partially skim milk or skim milk, or a combination thereof, it meets the following requirements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the meal replacement provides a minimum of 225 kcal or 945 kJ per serving;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 15 per cent and not more than 40 per cent of the energy available from the meal replacement is derived from its protein content, except that a meal replacement for use in a weight reduction diet shall derive not less than 20 per cent of its available energy from its protein content;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: subject to subsection (2), not more than 35 per cent of the energy available from the meal replacement is derived from its fat content;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 3.0 per cent of the energy available from the meal replacement is derived from linoleic acid in the form of a glyceride and not less than 0.5 per cent of the energy available from the meal replacement is derived from n-3 linolenic acid in the form of a glyceride, and the ratio of linoleic acid to n-3 linolenic acid is not less than 4 to 1 and not more than 10 to 1;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the proteins present in the meal replacement are

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: of a nutritional quality equivalent to that of casein, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: of a nutritional quality and in an amount sufficient to yield a result of not less than 15 per cent, or not less than 20 per cent in the case of a meal replacement for use in a weight reduction diet, when the nutritional quality of those proteins is divided by the nutritional quality of casein and multiplied by the percentage of energy available from the proteins present in the meal replacement; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: each serving of the meal replacement contains each vitamin and mineral nutrient listed in column I of the table to this section

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subsection (3), in an amount not less than the minimum amount shown for that vitamin or mineral nutrient in column II of the table, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subsections (4) and (5), in an amount that, including overage, is not more than the maximum amount shown for that vitamin or mineral nutrient in column III of the table.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell or advertise a meal replacement that is represented as a replacement for all daily meals unless, when in a ready-to-serve form or when prepared according to directions for use, with water, milk, partially skim milk or skim milk, or a combination thereof, it meets the following requirements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not more than 30 per cent of the energy available from the meal replacement is derived from its fat content; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not more than 10 per cent of the energy available from the meal replacement is derived from its saturated fatty acid content.

Subsection.Text: The minimum amount required under subparagraph (1)(f)(i) for selenium, chromium or molybdenum does not apply in respect of a meal replacement that is not represented as a replacement for all daily meals and that does not contain added selenium, chromium or molybdenum, as the case may be.
A vitamin or mineral nutrient that is not an added ingredient in the meal replacement shall not be taken into account for the purposes of subparagraph (1)(f)(ii).
The maximum amount shown for vitamin C in column III of the table to this section does not include overage.
No person shall sell or advertise a nutritional supplement that contains less than 225 kcal or 945 kJ per serving, unless it meets the following requirements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the nutritional supplement contains at least 150 kcal or 630 kJ per serving;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 15 per cent and no more than 40 per cent of the energy available from the nutritional supplement is derived from its protein content;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the proteins present in the nutritional supplement are

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: of a nutritional quality equivalent to that of casein, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: of a nutritional quality and in an amount sufficient to yield a result of not less than 15 per cent when the nutritional quality of those proteins is divided by the nutritional quality of casein and multiplied by the percentage of energy available from the proteins present in the nutritional supplement; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the nutritional supplement contains, per 100 kcal or 420 kJ, each vitamin and mineral nutrient listed in column I of the table to this section

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subsection (3), in an amount not less than the minimum amount shown for that vitamin or mineral nutrient in column II of the table, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subsections (4) and (5), in an amount that, including overage, is not more than the maximum amount shown for that vitamin or mineral nutrient in column III of the table.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell or advertise a nutritional supplement that provides 225 kcal or 945 kJ, or more, per serving unless, when in a ready-to-serve form or when prepared according to directions for use, with water, milk, partially skim milk, skim milk, or a combination thereof, it meets the following requirements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the nutritional supplement provides at least 225 kcal or 945 kJ per serving;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not more than 35 per cent of the energy available from the nutritional supplement is derived from its fat content;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 3.0 per cent of the energy available from the nutritional supplement is derived from linoleic acid in the form of a glyceride and not less than 0.5 per cent of the energy available from the nutritional supplement is derived from n-3 linolenic acid in the form of a glyceride, and the ratio of linoleic acid to n-3 linolenic acid is not less than 4 to 1 and not more than 10 to 1;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 15 per cent and not more than 40 per cent of the energy available from the nutritional supplement is derived from its protein content;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the proteins present in the nutritional supplement are

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: of a nutritional quality equivalent to that of casein, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: of a nutritional quality and in an amount sufficient to yield a result of not less than 15 per cent when the nutritional quality of those proteins is divided by the nutritional quality of casein and multiplied by the percentage of energy available from the proteins present in the nutritional supplement; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the nutritional supplement contains, per 100 kcal or 420 kJ, each vitamin and mineral nutrient listed in column I of the table to this section

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subsection (3), in an amount not less than the minimum amount shown for that vitamin or mineral nutrient in column II of the table, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: subject to subsections (4) and (5), in an amount that, including overage, is not more than the maximum amount shown for that vitamin or mineral nutrient in column III of the table.

Subsection.Text: The minimum amount required under subparagraph (1)(d)(i) or (2)(f)(i) for selenium, chromium or molybdenum does not apply in respect of a nutritional supplement that does not contain added selenium, chromium or molybdenum, as the case may be.
A vitamin or mineral nutrient that is not an added ingredient in the nutritional supplement shall not be taken into account for the purposes of subparagraphs (1)(d)(ii) and (2)(f)(ii).
The maximum amount shown for vitamin C in column III of the table to this section does not include overage.

row.entry: Minimum Amount per Available 100 Kcal or 420 KJ
Maximum Amount per Available 100 Kcal or 420 KJ

Section.Label: B.24.202
Section.Text: The label of a meal replacement or nutritional supplement shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: show the following information per serving of stated size and per stated quantity of food, when prepared according to the directions for use:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the energy value of the food, expressed in Calories (Calories or Cal) and kilojoules (kilojoules or kJ),

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the protein, fat, linoleic acid, n-3 linolenic acid, saturated fatty acid and carbohydrate contents of the food, expressed in grams,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the vitamin A, vitamin D, vitamin E, vitamin C, thiamin or vitamin B1, riboflavin or vitamin B2, niacin, vitamin B6, vitamin B12, folate and pantothenic acid or pantothenate contents of the food, expressed

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: in the case of a meal replacement, as a percentage of the daily value specified in column 4 of Part 2 of the Table of Daily Values for that vitamin, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: in the case of a nutritional supplement, in the applicable unit referred to in subsection D.01.003(1),

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the calcium, phosphorus, iron, iodide, magnesium and zinc contents of the food, expressed

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: in the case of a meal replacement, as a percentage of the daily value specified in column 4 of Part 2 of the Table of Daily Values, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: in the case of a nutritional supplement, in milligrams for calcium, phosphorus, iron, magnesium and zinc and in micrograms for iodide,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the copper, potassium, sodium and manganese contents of the food, expressed in milligrams, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the biotin, selenium, chromium and molybdenum contents of the food, expressed in micrograms;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a meal replacement or a nutritional supplement to which milk, partially skim milk or skim milk is to be added, carry a statement that the nutrient content of the food has been determined taking into consideration the milk, partially skim milk or skim milk that will be added according to the directions for use;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a meal replacement that is sold or advertised as a replacement for all daily meals in a weight reduction diet, include directions for use that would result in a daily energy intake of at least 900 kcal or 3 780 kJ;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: include the expiration date of the meal replacement or nutritional supplement;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a meal replacement for use in a weight reduction diet, carry the statement “USEFUL IN WEIGHT REDUCTION ONLY AS PART OF AN ENERGY-REDUCED DIET / UTILE POUR PERDRE DU POIDS SEULEMENT DANS LE CADRE D’UN RÉGIME À TENEUR RÉDUITE EN ÉNERGIE” prominently displayed on the principal display panel; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a meal replacement for use in a weight reduction diet that is not represented as a replacement for all daily meals in a diet, include the information required under section B.24.204.

Section.Label: B.24.203
Section.Text: The label of a prepackaged meal for use in a weight reduction diet or of a food to be sold in a weight reduction clinic shall

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: carry the statement “USEFUL IN WEIGHT REDUCTION ONLY AS PART OF AN ENERGY-REDUCED DIET / UTILE POUR PERDRE DU POIDS SEULEMENT DANS LE CADRE D’UN RÉGIME À TENEUR RÉDUITE EN ÉNERGIE” prominently displayed on the principal display panel; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: include the information required under section B.24.204.

Section.Label: B.24.204
Section.Text: The label of a prepackaged meal, or of a meal replacement other than a meal replacement represented as a replacement for all daily meals in a diet, that is packaged, sold or advertised for use in a weight reduction diet, or of a food to be sold in a weight reduction clinic, shall include, in the directions for use, a sample seven-day menu in which the prepackaged meal, meal replacement or food is used and which meets the following requirements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: each daily meal includes a minimum of one serving, as described in Canada’s Food Guide to Healthy Eating, published in 1992 by the Department of Supply and Services by authority of the Minister of National Health and Welfare, of one food from each of the following groups:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: milk, milk products or their alternatives,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: meat and meat alternatives,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: bread and grain products, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: vegetables and fruit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the daily energy intake provided for is not less than 1 200 kcal or 5 040 kJ;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: not more than 30 per cent of the total daily energy intake of the seven-day menu is derived from its fat content and not more than 10 per cent of the total daily energy intake of the menu is derived from its saturated fatty acid content;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the mean daily intake of each nutrient listed in column I of the table to this section is not less than the amount shown in column II, in the case of a menu recommended for men, or in column III, in the case of a menu recommended for women; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the menu does not include any reference to vitamin or mineral supplements.

Subsection.Text: No person shall label, package, sell or advertise a prepackaged meal or meal replacement for use in a weight reduction diet, or a food to be sold in a weight reduction clinic, in a manner likely to create an impression that consumption of a vitamin or mineral supplement must be part of a weight reduction diet.

No person shall, on a label of or in an advertisement for a prepackaged meal or meal replacement for use in a weight reduction diet, or a food to be sold in a weight reduction clinic, make any direct or indirect reference to a vitamin or mineral supplement.

Every person who advertises a prepackaged meal or meal replacement for use in a weight reduction diet, or a food to be sold in a weight reduction clinic, shall include in the advertisement the statement “USEFUL IN WEIGHT REDUCTION ONLY AS PART OF AN ENERGY-REDUCED DIET / UTILE POUR PERDRE DU POIDS SEULEMENT DANS LE CADRE D’UN RÉGIME À TENEUR RÉDUITE EN ÉNERGIE”.

Heading.TitleText: Foods Represented for Use in Very Low Energy Diets

Section.Label: B.24.300
Section.Text: No person shall advertise to the general public a food represented for use in a very low energy diet.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell, without a written order from a physician, a food represented for use in a very low energy diet.
Notwithstanding subsection (1), a person may sell, without a written order from a physician, a food represented for use in a very low energy diet to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a physician;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a wholesale druggist;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a pharmacist; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a hospital.

Subsection.Text: No person other than a pharmacist shall sell to the general public a food represented for use in a very low energy diet.

Section.Label: B.24.302
Section.Text: A pharmacist shall retain the written order of a physician for a food represented for use in a very low energy diet for at least two years after the date on which the order is filled.

Subsection.Text: A food represented for use in a very low energy diet, whether ready to serve or diluted with water according to the manufacturer’s directions, shall provide, per daily allowance recommended by the manufacturer

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: either

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 60 g of protein of a nutritional quality equivalent to that of casein, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: such an amount and quality of protein that, when the quality of the protein is expressed as a fraction of the quality of casein,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the fraction is not less than 85/100, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the product obtained by multiplying the fraction by the gram weight of the protein is not less than 60;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: each vitamin or mineral nutrient named in column I of an item of the table to this subsection, in an amount not less than the minimum amount per day set out in column II of that item; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any nutritive substance added to the food other than those referred to in paragraph (a) or (b), in an amount that is appropriate for the purpose of the substance in the food as determined from clinical trials.

Subsection.Text: Notwithstanding paragraph (1)(a), a food represented for use in a very low energy diet shall be accompanied by directions for use that when followed would result in the daily intake by a person of at least 1.2 g of protein per kilogram target body weight.

Section.Label: B.24.304
Section.Text: The label of a food represented for use in a very low energy diet shall carry the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the energy value of the food, expressed in Calories (Calories or Cal) and kilojoules (kilojoules or kJ) per 100 g or 100 mL of the food as offered for sale and per unit of ready-to-serve food;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the content in the food of protein, fat, carbohydrate and, where present, fibre expressed in grams per 100 g or 100 mL of the food as offered for sale and per unit of ready-to-serve food;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the content in the food of all those vitamins and mineral nutrients that are listed in the table to subsection B.24.303(1) expressed in milligrams, in the case of vitamin A expressed in retinol equivalents (RE), per 100 g or 100 mL of the food as offered for sale and per unit of ready-to-serve food;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the content in the food of any other nutritive substance added to the food in an amount described in paragraph B.24.303(1)(c), expressed in milligrams or in grams per 100 g or 100 mL of the food as offered for sale and per unit of ready-to-serve food;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the statement “USE ONLY UNDER MEDICAL SUPERVISION” prominently displayed on the principal display panel;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: directions for use of the food, including

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a statement of the rationale for the use of the food,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: criteria to be used for the selection of the persons to whom the food may be prescribed,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: instructions for consultation with and evaluation of the patient and patient follow-up, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a statement concerning adequate precautions and contra-indications;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: directions for the preparation of the food, and storage instructions for the food before and after the container has been opened; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the expiration date of the food.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell or advertise for sale a food represented for use in a very low energy diet unless the manufacturer, at least 90 days before the sale or advertisement, notifies the Minister in writing of the intention to sell the food or advertise the food for sale.
The notification referred to in subsection (1) shall be signed by the manufacturer and shall include, in respect of the food represented for use in a low energy diet, the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name under which the food is to be sold or advertised for sale;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the principal place of business of the manufacturer;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of each establishment in which the food is manufactured;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a list of the ingredients of the food, stated quantitatively;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the specifications for nutrient, microbiological and physical quality for each ingredient and for the food;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: details of quality control procedures respecting the testing of the ingredients and of the food;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: details of the manufacturing process and quality control procedures used throughout the process;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the results of tests carried out to determine the expiration date of the food;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the evidence relied on to establish that the food meets the nutritional requirements, other than energy requirements, of a person for whom it is intended, when the food is consumed in accordance with the directions for use;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the type of packaging to be used;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: directions for use;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: the written text of all labels, including package inserts, to be used in connection with the food; and

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: the name and title of the person who signed the notification and the date of signature.

Subsection.Text: Notwithstanding subsection (1), a person may sell or advertise for sale a food represented for use in a very low energy diet, if the Minister, after having been notified by the manufacturer pursuant to that subsection, has informed the manufacturer in writing that the notification meets the requirements of subsection (2).

No person shall sell or advertise for sale a food represented for use in a very low energy diet that has undergone a major change, unless the manufacturer, at least 90 days before the sale or advertisement, notifies the Minister in writing of the intention to sell or advertise for sale the food that has undergone the major change.

The notification referred to in subsection (1) shall be signed by the manufacturer and shall include, in respect of the food represented for use in a very low energy diet that has undergone a major change, the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name under which the food is to be sold or advertised for sale;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the principal place of business of the manufacturer;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the major change;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the evidence relied on to establish that the food meets the nutritional requirements, other than energy requirements, of a person for whom it is intended, when the food is consumed in accordance with the directions for use;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the evidence relied on to establish that the major change has no adverse effect on the food or its use;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the written text of all labels, including package inserts, to be used in connection with the food; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the name and title of the person who signed the notification and the date of signature.

Subsection.Text: Notwithstanding subsection (1), a person may sell or advertise for sale a food represented for use in a very low energy diet that has undergone a major change, if the Minister, after having been notified by the manufacturer pursuant to that subsection, has informed the manufacturer in writing that the notification meets the requirements of subsection (2).

Section.Label: B.25.001
Section.Text: In this Division,

Definition.Text: expiration date means, in respect of a human milk substitute, the date

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: after which the manufacturer does not recommend that it be consumed, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: up to which it maintains its microbiological and physical stability and the nutrient content declared on the label; (date limite d’utilisation)

Definition.Text: human milk substitute means any food that is represented

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for use as a partial or total replacement for human milk and intended for consumption by infants, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for use as an ingredient in a food referred to in paragraph (a); (succédané de lait humain)

Definition.Text: infant means a person who is under the age of one year; (bébé)
infant food means a food that is represented for consumption by infants; (aliment pour bébés)

junior (naming a food) means the named food where it contains particles of a size to encourage chewing by infants, but may be readily swallowed by infants without chewing; ((nom d’un aliment) pour enfants en bas âge)
