major change means, in respect of a human milk substitute, any change of an ingredient, the amount of an ingredient or the processing or packaging of the human milk substitute where the manufacturer’s experience or generally accepted theory would predict an adverse effect on the levels or availability of nutrients in, or the microbiological or chemical safety of, the human milk substitute; (changement majeur)
new human milk substitute means a human milk substitute that is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: manufactured for the first time,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: sold in Canada for the first time, or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: manufactured by a person who manufactures it for the first time; (succédané de lait humain nouveau)

Definition.Text: strained (naming a food) means the named food where it is of a generally uniform particle size that does not require and does not encourage chewing by infants before being swallowed. ((nom d’un aliment) en purée ou tamisé)

Section.Label: B.25.002
Section.Text: No person shall sell or advertise for sale an infant food that is set out in Column I of an item of Table I to this Division and contains more than the amount of sodium set out in Column II of that item.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), no person shall sell infant food that contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: strained fruit,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: fruit juice,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: fruit drink, or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: cereal,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: if sodium chloride has been added to that food.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply to strained desserts containing any of the foods mentioned in paragraphs (1)(a) to (d).

Heading.TitleText: Human Milk Substitutes and Food Containing Human Milk Substitutes

Section.Label: B.25.045
Section.Text: The common name of a human milk substitute or a new human milk substitute shall be infant formula. (préparation pour nourrissons)

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell or advertise for sale a new human milk substitute unless the manufacturer, at least 90 days before the sale or advertisement, notifies the Minister in writing of the intention to sell or advertise for sale the new human milk substitute.
The notification referred to in subsection (1) shall be signed and shall include, in respect of the new human milk substitute, the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name under which it will be sold or advertised for sale;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and the address of the principal place of business of the manufacturer;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the names and addresses of each establishment in which it is manufactured;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a list of all of its ingredients, stated quantitatively;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the specifications for nutrient, microbiological and physical quality for the ingredients and for the new human milk substitute;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: details of quality control procedures respecting the testing of the ingredients and of the new human milk substitute;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: details of the manufacturing process and quality control procedures used throughout the process;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the results of tests carried out to determine the expiration date of the new human milk substitute;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the evidence relied on to establish that the new human milk substitute is nutritionally adequate to promote acceptable growth and development in infants when consumed in accordance with the directions for use;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the type of packaging to be used;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: directions for use;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: the written text of all labels, including package inserts, to be used in connection with the new human milk substitute; and

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: the name and title of the person who signed the notification and the date of signature.

Subsection.Text: Notwithstanding subsection (1), a person may sell or advertise for sale a new human milk substitute if the manufacturer has notified the Minister pursuant to subsection (1) and is informed in writing by the Minister that the notification is satisfactory.

Section.Label: B.25.047
Section.Text: Sections B.25.051 to B.25.059 apply in respect of new human milk substitutes.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell or advertise for sale a human milk substitute that has undergone a major change unless the manufacturer of the human milk substitute, at least 90 days before the sale or advertisement, notifies the Minister in writing of the intention to sell or advertise for sale the human milk substitute.
The notification referred to in subsection (1) shall be signed and shall include, in respect of the human milk substitute, the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name under which it will be sold or advertised for sale;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and the address of the principal place of business of the manufacturer;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the major change;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the evidence relied on to establish that the human milk substitute is nutritionally adequate to promote acceptable growth and development in infants when consumed in accordance with the directions for use;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the evidence relied on to establish that the major change has had no adverse effect on the human milk substitute;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the written text of all labels, including package inserts, to be used in connection with the human milk substitute; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the name and title of the person who signed the notification and the date of signature.

Subsection.Text: Notwithstanding subsection (1), a person may sell or advertise for sale a human milk substitute that has undergone a major change if the manufacturer has notified the Minister pursuant to subsection (1) and is informed in writing by the Minister that the notification is satisfactory.

No person shall sell or advertise for sale a human milk substitute unless, when prepared according to directions for use, it complies with the provisions of this Division respecting human milk substitutes.

No person shall sell or advertise for sale a food that is represented as containing a human milk substitute unless the human milk substitute portion of the food complies with the nutritional requirements set out in this Division for human milk substitutes.

No person shall sell or advertise for sale a human milk substitute unless it meets the nutritional requirements of infants with normal or special dietary needs and it is of such a consistency that, when ready-to-serve, it passes freely through a nursing bottle nipple.

No person shall sell or advertise for sale a food that is represented as containing a human milk substitute unless the human milk substitute portion of the food meets the nutritional requirements of infants with normal or special dietary needs.

No person shall sell or advertise for sale a human milk substitute that requires, when prepared according to directions for use, the addition of a nutritive substance, other than water or a source of carbohydrate or both.

No person shall sell or advertise for sale a food represented as containing a human milk substitute that requires, when prepared according to directions for use, the addition of a nutritive substance other than water.
Except as otherwise provided in this Division, no person shall sell or advertise for sale a human milk substitute unless it contains, when prepared according to directions for use,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: per 100 available kilocalories

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 3.3 and not more than 6.0 grams of fat,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 500 milligrams of linoleic acid in the form of a glyceride,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than 1 kilocalorie from C22 Monoenoic Fatty Acids,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 1.8 and not more than 4.0 grams of protein,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 1.8 grams of protein of nutritional quality equivalent to casein, or such an amount and quality of protein, including those proteins to which amino acids are added, that, when the quality of the protein is expressed as a fraction of the quality of casein,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the fraction will not be less than 85/100, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the product obtained by multiplying the fraction by the gram weight of the protein will not be less than 1.8,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: notwithstanding sections D.01.010, D.01.011 and D.02.009, the vitamin and mineral nutrient set out in Column I of an item of Table II to this Division in an amount not less than the amount set out in Column II of that item and not more than the amount set out in Column III of that item, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 12 milligrams of choline; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a ratio of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: alpha-tocopherol to linoleic acid of not less than 0.6 International Units to one gram,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: calcium to phosphorus of not less than 1.2 grams to one gram and not more than 2.0 grams to one gram, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: vitamin B6 to protein of not less than 15 micrograms to one gram.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell or advertise for sale a food that is represented as containing a human milk substitute unless the human milk substitute portion of the food complies with subsection (1).
Subparagraph B.25.054(1)(a)(i) does not apply to a human milk substitute represented as being for a fat-modified diet.

Subparagraph B.25.054(1)(a)(iv), except that portion thereof that prescribes the maximum amount of protein, and subparagraph B.25.054(1)(a)(v) do not apply to a human milk substitute represented as being for a low (naming the amino acid) diet.

All that portion of subparagraph B.25.054(1)(a)(vi) that prescribes the minimum amounts of vitamin D, calcium and phosphorus and subparagraph B.25.054(1)(b)(ii) do not apply to a human milk substitute represented as being for a low (naming the mineral) diet or a low vitamin D diet or both.

Section.Label: B.25.056
Section.Text: No person shall sell a human milk substitute or a food that is represented as containing a human milk substitute

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that contains an added nutritive substance that is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: normally contained in human milk, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not referred to in paragraph B.25.054(1)(a)

ContinuedParagraph.Text: unless the amount of that substance present per 100 available kilocalories of the human milk substitute or human milk substitute portion of the food, when prepared according to directions for use, is equal to the amount thereof present per 100 available kilocalories of human milk; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that contains added amino acids unless

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the amino acids are required to improve the quality of the protein in the human milk substitute or human milk substitute portion of the food and are present in an amount not exceeding the minimum required for that purpose, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the protein content of the human milk substitute or human milk substitute portion of the food is supplied by isolated amino acids or by protein hydrolysate, or both

ContinuedParagraph.Text: and only the L forms of the amino acids have been added.

Subsection.Text: The label of a human milk substitute shall carry the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the content of protein, fat, available carbohydrate, ash and, where present, crude fibre in the food

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in grams per 100 grams or in grams per 100 millilitres of the human milk substitute as offered for sale, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in grams in a stated quantity of the human milk substitute when ready-to-serve;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the energy value expressed in

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: calories per 100 grams or calories per 100 millilitres of the human milk substitute as offered for sale, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: calories in a stated quantity of the human milk substitute when ready-to-serve;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the quantity of all vitamins and mineral nutrients listed in Table II to this Division

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in International Units or milligrams per 100 grams or in International Units or milligrams per 100 millilitres of the human milk substitute as offered for sale, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in International Units or milligrams in a stated quantity of the human milk substitute when ready-to-serve;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the quantity of choline and of any added nutritive substance normally contained in human milk and not referred to in paragraph B.25.054(1)(a)

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in milligrams or grams per 100 grams, or in milligrams or grams per 100 millilitres, of the human milk substitute as offered for sale, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in milligrams or grams in a stated quantity of the human milk substitute when ready-to-serve;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: adequate directions for the preparation, use and storage of the human milk substitute after the container has been opened; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the expiration date of the human milk substitute.

Subsection.Text: The label of a food that is represented as containing human milk substitute shall carry the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a statement on the principal display panel of the proportion of the human milk substitute contained in the food as offered for sale in close proximity to any claim regarding the presence of the human milk substitute and given equal prominence to such a claim;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the common name of the human milk substitute in the list of ingredients to be followed by a statement of all the components contained in the human milk substitute;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the content of protein, fat, available carbohydrate, ash and, where present, crude fibre contained in the human milk substitute portion of the food, expressed in grams per 100 grams or per 100 millilitres of the human milk substitute portion of the food as offered for sale,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the energy value of the human milk substitute portion of the food expressed in calories per 100 grams or in calories per 100 millilitres of the human milk substitute portion of the food as offered for sale,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of all the vitamins and mineral nutrients set out in Table II to this Division that are contained in the human milk substitute portion of the food in International Units or milligrams per 100 grams or in International Units or milligrams per 100 millilitres of the human milk substitute portion of the food as offered for sale, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of choline and of any added nutritive substance normally contained in human milk and not referred to in paragraph B.25.054(1)(a) contained in the human milk substitute portion of the food in milligrams or grams per 100 grams or in milligrams or grams per 100 millilitres of the human milk substitute portion of the food as offered for sale;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the content of protein, fat, available carbohydrate, ash and, where present, crude fibre in grams per 100 grams or per 100 millilitres of the food as offered for sale and in grams per stated quantity of ready-to-serve food,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the energy value expressed in calories per 100 grams or in calories per 100 millilitres of the food as offered for sale and in grams per a stated quantity of the food when ready-to-serve,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of all vitamins and mineral nutrients set out in Table II to this Division in International Units or milligrams per 100 grams or in International Units or milligrams per 100 millilitres of the food as offered for sale and in International Units or milligrams in a stated quantity of the food when ready-to-serve, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of choline and of any added nutritive substance normally contained in human milk and not referred to in paragraph B.25.054(1)(a) in milligrams or grams per 100 grams or in milligrams or grams per 100 millilitres of the food as offered for sale and in milligrams or grams in a stated quantity of the food when ready-to-serve;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: adequate directions for the preparation, use and storage of the food after the container has been opened; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the expiration date of the food.

Section.Label: B.25.058
Section.Text: Notwithstanding section D.02.005, no person shall make any claim with respect to the iron content of a human milk substitute except as required by paragraph B.25.057(1)(c), unless the human milk substitute contains at least one milligram of iron per 100 available kilocalories.

Section.Label: B.25.059
Section.Text: No person shall, on the label of or in any advertisement for a human milk substitute or a food represented as containing a human milk substitute, make any statement or claim relating to the content in the food of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the percentage of the daily value of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: fat,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: saturated fatty acids and trans fatty acids,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: sodium,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: potassium,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: sugars,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: fibre, or

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: cholesterol; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the number of Calories from

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: fat, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: saturated fatty acids and trans fatty acids.

Subsection.Text: Where the manufacturer of a human milk substitute or of a food that is represented as containing a human milk substitute is requested in writing by the Minister to submit on or before a specified day evidence with respect to the human milk substitute, the manufacturer shall make no further sales of that human milk substitute or food that is represented as containing human milk substitute after that day unless he has submitted the evidence requested.
If the Minister determines that the evidence submitted by a manufacturer under subsection (1) is not sufficient, he or she shall so notify the manufacturer in writing.

Where, pursuant to subsection (2), a manufacturer is notified that the evidence with respect to the human milk substitute is not sufficient, he shall make no further sales of that human milk substitute or of that food that is represented as containing the human milk substitute unless he submits further evidence and is notified in writing by the Minister that the further evidence is sufficient.
In this section, evidence with respect to the human milk substitute means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: evidence that establishes that the human milk substitute is nutritionally adequate to promote acceptable growth and development in infants when consumed in accordance with the directions for use; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the results of tests carried out to determine the expiration date of the human milk substitute.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), no person shall include on the label of a food any representation respecting the consumption of the food by an infant who is less than six months of age.
Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of a human milk substitute or a new human milk substitute.
Subject to subsection (2), no person shall sell a food that is labelled or advertised for consumption by infants if the food contains a food additive.
Subsection (1) does not apply to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: bakery products that are labelled or advertised for consumption by infants;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the following foods that are labelled or advertised for consumption by infants and that contain ascorbic acid:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: fruit purées, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: cereals containing banana;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: infant cereal products that contain lecithin;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: foods that are labelled or advertised for consumption by infants and that contain citric acid;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: infant formula that contains the food additives set out in Tables IV and X to section B.16.100 for use in infant formula;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: infant formula that contains ingredients manufactured with food additives set out in Table V to section B.16.100;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: infant formula that contains concentrated or dried whey products manufactured with liquid whey to which sodium hexametaphosphate has been added;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: infant cereal products that contain amylase in accordance with Table V to section B.16.100;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: infant formula that contains ascorbyl palmitate or tocopherols; or

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: infant formula that contains oils to which ascorbyl palmitate or tocopherols have been added.

table.title: Sodium Content in Infant Foods

row.entry: Total Sodium in Grams per 100 Grams of Food
Junior Meat, Junior Meat Dinners, Junior Dinners, Junior Breakfasts
Strained Meats, Strained Meat Dinners, Strained Dinners, Strained Breakfasts

Section.Label: B.26.001
Section.Text: In this Division, irradiation means treatment with ionizing radiation.

Section.Label: B.26.002
Section.Text: This Division does not apply to foods exposed to ionizing radiation from a measuring instrument used to determine weight, estimate bulk solids, measure the total solids in liquids or perform other inspection procedures.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), no person shall sell a food that has been irradiated.
A food that is set out in column 1 of the table to this Division that has been irradiated may be sold if both of the following requirements are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the ionizing radiation is of a type and from a source set out in column 2 for the purpose of irradiation set out in column 3; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the ionizing radiation that is absorbed by the food is either within the range set out in columns 4 and 5 or, if there is no minimum absorbed dose set out in column 4, is not more than the maximum absorbed dose set out in column 5.

Subsection.Text: A manufacturer who sells a food that has been irradiated shall keep on their premises, for at least two years after the date of the irradiation, a record that contains all of the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the food that was irradiated and the quantity and lot numbers of the food;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the purpose of the irradiation;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the irradiation;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the dose of ionizing radiation that was absorbed by the food;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the type and source of the ionizing radiation;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a statement that indicates whether the food was previously irradiated and, if it was previously irradiated, the information referred to in paragraphs (a) to (e) in respect of that previous irradiation.

Subsection.Text: A person who imports a food for sale in Canada that has been irradiated shall keep on their premises, for at least two years after the date of importation, a record of the information required by subsection (1).

Section.Label: B.26.005
Section.Text: A request that a food be added or a change made to the table to this Division shall be accompanied by a submission to the Minister containing the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the purpose and details of the proposed irradiation — including the type and source of the ionizing radiation — and the proposed number of treatments and the minimum and maximum absorbed doses of the ionizing radiation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: data indicating that the minimum dose of ionizing radiation proposed to be used accomplishes the intended purpose of the irradiation and the maximum dose of ionizing radiation proposed does not exceed the amount required to accomplish the purpose of the irradiation;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: information on the nature of the dosimeter used, the frequency of the dosimetry on the food and data pertaining to the dosimetry and phantoms used to assure that the dosimetry readings reflect the dose absorbed by the food during irradiation;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: data indicating the effects, if any, on the nutritional quality of the food, raw and ready-to-serve, under the proposed conditions of irradiation and any other processes that are combined with the irradiation;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: data establishing that the irradiated food has not been significantly altered in chemical, physical or microbiological characteristics to render the food unfit for human consumption;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: where the Minister so requests, data establishing that the proposed irradiation is safe under the conditions proposed for the irradiation;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the recommended conditions of storage and shipment of the irradiated food including the time, temperature and packaging and a comparison of the recommended conditions for the same food that has not been irradiated;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: details of any other processes to be applied to the food prior to or after the proposed irradiation; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: such other data as the Minister may require to establish that consumers and purchasers of the irradiated food will not be deceived or misled as to the character, value, composition, merit or safety of the irradiated food.

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: 5 MeV in any other case.

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: To reduce microbial load, including pathogens.

Heading.Label: DIVISION 27
Heading.TitleText: Low-Acid Foods Packaged in Hermetically Sealed Containers

Section.Label: B.27.001
Section.Text: In this Division,

Definition.Text: commercially sterile means the condition obtained in a food that has been processed by the application of heat, alone or in combination with other treatments, to render the food free from viable forms of microorganisms, including spores, capable of growing in the food at temperatures at which the food is designed normally to be held during distribution and storage; (stérilité commerciale)
hermetically sealed container means a container designed and intended to be secure against the entry of microorganisms, including spores; (récipient hermétiquement fermé)
low-acid food means a food, other than an alcoholic beverage, where any component of the food has a pH greater than 4.6 and a water activity greater than 0.85; (aliment peu acide)
refrigeration means exposure to a temperature of 4°C or less but does not mean frozen; (réfrigéré)
shipping container means a receptacle, package or wrapper in which containers of food are placed for transportation; (contenant d’expédition)
water activity means the ratio of the water vapour pressure of a food to the vapour pressure of pure water, at the same temperature and pressure. (activité de l’eau)

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell a low-acid food packaged in a hermetically sealed container unless the food is commercially sterile.
Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of a low-acid food packaged in a hermetically sealed container where

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the low-acid food is kept under refrigeration and the statement “Keep Refrigerated” and “Garder réfrigéré” is carried on the principal display panel of the label of its container, as well as on the label of its shipping container; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the low-acid food is kept frozen and the statement “Keep Frozen” and “Garder congelé” is carried on the principal display panel of the label of its container, as well as on the label of its shipping container.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of tomatoes or tomato products packaged in hermetically sealed containers where the tomatoes or tomato products have a pH of 4.7 or less after heat processing.

Section.Label: B.27.003
Section.Text: No person shall sell a low-acid food packaged in a hermetically sealed container where the container

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is swollen;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is not properly sealed; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has any defect that may adversely affect its hermetic seal.

Subsection.Text: Where, in the opinion of the Minister, the sale of a low-acid food packaged in a hermetically sealed container may contravene section B.27.002 or B.27.003, the Minister may, by notice in writing, request that the manufacturer or importer of the food submit, on or before the date specified in the notice, evidence that establishes that the processes used to manufacture, process and package the food rendered and maintained the food commercially sterile.

Where a manufacturer or an importer receives a notice issued pursuant to subsection (1), the manufacturer or importer shall make no further sales of the food on or after the day specified in the notice until he has submitted the evidence requested in that notice.

Where the Minister is of the opinion that the evidence submitted by a manufacturer or importer pursuant to subsection (1) is not sufficient, the Minister shall notify the manufacturer or importer in writing that the evidence is not sufficient.

Where, pursuant to subsection (3), a manufacturer or importer is notified that the evidence he has submitted is not sufficient, the manufacturer or importer shall make no further sales of the food until he submits further evidence and is notified in writing by the Minister that the further evidence is sufficient.

Section.Label: B.27.005
Section.Text: No person shall sell a commercially sterile low-acid food packaged in a hermetically sealed container unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the label or container of the food bears a code or lot number that identifies, in a legible and permanent manner,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the establishment in which the product was rendered commercially sterile, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the day, month and year on which the food was rendered commercially sterile; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the exact meaning of each item in any code or lot number referred to in paragraph (a) is available to an inspector at the establishment or, where the food is imported, from the importer.

Section.Label: B.28.001
Section.Text: The definitions in this section apply in this Division.

Definition.Text: genetically modify means to change the heritable traits of a plant, animal or microorganism by means of intentional manipulation. (modifier génétiquement)

major change means, in respect of a food, a change in the food that, based on the manufacturer’s experience or generally accepted nutritional or food science theory, places the modified food outside the accepted limits of natural variations for that food with regard to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the composition, structure or nutritional quality of the food or its generally recognized physiological effects;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the manner in which the food is metabolized in the body; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the microbiological safety, the chemical safety or the safe use of the food. (changement majeur)

Definition.Text: novel food means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a substance, including a microorganism, that does not have a history of safe use as a food;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a food that has been manufactured, prepared, preserved or packaged by a process that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: has not been previously applied to that food, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: causes the food to undergo a major change; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a food that is derived from a plant, animal or microorganism that has been genetically modified such that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the plant, animal or microorganism exhibits characteristics that were not previously observed in that plant, animal or microorganism,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the plant, animal or microorganism no longer exhibits characteristics that were previously observed in that plant, animal or microorganism, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: one or more characteristics of the plant, animal or microorganism no longer fall within the anticipated range for that plant, animal or microorganism. (aliment nouveau)

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell or advertise for sale a novel food unless the manufacturer or importer of the novel food

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has notified the Minister in writing of their intention to sell or advertise for sale the novel food; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has received a written notice from the Minister under paragraph B.28.003(1)(a) or subsection B.28.003(2).

Subsection.Text: A notification referred to in paragraph (1)(a) shall be signed by the manufacturer or importer, or a person authorized to sign on behalf of the manufacturer or importer, and shall include the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the common name under which the novel food will be sold;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the principal place of business of the manufacturer and, if the address is outside Canada, the name and address of the principal place of business of the importer;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the novel food, together with

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: information respecting its development,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: details of the method by which it is manufactured, prepared, preserved, packaged and stored,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: details of the major change, if any,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: information respecting its intended use and directions for its preparation,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: information respecting its history of use as a food in a country other than Canada, if applicable, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: information relied on to establish that the novel food is safe for consumption;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: information respecting the estimated levels of consumption by consumers of the novel food;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the text of all labels to be used in connection with the novel food; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the name and title of the person who signed the notification and the date of signing.

Subsection.Text: Within 45 days after receiving a notification referred to in paragraph B.28.002(1)(a), the Minister shall review the information included in the notification and

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the information establishes that the novel food is safe for consumption, notify the manufacturer or importer in writing that the information is sufficient; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if additional information of a scientific nature is necessary in order to assess the safety of the novel food, request in writing that the manufacturer or importer submit that information.

Subsection.Text: Within 90 days after receiving the additional information requested under paragraph (1)(b) the Minister shall assess it and, if it establishes that the novel food is safe for consumption, notify the manufacturer or importer in writing that the information is sufficient.
In this Part

Definition.Text: acetaminophen product has the same meaning as in Division 9; (produit d’acétaminophène)
adult standard dosage unit has, with reference to a drug, the same meaning as in Division 9; (dose normale pour adultes)

adverse drug reaction means a noxious and unintended response to a drug, which occurs at doses normally used or tested for the diagnosis, treatment or prevention of a disease or the modification of an organic function; (réaction indésirable à une drogue)

antibiotic means any drug or combination of drugs such as those named in C.01.410 to C.01.592 which is prepared from certain micro-organisms, or which formerly was prepared from micro-organisms but is now made synthetically and which possesses inhibitory action on the growth of other micro-organisms; (antibiotique)
brand name means, with reference to a drug, the name, whether or not including the name of any manufacturer, corporation, partnership or individual, in English or French,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that is assigned to the drug by its manufacturer,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: under which the drug is sold or advertised, and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: that is used to distinguish the drug; (marque nominative)

Definition.Text: case report means a detailed record of all relevant data associated with the use of a drug in a subject; (fiche d’observation)
children’s standard dosage unit has, with reference to a drug, the same meaning as in Division 9; (dose normale pour enfants)
child resistant package means a package that meets the requirements of subsection (2); (emballage protège-enfants)
common name means, with reference to a drug, the name in English or French by which the drug is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: commonly known, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: designated in scientific or technical journals, other than the publications referred to in Schedule B to the Act; (nom usuel)

Definition.Text: discontinue means, in respect of the sale of a drug by the manufacturer to whom a document was issued under subsection C.01.014.2(1) that sets out the drug identification number assigned for the drug, to permanently cease the sale of the drug; (cesser)
expiration date means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a drug in dosage form, the earlier of the following dates, expressed at minimum as a year and month:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the date up to and including which the drug maintains its labelled potency, purity and physical characteristics, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date after which the manufacturer recommends that the drug not be used; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an active ingredient, whichever of the following dates is applicable, expressed at minimum as a year and month:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the retest date, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date after which the manufacturer recommends that the active ingredient not be used; (date limite d’utilisation)

Definition.Text: flavour means a non-medicinal ingredient or combination of non-medicinal ingredients added to a drug solely to produce or mask a particular taste. It does not include an ingredient or combination of ingredients that impart only a sweet taste to the drug; (saveur)
fragrance means a non-medicinal ingredient or combination of non-medicinal ingredients added to a drug to produce or mask a particular odour; (parfum)
immediate container means the receptacle that is in direct contact with a drug; (récipient immédiat)
internal use means ingestion by mouth or application for systemic effect to any part of the body in which the drug comes into contact with mucous membrane; (usage interne)

List A means the document, entitled List of Certain Antimicrobial Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients, that is published by the Government of Canada on its website, as amended from time to time; (Liste A)

List B means the document, entitled List of Certain Veterinary Drugs Which May Be Imported But Not Sold, that is published by the Government of Canada on its website, as amended from time to time; (Liste B)
List C means the document, entitled Veterinary Health Products, that is published by the Government of Canada on its website, as amended from time to time; (Liste C)

List D means the document entitled List of Certain Non-prescription Drugs for Distribution as Samples that is published by the Government of Canada on its website, as amended from time to time; (Liste D)

non-medicinal ingredient means a substance — other than the pharmacologically active drug — that is added during the manufacturing process and that is present in the finished drug product; (ingrédient non médicinal)
official drug means any drug

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for which a standard is provided in these Regulations, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for which no standard is provided in these Regulations but for which a standard is provided in any of the publications mentioned in Schedule B to the Act; (drogue officielle)

Definition.Text: parenteral use means administration of a drug by means of a hypodermic syringe, needle or other instrument through or into the skin or mucous membrane; (usage parentéral)
per cent means per cent by weight unless otherwise stated; (pour cent)
pharmaceutical ink means a non-medicinal ingredient or combination of non-medicinal ingredients used to imprint the drug with marks or symbols; (encre pharmaceutique)
pharmacist means a person who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is registered or otherwise entitled under the laws of a province to practise pharmacy, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is practising pharmacy in that province; (pharmacien)

Definition.Text: pharmacy technician means a person who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is registered or otherwise entitled under the laws of a province to practise as a pharmacy technician; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is practising as a pharmacy technician in that province; (technicien en pharmacie)

Definition.Text: practitioner means a person who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is entitled under the laws of a province to treat patients with a prescription drug, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is practising their profession in that province; (praticien)

Definition.Text: prescription means an order given by a practitioner directing that a stated amount of any drug or mixture of drugs specified therein be dispensed for the person named in the order; (ordonnance)
proper name means, with reference to a drug, the name in English or French

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: assigned to the drug in section C.01.002,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that appears in bold-face type for the drug in these Regulations and, where the drug is dispensed in a form other than that described in this Part, the name of the dispensing form,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: specified in the Canadian licence in the case of drugs included in Schedule C or Schedule D to the Act, or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: assigned in any of the publications mentioned in Schedule B to the Act in the case of drugs not included in paragraph (a), (b) or (c); (nom propre)

Definition.Text: salicylate product has the same meaning as in Division 9; (produit de salicylate)

serious adverse drug reaction means a noxious and unintended response to a drug that occurs at any dose and that requires in-patient hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization, causes congenital malformation, results in persistent or significant disability or incapacity, is life-threatening or results in death; (réaction indésirable grave à une drogue)

serious unexpected adverse drug reaction means a serious adverse drug reaction that is not identified in nature, severity or frequency in the risk information set out on the label of the drug; (réaction indésirable grave et imprévue à une drogue)
teaspoon means, for the purpose of calculation of dosage, a volume of 5 cubic centimetres; (cuillerée à thé)
test group means a group that meets the requirements of subsection (3); (groupe d’essai)

veterinary health product means any of the following drugs that is in dosage form and that is not manufactured, sold or represented for use in the diagnosis, treatment, mitigation or prevention of a disease, disorder or abnormal physical state, or its symptoms:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a substance set out in Column I of Part 1 of List C that is consistent with the descriptive information set out in Columns II to V, or any combination of any substances in which all the medicinal ingredients are substances set out in Column I of Part 1 of that list if that combination is, in respect of each of those substances, consistent with the descriptive information set out in Columns II and III and the descriptive information set out in Columns IV and V that is, within each of those columns, common to those substances;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a homeopathic medicine set out in Column I of Part 2 of List C that is consistent with the descriptive information set out in Columns II to V, or any combination of homeopathic medicines set out in Column I of Part 2 of that list if that combination is, in respect of each of those homeopathic medicines, consistent with the descriptive information set out in Columns II and III and the descriptive information set out in Columns IV and V that is, within each of those columns, common to those homeopathic medicines; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a traditional medicine set out in Column I of Part 3 of List C that is consistent with the descriptive information set out in Columns II to V, or any combination of traditional medicines set out in Column I of Part 3 of that list if that combination is, in respect of each of those traditional medicines, consistent with the descriptive information set out in Columns II and III and the descriptive information set out in Columns IV and V that is, within each of those columns, common to those traditional medicines; (produit de santé animale)

Definition.Text: withdrawal period means the length of time between the last administration of a drug to an animal and the time when tissues or products collected from the treated animal for consumption as food contain a level of residue of the drug that would not likely cause injury to human health. (délai d’attente)

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of the Act, serious adverse drug reaction has the same meaning as in subsection (1).
A child resistant package is a package that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: when tested in accordance with an acceptable method,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a test group comprising children, cannot be opened

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: by at least 85 per cent of those children prior to a demonstration to them of the proper means of opening the package, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: by at least 80 per cent of those children after the demonstration, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a test group comprising adults

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: can be opened by at least 90 per cent of those adults, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: where the package is designed so that, once opened and reclosed, it continues to meet the requirements of subparagraph (i), can be so reclosed by at least 90 per cent of those adults; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: complies with the requirements of one of the following standards, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: Canadian Standards Association Standard CAN/CSA-Z76.1-M90, entitled Recloseable Child-Resistant Packages, published January 1990, as amended from time to time,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: European Standard EN 28317:1992, entitled Child-resistant packaging — Requirements and testing procedures for reclosable packages, as adopted by the European Committee for Standardization on October 30, 1992, recognized by the British Standards Institution, and effective February 15, 1993 and by the Association française de normalisation, and effective December 20, 1992, and which reiterates fully the international standard ISO 8317:1989, as amended from time to time, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: Code of Federal Regulations (United States), Title 16, Section 1700.15, entitled Poison prevention packaging standards, as amended from time to time.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this section, test group means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in relation to children, a group of at least 200 children who

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: are healthy and have no obvious physical or mental disability,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: are between 42 and 51 months of age, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: represent evenly, within plus or minus 10 per cent, each monthly age between 42 and 51 months calculated to the nearest month; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in relation to adults, a group of at least 100 adults who

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: are healthy and have no obvious physical or mental disability,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: are between 18 and 45 years of age, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: represent evenly, within plus or minus 10 per cent, each yearly age between 18 and 45 years calculated to the nearest year.

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of this section, an amendment from time to time to a standard referred to in paragraph (2)(b) becomes effective 18 months after the date designated by the competent authority as the effective date for the amendment.

Section.Label: C.01.002
Section.Text: The Proper Name of a drug shown opposite an item number in the following Table in the column headed “Chemical Names and Synonyms” shall be the name shown opposite that item number in the column headed “Proper Names”.

row.entry: N-2-Bromobenzyl-N-ethyl-N, N-dimethylammonium tosylate (Tosylic acid is trivial name for p-toluenesulphonic acid)
3-{[(4-methyl-1-piperazinyl)imino]methyl} rifamycin SV : Rifampicin (I.N.N.) (Rifamycin SV is an antibiotic produced by Streptomyces mediterranei)

Disodium 5,5′-(2-hydroxytrimethylenedioxy) bis[4-oxo-4H-1-benzopyran-2- carboxylate]: Disodium 4,4′-dioxo-5,5′-(2-hydroxytrimethylenedioxy)di (chromene-2-carboxylate): Cromolyn Sodium (USP): Disodium Cromoglycate
An alkaloid derived from Vinca rosea
An alkaloid derived from Vinca rosea

Section.Label: C.01.003
Section.Text: No person shall sell a drug that is not labelled as required by these Regulations.

Subsection.Text: The inner and outer labels of a drug shall show

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: on the principal display panel

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the proper name, if any, of the drug which, if there is a brand name for the drug, shall immediately precede or follow the brand name in type not less than one-half the size of that of the brand name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if there is no proper name, the common name of the drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: where a standard for the drug is prescribed in Division 6 of this Part, a statement that the drug is a Canadian Standard Drug, for which the abbreviation C.S.D. may be used,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: where a standard for the drug is not prescribed in Division 6 of this Part but is contained in a publication mentioned in Schedule B to the Act, the name of the publication containing the standard used or its abbreviation as provided in Schedule B or, if a manufacturer’s standard is used, a statement setting forth the fact that such a standard is used, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: in both official languages, the notation “sterile” “stérile” if the drug is required to be sterile by these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: on the upper left quarter of the principal display panel

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the symbol “Pr” in the case of a prescription drug, but the symbol “Pr” shall not appear on the label of any other drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the symbol “Symbol consisting of a diamond shape outline in which an uppercase letter C is centred.” in a clear manner and a conspicuous colour and size, in the case of a controlled drug, other than a controlled drug contained in an agricultural implant and set out in Part III of the schedule to Part G,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the symbol “N” in a colour contrasting with the rest of the label or in type not less than half the size of any letters used thereon, in the case of a narcotic as defined in the Narcotic Control Regulations, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a targeted substance as defined in section 1 of the Benzodiazepines and Other Targeted Substances Regulations, the following symbol in a colour contrasting with the rest of the label and in type not less than half the size of any other letter used on the main panel, namely,

ImageGroup.AlternateText: Symbol consisting of a square outline divided in half from top left corner to bottom right corner. The top right half has an uppercase letter C inside and lower left half has an uppercase letter T inside.

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: on any panel

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of the manufacturer of the drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the lot number of the drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: adequate directions for use of the drug, except in the case of a drug to which section C.01.004.02 applies,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a quantitative list of the medicinal ingredients of the drug by their proper names or, if they have no proper names, by their common names, except in the case of a drug to which section C.01.004.02 applies,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the expiration date of the drug, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a new drug for extraordinary use in respect of which a notice of compliance has been issued under section C.08.004.01, the following statement, displayed in capital letters and in a legible manner:

Provision.Text: “HEALTH CANADA HAS AUTHORIZED THE SALE OF THIS EXTRAORDINARY USE NEW DRUG FOR [naming purpose] BASED ON LIMITED CLINICAL TESTING IN HUMANS.
SANTÉ CANADA A AUTORISÉ LA VENTE DE CETTE DROGUE NOUVELLE POUR USAGE EXCEPTIONNEL AUX FINS DE [indication de la fin] EN SE FONDANT SUR DES ESSAIS CLINIQUES RESTREINTS CHEZ L’ÊTRE HUMAIN.”.

Subsection.Text: In addition to the requirements of subsection (1), the outer label of a drug shall display the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the net amount of the drug in the container in terms of weight, measure or number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a drug intended for parenteral use, a quantitative list of any preservatives present therein by their proper names or, if they have no proper names, by their common names; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a drug for human use that contains mercury or a salt or derivative thereof as a preservative, a quantitative list of all mercurial preservatives present therein by their proper names or, if they have no proper names, by their common names.

Subsection.Text: Where the container of a drug is too small to accommodate an inner label that conforms to the requirements of these Regulations, the inner label requirements of these Regulations do not apply to the drug in that container if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: there is an outer label that complies with the labelling requirements of these Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the inner label shows

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the proper name of the drug, the common name of the drug if there is no proper name or, in the case of a drug with more than one medicinal ingredient, the brand name of the drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the potency of the drug except where, in the case of a drug with more than one medicinal ingredient, the name used pursuant to subparagraph (i) for that drug is unique for a particular potency of the drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the net contents of the drug if it is not in a discrete dosage form,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the route of administration of the drug if other than oral,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the lot number of the drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the manufacturer of the drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: the expiration date of the drug, and

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: the identification of special characteristics of the dosage form if they are not evident from the name of the drug under subparagraphs (i) or (ii).

Subsection.Text: This section does not apply to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a drug sold to a drug manufacturer; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a drug dispensed pursuant to a prescription, if its label carries suitable directions for use and complies with the requirements of section C.01.005.

Subsection.Text: Every label of a drug for human use in dosage form shall display the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a telephone number, email address, website address, postal address or any other information that enables communication with a contact person in Canada; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a statement to the effect that any injury to a person’s health that is suspected of being associated with the use of the drug may be reported to the contact person.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the labels of a drug that is listed in Schedule C or D to the Act and that is in dosage form; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the inner and outer labels of a drug to which section C.01.004.02 applies.

Subsection.Text: In addition to the requirements of section C.01.004, the outer label of a drug for human use in dosage form shall display, either one bilingual table, placed on any panel, that contains only the following information in both English and French or one table in English and one table in French, each of which is placed on any panel, that contains only the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: adequate directions for use of the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a quantitative list of the drug’s medicinal ingredients by their proper names or, if they have no proper names, by their common names;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the drug’s non-medicinal ingredients listed in alphabetical order or in descending order of predominance by their proportion in the drug, preceded by words that clearly distinguish them from the medicinal ingredients; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the information referred to in subsection C.01.004.01(1).

Subsection.Text: If a package is too small to accommodate an outer label that displays one bilingual table that lists all of the drug’s non-medicinal ingredients or two unilingual tables, each of which lists all of the drug’s non-medicinal ingredients, the list of non-medicinal ingredients shall be displayed in both English and French on a tag, tape or card that is attached to the package.

If pharmaceutical ink, a fragrance or a flavour has been added to the drug, the following expressions may be included in the list of non-medicinal ingredients to indicate that those ingredients have been added to the drug, instead of listing them or combinations of them individually:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where a bilingual table referred to in subsection (1) is displayed, the expressions “flavour/saveur”, “fragrance/parfum” and “pharmaceutical ink/encre pharmaceutique”; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where two unilingual tables referred to in subsection (1) are displayed, the expressions

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: “encre pharmaceutique”, “parfum” and “saveur” in the table in French, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: “flavour”, “fragrance” and “pharmaceutical ink” in the table in English.

Subsection.Text: If the composition of the drug varies from one lot to another with respect to its non-medicinal ingredients,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where a bilingual table referred to in subsection (1) is displayed, the table shall include a reference to all non-medicinal ingredient alternatives that may be present in the drug, preceded by the symbol “+/–” or “±” or the expression “or/ou” or “may contain/peut contenir”; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where two unilingual tables referred to in subsection (1) are displayed,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the table in French shall list all non-medicinal ingredient alternatives that may be present in the drug, preceded by the symbol “+/–” or “±” or the expression “ou” or “peut contenir”, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the table in English shall list all non-medicinal ingredient alternatives that may be present in the drug, preceded by the symbol “+/–” or “±” or the expression “or” or “may contain”.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of paragraphs (3)(a) and (4)(a), the French terms in the expressions may appear first.
Subsections (1) to (5) do not apply to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: prescription drugs;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: drugs that are permitted to be sold without a prescription but that are to be administered only under the supervision of a practitioner; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: drugs that are represented as being solely for use as a disinfectant on hard non-porous surfaces.

Section.Label: C.01.004.03
Section.Text: In addition to the requirements of section C.01.004, the inner label of a drug to which section C.01.004.02 applies shall display on any panel

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: adequate directions for use of the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a quantitative list of the drug’s medicinal ingredients by their proper names or, if they have no proper names, by their common names; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the information referred to in subsection C.01.004.01(1).

Subsection.Text: No person shall import a drug in dosage form into Canada for the purpose of sale unless they have in Canada a person who is responsible for the sale of the drug.

No person who imports a drug in dosage form into Canada shall sell any lot or batch of the drug unless the name of the person who imports it, and the address of the principal place of business in Canada of the person responsible for its sale, appears on the inner and outer labels of the drug.

The principal display panel of both the inner label and outer label of a drug in dosage form shall show the drug identification number assigned for that drug, preceded by the expression “Drug Identification Number” or “Drogue : identification numérique”, or both, or the abbreviation “DIN”.
Subsection (1) does not apply to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a drug in dosage form that is compounded by a pharmacist under a prescription or by a practitioner; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a drug in dosage form that is sold under a prescription if the following information appears on the drug’s label:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the drug’s proper name, common name or brand name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the drug’s potency, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the drug’s manufacturer.

Subsection.Text: In this section and in sections C.01.005.1 and C.01.014, drug in dosage form means a drug in a form in which it is ready for use by the consumer without requiring any further manufacturing.
No pharmacist or practitioner shall sell a Class A opioid — including one that is compounded by a pharmacist under a prescription or by a practitioner — unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the drug’s package has applied to it a warning sticker that meets the specifications set out in the source document; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the drug is accompanied by a patient information handout that meets the specifications set out in the source document.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of the sale of a Class A opioid by a pharmacist or practitioner if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the opioid will be, or is, administered under the supervision of a practitioner; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the sale is to a pharmacist or practitioner.

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in this section.

Definition.Text: Class A opioid means a drug in dosage form set out in Part A of the List of Opioids, published by the Government of Canada on its website, as amended from time to time. (opioïde de catégorie A)
source document means the document entitled Information for Patients Concerning Opioids, published by the Government of Canada on its website, as amended from time to time. (document source)

Section.Label: C.01.006
Section.Text: Where a package of a drug has only one label, that label shall contain all the information required by these Regulations to be shown on both the inner and the outer labels.

Section.Label: C.01.007
Section.Text: No reference, direct or indirect, to the Act or to these Regulations shall be made upon any label of or in any advertisement for a drug unless such reference is a specific requirement of the Act or these Regulations.

Section.Label: C.01.009
Section.Text: If any Act of Parliament or any of its regulations prescribes a standard or grade for a drug and that standard or grade is given a name or designation in the Act or regulation, no person shall, on a label of or in any advertisement for that drug, use that name or designation unless the drug conforms with the standard or grade.

Section.Label: C.01.010
Section.Text: If it is necessary to provide adequate directions for the safe use of a parenteral drug or prescription drug that is used in the treatment or prevention of any disease, disorder or abnormal physical state mentioned in Schedule A to the Act, the disease, disorder or abnormal physical state may be mentioned on the drug’s labels, including any package insert and any document that is provided on request and that sets out supplementary information on the use of the drug, and, in that respect, the drug is exempt from subsections 3(1) and (2) of the Act.

Subsection.Text: A drug referred to in subsection 10(2) of the Act shall be exempt from the standard for any drug contained in any publication mentioned in Schedule B to the Act to the extent that such drug differs from that standard with respect to colour, flavour, shape and size, if such difference does not interfere with any method of assay prescribed in any such publication.

Where a manufacturer’s standard is used for a drug, the manufacturer shall make available to the Minister, on request, details of that standard and of a method of analysis for the drug acceptable to the Minister.
No person shall use a manufacturer’s standard for a drug that provides

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a lesser degree of purity than the highest degree of purity, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a greater variation in potency than the least variation in potency,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: provided for that drug in any publication mentioned in Schedule B to the Act.

Section.Label: C.01.012
Section.Text: A manufacturer who makes representations on a label of a drug in oral dosage form, or in any advertisement, with respect to the site, rate or extent of release to the body of a medicinal ingredient of the drug, or the availability to the body of a medicinal ingredient of the drug, shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: before making the representations, conduct such investigations, using an acceptable method, as may be necessary to demonstrate that the site, rate or extent of release to the body of the medicinal ingredient of the drug and the availability to the body of the medicinal ingredient of the drug, correspond to the representations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: on request submit the record of such investigations to the Minister.

Subsection.Text: Where the manufacturer of a drug is requested in writing by the Minister to submit on or before a specified day evidence with respect to a drug, the manufacturer shall make no further sales of that drug after that day unless he has submitted the evidence requested.
If the Minister determines that the evidence submitted by a manufacturer under subsection (1) is not sufficient, he or she shall so notify the manufacturer in writing.

Where, pursuant to subsection (2), a manufacturer is notified that the evidence with respect to a drug is not sufficient, he shall make no further sales of that drug unless he submits further evidence and is notified in writing by the Minister that that further evidence is sufficient.

A reference in this section to evidence with respect to a drug means evidence to establish the safety of the drug under the conditions of use recommended and the effectiveness of the drug for the purposes recommended.

Section.Label: C.01.013.1
Section.Text: Section C.01.013 does not apply in respect of a veterinary health product.

Heading.TitleText: Assignment and Cancellation of Drug Identification Numbers

Subsection.Text: No manufacturer shall sell a drug in dosage form unless a drug identification number has been assigned for that drug and the assignment of the number has not been cancelled under section C.01.014.6.
Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of a veterinary health product, a study drug as defined in section C.03.301 or a medicated feed as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Feeds Regulations, 1983.
A manufacturer of a drug may make an application for a drug identification number for that drug.
An application under subsection (1) shall be made to the Minister in writing and shall include the following information and material:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the manufacturer of the drug as it will appear on the label;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the pharmaceutical form in which the drug is to be sold;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of any drug other than a drug described in paragraph (d), the recommended route of administration;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a drug for disinfection in premises, the types of premises for which its use is recommended;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a quantitative list of the medicinal ingredients contained in the drug by their proper names or, if they have no proper names, by their common names;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the brand name under which the drug is to be sold;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: an indication of whether the drug is for human use or veterinary use;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the name and quantity of each colouring ingredient that is not a medicinal ingredient;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the use or purpose for which the drug is recommended;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the recommended dosage of the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: the address of the manufacturer referred to in paragraph (a) and, where the address is outside the country, the name and address of the importer of the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of any individual, firm, partnership or corporation, other than the names and addresses referred to in paragraphs (a) and (k), that will appear on the label of the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a drug for veterinary use, the written text of every label to be used in connection with the drug, including any package insert and any document that is provided on request and that sets out supplementary information on the use of the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (m.1)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a drug for human use, mock-ups of every label to be used in connection with the drug — including any package insert and any document that is provided on request and that sets out supplementary information on the use of the drug — and mock-ups of the drug’s packages;

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: the name and title of the person who signed the application and the date of signature; and

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a drug for human use, an assessment as to whether there is a likelihood that the drug will be mistaken for another drug for which a drug identification number has been assigned due to a resemblance between the brand name that is proposed to be used in respect of the drug and the brand name, common name or proper name of the other drug.

Subsection.Text: In the case of a new drug, a new drug submission, an extraordinary use new drug submission, an abbreviated new drug submission or an abbreviated extraordinary use new drug submission filed under section C.08.002, C.08.002.01 or C.08.002.1 shall be regarded as an application for a drug identification number.

Subject to subsection (2), if a manufacturer has provided all the information and material described in subsection C.01.014.1(2) or section C.08.002, C.08.002.01 or C.08.002.1, as the case may be, in respect of a drug, the Minister shall issue to the manufacturer a document that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sets out

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the drug identification number assigned for the drug, preceded by the abbreviation “DIN”, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if there are two or more brand names for the drug, the drug identification numbers assigned by the Minister for the drug, each of which pertains to one of the brand names and is preceded by the abbreviation “DIN”; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: contains the information referred to in paragraphs C.01.014.1(2)(a) to (f).

Subsection.Text: The Minister may refuse to issue the document referred to in subsection (1) if he or she has reasonable grounds to believe that the product in respect of which an application referred to in section C.01.014.1 has been made

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is not a drug, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is a drug but its sale would cause injury to the health of the purchaser or consumer or would be a contravention of the Act or these Regulations.

Subsection.Text: If the Minister refuses to issue the document under subsection (2), the manufacturer may submit additional information or material and request the Minister to reconsider his or her decision.
On the basis of the additional information or material submitted under subsection (3), the Minister shall reconsider the grounds on which the refusal to issue the document was made.
The Minister may, at any time, impose terms and conditions on a drug identification number assigned for a Class B opioid or amend those terms and conditions.

The Minister shall notify, in writing, the manufacturer to whom a document was issued under subsection C.01.014.2(1) that sets out the drug identification number of any terms and conditions imposed on the drug identification number and of any amendment to those terms and conditions.
In subsection (1), Class B opioid means a drug set out in Part B of the List of Opioids, published by the Government of Canada on its website, as amended from time to time.

Section.Label: C.01.014.3
Section.Text: The manufacturer to whom a document was issued under subsection C.01.014.2(1) that sets out the drug identification number assigned for a drug shall, within 30 days after the day on which the drug is first sold following the issuance by the Minister of the document, date and sign the document and return it to the Minister with a statement set out on it that the information it contains is correct and with an indication of the date of that first sale.

Section.Label: C.01.014.4
Section.Text: If the information referred to in subsection C.01.014.1(2) in respect of a drug is no longer correct owing to a change in the subject matter of the information,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a change in the subject matter of any of the information referred to in paragraphs C.01.014.1(2)(a) to (f)

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: that occurs prior to the sale of the drug, a new application shall be made, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: that occurs after the sale of the drug, no further sale of the drug shall be made until a new application for a drug identification number in respect of that drug is made and a number is assigned; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a change in the subject matter of any of the information referred to in paragraphs C.01.014.1(2)(g) to (k)

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: that occurs prior to the sale of the drug, the particulars of the change shall be submitted with the return of the document referred to in section C.01.014.3, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: that occurs after the sale of the drug, the person to whom the drug identification number in respect of that drug was issued shall, within 30 days of the change, inform the Minister of the change.

Subsection.Text: The manufacturer to whom a document was issued under subsection C.01.014.2(1) that sets out the drug identification number assigned for a drug shall, annually before the first day of October and in a form established by the Minister, provide the Minister with a notification that is signed by them and that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: indicates whether any of the following circumstances apply in respect of the drug:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: as of the day on which the notification is sent,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the manufacturer sells the drug in Canada, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the manufacturer has discontinued the sale of the drug in Canada, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the manufacturer has not sold the drug in Canada for a period that is greater than 12 months and a portion of that period is covered by the notification; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
