If a fabricator is required to maintain records and evidence in respect of the same active ingredient under subsections (2) and (3), they shall maintain them for the longest period that is applicable.

Every wholesaler, distributor referred to in section C.01A.003 and importer of a drug in dosage form shall retain records of sale of each lot or batch of the drug, which enable them to recall the lot or batch from the market, for one year after the expiration date of that lot or batch unless their establishment licence specifies some other period.

Every distributor of an active ingredient referred to in paragraph C.01A.003(a) and every wholesaler and importer of an active ingredient shall retain records of sale of each lot or batch of the active ingredient, which enable them to recall the lot or batch from the market, for the following period unless the person holds an establishment licence that specifies some other period:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an active ingredient that has a retest date, three years after the lot or batch has been completely distributed; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in any other case, one year after the expiration date of the lot or batch.

Subsection.Text: On receipt of a complaint or any information respecting the quality of a drug or its deficiencies or hazards, every fabricator, packager/labeller, wholesaler, distributor referred to in section C.01A.003 and importer of the drug shall make a record of the complaint or information that contains the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the results of any investigation carried out under subsection C.02.015(2) and, if applicable, the corrective action taken; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and business address of the person in charge of the quality control department to whom the complaint or information was forwarded under subsection C.02.015(2.1) and the date on which it was forwarded.

Subsection.Text: Records referred to in subsection (1) shall be retained for the following period unless the person holds an establishment licence that specifies some other period:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a drug in dosage form, one year after the expiration date of the lot or batch of the drug; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an active ingredient,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if the active ingredient has a retest date, three years after the lot or batch has been completely distributed, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in any other case, one year after the expiration date of the lot or batch of the active ingredient.

Subsection.Text: Every fabricator, packager/labeller, distributor referred to in section C.01A.003, importer and wholesaler shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: maintain records of the results of the self-inspection program required by section C.02.012 and of any action taken in connection with that program; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: retain those records for a period of at least three years.

Subsection.Text: Every person who fabricates or packages/labels a drug shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: maintain records on the operation of the sanitation program required to be implemented under section C.02.007; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: retain those records for a period of at least three years.

Section.Label: C.02.024.1
Section.Text: Every distributor of an active ingredient referred to in paragraph C.01A.003(a) and every fabricator, packager/labeller, wholesaler and importer of an active ingredient shall add all of the following information to the documentation that accompanies the active ingredient, immediately after any like information that has been added by another person:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their establishment licence number, or if there is none, their name, address, telephone number, fax number and email address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an indication whether they have fabricated, packaged/labelled, wholesaled, distributed or imported the active ingredient and the date on which that activity was carried out;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the expiration date; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the lot number.

Subsection.Text: Every distributor referred to in paragraph C.01A.003(b) and importer of a drug in dosage form shall retain in Canada a sample of each lot or batch of the packaged/labelled drug for one year after the expiration date of the drug unless their establishment licence specifies some other period.

Subject to subsection (4), the fabricator of a drug in dosage form shall retain a sample of each lot or batch of raw materials used in the fabrication for two years after the materials were last used in the fabrication unless their establishment licence specifies some other period.

Subject to subsection (4), the fabricator of an active ingredient shall retain a sample of each lot or batch of it for the following period unless their establishment licence specifies some other period:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an active ingredient that has a retest date, three years after the lot or batch has been completely distributed; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in any other case, one year after the expiration date of the lot or batch.

Subsection.Text: If a fabricator is required to maintain samples in respect of the same active ingredient under subsections (2) and (3), they shall maintain them for the longest period that is applicable.

Section.Label: C.02.026
Section.Text: The samples referred to in section C.02.025 shall be in an amount that is sufficient to determine whether the drug or raw material complies with the specifications for that drug or raw material.

Subsection.Text: Every distributor referred to in paragraph C.01A.003(b) and importer of a drug in dosage form shall establish the period during which each drug in the package in which it is sold will comply with the specifications for that drug.
Every fabricator and importer of an active ingredient shall establish the period during which each drug in the package in which it is sold will comply with the specifications for that drug.

Every distributor referred to in paragraph C.01A.003(b) and importer of a drug in dosage form shall monitor, by means of a continuing program, the stability of the drug in the package in which it is sold.
Every fabricator and importer of an active ingredient shall monitor, by means of a continuing program, the stability of the drug in the package in which it is sold.

Section.Label: C.02.029
Section.Text: In addition to the other requirements of this Division, a drug that is intended to be sterile shall be fabricated and packaged/labelled

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in separate and enclosed areas;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: under the supervision of personnel trained in microbiology; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: by a method scientifically proven to ensure sterility.

Section.Label: C.02.030
Section.Text: The provisions of sections C.02.025, C.02.027 and C.02.028 do not apply to medical gases.

Section.Label: C.03.001
Section.Text: In this Division,

Definition.Text: drug means a drug that is listed in Schedule C to the Act that is in dosage form or a drug that is an active ingredient of biological origin that can be used in the preparation of a drug listed in that Schedule; (drogue)
licence or Canadian licence[Repealed, SOR/97-12, s. 22]
master lot means a quantity of a drug from which a lot is prepared for sale by subsequent dilution or mixture; (maître-lot)
radionuclide generator means a radioactive parent and daughter

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: contained in an ion-exchange column, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: dissolved in a suitable solvent in a liquid-liquid extraction system

ContinuedDefinition.Text: where the radioactive daughter is separated from its parent by

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: elution from the ion exchange column, or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a solvent extraction procedure. (générateur de radionucléide)

Section.Label: C.03.001.1
Section.Text: No distributor referred to in paragraph C.01A.003(b) or importer shall sell a drug unless it has been fabricated, packaged/labelled, tested and stored in accordance with this Division.

Section.Label: C.03.012
Section.Text: On written request from the Minister, every fabricator, packager/labeller, tester, distributor referred to in paragraph C.01A.003(b) and importer of a drug shall submit protocols of tests together with samples of any lot or master lot of the drug before it is sold, and no person shall sell a lot of which the protocol or sample fails to meet the requirements of these Regulations.

Section.Label: C.03.013
Section.Text: No person shall fabricate or import a drug that is derived from animal tissue unless the tissue is obtained from a healthy animal free from infectious disease.

Subsection.Text: Section C.01.004 does not apply to a drug.

Every package of a drug that is a prescription drug shall carry the symbol “Pr” on the upper left quarter of the principal display panel of both its inner and outer labels or, in the case of a single dose container, on the upper left quarter of its outer label.
Subsection (1) does not apply to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a drug sold to a drug fabricator;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a drug sold under a prescription;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a radiopharmaceutical as defined in section C.03.201; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a component or kit as defined in section C.03.205.

Section.Label: C.03.201
Section.Text: In these Regulations, radiopharmaceutical means a drug that exhibits spontaneous disintegration of unstable nuclei with the emission of nuclear particles or photons.

Subsection.Text: Every package containing a radiopharmaceutical, other than a radionuclide generator, shall carry,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: on both the inner and the outer labels,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the proper name of the drug, which proper name, where there is a brand name, shall immediately precede or follow the brand name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the distributor referred to in paragraph C.01A.003(b),

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the lot number, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the drug identification number assigned for the radiopharmaceutical, preceded by the expression “Drug Identification Number” or “Drogue : identification numérique”, or both, or the abbreviation “DIN”; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: on the outer label

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the address of the distributor referred to in paragraph C.01A.003(b),

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the standard that the drug professes to meet, if that standard is referred to in any publication mentioned in Schedule B to the Act,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a statement of the pharmaceutical form or the route of administration of the drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a statement of the recommended use and the recommended radioactivity to be administered for that use, or a reference to an accompanying package insert that shows such information,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the radiation warning symbol set out in Schedule 3 to the Radiation Protection Regulations and the words “RAYONNEMENT — DANGER — RADIATION”,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: the names and a statement of the amounts of any preservatives or stabilizing agents contained in the drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: the names and a statement of the amounts of all other non-radioactive contents of the drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: a statement of the total radioactivity content of the drug including overfill,

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: a statement of the total volume of the drug including overfill, except where its contents are entirely in gaseous, capsule or lyophilized form,

Subparagraph.Label: (xi)
Subparagraph.Text: a statement of the concentration of radioactive material in the drug expressed as

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: units of radioactivity per capsule or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: units of radioactivity per unit volume,

ContinuedSubparagraph.Text: except where the contents of the drug are entirely in gaseous or lyophilized form,

Subparagraph.Label: (xii)
Subparagraph.Text: a statement of the specific activity of the drug expressed as units of radioactivity per unit weight of carrier present or the statement “carrier-free” or “sans entraîneur”, whichever is applicable,

Subparagraph.Label: (xiii)
Subparagraph.Text: a statement of the reference time in respect of the radioactivity values mentioned in subparagraphs (ix), (xi) and (xii), the name of the month being written or designated by letter abbreviation,

Subparagraph.Label: (xiv)
Subparagraph.Text: a statement of the recommended useful life or the date after which the drug is not recommended for use, the name of the month being written or designated by letter abbreviation, and

Subparagraph.Label: (xv)
Subparagraph.Text: a statement of the special storage requirements with reference to temperature and light.

Subsection.Text: Subparagraph (1)(a)(iv) does not apply to a radiopharmaceutical that is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: compounded by a pharmacist under a prescription or by a practitioner; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: sold under a prescription, if the radiopharmaceutical’s label indicates

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its proper name, common name or brand name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its potency, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of its manufacturer.

Subsection.Text: Subparagraph (1)(b)(viii) of this section does not apply where the information referred to in that subparagraph is shown on a package insert that accompanies the drug.
Section C.01.005 does not apply to a radiopharmaceutical.
Every radionuclide generator shall carry on the inner label

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the proper name of the radionuclide generator, which proper name, where there is a brand name, shall immediately precede or follow the brand name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the distributor referred to in paragraph C.01A.003(b);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the lot number;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the standard that the radionuclide generator professes to meet, if that standard is referred to in any publication mentioned in Schedule B to the Act;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the drug identification number assigned for the radionuclide generator, preceded by the expression “Drug Identification Number” or “Drogue : identification numérique”, or both, or the abbreviation “DIN”;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the radiation warning symbol set out in Schedule 3 to the Radiation Protection Regulations and the words “RAYONNEMENT — DANGER — RADIATION”;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the total parent radioactivity contained in the radionuclide generator;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the hour and date at which the radioactivity value mentioned in paragraph (g) is valid, the name of the month being written or designated by letter abbreviation;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the recommended useful life or the date after which the radionuclide generator is not recommended for use, the name of the month being written or designated by letter abbreviation;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the recommended useful life of the drug after removal from the radionuclide generator;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of special storage requirements with reference to temperature or shielding;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: complete directions for use or a reference to an accompanying package insert that sets out such directions; and

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: a statement cautioning against the dismantling of the radionuclide generator.

Subsection.Text: Paragraphs (1)(i) and (j) of this section do not apply where the information referred to in those subparagraphs is shown on a package insert that accompanies the radionuclide generator.
Section C.01.005 does not apply to a radionuclide generator.

No person shall sell a drug that contains technetium-99m at any time during its useful life if it also contains a radionuclidic impurity set out in the monograph for Sodium Pertechnetate Tc-99m Injection referred to in the publication set out in item 8 of Schedule B to the Act, in an amount greater than that shown in the monograph.

No person shall sell a radionuclide generator from which can be removed a drug that contains technetium-99m, at any time during the useful life of the drug, if the drug also contains a radionuclidic impurity set out in the monograph for Sodium Pertechnetate Tc-99m Injection referred to in the publication set out in item 8 of Schedule B to the Act, in an amount greater than that shown in the monograph.

Heading.TitleText: Drugs, Other than Radionuclides, Sold or Represented for Use in the Preparation of Radiopharmaceuticals

Section.Label: C.03.205
Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this section and in sections C.03.206 to C.03.209.

Definition.Text: component means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a unit of a drug, other than a radionuclide, separately packaged in a kit; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an empty vial or other accessory item in a kit. (constituant)

Definition.Text: kit means a package that is intended to be used in the preparation of radiopharmaceuticals and that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: contains one or more separately packaged units of a drug, other than a radionuclide; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: may contain empty vials or other accessory items. (trousse)

Section.Label: C.03.206
Section.Text: Sections C.01.005 and C.04.019 do not apply to a component or kit.

Subsection.Text: Every component shall be labelled to show

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: adequate identification of the component and an adequate description of its function;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where applicable, a quantitative list of its ingredients or a reference to the label of the kit that shows such information;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the distributor referred to in paragraph C.01A.003(b);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the lot number;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of any special storage requirements with respect to temperature and light;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the date after which the component is not recommended for use, the name of the month being written in full or designated by letter abbreviation; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: adequate directions for use or a reference to the accompanying package insert that shows such directions.

Subsection.Text: The component of a kit that is intended to contain the prepared radiopharmaceutical shall be labelled to display the drug identification number assigned for the kit, preceded by the expression “Drug Identification Number” or “Drogue : identification numérique”, or both, or the abbreviation “DIN”.

Section.Label: C.03.208
Section.Text: Every kit shall be labelled to show

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its proper name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its brand name, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a list of its contents;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the distributor referred to in paragraph C.01A.003(b);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the drug identification number assigned for the kit, preceded by the expression “Drug Identification Number” or “Drogue : identification numérique”, or both, or the abbreviation “DIN”;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the lot number;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of any special storage requirements with respect to temperature and light;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the date after which the kit is not recommended for use, the name of the month being written in full or designated by letter abbreviation;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: where the label of a component makes reference to the label of the kit that shows information as to the ingredients of the component, a quantitative list of the ingredients of that component;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the sterility and apyrogenicity of the components;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: adequate directions for preparing the radiopharmaceutical or a reference to the accompanying package insert that shows such directions;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the duration of the useful life of the prepared radiopharmaceutical;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the storage requirements for the prepared radiopharmaceutical;

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the recommended use for the prepared radiopharmaceutical and the recommended radioactivity to be administered for that use, or a reference to the accompanying package insert that shows such information; and

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the route of administration of the prepared radiopharmaceutical.

Section.Label: C.03.209
Section.Text: A package insert shall be included in every kit and shall show

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the proper name and the brand name, if any, of the kit and a description of its use;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a list of the contents of the kit;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the distributor referred to in paragraph C.01A.003(b) of the kit;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: identification of the radionuclides that can be used to prepare the radiopharmaceutical;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: directions for preparing the radiopharmaceutical and a statement of the storage requirements for the prepared radiopharmaceutical;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the duration of the useful life of the prepared radiopharmaceutical;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the biological actions of the prepared radiopharmaceutical;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: indications and contraindications in respect of the prepared radiopharmaceutical;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: warnings and precautions in respect of the components and the prepared radiopharmaceutical;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the adverse reactions, if any, associated with the prepared radiopharmaceutical;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: where applicable, the pharmacology and toxicology of the prepared radiopharmaceutical or a statement that such information is available on request;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: the radiation dosimetry in respect of the prepared radiopharmaceutical;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the recommended use for the prepared radiopharmaceutical and the recommended radioactivity to be administered for that use;

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the route of administration of the prepared radiopharmaceutical; and

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: a recommendation that the radiochemical purity and radioactivity content of the prepared radiopharmaceutical be checked prior to administration.

Section.Label: C.03.301
Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this section and in sections C.03.302 to C.03.319.

Definition.Text: adverse reaction means an undesirable and unintended response in a study subject or other person to a study drug that is caused by the administration of any dose of the study drug. (réaction indésirable)
good clinical practices means generally accepted clinical practices that are designed to protect the rights, safety and well-being of study subjects and other persons. (bonnes pratiques cliniques)
import means, in respect of a study drug, to import it into Canada for sale for the purpose of a study. (importer)
other person means an individual who comes into physical contact with a study subject. (autre personne)
protocol means a document that describes the objectives, design, methodology, statistical considerations and organization of a study. (protocole)

qualified investigator means the physician and member in good standing of a professional medical association in Canada to whom a sponsor gives the responsibility for the proper conduct of the study at a given study site, who is entitled to practise their profession under the laws of the province where the study site is located. (chercheur qualifié)
research ethics board means a body described in section C.03.306. (comité d’éthique de la recherche)
serious adverse reaction means an adverse reaction that results in any of the following consequences for the study subject or other person:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their in-patient hospitalization or its prolongation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a congenital malformation;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: persistent or significant disability or incapacity;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a life-threatening condition; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: death. (réaction indésirable grave)

Definition.Text: serious unexpected adverse reaction means a serious adverse reaction that is not identified in nature, severity or frequency in the risk information set out on the label of the study drug. (réaction indésirable grave et imprévue)
sponsor means a person who is responsible for the conduct of a study. (promoteur)
study means a basic clinical research study that involves human subjects and that is described in sections C.03.304 and C.03.305. (étude)
study drug means a positron-emitting radiopharmaceutical that is used in a study. (drogue destinée à l’étude)
study site means the location where all or part of a study is conducted. (lieu d’étude)

Subsection.Text: Sections C.03.303 to C.03.319 apply to the sale and importation of study drugs.
Sections C.03.001 to C.03.209 and Divisions 5 and 8 do not apply to study drugs.
Sections C.03.303 to C.03.319 do not apply to a study drug manufactured from a bulk process intermediate that is of biological origin.

Section.Label: C.03.303
Section.Text: No person shall sell or import a study drug unless all of the following requirements are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the study drug is for use only in a study;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the study drug has been previously tested in human subjects and its safety in humans has been demonstrated;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the study drug is to be imported, the manufacturer of the drug has a representative in Canada who is responsible for its sale;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the sponsor is authorized under section C.03.309 to sell or import the study drug; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the sponsor complies with sections C.03.310 to C.03.316.

Subsection.Text: The purpose of a study is to obtain data on any of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the pharmacokinetics or metabolism of the study drug;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: normal human biochemistry or physiology; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: changes caused to human biochemistry or physiology by aging, disease or medical interventions.

Subsection.Text: A study is not primarily intended to do any of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: discover, identify or verify the pharmacodynamic effects of the study drug;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: identify adverse reactions;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: fulfil an immediate therapeutic or diagnostic purpose; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: ascertain the safety or efficacy of the study drug.

Subsection.Text: A study shall meet all of the following requirements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: before the study drug is used in the study, there is sufficient data from testing it in animals and humans to demonstrate its safety in humans;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of active ingredients or combination of active ingredients in the study drug has been shown not to cause any clinically detectable pharmacodynamic effect in humans;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the total radiation dose incurred annually by a study subject, including from multiple administrations of the study drug, from significant contaminants or from impurities and from the use of other procedures for the purposes of the study, will be not more than 50 mSv;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: any concomitant drug used in the study has been assigned a drug identification number under subsection C.01.014.2(1) or, in the case of a concomitant drug that is a new drug, has been issued a notice of compliance under section C.08.004;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: study subjects shall be at least 18 years old and have legal capacity at the time of the study;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: female study subjects shall

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: be confirmed at the outset of the study, on the basis of a pregnancy test, as not being pregnant or state in writing that they are not pregnant, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: be advised that if they are lactating, they are to suspend lactation for 24 hours after the administration of the study drug; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the study shall not involve more than 30 study subjects.

Subsection.Text: Despite paragraph (1)(g), a study may involve more than 30 study subjects if the sponsor provides the Minister with a scientific rationale for the increase and the Minister approves it.

Section.Label: C.03.306
Section.Text: A research ethics board has all of the following characteristics:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its principal mandate is to approve the initiation of and to periodically review biomedical research that involves human subjects in order to protect their rights, safety and well-being;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it has at least five members, a majority of whom are Canadian citizens or permanent residents under the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, is composed of both men and women and includes at least the following:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: two members whose primary experience and expertise are in a scientific discipline, who have broad experience in the methods and areas of research to be approved and one of whom is from a medical discipline,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: one member knowledgeable in ethics,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: one member knowledgeable in Canadian laws relevant to the research to be approved,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: one member whose primary experience and expertise are in a non-scientific discipline, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: one member who is from the community or is a representative of an organization interested in the areas of research to be approved and who is not affiliated with the sponsor or with the study site; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: it has no affiliations with the sponsor that could compromise its ability to fulfil its principal mandate, or that could be perceived to do so.

Subsection.Text: The sponsor shall submit to the Minister an application for authorization to sell or import a study drug that contains the information set out in subsection (2) as well as sufficient information to demonstrate that all of the following criteria are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the use of the study drug will not endanger the health of any study subject or other person;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the study is not contrary to the best interests of the study subjects; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the objectives of the study can reasonably be achieved.

Subsection.Text: The application shall contain all of the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the title of the study and the protocol code or identification;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the purposes and a concise description of the study;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the number of study subjects;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the brand name, if any, of the study drug;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the chemical or generic name of the active ingredients in the study drug;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a qualitative list of the non-active ingredients of the study drug;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the maximum mass of the study drug to be administered to each study subject;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the radioactive dose range of the study drug, expressed in MBq or mCi;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the effective dose or effective dose equivalent of the study drug, expressed in mSv/MBq or rem/mCi;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the sponsor’s name and civic address, its postal address if different, and its telephone number, fax number and email address;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacturer’s name and civic address, its postal address if different, and its telephone number, fax number and email address;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an application for importation, the name and civic address, the postal address if different, and the telephone number, fax number and email address of the manufacturer’s representative in Canada who is responsible for the sale of the study drug;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: the name and civic address of each study site;

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: for each study site, the name, civic address, telephone number, fax number and email address of the qualified investigator;

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed starting date for the study at each study site, if known;

Paragraph.Label: (p)
Paragraph.Text: for each study site, the name, civic address, telephone number, fax number and email address of the research ethics board;

Paragraph.Label: (q)
Paragraph.Text: a statement, dated and signed by the research ethics board for each study site, that certifies that it has reviewed and approved the study, the protocol and the statement of the risks and anticipated benefits arising to the health of study subjects as a result of participating in the study that is set out in the informed consent form;

Paragraph.Label: (r)
Paragraph.Text: a list of any previous applications for an authorization to sell or import a drug for a study related to the current study; and

Paragraph.Label: (s)
Paragraph.Text: a statement, dated and signed by the sponsor’s senior medical or scientific officer in Canada and senior executive officer, that certifies both of the following:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the study will be conducted in accordance with these Regulations, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: all of the information contained or referred to in the application is complete and accurate and is not false or misleading.

Section.Label: C.03.308
Section.Text: If the information submitted under section C.03.307 is insufficient to enable the Minister to determine whether the sale or importation of the study drug should be authorized, the Minister may, by notice in writing, request the sponsor to provide any additional information that is necessary to make the determination and that is relevant to the study drug, the study or the protocol, by the date specified in the notice.

Section.Label: C.03.309
Section.Text: After examining the application and any additional information, the Minister shall authorize the sponsor to sell or import the study drug if she or he determines that the application complies with the requirements of section C.03.307, and shall send a notice of that decision to the sponsor that specifies the study sites in respect of which the sale or importation are authorized.

Section.Label: C.03.310
Section.Text: The sponsor shall notify the Minister in writing of the day on which the sale or importation of the study drug is intended to start in respect of each study site, not later than 15 days before that day.

Section.Label: C.03.311
Section.Text: A sponsor shall ensure that each study is conducted in accordance with good clinical practices and that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the study is scientifically sound and clearly described in its protocol;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the study is conducted, and the study drug is used, in accordance with the protocol and with these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: systems and procedures are implemented that assure the quality of every aspect of the study;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: at each study site, there is only one qualified investigator;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: at each study site, medical care and medical decisions, in respect of the study, are under the supervision of the qualified investigator;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: each individual who is involved in the conduct of the study is qualified by their education, training and experience to perform their respective tasks;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: before a study subject participates in the study, a copy of their signed consent form is included in the records for the study;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the requirements respecting information and records set out in section C.03.315 are met; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the study drug is manufactured, handled and stored in accordance with Division 2, other than sections C.02.019, C.02.025 and C.02.026.

Section.Label: C.03.312
Section.Text: Despite any other provision of these Regulations respecting labelling, the sponsor shall ensure that the study drug

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: bears an inner label that sets out both of the following:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the unique batch number for the study drug, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the radiation warning symbol set out in Schedule 3 to the Radiation Protection Regulations and the words “RAYONNEMENT — DANGER — RADIATION”; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is accompanied by a package insert that sets out all of the following information:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a statement that indicates that the study drug is to be used only under the supervision of a qualified investigator,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the chemical or generic name of the active ingredients in the study drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and civic address of the manufacturer,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and civic address of the sponsor,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the code or other identification of the protocol,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the warnings and precautions in respect of the use of the study drug, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: a list of the possible adverse reactions that are associated with the use of the study drug.

Subsection.Text: On the Minister’s written request, a sponsor shall submit, within the period specified in the request, information to establish the safety of the study drug if the Minister has reason to believe any of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the use of the study drug may endanger the health of a study subject or other person;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the study may be contrary to the best interests of the study subjects;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a qualified investigator is not respecting their undertaking made under paragraph C.03.315(3)(f); or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: information submitted in respect of the study drug or study is false or misleading.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may, by notice in writing, require the sponsor to provide the Minister with any information or records referred to in subsection C.03.315(3) to assess the safety of the study drug or the health of the study subjects or other persons, by the date specified in the notice.

During the course of a study, the sponsor shall notify the Minister of any serious adverse reaction or serious unexpected adverse reaction that occurs inside or outside Canada, within the following period:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the adverse reaction is fatal or life-threatening, within seven days after becoming aware of it; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the adverse reaction is not fatal or life-threatening, within 15 days after becoming aware of it.

Subsection.Text: The sponsor shall, within eight days after having notified the Minister under subsection (1), file with the Minister a complete report in respect of the adverse reaction, including an assessment of the importance and implication of the findings.
Sections C.01.016 to C.01.020 do not apply to study drugs.
The sponsor shall record, handle and store all information in respect of a study in a way that allows it to be reported completely and accurately and to be interpreted and verified.
The sponsor shall maintain complete and accurate records to establish that the study is conducted in accordance with these Regulations.
The sponsor shall maintain all of the following records in respect of the use of the study drug in each study:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: records respecting all adverse reactions that occur inside or outside Canada, including the indications for use and the dosage form of the study drug at the time of the adverse reaction;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: written procedures for subject monitoring and for the documentation and reporting of adverse reactions;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: articles from scientific journals or other publications that were used in support of the safety profile of the study drug in respect of humans;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: records in respect of each study subject, including respecting their enrolment, a copy of their signed consent form and sufficient information to enable them to be identified and contacted in the event that the sale of the study drug may endanger their health or that of another person;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: records respecting the shipment, receipt, sale, return and destruction or other disposition of the study drug;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: for each study site, an undertaking, dated and signed by the qualified investigator before the start of the study, that they will

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: conduct the study in accordance with good clinical practices, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: on discontinuance of the study by the sponsor, for any reason related to health or safety, immediately inform both the study subjects and the research ethics board of the discontinuance, provide them with the reasons for the discontinuance and advise them in writing of any potential risks to the health of study subjects or other persons;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: for each study site, a copy of the informed consent form; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: for each study site, a copy of the certifying statement described in paragraph C.03.307(2)(q), of the protocol for the study and of the statement of the risks and anticipated benefits arising to the health of study subjects as a result of participating in the study that is set out in the informed consent form.

Subsection.Text: The sponsor shall maintain all records for five years after the day on which the study ends.

If a sponsor discontinues a study in its entirety or at a study site, the sponsor shall notify all qualified investigators of the discontinuance as soon as possible in writing, and include in the notice the reasons for the discontinuance and whether the study presented any risks to the health of study subjects or other persons.

If the discontinuance is for reasons that would affect the health or safety of study subjects or other persons, the sponsor shall notify the Minister in writing within 15 days after the discontinuance, and include in the notice the reasons for the discontinuance and whether it will have an impact on any proposed or ongoing studies in respect of the study drug in Canada by the sponsor.
The Minister shall suspend an authorization to sell or import a study drug, in its entirety or in respect of a study site, in any of the following circumstances:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: information provided by the sponsor under section C.03.307, C.03.308 or C.03.313 proves to be inaccurate or incomplete;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the sponsor fails to provide the Minister with sufficient information to establish the safety of the study drug pursuant to a written request under section C.03.313, by the date specified in the request;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the sponsor fails to notify the Minister of an adverse reaction or file a report in respect of an adverse reaction in accordance with section C.03.314; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the sponsor contravenes a provision of these Regulations or any provision of the Act in relation to the study drug.

Subsection.Text: In determining whether to suspend an authorization in its entirety or in respect of a study site, the Minister shall consider whether the reason for the suspension affects the study in its entirety or affects only a certain study site.
Before suspending an authorization, the Minister shall send the sponsor a notice that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: specifies whether the suspension is of the study authorization in its entirety or in respect of a study site and sets out the reasons for the proposed suspension and the effective date;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, specifies the corrective action that the sponsor must take and the period within which it must be taken; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: gives the sponsor a reasonable opportunity to be heard in writing concerning the proposed suspension.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (3), the Minister shall immediately suspend an authorization if she or he has reason to believe that it is necessary to do so to prevent injury to the health of a study subject or any other person.
When the Minister suspends an authorization under subsection (4), the Minister must send the sponsor a notice that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sets out the reasons for the suspension;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, specifies the corrective action that the sponsor must take and the period within which it must be taken; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: gives the sponsor a reasonable opportunity to be heard in writing concerning the suspension.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), the Minister shall reinstate the authorization if the sponsor provides the Minister with sufficient evidence to establish that the study does not present a risk of injury to the health of study subjects or other persons, within the following periods:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a suspension under subsection C.03.317(1), 30 days after the day on which the suspension is effective; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a suspension under subsection C.03.317(4), the period specified in the notice sent under subsection C.03.317(5).

Subsection.Text: If the Minister does not reinstate any part of an authorization that was suspended, the Minister shall amend the authorization to remove that part.
The Minister shall cancel an authorization, in its entirety or in respect of a study site, in either of the following circumstances:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the study is discontinued in its entirety or at that study site by the sponsor under section C.03.316; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the sponsor fails to provide the Minister with the evidence required by subsection C.03.318(1) within the specified period.

Subsection.Text: When the Minister cancels all or part of an authorization, she or he shall send the sponsor a notice that sets out the reasons for the cancellation and the effective date.

Section.Label: C.04.001
Section.Text: In this Division,

Definition.Text: date of manufacture means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a product for which a standard of potency exists, the date it satisfactorily passes a potency test,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an animal product for which no standard of potency exists, the date of its removal from the animal, and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a product other than an animal product for which no standard of potency exists, the date of cessation of growth; (date de fabrication)

Definition.Text: drug means a drug that is listed in Schedule D to the Act that is in dosage form or a drug that is an active ingredient that can be used in the preparation of a drug listed in that Schedule; (drogue)
licence or Canadian licence[Repealed, SOR/97-12, s. 31]

Section.Label: C.04.001.1
Section.Text: No distributor referred to in paragraph C.01A.003(b) or importer shall sell a drug unless it has been fabricated, packaged/labelled, tested and stored in accordance with this Division.

Section.Label: C.04.002
Section.Text: This Division does not apply to a drug in oral dosage form that contains micro-organisms if the drug is recommended solely for restoring, normalizing or stabilizing the intestinal flora.

Section.Label: C.04.003
Section.Text: The date of issue of a drug shall be the date on which the finished product is removed from cold storage but in any case shall be, not later than

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: six months after the date of manufacture for a drug that has been kept constantly at a temperature not exceeding 10°C;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 12 months after the date of manufacture for a drug that has been kept constantly at a temperature not exceeding 5°C; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: two years after the date of manufacture for a drug that has been kept constantly at a temperature not exceeding 0°C.

Section.Label: C.04.013
Section.Text: Every fabricator and packager/labeller shall safely segregate all work with spore-bearing, pathogenic micro-organisms and other infectious agents known to require special precautions in manipulation and shall take such care of equipment and arrangements for supervision that the possibility of contamination of other drugs is avoided.

Section.Label: C.04.014
Section.Text: No person shall conduct laboratory procedures of a diagnostic nature in their premises unless those procedures are entirely segregated from the fabrication, packaging/labelling and testing of drugs.

Section.Label: C.04.015
Section.Text: On written request from the Minister, every fabricator, packager/labeller, tester, distributor referred to in paragraph C.01A.003(b) and importer of a drug shall submit protocols of tests together with samples of any lot of the drug before it is sold, and no person shall sell any lot of that drug if the protocol or sample fails to meet the requirements of these Regulations.

Section.Label: C.04.016
Section.Text: All animals from which drugs are prepared and preserved shall be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: under the direct supervision of competent medical or veterinary personnel;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: kept in quarantine by the fabricator for at least seven days before use; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: healthy and free from infectious disease.

Section.Label: C.04.017
Section.Text: A fabricator shall keep necropsy records of all animals that die or are killed after having been used in the production of a drug.

Section.Label: C.04.018
Section.Text: A fabricator shall immediately segregate, and report the fact to the Minister, any animal with actual or suspected vesicular stomatitis, foot and mouth disease, encephalomyelitis, infectious anaemia, glanders, anthrax, tetanus or any other serious infectious disease.

Section.Label: C.04.019
Section.Text: The provisions of section C.01.004 do not apply to a drug as defined in this Division but every package of such drug shall carry

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: on both the inner and the outer labels

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the proper name of the drug, which proper name, where there is a brand name, shall immediately precede or follow the brand name in type not less than one-half the size of that of the brand name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the distributor referred to in paragraph C.01A.003(b),

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the potency of the drug, where applicable,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the recommended dose of the drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the lot number,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the expiration date except upon the inner label of a single-dose container, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: adequate direction for use; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: on the outer label

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the address of the distributor referred to in paragraph C.01A.003(b),

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the proper name, or the common name if there is no proper name, and the amount, of any preservative in the drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a statement that the drug shall be stored at a temperature of not less than 2°C and not more than 10°C, unless the Minister has received evidence demonstrating that such a statement is not required,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a statement of the net contents in terms of weight, measure, or number, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a new drug for extraordinary use in respect of which a notice of compliance has been issued under section C.08.004.01, the following statement, displayed in capital letters and in a legible manner:

Provision.Text: “HEALTH CANADA HAS AUTHORIZED THE SALE OF THIS EXTRAORDINARY USE NEW DRUG FOR [naming purpose] BASED ON LIMITED CLINICAL TESTING IN HUMANS.
SANTÉ CANADA A AUTORISÉ LA VENTE DE CETTE DROGUE NOUVELLE POUR USAGE EXCEPTIONNEL AUX FINS DE [indication de la fin] EN SE FONDANT SUR DES ESSAIS CLINIQUES RESTREINTS CHEZ L’ÊTRE HUMAIN.”.

Section.Label: C.04.020
Section.Text: Except in the case of the following drugs, every package of a drug that is a prescription drug shall carry the symbol “Pr” on the upper left quarter of the principal display panel of both its inner and outer labels or, in the case of a single dose container, on the upper left quarter of its outer label:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a drug sold to a person who holds an establishment licence; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a drug sold under a prescription.

Heading.TitleText: Bacterial Vaccines, Products Analogous to Bacterial Vaccines

Section.Label: C.04.050
Section.Text: Except as provided in this Division, a bacterial vaccine shall be a sterile suspension of killed cultures of bacteria, with or without the addition of other medication, and shall not include an autogenous vaccine.

Section.Label: C.04.051
Section.Text: No person shall sell a bacterial vaccine unless the culture that has been used in its preparation has been tested by an acceptable method for identity and purity and when so tested it shall be true to name and a pure strain, and a record of the culture shall be maintained which shall include a statement of its origin, properties and characteristics.

Section.Label: C.04.052
Section.Text: No fabricator shall use a substrate (culture medium), in the production of a bacterial vaccine, that contains any horse meat or horse serum.

Section.Label: C.04.053
Section.Text: A fabricator of a bacterial vaccine prepared from a bacterium that does not grow readily in ordinary culture media shall test its sterility in media which are specially favourable to the growth of such bacterium, and it shall be sterile.

Section.Label: C.04.054
Section.Text: Except as provided in sections C.04.083, C.04.084 and C.04.090, both the inner and outer labels of every multiple-dose container and the outer label of every single-dose container of a bacterial vaccine shall carry a statement of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the number of bacteria per millilitre, or the weight of dried substance of bacteria per millilitre,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the number of bacteria per millilitre, or the weight of dried substance of bacteria per millilitre, of each species or immunogenic type for a vaccine that contains a number of different species or immunogenic types of bacteria,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the exact nature and amount of any substance, other than a simple diluent, combined with such vaccine, and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the recommended dose,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: and the inner label of a single-dose container shall carry a statement that it contains only one dose.

Section.Label: C.04.055
Section.Text: The expiration date of a bacterial vaccine shall be not later than 18 months after the date of manufacture or the date of issue.

Section.Label: C.04.060
Section.Text: Cultures of Salmonella typhosa used in the preparation of typhoid vaccine shall be smooth, motile, and in the Vi form, with the following antigenic structure IX,XII,Vi; d.-.

Section.Label: C.04.061
Section.Text: No person shall sell any lot of typhoid vaccine unless such lot has been shown to meet a test for potency made by an acceptable method.

Section.Label: C.04.065
Section.Text: A fabricator shall, in the preparation of pertussis (whooping cough) vaccine, use only strains of Bordetella pertussis that meet the requirements of an antigenic test made by an acceptable method.

Section.Label: C.04.066
Section.Text: No person shall sell any lot of pertussis (whooping cough) vaccine unless such lot has been shown to meet a test for potency made by an acceptable method.

Section.Label: C.04.070
Section.Text: B.C.G. vaccine shall be prepared from living B.C.G. organisms that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: have been obtained directly from a source approved by the Minister;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: are proved to be non-pathogenic by an acceptable method; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: have a history of successful use in the production of B.C.G. vaccine.

Section.Label: C.04.071
Section.Text: No fabricator shall employ any person in the manufacture of B.C.G. vaccine unless such person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has been and remains free from all forms of tuberculous infection,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: undergoes every six months a medical examination, that shall include an X-ray examination of the chest, for the presence of tuberculosis, such examination being made by a qualified, practising physician who shall sign a certificate of such person’s freedom from tuberculosis, and such certificate shall be kept on file and be available at all times, and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: resides in a household that is at all times free from active tuberculosis,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: nor shall a fabricator employ such person in any other laboratory position.

Section.Label: C.04.072
Section.Text: The preparation, preservation and packaging/labelling of B.C.G. vaccine shall be conducted under the direct supervision of an experienced bacteriologist who has

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not less than three years postgraduate training in bacteriology and immunology;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: specialized in the field of bacteriology; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: at least one year of practical experience in the manufacture of B.C.G. vaccine.

Section.Label: C.04.073
Section.Text: No fabricator shall permit any culture that is not a B.C.G. culture to be at any time on any premises that are used for the manufacture of B.C.G. vaccine.

Section.Label: C.04.074
Section.Text: A packager/labeller shall test by an acceptable method, after filling of the final container, each lot of B.C.G. vaccine for the presence of contaminating micro-organisms and when so tested it shall be free therefrom.

Section.Label: C.04.075
Section.Text: Notwithstanding section C.04.074, a fluid B.C.G. vaccine may be released for sale if no growth has appeared upon the test culture medium after an incubation of 24 hours, but if there is evidence of the presence of contaminating micro-organisms in any lot during the test period of 10 days the packager/labeller shall at once recall such lot.

Section.Label: C.04.076
Section.Text: Every fabricator and packager/labeller shall determine the number of viable B.C.G. organisms in each lot of vaccine by an acceptable method and shall keep a record of the number.

Section.Label: C.04.077
Section.Text: A fabricator of B.C.G. vaccine shall keep, at a temperature not exceeding 5.0°C, and for not less than six months,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the culture on glycerine-water potato medium from which the Sauton I and Sauton II subcultures were made, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not less than six vials of the final product

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: from each lot thereof.

Section.Label: C.04.078
Section.Text: Every fabricator and packager/labeller of B.C.G. vaccine shall keep, in form satisfactory to the Minister, continuous clinical records of the use of B.C.G. vaccine in humans.

Section.Label: C.04.079
Section.Text: A fabricator of B.C.G. vaccine shall examine pathologically all test animals used and shall immediately report to the Minister any evidence of active, progressive tuberculosis in any such animals.

Section.Label: C.04.080
Section.Text: The expiration date for B.C.G. vaccine shall be not more than

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: 10 days after harvesting in the case of fluid vaccine;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 12 months after harvesting in the case of freeze dried vaccine stored at a temperature of 4°C or above; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: 20 months after harvesting in the case of freeze dried vaccine stored at a temperature below 4°C.

Section.Label: C.04.081
Section.Text: No person shall sell fluid B.C.G. vaccine that is not packaged in containers sealed by fusion.

Section.Label: C.04.082
Section.Text: No inner label shall be required for fluid B.C.G. vaccine in single-dose containers.

Section.Label: C.04.083
Section.Text: The label of fluid B.C.G. vaccine shall carry, in lieu of the statements provided in paragraphs C.04.054(a) and (b), a statement of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the weight of bacteria per millilitre; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the route of administration of the vaccine.

Section.Label: C.04.084
Section.Text: The label of freeze-dried B.C.G. vaccine shall carry, in lieu of the statements provided in paragraphs C.04.054(a) and (b), a statement of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of bacteria per vial or per dose; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the route of administration of the vaccine.

Section.Label: C.04.085
Section.Text: The provisions of subparagraph C.04.019(b)(iv) do not apply to freeze-dried B.C.G. vaccine.

Section.Label: C.04.090
Section.Text: A product analogous to a bacterial vaccine shall be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a bacterial antigen, other than a bacterial vaccine, such as a lysate, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an extract prepared from a bacterial culture,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: and shall conform to the requirements of these Regulations for bacterial vaccines except those of paragraphs (a) and (b) of C.04.054.

Section.Label: C.04.091
Section.Text: The expiration date of a product analogous to a bacterial vaccine shall be not later than 18 months after the date of manufacture or the date of issue, but for dried tuberculin and tuberculin containing at least 50 per cent glycerin the expiration date shall be not later than five years after the date of manufacture or the date of issue, and for all other tuberculins not more than 12 months after the date of manufacture or the date of issue.

Section.Label: C.04.100
Section.Text: A virus vaccine, rickettsial vaccine, shall be a suspension of, or prepared from, living or killed viruses or rickettsiae.

Section.Label: C.04.101
Section.Text: No person shall sell a virus or a rickettsial vaccine unless the fabricator has submitted to the Minister details of the source of the strains of viruses or rickettsiae used, the method of their propagation, the method of fabrication of the vaccine, the methods employed for determining sterility, safety, identity and potency and any other tests required by these Regulations.

Section.Label: C.04.102
Section.Text: Upon written request from the Minister every fabricator and packager/labeller shall submit with respect to each lot of virus or rickettsial vaccine, when ready for sale, detailed protocols of sterility, safety, identity, potency, and of any other tests required by these Regulations.

Section.Label: C.04.110
Section.Text: Smallpox vaccine

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be a virus vaccine;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall be the living virus of vaccinia or its derivatives obtained from

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the vesicles produced in the skin of healthy calves by inoculation of vaccinia virus,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: specifically infected membranes of chick embryos, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: suitable tissue culture infected with vaccinia virus or its derivatives; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: shall be in fluid or dried form.

Section.Label: C.04.111
Section.Text: Every fabricator and packager/labeller shall fabricate and package/label smallpox vaccine only in an independent unit that is isolated from all other laboratory activities, and in or about which no extraneous materials are permitted or stored.

Section.Label: C.04.112
Section.Text: A fabricator shall exclude the personnel who care for the vaccine animals from horse stables and paddocks and from contact with horses while smallpox vaccine is being propagated.

Section.Label: C.04.113
Section.Text: Every fabricator and packager/labeller shall dispense smallpox vaccine only in sterile glass containers that are sealed under aseptic conditions.

Section.Label: C.04.114
Section.Text: Every fabricator and packager/labeller shall test smallpox vaccine to establish that it is free from

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: spore-forming anaerobic micro-organisms;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: coagulase positive staphylococci;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: haemolytic streptococci; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: any other contaminating pathogenic micro-organisms.

Section.Label: C.04.115
Section.Text: Smallpox vaccine, when tested by acceptable methods,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall be free from extraneous micro-organisms, in the case of vaccine prepared for use by jet gun; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall contain not more than 500 viable non-pathogenic bacteria per millilitre, in the case of vaccine prepared for use by the multiple pressure technique or by scarification.

Section.Label: C.04.116
Section.Text: Smallpox vaccine must demonstrate evidence of disease prevention that is at least equivalent to that of a vaccine that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is known to prevent human to human transmission of smallpox; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: meets the potency of equal to or greater than 108 pockforming units per millilitre, as determined using chick embryo chorioallantoic membranes.

Section.Label: C.04.117
Section.Text: No person shall sell smallpox vaccine unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of fluid vaccine, it has been stored at a temperature below -10°C;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of dried vaccine, it has been stored at a temperature below 10°C; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the outer label carries a statement that it shall be stored at a temperature of not more than 5°C.

Section.Label: C.04.118
Section.Text: Notwithstanding the provisions of section C.04.003, the date of issue of smallpox vaccine shall be not later than

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of fluid vaccine, nine months after the date of manufacture; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of dried vaccine, 24 months after the date of manufacture.

Section.Label: C.04.119
Section.Text: The expiration date of smallpox vaccine shall not exceed the following, unless supported by evidence of stability satisfactory to the Minister:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of fluid vaccine, 3 months after the date of issue; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of dried vaccine, 12 months after the date of issue.

Section.Label: C.04.120
Section.Text: No inner label shall be required for smallpox vaccine in single-dose containers or when dispensed in capillary tubes.

Section.Label: C.04.121
Section.Text: No person shall sell smallpox vaccine to which an antibiotic has been added.

Section.Label: C.04.122
Section.Text: Poliomyelitis vaccine shall be an aqueous suspension of killed poliomyelitis viruses, Types I, II, and III.

Section.Label: C.04.123
Section.Text: Poliomyelitis vaccine shall be prepared in acceptable tissue culture medium from strains of poliomyelitis virus proven capable of producing vaccine of acceptable potency.

Section.Label: C.04.124
Section.Text: Poliomyelitis vaccine in its final form shall contain not more than 0.35 milligram per millilitre of total nitrogen, nor more than one part per million of animal serum.

Section.Label: C.04.125
Section.Text: No person shall sell poliomyelitis vaccine unless it has been tested by an acceptable method for potency and safety and when so tested it shall be safe and of acceptable potency.

Section.Label: C.04.126
Section.Text: The outer label shall carry a statement of any antibiotic present in the vaccine.

Section.Label: C.04.127
Section.Text: The expiration date of the poliomyelitis vaccine shall be not later than 12 months after the date of the last satisfactory potency test unless evidence, satisfactory to the Minister, is presented that a longer period is appropriate.

Section.Label: C.04.128
Section.Text: Poliovirus Vaccine, Live, Oral or Poliovirus Vaccine, Live, Oral (Naming the strains) shall be prepared from living poliomyelitis virus types I, II and III that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: have been obtained directly from a source acceptable to the Minister;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: are shown to be genetically stable by an acceptable method;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: are shown to be non-pathogenic when given orally to humans;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: are proved to be capable of multiplying in the human alimentary tract and of producing type specific neutralizing antibodies when administered orally; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: have a history of successful use in the production of polio-virus vaccine, live, oral.

Section.Label: C.04.129
Section.Text: Poliovirus vaccine, live, oral, shall be fabricated, packaged/labelled and tested in premises separated from buildings where other products are fabricated, packaged/labelled or tested, and from buildings where control tests involving the use of cell lines or virus strains not employed in the fabrication, packaging/labelling and testing of poliovirus vaccine, live, oral, are carried out.

Section.Label: C.04.130
Section.Text: No fabricator shall permit the introduction of any bacterial or viral cultures other than those used in the manufacture of poliovirus vaccine, live, oral on any premises that are used for the manufacture of poliovirus vaccine, live, oral.

Section.Label: C.04.131
Section.Text: Notwithstanding sections C.04.129 and C.04.130, a fabricator may manufacture other drugs in an area in which polio-virus vaccine, live, oral is manufactured at times when that vaccine is not being manufactured, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: both prior to and following each manufacture the area is cleaned and disinfected by methods acceptable to the Minister; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the fabricator has received written permission from the Minister to carry out such manufacture.

Section.Label: C.04.132
Section.Text: Poliovirus vaccine, live, oral shall be prepared only

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in a tissue culture,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in a medium, and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: by methods

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: acceptable to the Minister.

Section.Label: C.04.133
Section.Text: No fabricator shall sell poliovirus vaccine, live, oral, unless he has tested each lot for extraneous micro-organisms and the vaccine is free therefrom.

Section.Label: C.04.134
Section.Text: A fabricator of poliovirus vaccine, live, oral shall test, by a method acceptable to the Minister, each lot of vaccine for neurovirulence and for genetic markers and it shall meet the requirements established by the Minister.

Section.Label: C.04.135
Section.Text: No fabricator shall employ any person in the manufacture of poliovirus vaccine, live, oral unless such person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is free from infectious disease;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has been vaccinated successfully against poliomyelitis by poliovirus vaccine, live, oral; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has been proved by periodic tests to be a non-carrier of poliomyelitis virus.

Section.Label: C.04.136
Section.Text: A fabricator of poliovirus vaccine, live, oral shall not permit the entry to a building in which the vaccine is manufactured of any person who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is not directly concerned with the manufacturing processes; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has been working on the same day with experimental animals or with infectious agents.

Section.Label: C.04.137
Section.Text: Bacteriophage shall be a virus preparation with specific lytic action against micro-organisms actually or potentially pathogenic.

Section.Label: C.04.138
Section.Text: The expiration date of bacteriophage shall be not later than 12 months after the date of manufacture or the date of issue.

Section.Label: C.04.140
Section.Text: Schick test reagents for the diagnosis of susceptibility to diphtheria shall be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: diphtheria toxin for Schick test;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: Schick control; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: diphtheria toxin for Schick test with control.

Section.Label: C.04.141
Section.Text: Diphtheria toxin for Schick test shall be sterile diluted diphtheria toxin stabilized by an acceptable method.

Section.Label: C.04.142
Section.Text: Schick control shall be suitably diluted

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: diphtheria toxoid; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: sterile diphtheria toxin heated at a temperature of 95°C for five minutes.

Section.Label: C.04.143
Section.Text: The human test dose of diphtheria toxin for Schick test, when aged toxin containing a preservative is used, shall be determined by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: intracutaneous injection into normal guinea pigs in mixtures with different proportions of diphtheria antitoxin, and one test dose mixed with 1/750 or more of a unit of antitoxin must cause no local reaction but mixed with 1/1,250 or less of a unit of antitoxin must cause a definite local reaction of the type known as the “positive Schick reaction”; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: intracutaneous injection into normal guinea pigs without admixture with antitoxin, and 1/50 of one test dose must not cause, and 1/25 of one test dose must cause, a definite local reaction of the type known as the “positive Schick reaction”.

Section.Label: C.04.144
Section.Text: The human test dose of diphtheria toxin for Schick test, when fresh toxin containing no preservative is used, shall be determined by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: intracutaneous injection into normal guinea pigs in mixtures with different proportions of diphtheria antitoxin, and one test dose mixed with 1/750 or more of a unit of antitoxin must cause no local reaction, but mixed with 1/1,500 or less of a unit of antitoxin must cause a definite local reaction of the type known as the “positive Schick reaction”; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: intracutaneous injection into normal guinea pigs without admixture with antitoxin, and 1/100 of one test dose must not cause, and 1/50 of one test dose must cause, a definite local reaction of the type known as the “positive Schick reaction”.

Section.Label: C.04.145
Section.Text: The human test dose for the Schick control shall give a negative Schick reaction when injected intracutaneously into normal guinea pigs.

Section.Label: C.04.146
Section.Text: No person shall sell diphtheria toxin for Schick test unless both the inner and the outer labels carry a statement of the number of human test doses it contains together with the name of any stabilizer.

Section.Label: C.04.147
Section.Text: The expiration date of Schick test reagents for the diagnosis of susceptibility to diphtheria shall be not later than 12 months after the date of manufacture or the date of issue.

Section.Label: C.04.160
Section.Text: Liquid diphtheria toxoid shall be sterile, formalized, detoxified diphtheria toxin and shall not contain more than 0.02 per cent free formaldehyde.

Section.Label: C.04.161
Section.Text: Diphtheria toxoid alum precipitated shall be prepared from diphtheria toxoid, and shall not contain more than 15 milligrams of alum per human dose.

Section.Label: C.04.162
Section.Text: The alum used in the preparation of diphtheria toxoid alum precipitated shall contain not less than 99.5 per cent pure potassium alum, Al K(SO4)2,12H2O.

Section.Label: C.04.163
Section.Text: No fabricator shall use a culture medium for the production of diphtheria toxin that contains horse protein or Witte peptone or that has not been freed as far as possible from any other allergenic ingredient.

Section.Label: C.04.164
Section.Text: Diphtheria toxin from which diphtheria toxoid is prepared shall have a toxicity, as indicated by an L+dose, of not more than 0.20 millilitre or by an M.L.D. of not more than 0.0025 millilitre.

Section.Label: C.04.165
Section.Text: A fabricator shall test each bulk container of diphtheria toxoid, before being dispensed into the final containers, for toxicity by an acceptable method, and it shall be non-toxic.

Section.Label: C.04.166
Section.Text: No person shall sell any lot of diphtheria toxoid unless such lot has been shown to meet a test for antigenicity made by an acceptable method.

Section.Label: C.04.167
Section.Text: A fabricator shall fill diphtheria toxoid aseptically into clear glass containers and where preservative is not added shall seal the containers by fusion.

Section.Label: C.04.168
