Section.Text: No person shall sell diphtheria toxoid that contains phenol.

Section.Label: C.04.169
Section.Text: No person shall sell diphtheria toxoid unless both the inner and the outer labels carry a statement of the appropriate dose for purposes of immunization.

Section.Label: C.04.170
Section.Text: The expiration date of diphtheria toxoid shall be not later than two years after the date of manufacture or the date of issue.

Section.Label: C.04.180
Section.Text: Liquid tetanus toxoid shall be sterile, formalized, detoxified tetanus toxin, and shall not contain more than 0.02 per cent free formaldehyde.

Section.Label: C.04.181
Section.Text: Tetanus toxoid alum precipitated shall be prepared from tetanus toxoid, and shall not contain more than 15 milligrams of alum per human dose.

Section.Label: C.04.182
Section.Text: The alum used in the preparation of tetanus toxoid alum precipitated shall contain not less than 99.5 per cent pure potassium alum, Al K(SO4)2, 12H2O.

Section.Label: C.04.183
Section.Text: No fabricator shall use a culture medium for the production of tetanus toxin that contains horse protein or Witte peptone or that has not been freed as far as possible from any other allergenic ingredient.

Section.Label: C.04.184
Section.Text: Tetanus toxin from which tetanus toxoid is prepared shall have a toxicity as indicated by an M.L.D. for the guinea pig of not more than 0.0001 millilitre.

Section.Label: C.04.185
Section.Text: A packager/labeller shall test each bulk container of tetanus toxoid, before being dispensed into the final containers, for toxicity by an acceptable method, and it shall be non-toxic.

Section.Label: C.04.186
Section.Text: No person shall sell any lot of tetanus toxoid unless such lot has been shown to meet a test for antigenicity made by an acceptable method.

Section.Label: C.04.187
Section.Text: No person shall sell tetanus toxoid unless both the inner and the outer labels carry a statement of the appropriate dose for purposes of immunization.

Section.Label: C.04.188
Section.Text: A fabricator shall fill tetanus toxoid aseptically into clear glass containers and where a preservative is not added shall seal the container by fusion.

Section.Label: C.04.189
Section.Text: No person shall sell tetanus toxoid that contains phenol.

Section.Label: C.04.190
Section.Text: The expiration date of tetanus toxoid shall be not later than two years after the date of manufacture or the date of issue.

Section.Label: C.04.210
Section.Text: An antitoxin or antiserum shall be the serum or fraction thereof separated from the blood of animals that have been artificially immunized against the by-products or antigenic fractions of specific cultures of micro-organisms, or against specific venoms.

Section.Label: C.04.211
Section.Text: The potency of an antitoxin or antiserum shall be determined by an acceptable method and where applicable the unit of potency shall be the International Unit.

Section.Label: C.04.212
Section.Text: Liquid diphtheria antitoxin shall have a potency of not less than 500 International Units per millilitre.

Section.Label: C.04.213
Section.Text: Liquid tetanus antitoxin shall have a potency of not less than 400 International Units per millilitre.

Section.Label: C.04.214
Section.Text: A liquid antitoxin or antiserum shall contain not more than 20 per cent solids.

Section.Label: C.04.215
Section.Text: A dried antitoxin shall be prepared from a liquid antitoxin and, when reconstituted to the original volume of the liquid antitoxin, shall have a potency not less than that prescribed for such liquid antitoxin.

Section.Label: C.04.216
Section.Text: A dried antitoxin or antiserum shall not contain more than one per cent moisture when determined by an acceptable method.

Section.Label: C.04.217
Section.Text: Each lot of antitoxin or antiserum shall be tested by an acceptable method for pyrogenicity and it shall be pyrogen-free, and, after filling into the final containers, for identity and it shall be true to name.

Section.Label: C.04.218
Section.Text: No person shall sell an antitoxin or antiserum unless both the inner and the outer labels carry a statement of the species of animal used, when other than the horse, and the net contents in millilitres or the number of units in the container.

Section.Label: C.04.219
Section.Text: In respect of antitoxins, the expiration date shall be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for liquid antitoxins with standards of potency, not later than five years after the date of manufacture;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for dried antitoxins with standards of potency, not later than five years after the date of manufacture;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for liquid antioxins with no standards of potency, not later than 12 months after the date of manufacture; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: for dried antitoxins with no standards of potency, not later than five years after the date of manufacture.

Section.Label: C.04.220
Section.Text: In respect of antisera, the expiration date shall be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for liquid antisera with standards of potency, not later than three years after the date of manufacture;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for dried antisera with standards of potency, not later than five years after the date of manufacture;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for liquid antisera with no standards of potency, not later than 12 months after the date of manufacture; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: for dried antisera with no standards of potency, not later than five years after the date of manufacture.

Section.Label: C.04.230
Section.Text: Preparations from human sources shall be pooled blood plasma, or pooled blood serum, or fractions of either separated by a method satisfactory to the Minister.

Section.Label: C.04.231
Section.Text: A fabricator shall obtain human serum, or human plasma, only from a person certified by a qualified medical practitioner to be healthy.

Section.Label: C.04.232
Section.Text: A fabricator shall not use a person to serve as a donor of blood, placenta, or cord who has a history of a disease transmissible by blood transfusion including syphilis, infectious hepatitis, or malaria.

Section.Label: C.04.233
Section.Text: The operation of drawing blood from a donor shall be under the supervision of a qualified medical practitioner, and shall be carried out in a suitable bleeding room under the control of the fabricator.

Section.Label: C.04.234
Section.Text: A fabricator shall obtain human placenta and cord used in the manufacture of preparations from human sources only from women confined in public hospitals, and the donor of such placenta and cord shall have been free from the toxaemias of pregnancy, and the placenta and cord shall not show gross evidence of any pathological condition.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), dried human serum, dried human plasma or dried fractions of either shall not contain more than one per cent moisture when determined by an acceptable method.
Dried Rho(D) Immune Human globulin shall not contain more than three per cent moisture when determined by an acceptable method.
Dried Antihemophilic Factor Human shall not contain more than two per cent moisture when determined by an acceptable method.

Section.Label: C.04.236
Section.Text: A fabricator shall provide directions or means for the removal of particles of such size as to be dangerous to the recipient from preparations from human sources that are issued in fluid form or that are reconstituted from the dried form.

Section.Label: C.04.237
Section.Text: A fabricator of preparations from human sources shall maintain complete records of all donors, which records shall include the medical certificate required by section C.04.231.

Section.Label: C.04.238
Section.Text: A fabricator, packager/labeller or distributor referred to in paragraph C.01A.003(b) may issue human serum or human plasma, or fractions of either of them, for prophylactic or therapeutic use in any of the following forms:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: immune human serum, which shall be serum separated from the blood of persons recovered from the disease or from persons specifically immunized against the disease for which the serum is intended as a prophylactic or therapeutic agent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: immune human globulins, or other immune human serum fractions, which shall be prepared from immune human serum or plasma;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: normal human serum, or normal human plasma, or fractions of either of these prepared from the blood of normal individuals; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: dried products prepared from any of these.

Section.Label: C.04.239
Section.Text: No person shall sell a preparation from human sources unless both the inner and the outer labels clearly indicate that the preparation is derived from human sources.

Section.Label: C.04.240
Section.Text: The expiration date for preparations from human sources issued in fluid or dried form shall be not later than five years after the date of filling the immediate container.

Section.Label: C.04.241
Section.Text: The date of manufacture of preparations from human sources shall be the date of bleeding the donor.

Subsection.Text: Insulin means the active principle of the pancreas that affects the metabolism of carbohydrates in the animal body and that is of value in the treatment of diabetes mellitus.
The Canadian Reference Standard for insulin shall be the International Standard therefor.
The insulin preparations described in these Regulations shall contain insulin to which may be added only such ingredients as are prescribed in these Regulations.
The potency of an insulin preparation shall be expressed in units per cubic centimetre and each unit per cubic centimetre shall provide one International Unit of insulin per cubic centimetre.

Section.Label: C.04.551
Section.Text: No person shall sell or dispense an insulin preparation that has not been stored by him continuously at a temperature between 35° and 50°F (2° and 10°C).

Section.Label: C.04.552
Section.Text: The zinc-insulin crystals used in an insulin preparation shall contain, as determined by an acceptable method,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 21 International Units of insulin per milligram, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: on the dry basis, not less than 0.30 per cent and not more than 0.90 per cent zinc.

Section.Label: C.04.553
Section.Text: The insulin preparation, “Insulin injection” or “Insulin” shall be a clear colourless or almost colourless sterile solution free from turbidity and insoluble matter, prepared from insulin or zinc insulin crystals, shall have a pH of not less than 2.5 or more than 3.5, or not less than 7.0 or more than 7.8 and shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: weight by volume,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 0.1 per cent and not more than 0.25 per cent of either phenol or cresol, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 1.4 per cent and not more than 1.8 per cent glycerin; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: as determined by an acceptable method, for each 1,000 International Units of insulin,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than 7.0 milligrams of nitrogen for Insulin Injection prepared from zinc-insulin crystals, and not more than 8.5 milligrams of nitrogen for Insulin Injection other than that made from zinc-insulin crystals,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 0.10 milligram and not more than 0.40 milligram of zinc for Insulin Injection prepared from zinc-insulin crystals, and not more than 0.40 milligram of zinc for Insulin Injection other than that made from zinc-insulin crystals, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of Insulin Injection other than that made from zinc-insulin crystals, not more than 1.0 milligram of ash.

Section.Label: C.04.554
Section.Text: No person shall sell Insulin Injection unless,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it is dispensed in a vial of approximately 10 cubic centimetre capacity that contains an excess volume sufficient to permit withdrawal of 10 cubic centimetres;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the vial label indicates that each cubic centimetre has a potency equal to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 40 International Units of insulin,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 80 International Units of insulin, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: 100 International Units of insulin; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: each cubic centimetre thereof has an actual potency that is at least 95 per cent and does not exceed 105 per cent of the potency indicated on the label as determined by an acceptable method.

Subsection.Text: A fabricator shall not sell Insulin Injection unless he

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has filed with the Minister, in accordance with subsection (2), a submission relating to that preparation, in a form and having a content satisfactory to the Minister;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has furnished the Minister with such additional information as the Minister may require; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has received from the Minister a notice that the information contained in the submission is in accordance with the requirements of this section.

Subsection.Text: A submission filed pursuant to subsection (1) shall include at least,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for each master lot of insulin or zinc-insulin crystals employed in the manufacture of Insulin Injection

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: protocols of assay of its potency expressed in International Units per cubic centimetre, in the case of insulin, and in International Units per milligram, in the case of zinc-insulin crystals,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a report of its moisture content in percentage determined by drying to constant weight at 100°C in the case of zinc-insulin crystals,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a report of the ash content in the case of insulin, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: reports of assay of its nitrogen content in milligrams and its zinc content in milligrams per 1,000 International Units of insulin;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for the first finished lot of Insulin Injection prepared from each master lot of insulin or zinc-insulin crystals, a report on the amount of each component thereof; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for the first filling of the first finished lot of Insulin Injection from each master lot of insulin or zinc-insulin crystals,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a report of assay of its nitrogen content in milligrams per 1,000 International Units of insulin,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a report of assay of its zinc content in milligrams per 1,000 International Units of insulin, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a report on the determination of its pH.

Section.Label: C.04.556
Section.Text: The expiration date printed on the inner and outer labels of every package of Insulin Injection shall be a date not later than two years after the date of removal for distribution from the fabricator’s place of storage.

Section.Label: C.04.557
Section.Text: The insulin preparation “Insulin Zinc Suspension — Rapid” shall be a sterile suspension in a buffered aqueous medium, of insulin modified by the addition of zinc in such a way that the suspended precipitate consists of amorphous material, shall have a pH of not less than 7.0 and not more than 7.8 and shall contain,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: weight by volume,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 0.15 per cent and not more than 0.17 per cent of sodium acetate (NaC2H3O2.3H2O),

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 0.65 per cent and not more than 0.75 per cent of sodium chloride, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 0.09 per cent and not more than 0.11 per cent of methyl-p-hydroxybenzoate; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: as determined by an acceptable method, for each 1,000 International Units of insulin,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than 7.0 milligrams of nitrogen; and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 1.2 milligrams and not more than 2.5 milligrams of zinc, of which not less than 20 per cent and not more than 65 per cent shall be in the supernatant liquid.

Section.Label: C.04.558
Section.Text: The insulin used in the preparation of Insulin Zinc Suspension — Rapid shall be obtained from one or more master lots and shall be present in an amount sufficient to provide either 40, 80 or 100 International Units of insulin in each cubic centimetre of Insulin Zinc Suspension-Rapid when the precipitate is suspended uniformly.

Section.Label: C.04.559
Section.Text: The clear supernatant liquid obtained from Insulin Zinc Suspension — Rapid shall contain not more than 1.0 International Unit of Insulin per cubic centimetre when the potency of the insulin preparation is 40 units per cubic centimetre, and not more than 1.5 International Units of insulin per cubic centimetre when the potency of the insulin preparation is either 80 units or 100 units per cubic centimetre, as determined by an acceptable method.

Section.Label: C.04.560
Section.Text: No person shall sell Insulin Zinc Suspension — Rapid unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it is dispensed in a vial of approximately 10 cubic centimetre capacity that contains an excess volume sufficient to permit withdrawal of 10 cubic centimetres; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: each cubic centimetre thereof provides, when the precipitate is suspended uniformly,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 40 International Units of insulin,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 80 International Units of insulin, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: 100 International Units of insulin.

Subsection.Text: A fabricator shall not sell Insulin Zinc Suspension — Rapid unless he

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has filed with the Minister, in accordance with subsection (2), a submission relating to that preparation, in a form and having a content satisfactory to the Minister;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has furnished the Minister such additional information as the Minister may require; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has received from the Minister a notice that the information contained in the submission is in accordance with the requirements of this section.

Subsection.Text: A submission filed pursuant to subsection (1) shall include at least,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for each master lot of insulin or zinc-insulin crystals employed in the manufacture of Insulin Zinc Suspension — Rapid,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: protocols of assay of its potency expressed in International Units per cubic centimetre in the case of insulin, and in International Units per milligram in the case of zinc-insulin crystals,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a report of its moisture content in percentage determined by drying to constant weight at 100°C in the case of zinc-insulin crystals, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: reports of assay of its nitrogen content in milligrams and its zinc content in milligrams per 1,000 International Units of insulin;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for the first finished lot of Insulin Zinc Suspension — Rapid prepared from each master lot of insulin or zinc-insulin crystals

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a report on the amount of each component used in the preparation,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a report of assay of its nitrogen content per 1,000 International Units of insulin,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a report of assay of its zinc content per 1,000 International Units of insulin,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a report of the insulin content in International Units per cubic centimetre of the supernatant liquid after removal of the suspended precipitate,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a report of assay of the zinc content of the supernatant liquid after removal of the suspended precipitate,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: a report on the determination of its pH, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: a report on the microscopic appearance of the suspended precipitate; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for the first filling of the first finished lot of Insulin Zinc Suspension — Rapid from each master lot of insulin or zinc-insulin crystals,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a report on the determination of its pH,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a report on the microscopic examination of the precipitate, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a report on its identification, as determined by an acceptable method.

Section.Label: C.04.562
Section.Text: The expiration date printed on the inner and outer labels of every package of Insulin Zinc Suspension — Rapid shall be a date not later than two years after the date of filling of the immediate container.

Section.Label: C.04.563
Section.Text: The insulin preparation “Insulin Zinc Suspension — Medium” shall be a sterile suspension, in a buffered aqueous medium, of insulin modified by the addition of zinc in such a way that the suspended precipitate consists of a mixture of crystals and amorphous material in an approximate ratio of seven parts of crystals to three parts of amorphous material, shall have a pH of not less than 7.0 and not more than 7.8 and shall contain,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: weight by volume,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 0.15 per cent and not more than 0.17 per cent of sodium acetate (NaC2H3O2.3H2O),

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 0.65 per cent and not more than 0.75 per cent of sodium chloride, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 0.09 per cent and not more than 0.11 per cent of methyl-p-hydroxybenzoate; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: as determined by an acceptable method, for each 1,000 International Units of insulin,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than 7.0 milligrams of nitrogen of which not less than 63 per cent and not more than 73 per cent shall be in the crystalline component, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 1.2 milligrams and not more than 2.5 milligrams of zinc, of which not less than 20 per cent and not more than 65 per cent shall be in the supernatant liquid.

Section.Label: C.04.564
Section.Text: The insulin used in the preparation of Insulin Zinc Suspension — Medium shall be obtained from one or more master lots and shall be present in an amount sufficient to provide either 40, 80 or 100 International Units of insulin in each cubic centimetre of the preparation when the precipitate is suspended uniformly.

Section.Label: C.04.565
Section.Text: The clear supernatant liquid obtained from Insulin Zinc Suspension — Medium shall contain not more than 1.0 International Unit of insulin per cubic centimetre when the potency of the insulin preparation is 40 units per cubic centimetre, and not more than 1.5 International Units of insulin per cubic centimetre when the potency of the insulin preparation is either 80 units or 100 units per cubic centimetre, as determined by an acceptable method.

Section.Label: C.04.566
Section.Text: No person shall sell Insulin Zinc Suspension-Medium unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it is dispensed in a vial of approximately 10 cubic centimetre capacity that contains an excess volume sufficient to permit withdrawal of 10 cubic centimetres; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: each cubic centimetre thereof provides, when the precipitate is suspended uniformly,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 40 International Units of insulin,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 80 International Units of insulin, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: 100 International Units of insulin.

Subsection.Text: A fabricator shall not sell Insulin Zinc Suspension-Medium unless he

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has filed with the Minister, in accordance with subsection (2), a submission relating to that preparation, in a form and having a content satisfactory to the Minister;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has furnished the Minister with such additional information as the Minister may require; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has received from the Minister a notice that the information contained in the submission is in accordance with the requirements of this section.

Subsection.Text: A submission filed pursuant to subsection (1) shall include at least,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for each master lot of insulin or zinc-insulin crystals employed in the manufacture of Insulin Zinc Suspension-Medium,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: protocols of assay of its potency expressed in International Units per cubic centimetre in the case of insulin, and in International Units per milligram in the case of zinc-insulin crystals,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a report of its moisture content in percentage determined by drying to constant weight at 100°C in the case of zinc-insulin crystals, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: reports of assay of its nitrogen content in milligrams and its zinc content in milligrams per 1,000 International Units of insulin;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for the first finished lot of Insulin Zinc Suspension-Medium prepared from each master lot of insulin or zinc-insulin crystals,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a report on the amount of each component used in the preparation,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a report of assay of its nitrogen content in milligrams per cubic centimetre or per 1,000 International Units of insulin,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a report of assay of its zinc content in milligrams per cubic centimetre or per 1,000 International Units of insulin,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a report of the insulin content, in International Units per cubic centimetre, of the supernatant liquid after removal of the suspended precipitate,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a report on the determination of the proportion of the nitrogen in the crystalline component of the suspended precipitate,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: a report of assay of the zinc content of the supernatant liquid after removal of the suspended precipitate,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: a report on the determination of its pH, and

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: a report on the microscopic appearance of the suspended precipitate; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for the first filling of the first finished lot of Insulin Zinc Suspension — Medium from each master lot of insulin or zinc-insulin crystals,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a report on the determination of its pH,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a report on the microscopic examination of the precipitate, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a report on its identification as determined by an acceptable method.

Section.Label: C.04.568
Section.Text: The expiration date printed on the inner and outer labels of Insulin Zinc Suspension — Medium shall be a date not later than two years after the date of filling of the immediate container.

Section.Label: C.04.569
Section.Text: The insulin preparation “Insulin Zinc Suspension — Prolonged” shall be a sterile suspension in a buffered aqueous medium of insulin modified by the addition of zinc in such a way that the suspended precipitate consists of crystals with not more than a trace of amorphous material, shall have a pH of not less than 7.0 and not more than 7.8 and shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: weight by volume,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 0.15 per cent and not more than 0.17 per cent of sodium acetate (NaC2H3O2.3H2O),

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 0.65 per cent and not more than 0.75 per cent of sodium chloride, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 0.09 per cent and not more than 0.11 per cent of methyl-p-hydroxybenzoate; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: as determined by an acceptable method, for each 1,000 International Units of insulin,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than 7.0 milligrams of nitrogen, of which not less than 90 per cent shall be in the crystalline component, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 1.2 milligrams and not more than 2.5 milligrams of zinc, of which not less than 20 per cent and not more than 65 per cent shall be in the supernatant liquid.

Section.Label: C.04.570
Section.Text: The insulin used in the preparation of Insulin Zinc Suspension — Prolonged shall be obtained from one or more master lots and shall be present in an amount sufficient to provide either 40, 80 or 100 International Units of insulin in each cubic centimetre of the preparation when the precipitate is suspended uniformly.

Section.Label: C.04.571
Section.Text: The clear supernatant liquid obtained from Insulin Zinc Suspension — Prolonged shall contain not more than 1.0 International Unit of insulin per cubic centimetre when the potency of the insulin preparation is 40 units per cubic centimetre, and not more than 1.5 International Units of insulin per cubic centimetre when the potency of the insulin preparation is either 80 units or 100 units per cubic centimetre, as determined by an acceptable method.

Section.Label: C.04.572
Section.Text: No person shall sell Insulin Zinc Suspension — Prolonged unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it is dispensed in a vial of approximately 10 cubic centimetre capacity that contains an excess volume sufficient to permit withdrawal of 10 cubic centimetres; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: each cubic centimetre thereof provides, when the precipitate is suspended uniformly,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 40 International Units of insulin,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 80 International Units of insulin, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: 100 International Units of insulin.

Subsection.Text: A fabricator shall not sell Insulin Zinc Suspension — Prolonged unless he

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has filed with the Minister, in accordance with subsection (2), a submission relating to that preparation, in a form and having a content satisfactory to the Minister;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has furnished the Minister with such additional information as the Minister may require; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has received from the Minister a notice that the information contained in the submission is in accordance with the requirements of this section.

Subsection.Text: A submission filed pursuant to subsection (1) shall include at least,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for each master lot of insulin or zinc-insulin crystals employed in the manufacture of Insulin Zinc Suspension — Prolonged,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: protocols of assay of its potency expressed in International Units per cubic centimetre in the case of insulin, and in International Units per milligram in the case of zinc-insulin crystals,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a report of its moisture content in percentage determined by drying to constant weight at 100°C in the case of zinc-insulin crystals, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: reports of assay of the nitrogen content in milligrams and of its zinc content in milligrams per 1,000 International Units of insulin;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for the first finished lot of Insulin Zinc Suspension — Prolonged prepared from each master lot of insulin or zinc-insulin crystals,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a report on the amount of each component used in the preparation,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a report of assay of its nitrogen content in milligrams per cubic centimetre or per 1,000 International Units of insulin,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a report of assay of its zinc content in milligrams per cubic centimetre or per 1,000 International Units of insulin,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a report of the insulin content, in International Units per cubic centimetre, of the supernatant liquid after removal of the suspended precipitate,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a report of the determination of the proportion of the nitrogen in the crystalline component of the suspended precipitate,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: a report of assay of the zinc content of the supernatant liquid after removal of the suspended precipitate,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: a report on the determination of its pH, and

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: a report on the microscopic appearance of the suspended precipitate; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for the first filling of the first finished lot of Insulin Zinc Suspension — Prolonged from each master lot of insulin or zinc-insulin crystals,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a report on the determination of its pH,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a report on the microscopic examination of the precipitate, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a report on its identification as determined by an acceptable method.

Section.Label: C.04.574
Section.Text: The expiration date printed on the inner and outer labels of every package of Insulin Zinc Suspension — Prolonged shall be a date not later than two years after the date of filling of the immediate container.

Section.Label: C.04.575
Section.Text: The insulin preparation “Globin Insulin with Zinc” shall be a sterile solution of insulin modified by the addition of globin prepared from beef blood, in the form of globin hydrochloride, and zinc, shall be a clear, yellowish, or almost colourless liquid free from insoluble matter and acceptably free from turbidity, shall have a pH of not less than 3.4 and not more than 3.8 and shall contain,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: weight by volume, not less than 1.3 per cent and not more than 1.7 per cent glycerin, and either

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 0.15 per cent and not more than 0.20 per cent cresol, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 0.20 per cent and not more than 0.26 per cent phenol, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: as determined by an acceptable method, for each 1,000 International Units of insulin,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than 15.0 milligrams of total nitrogen,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 36.0 milligrams and not more than 40.0 milligrams of globin calculated as 6.0 times the nitrogen content of the globin, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 2.5 milligrams and not more than 3.5 milligrams of zinc.

Section.Label: C.04.576
Section.Text: The globin hydrochloride used in the preparation of Globin Insulin with Zinc shall contain not less than 16.0 per cent and not more than 17.5 per cent nitrogen calculated on a dry, ash-free and hydrochloric acid-free basis, and its ash content shall be not more than 0.3 per cent as determined by an acceptable method.

Section.Label: C.04.577
Section.Text: The insulin used in the preparation of Globin Insulin with Zinc shall be obtained from one or more master lots and shall be present in an amount sufficient to provide either 40 or 80 International Units of insulin in each cubic centimetre of the Globin Insulin with Zinc.

Subsection.Text: The Canadian Reference Standard for Globin Insulin with Zinc shall be the standard adopted therefor by the Minister from time to time.
Upon application of a person who holds an establishment licence, the Minister shall furnish him with a portion of the Canadian Reference Standard with directions for comparative testing.

The testing of the biological reaction of Globin Insulin with Zinc shall be made by an acceptable method and that biological reaction shall be comparable to the biological reaction of the portion of the Canadian Reference Standard furnished by the Minister.

Section.Label: C.04.579
Section.Text: No person shall sell Globin Insulin with Zinc unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it is dispensed in a vial of approximately 10 cubic centimetre capacity that contains an excess volume sufficient to permit withdrawal of 10 cubic centimetres; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: each cubic centimetre thereof provides,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 40 International Units of insulin, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 80 International Units of insulin.

Subsection.Text: A fabricator shall not sell Globin Insulin with Zinc unless he

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has filed with the Minister, in accordance with subsection (2), a submission relating to that preparation, in a form and having a content satisfactory to the Minister;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has furnished the Minister with such additional information as the Minister may require; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has received from the Minister a notice that the information contained in the submission is in accordance with the requirements of this section.

Subsection.Text: A submission filed pursuant to subsection (1) shall include at least,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for each master lot of insulin or zinc-insulin crystals employed in the manufacture of Globin Insulin with Zinc,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: protocols of assay of its potency expressed in International Units per cubic centimetre in the case of insulin, and in International Units per milligram in the case of zinc-insulin crystals,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a report of its moisture content in percentage determined by drying to constant weight at 100°C in the case of zinc-insulin crystals, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: reports of assay of its nitrogen content in milligrams and its zinc content in milligrams per 1,000 International Units of insulin;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for the master lot of globin hydrochloride used in the preparation of Globin Insulin with Zinc, reports of assay of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its nitrogen content in per cent calculated on a dry, ash-free and hydrochloric acid free basis,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its chloride content in per cent calculated as hydrochloride, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its ash content in percentage;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for the components used in the preparation of the trial mixture of Globin Insulin with Zinc, a report on the quantity of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: insulin in grams, or in International Units,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: zinc in grams, or in milligrams, per 1,000 International Units of insulin,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: globin hydrochloride in grams or in milligrams, per 1,000 International Units of insulin, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the volume of the preparation in cubic centimetres or litres;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: for the trial mixture of Globin Insulin with Zinc,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a report of assay of its nitrogen content in milligrams per cubic centimetre or per 1,000 International Units of insulin,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a report of assay of its zinc content in milligrams per cubic centimetre or per 1,000 International Units of insulin,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: protocols of the biological reaction showing the retardation of the insulin effect, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a report on the determination of its pH;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: for the first finished lot of Globin Insulin with Zinc from each trial mixture of Globin Insulin with Zinc, a report on the amount of each component in the preparation; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: for the first filling of the first finished lot of Globin Insulin with Zinc from each trial mixture of Globin Insulin with Zinc,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a report of assay of its nitrogen content in milligrams per cubic centimetre or per 1,000 International Units of insulin,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a report of assay of its zinc content in milligrams per cubic centimetre or per 1,000 International Units of insulin, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a report on the determination of its pH.

Section.Label: C.04.581
Section.Text: The expiration date printed on the inner and outer labels of every package of Globin Insulin with Zinc shall be a date not later than two years after the date of filling of the immediate container.

Section.Label: C.04.582
Section.Text: The insulin preparation “NPH Insulin” or “Isophane Insulin” shall be a sterile preparation of rod-shaped crystals containing insulin, protamine and zinc, suspended in a buffered aqueous medium, shall have a pH of not less than 7.0 and not more than 7.8 and shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: weight by volume, not less than 0.15 per cent and not more than 0.25 per cent anhydrous disodium phosphate, and either

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 1.4 per cent and not more than 1.8 per cent glycerin and not less than 0.15 per cent and not more than 0.17 per cent metacresol and not less than 0.06 and not more than 0.07 per cent phenol, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 0.40 per cent and not more than 0.45 per cent sodium chloride and not less than 0.7 per cent and not more than 0.9 per cent glycerin and not less than 0.18 per cent and not more than 0.22 per cent metacresol; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: as determined by an acceptable method, for each 1,000 International Units of insulin,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than 8.5 milligrams of nitrogen,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 3.0 milligrams and not more than 6.0 milligrams of protamine except that the ratio of the protamine to the insulin shall be not less than the isophane ratio and shall not exceed the isophane ratio by more than 10 per cent,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 0.16 milligram and not more than 0.40 milligram of zinc, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: no protease activity significant for the stability of NPH insulin.

Section.Label: C.04.583
Section.Text: The protamine used in preparing NPH Insulin shall be obtained from the sperm or from the mature testes of fish belonging to the family Salmonidae, genera Oncorhynchus Suckley, or Salmo Linne.

Section.Label: C.04.584
Section.Text: The isophane ratio means the minimum number of milligrams of protamine required to precipitate 100 International Units of insulin and shall be determined by an acceptable method.

Section.Label: C.04.585
Section.Text: The insulin used in the preparation of NPH Insulin shall be obtained from one or more master lots and shall be present in an amount sufficient to provide either 40, 80 or 100 International Units of insulin in each cubic centimetre of the preparation when the precipitate is suspended uniformly.

Section.Label: C.04.586
Section.Text: The clear supernatant liquid obtained from NPH insulin shall contain not more than 0.4 International Units of insulin per cubic centimetre when the potency of the insulin preparation is 40 units per cubic centimetre, not more than 0.6 International Units of insulin per cubic centimetre when the potency of the insulin preparation is 80 units per cubic centimetre and not more than 0.7 International Units of insulin per cubic centimetre when the potency of the insulin preparation is 100 units per cubic centimetre, as determined by an acceptable method.

Section.Label: C.04.587
Section.Text: No person shall sell NPH Insulin unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it is dispensed in a vial of approximately 10 cubic centimetre capacity that contains an excess volume sufficient to permit withdrawal of 10 cubic centimetres; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: each cubic centimetre thereof provides,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 40 International Units of insulin,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 80 International Units of insulin, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: 100 International Units of insulin.

Subsection.Text: A fabricator shall not sell NPH Insulin unless he

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has filed with the Minister, in accordance with subsection (2), a submission relating to that preparation, in a form and having a content satisfactory to the Minister;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has furnished the Minister with such additional information as the Minister may require; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has received from the Minister a notice that the information contained in the submission is in accordance with the requirements of this section.

Subsection.Text: A submission filed pursuant to subsection (1) shall include at least,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for each master lot of zinc-insulin crystals employed in the manufacture of NPH Insulin,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: protocols of assay of its potency in International Units per milligram,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a report of its moisture content in per cent determined by drying to constant weight at 100°C, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: reports of assay of its nitrogen content in milligrams and its zinc content in milligrams per 1,000 International Units of insulin;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for the master lot of protamine, a report of the isophane ratio for the insulin used in the preparation of the NPH Insulin;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for the trial mixture of NPH Insulin,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a report of assay of its nitrogen content in milligrams per cubic centimetre or per 1,000 International Units of insulin,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a report of assay of its zinc content in milligrams per cubic centimetre or per 1,000 International Units of insulin,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a report of the insulin content in International Units per cubic centimetre of the supernatant liquid after removal of the suspended precipitate,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a report on the determination of its pH, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a report on the microscopic examination of the precipitate;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: for the first finished lot of NPH Insulin from each trial mixture of NPH Insulin, a report on the amount of each component in the preparation; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: for the first filling of the first finished lot of NPH Insulin from each trial mixture of NPH Insulin,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a report of assay of its nitrogen content in milligrams per cubic centimetre or per 1,000 International Units of insulin,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a report of assay of its zinc content in milligrams per cubic centimetre or per 1,000 International Units of insulin,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a report on the determination of its pH,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a report on the microscopic examination of the precipitate, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a report of its identification as determined by an acceptable method.

Section.Label: C.04.589
Section.Text: The expiration date printed on the inner and outer labels of NPH Insulin shall be a date not later than two years after the date of filling of the immediate container.

Section.Label: C.04.590
Section.Text: The insulin preparation “Protamine Zinc Insulin” shall be a sterile white suspension in a buffered aqueous medium, containing insulin modified by the addition of protamine and zinc, shall have a pH of not less than 7.1 and not more than 7.4, and shall contain,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: weight by volume,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 0.15 per cent and not more than 0.25 per cent anhydrous disodium phosphate,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 1.4 per cent and not more than 1.8 per cent glycerin, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: either not less than 0.18 per cent and not more than 0.22 per cent cresol, or not less than 0.22 per cent and not more than 0.28 per cent phenol; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: as determined by an acceptable method, for each 1,000 International Units of insulin,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than 12.5 milligrams of total nitrogen,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 10.0 milligrams and not more than 15.0 milligrams of protamine,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 1.7 milligrams and not more than 2.5 milligrams of zinc.

Section.Label: C.04.591
Section.Text: The protamine used in the preparation of Protamine Zinc Insulin shall be obtained from the sperm or from the mature testes of fish belonging to the family Salmonidae, genera Oncorhunchus Suckley or Salmo Linne.

Section.Label: C.04.592
Section.Text: The insulin used in the preparation of Protamine Zinc Insulin shall be obtained from one or more master lots and shall be present in an amount sufficient to provide either 40, 80 or 100 International Units of insulin in each cubic centimetre of the preparation when the precipitate is suspended uniformly.

Subsection.Text: The Canadian Reference Standard for Protamine Zinc Insulin shall be the standard adopted therefor by the Minister from time to time.
Upon application of a person who holds an establishment licence, the Minister shall furnish him with a portion of the Canadian Reference Standard with directions for comparative testing.

The testing of the biological reaction of Protamine Zinc Insulin shall be made by an acceptable method and that biological reaction shall be comparable to the biological reaction of the portion of the Canadian Reference Standard furnished by the Minister.

Section.Label: C.04.594
Section.Text: No person shall sell Protamine Zinc Insulin unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it is dispensed in a vial of approximately 10 cubic centimetre capacity that contains an excess volume sufficient to permit withdrawal of 10 cubic centimetres; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: each cubic centimetre thereof provides

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 40 International Units of insulin,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 80 International Units of insulin, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: 100 International Units of insulin.

Subsection.Text: A fabricator shall not sell Protamine Zinc Insulin unless he

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has filed with the Minister, in accordance with subsection (2), a submission relating to that preparation, in a form and having a content satisfactory to the Minister;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has furnished the Minister with such additional information as the Minister may require; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has received from the Minister a notice that the information contained in the submission is in accordance with the requirements of this section.

Subsection.Text: A submission filed pursuant to subsection (1) shall include at least,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for each master lot of insulin or zinc-insulin crystals employed in the manufacture of Protamine Zinc Insulin,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: protocols of assay of its potency in International Units per cubic centimetre in the case of insulin and in International Units per milligram in the case of zinc-insulin crystals,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a report on its moisture content in percentage determined by drying to constant weight at 100°C in the case of zinc-insulin crystals, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: reports of assay of its nitrogen content in milligrams, and its zinc content in milligrams per 1,000 International Units of insulin;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for the components used in the preparation of the trial mixture of Protamine Zinc Insulin, a report on the quantity of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: insulin in grams or in International Units,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: zinc in grams or in milligrams, per 1,000 International Units of insulin,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: protamine in grams or in milligrams, per 1,000 International Units of insulin, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the volume of the preparation in cubic centimetres or litres;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for the trial mixture of Protamine Zinc Insulin,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a report of assay of its nitrogen content in milligrams per cubic centimetre or per 1,000 International Units of insulin,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a report of assay of its zinc content in milligrams per cubic centimetre per 1,000 International Units of insulin,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: protocols of its biological reaction showing retardation of the insulin effect, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a report on the determination of its pH;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: for the first finished lot of Protamine Zinc Insulin from each trial mixture of Protamine Zinc Insulin, a report on the amount of each component in the preparation; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: for the first filling of the first finished lot of Protamine Zinc Insulin from each trial mixture of Protamine Zinc Insulin,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a report of assay of its nitrogen content in milligrams per cubic centimetre or per 1,000 International Units,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a report of assay of its zinc content in milligrams per cubic centimetre or per 1,000 International Units, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a report on the determination of its pH.

Section.Label: C.04.596
Section.Text: The expiration date printed on the inner and outer labels of every package of Protamine Zinc Insulin shall be a date not later than two years after the date of filling of the immediate container.

Section.Label: C.04.597
Section.Text: The insulin preparation “Sulphated Insulin” shall be a clear or slightly turbid, colourless or almost colourless, sterile, isotonic preparation of zinc-insulin crystals chemically modified by treatment with sulphuric acid, shall have a pH of not less than 6.0 and not more than 7.0, and shall contain,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: weight by volume,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 0.6 per cent and not more than 1.0 per cent sodium chloride, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 0.2 per cent and not more than 0.3 per cent phenol; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: as determined by an acceptable method,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than 200 milligrams protein for each 1,000 International Units of insulin, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not less than 5.5 and not more than 6.5 sulphate groups per insulin molecule.

Section.Label: C.04.598
Section.Text: The neutralization ratio means the amount of anti-beef-insulin serum required to neutralize one unit of Sulphated Insulin divided by the amount required to neutralize one unit of beef insulin, and shall be determined by an acceptable method.

Section.Label: C.04.599
Section.Text: The neutralization ratio of Sulphated Insulin shall be not less than 4 to 1.

Section.Label: C.04.600
Section.Text: No person shall sell Sulphated Insulin unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it is dispensed in a vial of approximately 10 cubic centimetre capacity that contains an excess volume sufficient to permit withdrawal of 10 cubic centimetres, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: each cubic centimetre thereof provides 100 International Units of insulin as determined by an acceptable method.

Subsection.Text: A fabricator shall not sell Sulphated Insulin unless he

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has filed with the Minister, in accordance with subsection (2), a submission relating to that preparation, in a form and having a content satisfactory to the Minister;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has furnished the Minister with such additional information as the Minister may require; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has received from the Minister a notice that the information contained in the submission is in accordance with the requirements of this section.

Subsection.Text: A submission filed pursuant to subsection (1) shall include at least,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for each master lot of zinc-insulin crystals employed in the manufacture of Sulphated Insulin,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: protocols of assay of its potency in International Units per milligram,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a report of its moisture content in percentage determined by drying to constant weight at 100°C, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: reports of assay of its nitrogen content in milligrams and its zinc content in milligrams per 1,000 International Units of insulin; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for each lot of Sulphated Insulin prepared from each master lot of zinc-insulin crystals,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a report of the amount of each component,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a report of the protein content in milligrams per 1,000 International Units of insulin,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a report on the determination of the neutralization ratio,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a report on the determination of the number of sulphate groups per insulin molecule,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: protocols of assay of its potency expressed as International Units per cubic centimetre, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: a report on the determination of its pH.

Section.Label: C.04.602
Section.Text: The expiration date printed on the inner and outer labels of every package of Sulphated Insulin shall be a date not later than two years after the date of filling of the immediate container.

Section.Label: C.04.650
Section.Text: The packager/labeller of Insulin Injection may label that insulin preparation “Insulin made from Zinc-Insulin crystals” only when it has been prepared from zinc-insulin crystals.

Section.Label: C.04.651
Section.Text: The packager/labeller of an insulin preparation shall print the information required by these Regulations to appear on both the inner and outer labels of every package of that insulin preparation as set out in the Table to this section.

row.entry: Insulin Injection, not labelled as set out in item 2.
Insulin Injection, labelled “Insulin made from Zinc-Insulin crystals.”
Insulin Zinc Suspension — Rapid, Insulin Zinc Suspension — Medium and Insulin Zinc Suspension — Prolonged.
(a) red ink on lavender stock plus a distinguishing mark or design.
(b) green ink on lavender stock plus a distinguishing mark or design.
(a) red ink on brown stock except that the expression “40 units per cubic centimetre” may be printed in white letters on a red background.
(b) green ink on brown stock except that the expression “80 units per cubic centimetre” may be printed in white letters on a green background.
black ink on white stock plus the statement “Warning... Not for Ordinary Use... See Package Leaflet”.

Section.Label: C.04.652
Section.Text: The packager/labeller of an insulin preparation shall print on the outer label of every package thereof instructions to store the preparation in a refrigerator at 35° to 50°F (2° to 10°C) and to avoid exposing it to freezing.

Section.Label: C.04.653
Section.Text: The packager/labeller of an insulin preparation that consists of a precipitate suspended in a buffered aqueous medium shall print on the inner label of every package thereof the statement “Shake Carefully”.

Section.Label: C.04.654
Section.Text: The packager/labeller of an insulin preparation may, in lieu of printing adequate directions for its use on both the inner and outer labels thereof as required by subparagraph C.04.019(a)(vii), print the descriptions for use in a descriptive circular prepared in accordance with section C.04.655, but in such case he shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: enclose a copy of the circular in the package containing the preparation; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: state on the outer label of the package that such a circular is enclosed therein.

Section.Label: C.04.655
Section.Text: The descriptive circular referred to in section C.04.654 shall include, at least, the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a statement that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the treatment of diabetes mellitus requires medical supervision and review,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: insulin preparations should be used only as determined by a physician for each patient in the light of blood-sugar and urinary-sugar findings, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the physician’s instructions concerning diet, dosage, rest and exercise should be followed carefully;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an outline of the procedure to be followed in withdrawing the insulin preparation from the vial, including techniques for sterilization of the syringe and needle, vial-stopper and site of injection;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a statement explaining that injections should be subcutaneous, and not intravenous or intramuscular, and a caution against successive injections in any one site;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a statement that doses are specified in terms of Units of potency per cubic centimetre and that the volume of each dose will depend upon the potency in terms of units per cubic centimetre stated on the label of the insulin preparation and that, for these reasons, it is important that the patient understand the markings on syringes;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a brief explanation of hypoglycemia together with emergency measures suitable for use by patients and those caring for patients in the event of hypoglycemic reactions;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a statement indicating the possibility of undesirable reactions associated with illness or infection, with the omission or loss of a meal, and with a shortage of the insulin preparation;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a statement warning against using any other type of insulin preparation than that prescribed by the physician;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: a statement that the use of a package should not be commenced after the expiration date printed on the package;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: a statement that the contents should be used as continuously as practicable and that any vial from which a part of the contents has been withdrawn should be discarded in the event of its being in disuse for several weeks’ time;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: a statement stressing the importance of visiting a physician regularly and of carefully following his instructions;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of insulin preparations consisting of a clear, colourless or almost colourless solution, free from turbidity and from insoluble matter, a statement that if the contents of the vial become cloudy or turbid, use of that vial should be discontinued;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of insulin preparations consisting of a precipitate suspended in a buffered aqueous medium, a statement explaining that it is necessary to shake the vial carefully before withdrawing a dose, noting that if the contents have become lumpy or granular in appearance or have formed a deposit of particles on the wall of the container, the use of that vial should be discontinued;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: instructions that the insulin preparation should be stored in a refrigerator at 35° to 50°F (2° to 10°C) and should not be exposed to freezing; and

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of Sulphated Insulin, a statement explaining that this insulin preparation is not for ordinary use, but is a chemically modified insulin which may be more effective than the usual insulin preparations in certain insulin-resistant or insulin-allergic diabetic patients.

Subsection.Text: Notwithstanding section C.04.554, a person who holds an establishment licence may sell Insulin Injection made from zinc-insulin crystals contained in vials of approximately 20 cubic centimetre capacity each of which vials

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: contains an excess volume sufficient to permit withdrawal of 20 cubic centimetres, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: provides 500 International Units of insulin per cubic centimetre,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: if

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: notwithstanding section C.04.651, both the inner and outer labels are printed in black ink on white stock and overprinted in narrow brown and white diagonal stripes, of which there shall be at least five but not more than 20 to each inch;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: both the inner and the outer labels carry the statement “Warning — High Potency — Not for Ordinary Use”; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: each package contains a descriptive circular that conforms to the requirements of section C.04.655 and, in addition, includes,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: at the beginning of the circular the statement:

Provision.Text: “Warning — This insulin preparation contains 500 International Units of insulin in each cubic centimetre. Extreme caution must be observed in the measurement of doses because inadvertent overdose may result in irreversible shock. Serious consequences may result if it is used other than under constant medical supervision. Unless specifically prescribed it should never be used by patients to replace use of any other insulin preparations.”,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a statement that Insulin made from Zinc-Insulin crystals 500 International Units per cubic centimetre should not be administered intravenously, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a statement giving information for the safe and effective use by physicians of the drug in insulin shock therapy and in the treatment of diabetic patients with high insulin resistance (daily requirement more than 200 International Units of insulin).

Section.Label: C.04.675
Section.Text: Anterior pituitary extract shall include all natural products, prepared from the anterior lobe of the pituitary gland of animals, having physiological properties associated with the hormones of the anterior pituitary gland and their proper names shall be

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: Gonadotrophic Hormone, Gonadotrophin, followed by qualifying words to indicate the gonadotrophic activity associated with the extract,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: and if unpurified anterior pituitary extract

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: Pituitary Extract Anterior Lobe followed by qualifying words to indicate the physiological properties associated with it.

Section.Label: C.04.676
Section.Text: Reference standards for anterior pituitary extract shall be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the International Standard,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where no International Standard exists, the Canadian Reference Standard shall be that established and kept by the Minister from whom portions for comparative testing may be had upon application, and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: where neither an International Standard nor a Canadian Reference Standard exists, a provisional reference standard that shall be a suitable quantity of the product submitted by the distributor referred to in paragraph C.01A.003(b) to the Minister for checking the uniformity of the product.

Section.Label: C.04.677
Section.Text: Both the inner and outer labels of an anterior pituitary extract shall carry a statement of the potency in terms of the reference standard for anterior pituitary extract provided in section C.04.676 as determined by an acceptable method, except that where no reference standard for an anterior pituitary extract exists, the distributor referred to in paragraph C.01A.003(b) shall include, with every package of the anterior pituitary extract, an acceptable statement of the unit of potency and the method of assay used.

Section.Label: C.04.678
Section.Text: No person who holds an establishment licence shall sell corticotrophic hormones for subcutaneous or intramuscular use unless the preparation has been assayed by an acceptable method involving subcutaneous injection and, where the preparation is recommended for intravenous use, the label carries specific dosage instructions for that use.

Section.Label: C.04.679
Section.Text: No person shall sell as such adrenocorticotrophic hormone, thyrotrophic hormone, growth hormone pituitary, lactogenic hormone, or gonadotrophic hormone that is not acceptable free from any anterior pituitary extract other than the one for which it is named.

Section.Label: C.04.680
Section.Text: The outer label of a mixture of two or more of adrenocorticotrophic hormone, thyrotrophic hormone, growth hormone pituitary, lactogenic hormone and gonadotrophic hormone, or a mixture of any of those with pituitary extract anterior lobe, shall carry a declaration of the proper name and the amount of each component of the mixture.

Section.Label: C.04.681
Section.Text: The outer label of an anterior pituitary extract or mixture of anterior pituitary extracts shall carry a statement

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: showing the species of animal from which the glands used in the preparation of the anterior pituitary extract were obtained,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that it shall be stored at refrigerator temperature, and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: that, except in the case of gonadotrophic hormones, it is to be used only on the advice or on the prescription of a physician.

Section.Label: C.04.682
Section.Text: Both the inner and outer labels of adrenocorticotrophic hormone shall carry a statement indicating the route of administration, in addition to meeting the requirements of paragraphs C.04.681(a) and (b).

Section.Label: C.04.683
Section.Text: The expiration date for an anterior pituitary extract or mixture of anterior pituitary extracts shall be not more than two years after the date of passing a potency test.

Heading.Label: DIVISION 5
Heading.TitleText: Drugs for Clinical Trials Involving Human Subjects

Section.Label: C.05.001
Section.Text: The definitions in this section apply in this Division.

Definition.Text: adverse drug reaction means any noxious and unintended response to a drug that is caused by the administration of any dose of the drug. (réaction indésirable à une drogue)

adverse event means any adverse occurrence in the health of a clinical trial subject who is administered a drug, that may or may not be caused by the administration of the drug, and includes an adverse drug reaction. (incident thérapeutique)

clinical trial means an investigation in respect of a drug for use in humans that involves human subjects and that is intended to discover or verify the clinical, pharmacological or pharmacodynamic effects of the drug, identify any adverse events in respect of the drug, study the absorption, distribution, metabolism and excretion of the drug, or ascertain the safety or efficacy of the drug. (essai clinique)
drug means a drug for human use that is to be tested in a clinical trial. (drogue)

good clinical practices means generally accepted clinical practices that are designed to ensure the protection of the rights, safety and well-being of clinical trial subjects and other persons, and the good clinical practices referred to in section C.05.010. (bonnes pratiques cliniques)
import means to import a drug into Canada for the purpose of sale in a clinical trial. (importer)
investigator’s brochure means, in respect of a drug, a document containing the preclinical and clinical data on the drug that are described in paragraph C.05.005(e). (brochure du chercheur)
protocol means a document that describes the objectives, design, methodology, statistical considerations and organization of a clinical trial. (protocole)

qualified investigator means the person responsible to the sponsor for the conduct of the clinical trial at a clinical trial site, who is entitled to provide health care under the laws of the province where that clinical trial site is located, and who is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a clinical trial respecting a drug to be used for dental purposes only, a physician or dentist and a member in good standing of a professional medical or dental association; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in any other case, a physician and a member in good standing of a professional medical association. (chercheur qualifié)

Definition.Text: research ethics board means a body that is not affiliated with the sponsor, and

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the principal mandate of which is to approve the initiation of, and conduct periodic reviews of, biomedical research involving human subjects in order to ensure the protection of their rights, safety and well-being; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that has at least five members, that has a majority of members who are Canadian citizens or permanent residents under the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, that is composed of both men and women and that includes at least

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: two members whose primary experience and expertise are in a scientific discipline, who have broad experience in the methods and areas of research to be approved and one of whom is from a medical discipline or, if the clinical trial is in respect of a drug to be used for dental purposes only, is from a medical or dental discipline,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: one member knowledgeable in ethics,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: one member knowledgeable in Canadian laws relevant to the biomedical research to be approved,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: one member whose primary experience and expertise are in a non-scientific discipline, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: one member who is from the community or is a representative of an organization interested in the areas of research to be approved and who is not affiliated with the sponsor or the site where the clinical trial is to be conducted. (comité d’éthique de la recherche)

Definition.Text: serious adverse drug reaction means an adverse drug reaction that requires in-patient hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization, that causes congenital malformation, that results in persistent or significant disability or incapacity, that is life threatening or that results in death. (réaction indésirable grave à une drogue)

serious unexpected adverse drug reaction means a serious adverse drug reaction that is not identified in nature, severity or frequency in the risk information set out in the investigator’s brochure or on the label of the drug. (réaction indésirable grave et imprévue à une drogue)
sponsor means an individual, corporate body, institution or organization that conducts a clinical trial. (promoteur)

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), this Division applies to the sale or importation of drugs to be used for the purposes of clinical trials involving human subjects.

Except for paragraph C.05.003(a), subsections C.05.006(2) and (3), paragraphs C.05.010(a) to (i), section C.05.011, subsections C.05.012(1) and (2), paragraphs C.05.012(3)(a) to (d) and (f) to (h), subsection C.05.012(4) and sections C.05.013, C.05.016 and C.05.017, this Division does not apply to the sale or importation of a drug for the purposes of a clinical trial authorized under subsection C.05.006(2).

Section.Label: C.05.003
Section.Text: Despite sections C.01.014, C.08.002, C.08.002.02 and C.08.003, no person shall sell or import a drug for the purposes of a clinical trial unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person is authorized under this Division;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the person complies with this Division and sections C.01.015, C.01.036, C.01.037 to C.01.040, C.01.040.2, C.01.064 to C.01.067, C.01.070, C.01.131, C.01.133 to C.01.136, and C.01.435; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the drug is to be imported, the person has a representative in Canada who is responsible for the sale of the drug.

Section.Label: C.05.004
Section.Text: Despite these Regulations, a sponsor may submit an application under this Division to sell or import a drug for the purposes of a clinical trial that contains a substance the sale of which is prohibited by these Regulations, if the sponsor establishes, on the basis of scientific information, that the inclusion of the substance in the drug may result in a therapeutic benefit for a human being.

Section.Label: C.05.005
Section.Text: An application by a sponsor for authorization to sell or import a drug for the purposes of a clinical trial under this Division shall be submitted to the Minister, signed and dated by the sponsor’s senior medical or scientific officer in Canada and senior executive officer and shall contain the following information and documents:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the protocol for the clinical trial;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the statement, as it will be set out in each informed consent form, that states the risks and anticipated benefits arising to the health of clinical trial subjects as a result of their participation in the clinical trial;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a clinical trial attestation, signed and dated by the sponsor’s senior medical or scientific officer in Canada and senior executive officer, containing

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the title of the protocol and the clinical trial number,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the brand name, the chemical name or the code for the drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the therapeutic and pharmacological classifications of the drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the medicinal ingredients of the drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
