Paragraph.Text: kept accurate records of the distribution of that new drug and of the results of the clinical testing and has made those records available to the Minister for inspection on the request of the Minister; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: immediately reported to the Minister all information he has obtained with respect to serious adverse reactions.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may notify the manufacturer of a new drug that sales of that new drug to qualified investigators are prohibited if, in the opinion of the Minister, it is in the interest of public health to do so.
Notwithstanding subsection (1), no manufacturer shall sell a new drug to a qualified investigator if the Minister has notified the manufacturer of that drug that such sales are prohibited.
Paragraph (1)(c) does not apply to a radiopharmaceutical as defined in section C.03.201 or to a component or kit as defined in section C.03.205.

Every manufacturer who files a new drug submission, an extraordinary use new drug submission, an abbreviated new drug submission, an abbreviated extraordinary use new drug submission, a supplement to any of those submissions or a submission for the clinical testing of a new drug for veterinary use shall, in addition to any information and material that is required under section C.08.002, C.08.002.01, C.08.002.1, C.08.003 or C.08.005, include in the submission or supplement

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a sectional report in respect of each human, animal and in vitro study included in the submission or supplement;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a comprehensive summary of each human, animal and in vitro study referred to or included in the submission or supplement; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a submission certificate in respect of all information and material contained in the submission or supplement and any additional information or material filed to amend the submission or supplement.

Subsection.Text: A sectional report referred to in paragraph (1)(b) shall include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a summary of each study included in the submission or supplement;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a summary of any additional information or material filed to amend the submission or supplement; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: where raw data is available to the manufacturer in respect of a study,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a summary of the data,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a cross-referencing of the data to the relevant portions of the sectional report,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a description of the conditions under which the experiments from which the data were obtained were conducted,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the details of the data treatment process, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the results and conclusions of the study.

Subsection.Text: The comprehensive summary referred to in paragraph (1)(c) shall include a summary of the methods used, results obtained and conclusions arrived at in respect of all studies referred to or included in the submission or supplement and shall be cross-referenced to the relevant portions of the sectional reports.
The submission certificate referred to in paragraph (1)(d) shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: certify that all information and material included in the submission or supplement and any additional information or material filed to amend the submission or supplement are accurate and complete, and that the sectional reports and the comprehensive summary correctly represent the information and material referred to or included in the submission or supplement; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: be signed and dated by

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the senior executive officer in Canada of the manufacturer filing the submission or supplement, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the senior medical or scientific officer of the manufacturer.

Subsection.Text: Every manufacturer who has filed a new drug submission, an extraordinary use new drug submission, an abbreviated new drug submission, an abbreviated extraordinary use new drug submission, a supplement to any of those submissions or a submission for the clinical testing of a new drug for veterinary use and who has any relating clinical case reports or raw data that were not included in the submission or supplement shall keep those reports or data and shall, within 30 days after receiving a written request from the Minister, submit them to the Minister.

For the purposes of subsection (2), evidence or new information obtained by the Minister includes any information or material filed by any person under Division 5 or section C.08.002, C.08.002.01, C.08.002.1, C.08.003, C.08.005 or C.08.005.1.

The Minister may, by notice to a manufacturer, suspend, for a definite or indefinite period, a notice of compliance issued to that manufacturer in respect of a new drug submission, an extraordinary use new drug submission, an abbreviated new drug submission, an abbreviated extraordinary use new drug submission or a supplement to any of those submissions if the Minister considers

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that the drug is not safe for the use represented in the submission or supplement, as shown by evidence obtained from

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: clinical or other experience not reported in the submission or supplement or not available to the Minister at the time the notice of compliance was issued, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: tests by new methods or tests by methods not reasonably applicable at the time the notice of compliance was issued;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that, upon the basis of new information obtained after the issuance of the notice of compliance, there is lack of substantial evidence that the drug will have the effect it is represented to have under the conditions of use prescribed, recommended or proposed by the manufacturer;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: that the submission or supplement contained an untrue statement of material fact;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: that the manufacturer has failed to establish a system for maintaining required records or has repeatedly or deliberately failed to maintain such records;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: that, on the basis of new information obtained after the issuance of the notice of compliance, the methods, equipment, plant and controls used in the manufacturing, processing and packaging of the drug are inadequate to assure and preserve the identity, strength, quality or purity of the new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: that, on the basis of new information obtained after the issuance of the notice of compliance, the labelling of the drug is false or misleading or incomplete in any particular and that this defect was not corrected by the manufacturer upon receipt of a written notice from the Minister specifying the respect in which the labelling is false or misleading or incomplete; or

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: that, in the case of a new drug for extraordinary use, the manufacturer has not adhered to the plan referred to in subparagraph C.08.002.01(2)(b)(ix).

Subsection.Text: The Minister may, by notice to a manufacturer, suspend for a definite or indefinite period a notice of compliance issued to that manufacturer in respect of a new drug submission, an extraordinary use new drug submission, an abbreviated new drug submission, an abbreviated extraordinary use new drug submission or a supplement to any of those submissions, if, after the Minister has, under section 21.31 of the Act, ordered the holder of a therapeutic product authorization referred to in subparagraph C.01.052(1)(b)(iii) to conduct an assessment of the new drug in order to provide evidence establishing that the benefits associated with the drug outweigh the risks of injury to health,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the holder fails to comply with the order; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the holder complies with the order but the Minister determines that the results of the assessment are not sufficient to establish that the benefits associated with the drug outweigh the risks of injury to health.

Subsection.Text: Where a manufacturer has received a notice of compliance issued in respect of a new drug submission, an extraordinary use new drug submission, an abbreviated new drug submission, an abbreviated extraordinary use new drug submission or a supplement to any of those submissions, the manufacturer shall establish and maintain records, in a manner that enables an audit to be made, respecting

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: animal or clinical experience, studies, investigations and tests conducted by the manufacturer or reported to him by any person concerning that new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: reports from the scientific literature or the bibliography therefrom that are available to him concerning that new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: experience, investigations, studies and tests involving the chemical or physical properties or any other properties of that new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: any substitution of another substance for that new drug or any mixing of another substance with that new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any error in the labelling of that new drug or in the use of the labels designed for that new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: any bacteriological or any significant chemical or physical or other change or deterioration in any lot of that new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: any failure of one or more distributed lots of the new drug to meet the specifications established for that new drug in the submission or supplement; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: any unusual failure in efficacy of that new drug.

Subsection.Text: The manufacturer shall retain the records respecting the information referred to in subsection (1) for at least seven years from the day on which they were established.

A manufacturer or importer who sells a new drug for extraordinary use in accordance with section C.08.002.02 shall retain the written order for at least 15 years from the day on which the order was filled.

Section.Label: C.08.008
Section.Text: No manufacturer shall sell a new drug unless the manufacturer has, with respect to all the manufacturer’s previous sales of that new drug, furnished to the Minister

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a summary of a record respecting any information referred to in paragraphs C.08.007(1)(a) to (c), on receipt of a request from the Minister for the summary;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a summary of a record respecting any information referred to in paragraph C.08.007(1)(d) to (f), immediately on the manufacturer establishing the record; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a summary of a record respecting any information referred to in paragraph C.08.007(1)(g) or (h), within 15 days after the day on which the manufacturer established the record.

Section.Label: C.08.008.1
Section.Text: Where a manufacturer has received a notice of compliance issued in respect of an extraordinary use new drug submission, an abbreviated extraordinary use new drug submission or a supplement to either of those submissions, the manufacturer

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall adhere to the plan referred to in subparagraph C.08.002.01(2)(b)(ix); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall, before the first day of October in each year and whenever requested to do so by the Minister for the purposes of assessing the safety and effectiveness of the drug to which the notice of compliance relates, provide a report on the use of the drug, including a critical analysis of any available updated information respecting the drug’s safety and effectiveness.

Subsection.Text: Where the Minister has decided

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to notify the manufacturer of a new drug for veterinary use that the sale of that drug to qualified investigators is prohibited, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to suspend a notice of compliance issued under section C.08.004 or C.08.004.01,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: the manufacturer, if dissatisfied with that decision, may require the Minister to provide him with the reasons for the decision.

Subsection.Text: Where the manufacturer has received the reasons for a decision of the Minister pursuant to subsection (1), he may require the Minister to refer that decision to a New Drug Committee and thereupon shall provide the Minister with a statement of the reasons for his dissatisfaction and any information and material upon which he relies in support of those reasons.

Where the Minister has been required to refer a decision to a New Drug Committee pursuant to subsection (2), he shall appoint a member of the New Drug Committee, the dissatisfied manufacturer shall appoint a member of the New Drug Committee and the two members so appointed shall appoint a third member of the New Drug Committee who shall be chairman, or, if they are unable to do so within a reasonable time, the Minister shall appoint a third member of the New Drug Committee who shall be chairman.
Any person who is in the full-time employment of the Department or in the full-time employment of the dissatisfied manufacturer shall not be appointed a member of a New Drug Committee.
A member of a New Drug Committee shall, on appointment, sign an undertaking not to disclose or use any information, material, data, evidence or representations considered pursuant to subsection (6).

The Minister shall pay the reasonable fees and costs incurred by the member of the New Drug Committee appointed by the Minister, and the dissatisfied manufacturer shall pay the reasonable fees and costs incurred by the member appointed by the dissatisfied manufacturer, and the Minister and the dissatisfied manufacturer shall each pay half of the reasonable fees and costs incurred by the chairman.

The New Drug Committee formed pursuant to subsection (3) shall consider the reasons for the decision of the Minister, the reasons for the dissatisfaction of the dissatisfied manufacturer and any information or material in support of the reasons of the Minister or the dissatisfied manufacturer and may consider other evidence, material, information or representations.
The New Drug Committee formed pursuant to subsection (3) shall report its findings and recommendations to the Minister.
No member of a New Drug Committee shall disclose or use any information, material, data, evidence or representations considered pursuant to subsection (6).
Where the Minister has received the findings and recommendations of a New Drug Committee, he may reconsider the decision to which those findings and recommendations relate.

Heading.TitleText: Disclosure of Information in Respect of Clinical Trials

Subsection.Text: In sections C.08.009.2 and C.08.009.3, information in respect of a clinical trial means information in respect of a clinical trial, within the meaning of section C.05.001, that is contained in a new drug submission, an extraordinary use new drug submission, an abbreviated new drug submission or an abbreviated extraordinary use new drug submission for a new drug for human use filed under section C.08.002, C.08.002.01 or C.08.002.1 or in a supplement to any of those submissions filed under section C.08.003.

For greater certainty, the definition information in respect of a clinical trial includes information that is contained in a submission or supplement referred to in that definition and that is in respect of clinical testing involving human subjects in regards to which an application was filed under this Division before September 1, 2001.

Information in respect of a clinical trial that is confidential business information ceases to be confidential business information when one of the following circumstances occurs with respect to the submission or supplement:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister issues a notice of compliance under section C.08.004 or C.08.004.01;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where the Minister issues a notice to the manufacturer under paragraph C.08.004(1)(b) or C.08.004.01(1)(b) and the manufacturer does not amend the submission or supplement under subsection C.08.004(2) or C.08.004.01(2), the applicable period referred to in the relevant subsection expires;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister issues a notice to the manufacturer under paragraph C.08.004(3)(b) or C.08.004.01(3)(b).

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply to information in respect of a clinical trial that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: was not used by the manufacturer in the submission or supplement to support the proposed conditions of use for the new drug or the purpose for which the new drug is recommended; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: describes tests, methods or assays that are used exclusively by the manufacturer.

Section.Label: C.08.009.3
Section.Text: The Minister may disclose, without notifying the person to whose business or affairs the information relates or obtaining their consent, any information in respect of a clinical trial that has ceased to be confidential business information.

Heading.TitleText: Sale of New Drug for Emergency Treatment

Subsection.Text: The Minister may issue a letter of authorization authorizing the sale of a quantity of a new drug for human or veterinary use to a practitioner named in the letter of authorization for use in the emergency treatment of a patient under the care of that practitioner, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the practitioner has supplied to the Minister information concerning

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the medical emergency for which the drug is required,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the data in the possession of the practitioner with respect to the use, safety and efficacy of that drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the names of all institutions in which the drug is to be used, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: such other data as the Minister may require; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the practitioner has agreed to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: report to the manufacturer of the new drug and to the Minister on the results of the use of the drug in the medical emergency, including information respecting any adverse reactions encountered, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: account to the Minister on request for all quantities of the drug received by him.

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall not issue a letter of authorization under subsection (1) for a new drug that is or that contains a restricted drug as defined in section J.01.001.
The Minister shall, in any letter of authorization issued pursuant to subsection (1), state

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the practitioner to whom the new drug may be sold;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the medical emergency in respect of which the new drug may be sold; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of the new drug that may be sold to that practitioner for that emergency.

Subsection.Text: Notwithstanding section C.08.002, a manufacturer may sell to a practitioner named in a letter of authorization issued pursuant to section C.08.010, a quantity of the new drug named in that letter that does not exceed the quantity specified in the letter.
A sale of a new drug made in accordance with subsection (1) is exempt from the provisions of the Act and these Regulations.
Notwithstanding anything in this Division, a person may sell, pursuant to a written prescription of a veterinary practitioner, a medicated feed if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: as regards the drug or drugs used as the medicating ingredient of the medicated feed,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the Minister has assigned a drug identification number pursuant to section C.01.014.2, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the sale is permitted by section C.08.005, C.08.011 or C.08.013;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the medicated feed is for the treatment of animals under the direct care of the veterinary practitioner who signed the prescription;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the medicated feed is for therapeutic purposes only; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the written prescription contains the following information:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of the person named on the prescription as the person for whom the medicated feed is to be mixed,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the species, production type and age or weight of the animals to be treated with the medicated feed,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the type and amount of medicated feed to be mixed,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the proper name, or the common name if there is no proper name, of the drug or each of the drugs, as the case may be, to be used as medicating ingredients in the preparation of the medicated feed, and the dosage levels of those medicating ingredients,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: any special mixing instructions, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: labelling instructions including

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: feeding instructions,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: a warning statement respecting the withdrawal period to be observed following the use of the medicated feed, and

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: where applicable, cautions with respect to animal health or to the handling or storage of the medicated feed.

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of this section, medicated feed has the same meaning as in the Feeds Regulations.

Notwithstanding anything in this Division, a person may sell a new drug proposed for use in animals to an experimental studies investigator in a quantity specified by the Minister for the purpose of conducting an experimental study in animals if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the experimental studies investigator has been issued an experimental studies certificate pursuant to subsection C.08.015(1) and the certificate has not been suspended or cancelled pursuant to section C.08.018; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the drug is labelled in accordance with subsection C.08.016(1).

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this section and sections C.08.014 to C.08.018,

Definition.Text: experimental studies certificate means a certificate issued pursuant to subsection C.08.015(1); (certificat d’études expérimentales)
experimental studies investigator means a person named as the investigator in an experimental studies certificate; (expert en études expérimentales)
experimental study means a limited test of a new drug in animals carried out by an experimental studies investigator. (étude expérimentale)

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of obtaining an experimental studies certificate, an applicant shall submit to the Minister, in writing, the following information and material:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the brand name of the new drug or the identifying name or code proposed for the new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the objectives and an outline of the proposed experimental study of the new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the species, number and production type of animals in respect of which the new drug is to be administered;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the manufacturer of the new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the address of the premises in which the experimental study is to be conducted;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the facilities to be used to conduct the experimental study;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the name, address and qualifications of the proposed experimental studies investigator;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the chemical structure, if known, and the relevant compositional characteristics of the new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed quantity of the new drug to be used for the experimental study;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the results of any toxicological or pharmacological studies that may have been conducted with the new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: the written agreement referred to in subsection (2); and

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: such other information and material as the Minister may require.

Subsection.Text: Where a food-producing animal is involved in an experimental study, the applicant referred to in subsection (1) shall, for the purposes of obtaining an experimental studies certificate, obtain from the owner of the animals, or from a person authorized by the owner, a written agreement not to sell the animal or any products from it without prior authorization from the experimental studies investigator.

The Minister may request the manufacturer of a new drug to submit to him samples of the new drug or of any ingredient of the drug and, in satisfactory form and manner, any other information that the Minister requests and where such samples or information are not submitted, the Minister may refuse to issue an experimental studies certificate.
Where, on receipt of the information and material submitted pursuant to section C.08.014, the Minister is satisfied that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant is qualified as an experimental studies investigator for the purposes of the proposed experimental study,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the facilities for the conduct of the experimental study are adequate for the purposes of the proposed experimental study, and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed experimental study can be conducted without undue foreseeable risk to humans or animals,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: the Minister shall issue an experimental studies certificate for the purposes of the proposed experimental study and shall specify therein the quantity of the new drug that may be sold to the experimental studies investigator.

Subsection.Text: If, on receipt of the information and material submitted under section C.08.014, the Minister is not satisfied that the requirements of paragraphs (1)(a), (b) and (c) have been met, he or she shall refuse to issue an experimental studies certificate.
The label of a new drug that is sold pursuant to section C.08.013 shall show

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the brand name of the new drug or the identifying name or code proposed for the new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a warning statement to the effect that the drug is for use only in an experimental study in animals;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the lot number of the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the manufacturer of the drug; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the person to whom the drug has been supplied.

Subsection.Text: Sections C.01.004, C.01.005 and C.01.014 do not apply to a drug that is sold pursuant to section C.08.013 and labelled in accordance with subsection (1).

Section.Label: C.08.017
Section.Text: An experimental studies investigator shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: use the new drug only in accordance with the outline of the experimental study;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: report immediately to the Minister all serious adverse drug reactions associated with the use of the new drug;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: report promptly to the Minister, on request, the results of the experimental study;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: return to the manufacturer, on request, all quantities of the new drug not used in the experimental study;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: maintain all records of the experimental study for a period of at least two years after the conclusion of the study and, on request, make such records available to the Minister;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: report promptly to the Minister any known disposition of animals involved in the study or of any products from the animals that is contrary to the terms of the agreement referred to in subsection C.08.014(2); and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: account to the Minister, on request, for all quantities of the new drug received by him.

Heading.TitleText: Suspension or Cancellation of Experimental Studies Certificate

Subsection.Text: If the Minister determines that it is necessary in order to safeguard animal health or public health or to promote public safety, he or she may suspend for a definite or indefinite period or cancel an experimental studies certificate.
Without limiting the generality of subsection (1), the Minister may suspend or cancel an experimental studies certificate if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the information and material submitted pursuant to section C.08.014 contains an untrue statement or contains any omission concerning the properties of the drug that were known or ought reasonably to have been known to the manufacturer or the experimental studies investigator;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the labelling of the new drug is, at any time, false, misleading, deceptive or incomplete;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the qualifications of the experimental studies investigator prove to be inadequate;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: there is evidence that the experimental studies investigator has not complied with the conditions referred to in section C.08.017; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: an action of the manufacturer in respect of the new drug has resulted in his conviction for a violation of section C.08.002.

Section.Label: C.09.001
Section.Text: This Division does not apply to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a drug that is required by these Regulations or the Narcotic Control Regulations to be sold only on prescription; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a drug for use exclusively in animals.

Section.Label: C.09.010
Section.Text: No manufacturer or importer shall, after June 30, 1986, sell a drug for analgesia that contains a combination of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a salt or derivative of salicylic acid with another salt or derivative of salicylic acid or with salicylamide; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: acetaminophen with a salt or derivative of salicylic acid or with salicylamide.

Section.Label: C.09.011
Section.Text: Each label of a drug that is intended for internal use and contains acetaminophen, salicylic acid or a salt or derivative thereof shall, after June 30, 1986, carry a caution

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to consult a physician if the underlying condition requires continued use for more than five days; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that it is hazardous to exceed the maximum recommended dose unless advised by a physician.

Section.Label: C.09.012
Section.Text: Each label of a drug that is intended for internal use and contains salicylic acid or a salt or derivative thereof shall after June 30, 1986, carry a warning statement to consult a physician before taking the drug during the last three months of pregnancy or when nursing.

Subsection.Text: The adult standard dosage unit of acetaminophen shall be 325 mg.
The children’s standard dosage units of acetaminophen shall be 80 mg or 160 mg.
In this Division, acetaminophen product means a drug that contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: acetaminophen as a single medicinal ingredient; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: acetaminophen in combination with caffeine.

Subsection.Text: No manufacturer or importer shall sell an acetaminophen product unless it meets the requirements of this Division.

Subject to subsections (2) to (4), an acetaminophen product sold in the form of a tablet, capsule or other solid dosage form intended for oral administration shall contain one adult standard dosage unit of acetaminophen per individual dosage form.

An acetaminophen product in the form of a tablet, capsule or other solid dosage form intended for oral administration may contain 500 mg of acetaminophen per individual dosage form if it has a label that states that it is not a standard dosage unit product.

An acetaminophen product sold in the form of a tablet, capsule or other solid dosage form that is intended for oral administration may contain 325 mg of acetaminophen for immediate release and another 325 mg for subsequent release, if it has a label that states that it is not a standard dosage unit product.

An acetaminophen product sold in the form of a tablet, capsule or other solid dosage form that is intended for oral administration and that is specially recommended for children shall contain one children’s standard dosage unit of acetaminophen per individual dosage form.

An acetaminophen product in the form of a liquid that is intended to be taken as drops and that is specially recommended for children shall contain one children’s standard dosage unit of acetaminophen per millilitre of the product.
A package of an acetaminophen product described in subsection (5) shall be accompanied by a measuring device capable of accurately delivering 0.5 mL of the product.

An acetaminophen product in the form of a liquid that is not intended to be taken as drops and that is specially recommended for children shall contain one children’s standard dosage unit per teaspoon of the product.
An acetaminophen product in the form of a liquid shall contain one adult standard dosage unit of acetaminophen per teaspoon of the product.
The adult standard dosage unit of a salicylate shall be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of acetylsalicylic acid, sodium salicylate and magnesium salicylate, 325 mg; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of choline salicylate, 435 mg.

Subsection.Text: The children’s standard dosage unit of a salicylate shall be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of acetylsalicylic acid, sodium salicylate and magnesium salicylate, 80 mg; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of choline salicylate, 110 mg.

Subsection.Text: In this Division, salicylate product means a drug that contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a salt or derivative of salicylic acid as a single medicinal ingredient;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a salt or derivative of salicylic acid in combination with caffeine;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a salt or derivative of salicylic acid in combination with one or more buffering agents or antacids; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a salt or derivative of salicylic acid in combination with caffeine and one or more buffering agents or antacids.

Subsection.Text: No manufacturer or importer shall sell a salicylate product after June 30, 1986 unless it meets the requirements of this Division.

No manufacturer or importer shall, until June 30, 1986, sell a salicylate product in a dosage unit other than one mentioned in this Division, unless the salicylate product was legally available for sale in Canada on February 1, 1984.

Subject to subsections (2) and (3) and section C.09.035, a salicylate product in the form of a tablet, capsule or other solid dosage form intended for oral administration shall contain one adult standard dosage unit of a salicylate per individual dosage form.
A salicylate product in the form of a tablet, capsule or other solid dosage form intended for oral administration may contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: 500 mg of acetylsalicylic acid, sodium salicylate or magnesium salicylate, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 670 mg of choline salicylate

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: per individual dosage form if it has a label that states that it is not a standard dosage unit product.

Subsection.Text: A salicylate product in the form of a tablet, capsule or other solid dosage form intended for oral administration may contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: two adult standard dosage units of a salicylate per individual dosage form if the label of the salicylate product states that each individual dosage form contains two adult standard dosage units; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: three adult standard dosage units of a salicylate per individual dosage form if the label of the salicylate product states that each individual dosage form contains three adult standard dosage units.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), a salicylate product in the form of a liquid shall contain one adult standard dosage unit of a salicylate per teaspoon.
A salicylate product in the form of a liquid may contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: two adult standard dosage units of a salicylate per teaspoon if the label of the salicylate product states that each teaspoon of the product contains two adult standard dosage units; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: three adult standard dosage units of a salicylate per teaspoon if the label of the salicylate product states that each teaspoon of the product contains three adult standard dosage units.

Section.Label: C.09.034
Section.Text: A salicylate product that is claimed to be buffered shall provide at least 1.9 milliequivalents of acid neutralizing capacity per adult standard dosage unit of a salicylate.

Section.Label: C.09.035
Section.Text: A salicylate product in the form of a tablet, capsule or other solid dosage form intended for oral administration and that is specially recommended for children shall contain one children’s standard dosage unit of a salicylate per individual dosage form.

Heading.Label: DIVISION 10
Heading.TitleText: Access to Drugs in Exceptional Circumstances

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in this section.

Definition.Text: foreign regulatory authority means a government agency or other entity outside Canada that has a legal right to control the manufacturing, use or sale of drugs within its jurisdiction. (autorité réglementaire étrangère)
public health official means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Chief Public Health Officer appointed under subsection 6(1) of the Public Health Agency of Canada Act;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Chief Medical Officer of Health, or equivalent, of a province;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Surgeon General of the Canadian Armed Forces; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the Chief Medical Officer of Public Health for the First Nations and Inuit Health Branch of the Department of Health. (responsable de la santé publique)

Subsection.Text: Despite sections A.01.040 and C.01.004.1, any person who holds an establishment licence that authorizes the importation of a drug may import a drug for which a notice of compliance has not been issued under section C.08.004 or C.08.004.01, or for which a drug identification number has not been assigned under subsection C.01.014.2(1), if the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a public health official has, within the past year, notified the Minister in writing of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: an urgent public health need for the immediate use of the drug within their jurisdiction, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the intended use or purpose of the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the drug is authorized by a foreign regulatory authority in the United States, Switzerland or the European Union to be sold for the same use or purpose as that described under subparagraph (a)(ii);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the drug is in the same category as the category for which the licence was issued;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the drug is imported directly from the country in which it is authorized to be sold by the foreign regulatory authority; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the drug is one for which the following information is set out in the List of Drugs for an Urgent Public Health Need that is published by the Government of Canada on its website, as amended from time to time:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: brand name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: medicinal ingredients,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: dosage form,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: strength,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: route of administration, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: identifying code or number, if any, assigned in the country in which the drug was authorized for sale.

Subsection.Text: Sections C.01A.006 and C.01A.007 do not apply in respect of the importation of a drug under subsection (2).
For greater certainty, a licensee may, despite subsection C.01A.004(1), import a drug under subsection (2) without having their licence amended under section C.01A.006.
Divisions 2 to 4, other than the following provisions, do not apply to the importation of a drug under subsection (2):

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sections C.02.003.1 and C.02.004 as they apply to the storage of the drug by the licensee;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: section C.02.006;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: subsection C.02.012(1);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: sections C.02.013 and C.02.014;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: section C.02.015 as it applies to the storage and transportation of the drug by the licensee;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: subsection C.02.021(1) as it applies to the storage of the drug by the licensee;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: subsection C.02.022(1);

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: section C.02.023;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: subsections C.02.024(1) and C.02.025(1);

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: section C.03.013; and

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: section C.04.001.1 as it applies to the storage of the drug by the licensee.

Subsection.Text: A sale of a drug that is imported under subsection C.10.001(2) is exempt from the provisions of these Regulations only if the drug is sold, within the jurisdiction of a public health official who has notified the Minister as described in paragraph C.10.001(2)(a), for use in respect of the same urgent public health need for which it was imported.

Any person who wholesales such a drug must hold an establishment licence to wholesale a drug in the same category and despite subsection (1), the following provisions apply in respect of the wholesale:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sections C.02.003.1 and C.02.004 as they apply to the storage of the drug by the licensee;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: section C.02.006 as it applies to the storage of the drug by the licensee;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: subsection C.02.012(1);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: section C.02.013;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: section C.02.015 as it applies to the storage and transportation of the drug by the licensee;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: subsection C.02.022(1);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: section C.02.023; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: subsection C.02.024(1).

Section.Label: C.10.003
Section.Text: Every licensee who imports a drug under subsection C.10.001(2) must notify the Minister within 15 days after the day on which it is imported by providing the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name, title and contact information of the person who imported the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the brand name of the drug;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the medicinal ingredients, strength, dosage form, route of administration and the identifying code or number, if any assigned in the country in which the drug was authorized for sale;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the country from which the drug was imported; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the total quantity of the drug imported.

Subsection.Text: In this Part,

Definition.Text: advertise means to advertise to the general public; (faire de la publicité)
brand name means, with reference to a drug, the name, whether or not including the name of any manufacturer, corporation, partnership or individual, in English or French,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that is assigned to the drug by its manufacturer,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: under which the drug is sold or advertised, and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: that is used to distinguish the drug; (marque nominative)

Definition.Text: common name means, with reference to a salt or derivative of a vitamin, the name in English or French by which the salt or derivative is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: commonly known, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: designated in scientific or technical journals; (nom usuel)

Definition.Text: prepackaged product means any food that is contained in a package in the manner in which it is ordinarily sold to, or used or purchased by, a person; (produit préemballé)
reasonable daily intake, in respect of a food named in an item in Column I of Schedule K, means the amount of that food set out in Column II of that item; (ration quotidienne normale)
Table of Daily Values has the same meaning as in subsection B.01.001(1); (Tableau des valeurs quotidiennes)
Table of Reference Amounts has the same meaning as in subsection B.01.001(1); (Tableau des quantités de référence)

testimonial, with respect to a food or drug that is represented as containing a vitamin, mineral nutrient or mineral, means any dramatized or undramatized pictorial, written or oral representation as to the result that is, has been or may be produced by the addition to a person’s diet of that vitamin, mineral nutrient or mineral, as the case may be; (témoignage)

weighted recommended nutrient intake means, in respect of a vitamin or mineral nutrient, the amount of the vitamin or mineral nutrient set out in Table II to Division 1 and Table II to Division 2. (apport nutritionnel recommandé pondéré)

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this Part, a serving of stated size of a food shall be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: based on the food as offered for sale;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in either of the following cases, the net quantity of the food in the package:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if the quantity of food in the package can reasonably be consumed by one person at a single eating occasion, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the package contains less than 200% of the reference amount for the food; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in all other cases, the amount indicated for the food according to the criteria set out in column 3A of the Table of Reference Amounts.

Subsection.Text: A serving of stated size of a food shall be expressed as follows:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a single-serving prepackaged product to which paragraph (2)(b) applies, per package and using the following units:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in grams, if the net quantity of the food is shown on the label by weight or by count, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in millilitres, if the net quantity of the food is shown on the label by volume; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a multiple-serving prepackaged product to which paragraph (2)(c) applies, according to the following units set out in column 3B of the Table of Reference Amounts and according to the manner set out in that column:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the household measure that applies to the product, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the metric measure that applies to the product.

Subsection.Text: The daily value of a vitamin or mineral nutrient set out in column 1 of Part 2 of the Table of Daily Values is, in respect of a food, the quantity

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: set out in column 2, if the food is intended solely for infants six months of age or older but less than one year of age;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: set out in column 3, if the food is intended for infants six months of age or older but less than one year of age or for children one year of age or older but less than four years of age, and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: set out in column 4, in any other case.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply if the food is a human milk substitute intended solely for infants less than six months of age.
In this Division, vitamin means any of the following vitamins:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: vitamin A;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: vitamin D;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: vitamin E;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: vitamin K;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: vitamin C;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: thiamin, thiamine or vitamin B1;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: riboflavin or vitamin B2;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: niacin;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: vitamin B6;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: folacin or folate;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: vitamin B12;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: pantothenic acid or pantothenate;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: biotin; and

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: choline. (vitamin)

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this Division, no expression, other than an expression set out in subsection (1), shall be used to declare the vitamin content of a food.
This Division applies only in respect of foods represented as containing a vitamin for use in human nutrition.

For the purposes of these Regulations, the vitamin content of a food, other than a formulated liquid diet, a human milk substitute or a food represented as containing a human milk substitute, shall be determined

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of vitamin A, in terms of the content of retinol and its derivatives and beta-carotene, calculated on the basis of micrograms of retinol activity equivalents (RAE) and expressed in micrograms on the basis of the following relationships:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 1 RAE = 1 microgram of retinol, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: 1 RAE = 12 micrograms of beta-carotene;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of vitamin D, in terms of the content of cholecalciferol and ergocalciferol, expressed in micrograms;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of vitamin E, in terms of the content of d-alpha-tocopherol and dl-alpha-tocopherol and their derivatives, expressed in milligrams on the basis of the following relationships:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: one milligram d-alpha-tocopherol = one milligram vitamin E, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: one milligram dl-alpha-tocopherol = 0.74 milligram vitamin E;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of vitamin K, in terms of the content of phylloquinone and menaquinones, expressed in micrograms;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of vitamin C, in terms of the content of L-ascorbic acid and L-dehydroascorbic acid and their derivatives, calculated in milligram equivalents of L-ascorbic acid and expressed in milligrams;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of thiamin, thiamine or vitamin B1, and its derivatives, in terms of the content of thiamin, expressed in milligrams;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of riboflavin or vitamin B2 and its derivatives, in terms of the content of riboflavin, expressed in milligrams;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of niacin, in terms of the content of niacin and its derivatives, calculated in milligrams of nicotinic acid, plus the content of tryptophan, calculated in milligrams and divided by 60, with the total niacin equivalents (NE) expressed in milligrams;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of vitamin B6, in terms of the content of pyridoxine, pyridoxal and pyridoxamine and their derivatives, calculated in milligram equivalents of pyridoxine and expressed in milligrams;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of folate, in terms of the content of folic acid (pteroylmonoglutamic acid) and related compounds exhibiting the biological activity of folic acid, calculated and expressed in micrograms of dietary folate equivalents (DFE);

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of vitamin B12, in terms of the content of cyanocobalamin and related compounds exhibiting the biological activity of cyanocobalamin, calculated in microgram equivalents of cyanocobalamin and expressed in micrograms;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of pantothenic acid or pantothenate, in terms of the content of d-pantothenic acid, expressed in milligrams;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of biotin, in terms of the content of biotin, expressed in micrograms; and

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of choline, in terms of the content of choline, expressed in milligrams.

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of paragraph (1)(h), the content of tryptophan may be calculated

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: where the protein originates from a food that contains protein from more than one source or from a source other than milk, meat, poultry, fish or eggs, as constituting 1.1 per cent of the protein;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where the protein originates from milk, meat, poultry or fish, as constituting 1.3 per cent of the protein; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: where the protein originates from eggs, as constituting 1.5 per cent of the protein.

Subsection.Text: No person shall, on the label of or in any advertisement for a food, other than a formulated liquid diet, a human milk substitute or a food represented as containing a human milk substitute, make a statement or claim concerning the vitamin content of the food unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the vitamin is set out in column 1 of Part 2 of the Table of Daily Values;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the percentage of the daily value of the vitamin, per serving of stated size, is 5% or more; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the vitamin content is declared on the label or in the advertisement as a percentage of the daily value, per serving of stated size.

Subsection.Text: The condition set out in paragraph (1)(c) need not be met if the statement or claim described in subsection (1) is made on a label of or in any advertisement for a fresh vegetable or fruit or any combination of fresh vegetables or fruits without any added ingredients, an orange with added food colour or a fresh vegetable or fruit coated with mineral oil, paraffin wax, petrolatum or any other protective coating.

If a statement or claim described in subsection (1) is made in an advertisement for a food that is not a prepackaged product or in an advertisement for a prepackaged product that is not made or placed by or on the direction of the manufacturer of the product, the percentage of the daily value, per serving of stated size, shall,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an advertisement, other than a radio or television advertisement, be

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: adjacent to, without any intervening printed, written or graphic material, the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or the most prominent statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made more than once, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: shown in letters of at least the same size and prominence as those of the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or the most prominent statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made more than once;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a radio advertisement or the audio portion of a television advertisement, immediately precede or follow the statement or claim; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a television advertisement, be communicated

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the audio mode, if the statement or claim is made only in the audio portion of the advertisement or in both the audio and visual portions, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the audio or visual mode, if the statement or claim is made only in the visual portion of the advertisement.

Subsection.Text: The percentage of the daily value, per serving of stated size, that is communicated in the visual mode of a television advertisement in accordance with subparagraph (2)(c)(ii) shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: appear concurrently with and for at least the same amount of time as the statement or claim;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: be adjacent to, without any intervening printed, written or graphic material, the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or the most prominent statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made more than once; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: be shown in letters of at least the same size and prominence as those of the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or the most prominent statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made more than once.

Subsection.Text: Paragraph (1)(b) does not apply in respect of a declaration of the vitamin content in a nutrition facts table.
Paragraph (1)(c) does not apply to a declaration of the biotin content as required by subparagraph B.24.202(a)(vi).

Section.Label: D.01.006
Section.Text: No person shall, on the label of or in any advertisement for a food, make any claim concerning the action or effects of a vitamin contained in the food, except to the effect that the vitamin

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is a factor in the maintenance of good health; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is generally recognized as an aid in maintaining the functions of the body necessary to the maintenance of good health and normal growth and development.

Subsection.Text: If a component of an ingredient of a prepackaged product set out in the table to subsection B.01.009(1) is a vitamin, no person shall, on the label of or in any advertisement for the prepackaged product, make a statement or claim concerning the vitamin as a component of that ingredient unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: despite subsection B.01.008.2(6), the vitamin is declared by its common name, and that common name is shown in parentheses immediately after the ingredient in respect of which it is a component, except that if a source of a food allergen or gluten is required by paragraph B.01.010.1(8)(a) to be shown immediately after that ingredient, the common name of the vitamin is instead shown immediately after that source; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: all components of the ingredient are declared.

Subsection.Text: Paragraph (1)(b) does not apply to flour used as an ingredient in the manufacture of a prepackaged product referred to in subsection (1).

Section.Label: D.01.009
Section.Text: Subject to section D.01.010, no person shall sell a food to which any of the following vitamins have been added unless a reasonable daily intake of that food by a person would result in the daily intake by such person of not less than,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of vitamin A, 1,600 International Units;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of thiamine, 0.6 milligram;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of riboflavin, 1.0 milligram;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of niacin or niacinamide, six milligrams;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of ascorbic acid, 20 milligrams; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of vitamin D, 300 International Units.

Section.Label: D.01.010
Section.Text: Where a food to which a vitamin has been added is represented as being solely for use in the feeding of children under two years of age, no person shall sell such food unless a reasonable daily intake of that food by a child under two years of age would result in the daily intake by the child of not less than,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of vitamin A, 1,000 International Units;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of thiamine, 0.4 milligram;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of riboflavin, 0.6 milligram;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of niacin or niacinamide, four milligrams;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of pyridoxine, 0.6 milligram;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of ascorbic acid, 20 milligrams;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of vitamin D, 300 International Units; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of vitamin E, five International Units.

Section.Label: D.01.011
Section.Text: No person shall sell a food to which any of the following vitamins have been added if a reasonable daily intake of that food by a person would result in the daily intake by such person of more than,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of vitamin A, 2,500 International Units;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of thiamine, two milligrams;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of riboflavin, three milligrams;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of niacin or niacinamide, 20 milligrams;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of pyridoxine, 1.5 milligrams;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of ascorbic acid, 60 milligrams;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of vitamin D, 400 International Units; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of vitamin E, 15 International Units.

Section.Label: D.01.012
Section.Text: No person shall, in advertising a food that is represented as containing a vitamin or on a label of such food,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: give any assurance or guarantee of any kind with respect to the result that may be, has been or will be obtained by the addition of the vitamin to a person’s diet; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: refer to, reproduce or quote any testimonial.

table.title: Weighted Recommended Nutrient Intake

Subsection.Text: In this Division, mineral nutrient means any of the following chemical elements, whether alone or in a compound with one or more other chemical elements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sodium;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: potassium;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: calcium;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: phosphorus;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: magnesium;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: iron;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: zinc;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: iodide;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: chloride;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: copper;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: fluoride;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: manganese;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: chromium;

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: selenium;

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: cobalt;

Paragraph.Label: (p)
Paragraph.Text: molybdenum;

Paragraph.Label: (q)
Paragraph.Text: tin;

Paragraph.Label: (r)
Paragraph.Text: vanadium;

Paragraph.Label: (s)
Paragraph.Text: silicon; and

Paragraph.Label: (t)
Paragraph.Text: nickel. (minéral nutritif)

Subsection.Text: This Division applies only in respect of foods that are represented as containing a mineral nutrient for use in human nutrition.

No person shall, on the label of or in any advertisement for a food, other than salt for table or general household use containing added iodide, prepackaged water and ice, a formulated liquid diet, a human milk substitute or a food represented as containing a human milk substitute, make a statement or claim concerning the mineral nutrient content of the food unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the mineral nutrient is set out in column 1 of Part 2 of the Table of Daily Values;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the percentage of the daily value of the mineral nutrient, per serving of stated size, is 5% or more; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the mineral nutrient content is declared on the label or in the advertisement as a percentage of the daily value, per serving of stated size.

Subsection.Text: The condition set out in paragraph (1)(c) need not be met if the statement or claim described in subsection (1) is made on a label of or in any advertisement for a fresh vegetable or fruit or any combination of fresh vegetables or fruits without any added ingredients, an orange with added food colour or a fresh vegetable or fruit coated with mineral oil, paraffin wax, petrolatum or any other protective coating.

If a statement or claim described in subsection (1) is made in an advertisement for a food that is not a prepackaged product or in an advertisement for a prepackaged product that is not made or placed by or on the direction of the manufacturer of the product, the percentage of the daily value, per serving of stated size, shall,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an advertisement, other than a radio or television advertisement, be

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: adjacent to, without any intervening printed, written or graphic material, the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or the most prominent statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made more than once, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: shown in letters of at least the same size and prominence as those of the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or the most prominent statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made more than once;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a radio advertisement or the audio portion of a television advertisement, immediately precede or follow the statement or claim; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a television advertisement, be communicated

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the audio mode, if the statement or claim is made only in the audio portion of the advertisement or in both the audio and visual portions, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the audio or visual mode, if the statement or claim is made only in the visual portion of the advertisement.

Subsection.Text: The percentage of the daily value, per serving of stated size, that is communicated in the visual mode of a television advertisement in accordance with subparagraph (2)(c)(ii) shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: appear concurrently with and for at least the same amount of time as the statement or claim;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: be adjacent to, without any intervening printed, written or graphic material, the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or the most prominent statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made more than once; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: be shown in letters of at least the same size and prominence as those of the statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made only once, or the most prominent statement or claim, if the statement or claim is made more than once.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply to a statement or claim made in respect of the sodium or potassium content.
Paragraphs (1)(a) and (c) do not apply in respect of a declaration of the total fluoride ion content as required by sections B.12.002 and B.12.008.
Paragraph (1)(b) does not apply in respect of a declaration of the mineral nutrient content in a nutrition facts table.
Paragraph (1)(c) does not apply in respect of a declaration of the chromium, copper, manganese, molybdenum and selenium content as required by subparagraph B.24.202(a)(v).

Section.Label: D.02.004
Section.Text: No person shall, on the label of or in any advertisement for a food, make any claim concerning the action or effects of a mineral nutrient contained in the food, except to the effect that the mineral nutrient

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is a factor in the maintenance of good health; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is generally recognized as an aid in maintaining the functions of the body necessary to the maintenance of good health and normal growth and development.

Subsection.Text: If a component of an ingredient of a prepackaged product set out in the table to subsection B.01.009(1) is a mineral nutrient, no person shall, on the label of or in any advertisement for the prepackaged product, make a statement or claim concerning the mineral nutrient as a component of that ingredient unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: despite subsection B.01.008.2(6), the mineral nutrient is declared by its common name, and that common name is shown in parentheses immediately after the ingredient in respect of which it is a component, except that if a source of a food allergen or gluten is required by paragraph B.01.010.1(8)(a) to be shown immediately after that ingredient, the common name of the mineral nutrient is instead shown immediately after that source; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: all components of the ingredient are declared.

Subsection.Text: Paragraph (1)(b) does not apply to flour used as an ingredient in the manufacture of a prepackaged product referred to in subsection (1).

Section.Label: D.02.008
Section.Text: No person shall, in advertising a food that is represented as containing a mineral nutrient or on a label of such food,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: give any assurance or guarantee of any kind with respect to the result that may be, has been or will be obtained by the addition of the mineral nutrient to a person’s diet; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: refer to, reproduce or quote any testimonial.

Section.Label: D.02.009
Section.Text: No person shall sell a food to which any of the following mineral nutrients have been added unless a reasonable daily intake of that food by a person would result in the daily intake by such person of not less than,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of calcium, 300 milligrams;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of phosphorus, 300 milligrams;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of iron, four milligrams; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of iodine, 0.10 milligram.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell elemental iron powder for use in foods as a source of iron as a mineral nutrient unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: subject to paragraph (b), the powder meets the specifications for

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: Iron, Carbonyl,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: Iron, Electrolytic, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: Iron, Reduced,

ContinuedParagraph.Text: as set out in the Food Chemicals Codex, Third Edition, 1981, published by the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of Iron, Reduced, 100 per cent by weight of the particles pass through a 100 mesh sieve and at least 95 per cent by weight of the particles pass through a 325 mesh sieve.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell a food to which elemental iron powder has been added as a source of iron as a mineral nutrient unless the powder meets the requirements referred to in paragraphs (1)(a) and (b).

Section.Label: D.02.011
Section.Text: No person shall sell a food to which sodium iron pyrophosphate has been added as a source of iron as a mineral nutrient unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the bioavailability of the iron in the food is not less than 50 per cent of the bioavailability of ferrous sulphate as determined by official method FO-42, Determination of Bioavailability of Iron, December 15, 1982; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that person retains documentary evidence showing that the bioavailability of the iron in the food has been determined by the official method referred to in paragraph (a) and, on request by the Minister, submits such evidence to the Minister.

table.title: Weighted Recommended Nutrient Intake

Heading.Label: DIVISION 3
Heading.TitleText: Addition of Vitamins, Mineral Nutrients or Amino Acids to Foods

Subsection.Text: In this Division, the expressions vitamin and mineral nutrient have the same meaning as in Divisions 1 and 2.
This Division applies only in respect of foods that are represented as containing a vitamin, mineral nutrient or amino acid for use in human nutrition.

Subject to section D.03.003, no person shall sell a food to which a vitamin, mineral nutrient or amino acid has been added unless the food is listed in Column I of the Table to this section and the vitamin, mineral nutrient or amino acid, as the case may be, is listed opposite that food in Column II of the Table.

No milk or milk product or derivative listed in Column I of the Table to this section applies to the lacteal secretion obtained from the mammary gland of any animal other than a cow, genus Bos, or a product or derivative of such secretion unless that animal is identified therein.

row.entry: Vitamin, Mineral Nutrient or Amino Acid
Thiamine, niacin, vitamin B6, folic acid, pantothenic acid, magnesium, iron and zinc.
Fruit nectars, vegetable drinks, bases and mixes for vegetable drinks and a mixture of vegetable juices
Fruit flavoured drinks that meet all the requirements of section B.11.150
Vitamin C, folic acid, thiamine, iron, potassium.
Bases, concentrates and mixes that are used for making fruit flavoured drinks and that meet all the requirements of section B.11.151
Vitamin C, folic acid, thiamine, iron, potassium.
Thiamine, riboflavin, niacin or niacinamide, calcium, phosphorus, iron, iodine.
Margarine and other similar substitutes for butter
Thiamine, riboflavin, niacin or niacinamide, folic acid, pantothenic acid, vitamin B6, iron, magnesium
Infant formulas and formulated liquid diets

Amino acids — alanine, arginine, aspartic acid, cystine, glutamic acid, glycine, histidine, hydroxyproline, isoleucine, leucine, lysine, methionine, phenylalanine, proline, serine, taurine, threonine, tryptophan, tyrosine, valine;
Minerals — calcium, chloride, chromium, copper, iodide, iron, magnesium, manganese, molybdenum, phosphorus, potassium, selenium, sodium, zinc;
Vitamins — alpha-tocopherol, biotin, d-pantothenic acid, folic acid, niacin, riboflavin, thiamin, vitamin A, vitamin B6, vitamin B12, vitamin C, vitamin D, vitamin K.
Foods represented for use in a very low energy diet

Vitamins — alpha-tocopherol, biotin, d-pantothenic acid, folic acid, niacin, riboflavin, thiamine, vitamin A, vitamin B6, vitamin B12, vitamin C, vitamin D, vitamin K Minerals — calcium, chloride, chromium, copper, iodine, iron, magnesium, manganese, molybdenum, phosphorus, potassium, selenium, sodium, zinc
Flavoured beverage mixes and bases recommended for addition to milk
Vitamin A, thiamine, niacin or niacinamide, vitamin C, iron.
Simulated meat products, simulated poultry meat products, meat product extenders and poultry product extenders

Thiamine, riboflavin, niacin, pyridoxine, d-pantothenic acid, folic acid, vitamin B12, iron, magnesium, potassium, zinc, copper, histidine, isoleucine, leucine, lysine, methionine, phenylalanine, threonine, tryptophan, valine.
Vitamins — alpha-tocopherol, biotin, d-pantothenic acid, folic acid, niacin, riboflavin, thiamine, vitamin A, vitamin B6, vitamin B12, vitamin C, vitamin D
Minerals — calcium, chloride, chromium, copper, iodine, iron, magnesium, manganese, molybdenum, phosphorus, potassium, selenium, sodium, zinc
Ready breakfast, instant breakfast and other similar breakfast replacement foods however described
Vitamin A, thiamine, riboflavin, niacin or niacinamide, vitamin C, iron
Condensed milk, milk, milk powder, sterilized milk, (naming the flavour) milk

Skim milk with added milk solids, partly skimmed milk with added milk solids, (naming the flavour) skim milk, (naming the flavour) partly skimmed milk, (naming the flavour) skim milk with added milk solids, (naming the flavour) partly skimmed milk with added milk solids, skim milk, partly skimmed milk, skim milk powder
Evaporated skim milk, concentrated skim milk, evaporated partly skimmed milk, concentrated partly skimmed milk
Vitamin A, vitamin C, vitamin D.

Apple juice, reconstituted apple juice, grape juice, reconstituted grape juice, pineapple juice, reconstituted pineapple juice, apple and (naming the fruit) juice as described in section B.11.132, concentrated fruit juice except frozen concentrated orange juice
Flour, White Flour, Enriched Flour or Enriched White Flour
Thiamine, riboflavin, niacin, vitamin B6, folic acid, d-pantothenic acid, calcium, iron, magnesium.
Vitamin A, thiamine, riboflavin, niacin or niacinamide, vitamin B6, d-pantothenic acid, folic acid, vitamin B12, alphatocopherol, calcium, iron, zinc, potassium.
Partly skimmed goat’s milk, skimmed goat’s milk, partly skimmed goat’s milk powder, skimmed goat’s milk powder
Evaporated partly skimmed goat’s milk, evaporated skimmed goat’s milk
Vitamins A, C, D, folic acid
Pre-cooked rice as defined in subsection B.13.010.1(1)
Thiamine, niacin, vitamin B6, folic acid, pantothenic acid, iron
Mineral water, spring water, water in sealed containers, prepackaged ice

Liquid whole egg, dried whole egg, frozen whole egg, liquid yolk, dried yolk, frozen yolk, liquid egg-white, (liquid albumen), dried egg-white (dried albumen), frozen egg-white (frozen albumen), liquid whole egg mix, dried whole egg mix, frozen whole egg mix, liquid yolk mix, dried yolk mix, frozen yolk mix
Vitamin A, Vitamin D, Vitamin E, thiamine, riboflavin, niacin, vitamin B6, folacin, vitamin B12, pantothenic acid, calcium, phosphorus, magnesium, potassium, iron, zinc

Section.Label: D.03.003
Section.Text: Section D.03.002 does not apply to a food when all of the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the food is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a gluten-free food referred to in paragraph B.24.003(1)(g), or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: represented for a special dietary use referred to in paragraph B.24.003(1)(h) or (i);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: no standard is prescribed in these Regulations for the food; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the food is not advertised.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), no person shall sell a drug containing fluorine if the largest recommended daily dosage of that drug as shown on the label thereof would, if consumed by a person, result in a daily intake by that person of more than one milligram of fluoride ion.
Subsection (1) does not apply to a drug sold by prescription.

Section.Label: D.05.009
Section.Text: Where a drug contains fluorine, both the inner and outer labels of the drug shall carry a cautionary statement that, if the drug is used in an area where the drinking water has a natural fluorine content in excess of 0.7 parts of fluoride ion per million parts of water or is artificially fluoridated, mottling of the tooth enamel of a user of the drug may result.

Subsection.Text: In this Part, cyclamate sweetener means any of the following substances sold as a sweetener:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: cyclohexyl sulfamic acid or any of its salts; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
