Paragraph.Text: any substance containing cyclohexyl sulfamic acid or any of its salts.

Subsection.Text: Part B does not apply to any cyclamate sweetener.

Section.Label: E.01.002
Section.Text: No person shall sell a cyclamate sweetener that is not labelled as required by this Part.

Section.Label: E.01.003
Section.Text: No person shall, in advertising a cyclamate sweetener to the general public, make any representation other than with respect to the name, price and quantity of the sweetener.

Section.Label: E.01.004
Section.Text: Every cyclamate sweetener shall be labelled to state that it should be used only on the advice of a physician.

Section.Label: E.01.005
Section.Text: Every cyclamate sweetener shall be labelled to show

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its energy value expressed, in calories, per teaspoon, drop, tablet or other measure used in the directions for use and per 100 grams or 100 millilitres; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a list of all its ingredients and, in the case of cyclohexyl sulfamic acid or any of its salts or a carbohydrate, its quantity.

Section.Label: G.01.001
Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Part.

Definition.Text: Act means the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act. (Loi)
advertisement includes any representation by any means whatever for the purpose of promoting, directly or indirectly, the sale or other disposal of a controlled drug. (publicité)

competent authority means a public authority of a foreign country that is authorized under the laws of the country to approve the importation or exportation of controlled drugs into or from the country. (autorité compétente)
compound includes a preparation. (composé)
controlled drug means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a controlled substance set out in the schedule to this Part; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a midwife, nurse practitioner or podiatrist, a controlled substance set out in the schedule to this Part that the midwife, nurse practitioner or podiatrist may prescribe, possess or conduct an activity with, in accordance with sections 3 and 4 of the New Classes of Practitioners Regulations. (drogue contrôlée)

Definition.Text: designated criminal offence means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an offence involving the financing of terrorism against any of sections 83.02 to 83.04 of the Criminal Code;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an offence involving fraud against any of sections 380 to 382 of the Criminal Code;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the offence of laundering proceeds of crime against section 462.31 of the Criminal Code;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an offence involving a criminal organization against any of sections 467.11 to 467.13 of the Criminal Code; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a conspiracy or an attempt to commit, being an accessory after the fact in relation to, or any counselling in relation to, an offence referred to in any of paragraphs (a) to (d). (infraction désignée en matière criminelle)

Definition.Text: destroy, in respect of a controlled drug, means to alter or denature it to such an extent that its consumption is rendered impossible or improbable. (destruction)
hospital means a facility that is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: licensed, approved or designated by a province in accordance with the laws of the province to provide care or treatment to persons or animals suffering from any form of disease or illness; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: owned or operated by the Government of Canada or the government of a province and that provides health services. (hôpital)

Definition.Text: international obligation means an obligation in respect of a controlled drug set out in a convention, treaty or other multilateral or bilateral instrument that Canada has ratified or to which Canada adheres. (obligation internationale)
label has the same meaning as in section 2 of the Food and Drugs Act. (étiquette)
licensed dealer means the holder of a licence issued under section G.02.007. (distributeur autorisé)
midwife has the same meaning as in section 1 of the New Classes of Practitioners Regulations. (sage-femme)
nurse practitioner has the same meaning as in section 1 of the New Classes of Practitioners Regulations. (infirmier praticien)
package includes anything in which a controlled drug is wholly or partly contained, placed or packed. (emballage)
pharmacist means a person who is entitled under the laws of a province to practise pharmacy and who is practising pharmacy in that province. (pharmacien)
podiatrist has the same meaning as in section 1 of the New Classes of Practitioners Regulations. (podiatre)
preparation means a drug that contains a controlled drug and an active medicinal ingredient in a recognized therapeutic dose, other than a controlled drug. (préparation)
prescription means an authorization given by a practitioner that a stated amount of a controlled drug be dispensed for the person named in it or the animal identified in it (ordonnance)
qualified person in charge means the individual designated under subsection G.02.004(1). (responsable qualifié)

Security Directive means the Directive on Physical Security Requirements for Controlled Substances and Drugs Containing Cannabis, as amended from time to time and published by the Government of Canada on its website. (Directive en matière de sécurité)
senior person in charge means the individual designated under section G.02.003. (responsable principal)
test kit means a kit

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that contains a controlled drug and a reagent system or buffering agent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that is used during the course of a chemical or analytical procedure to test for the presence or quantity of a controlled drug for a medical, laboratory, industrial, educational, law administration or enforcement, or research purpose; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the contents of which are not intended or likely to be consumed by, or administered to, a person or an animal. (nécessaire d’essai)

Subsection.Text: The Act and this Part do not apply in respect of a controlled drug that is contained in an agricultural implant and set out in Part III of the schedule to this Part, but nothing in this section exempts such a drug from the requirements of Part C.

In this section, agricultural implant means a product that is presented in a form suitable to allow sustained release of an active ingredient over a certain period of time and that is intended for insertion under the skin of a food-producing animal for the purpose of increasing weight gain and improving feed efficiency.

Section.Label: G.01.003
Section.Text: A member of a police force or a person acting under their direction and control who, in respect of the conduct of the member or person, is exempt from the application of subsection 4(2) or section 5, 6 or 7 of the Act by virtue of the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act (Police Enforcement) Regulations is, in respect of that conduct, exempt from the application of this Part.

Section.MarginalNote: Application of Parts C and D
Section.Label: G.01.004
Section.Text: Except as otherwise provided in this Part, it is prohibited to sell or provide a controlled drug or a preparation that does not comply with all provisions of Parts C and D that are applicable to it.

Subsection.Text: A person is authorized to possess a controlled drug set out in any of items 1 to 3, 8 to 10, 12 to 14, 16 and 17 of Part I of the schedule to this Part if the person has obtained the controlled drug in accordance with these Regulations, in the course of activities conducted in connection with the administration or enforcement of an Act or regulation, or from a person who is exempt under section 56 of the Act from the application of subsection 5(1) of the Act with respect to that controlled drug, and the person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: requires the controlled drug for their business or profession and is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a licensed dealer,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a pharmacist, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a practitioner who is registered and entitled to practise in the province in which they possess that drug;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is a practitioner who is registered and entitled to practise in a province other than the province in which they have that possession for emergency medical purposes only;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is a hospital employee or a practitioner in a hospital;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: has obtained the controlled drug for their own use

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: from a practitioner, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in accordance with a prescription that was not issued or obtained in contravention of these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: is a practitioner of medicine who received the controlled drug under subsection G.06.003(1) or (2) and their possession is for the purpose of providing or delivering it to a person referred to in subsection G.06.003(3);

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: is an agent or mandatary of a practitioner of medicine who received the controlled drug under subsection G.06.003(1) and their possession is for the purpose of providing or delivering it to a person referred to in subsection G.06.003(2);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: is employed as an inspector, a member of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police, a police constable, a peace officer or a member of the technical or scientific staff of the Government of Canada, the government of a province or a university in Canada and their possession is in connection with that employment;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: is not a practitioner of medicine referred to in paragraph (e) or an agent or mandatary referred to in paragraph (f), is exempted under section 56 of the Act with respect to possession of that controlled drug and their possession is for a purpose set out in the exemption; or

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: is the Minister.

Subsection.Text: A person is authorized to possess a controlled drug referred to in subsection (1) if the person is acting as the agent or mandatary of any person who is authorized to possess it in accordance with any of paragraphs (1)(a) to (e), (h) and (i).

Subsection.MarginalNote: Agent or mandatary — person referred to in paragraph (1)(g)
Subsection.Text: A person is authorized to possess a controlled drug referred to in subsection (1) if they

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: are acting as the agent or mandatary of a person who they have reasonable grounds to believe is a person referred to in paragraph (1)(g); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: possess the controlled drug for the purpose of assisting that person in the administration or enforcement of an Act or a regulation.

Section.Label: G.01.006
Section.Text: A person may sell, possess or otherwise deal in a test kit if the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a registration number has been issued for the test kit under section G.01.008 and has not been cancelled under section G.01.009;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the test kit bears, on its external surface,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the manufacturer,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the trade name or trademark, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the registration number; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the test kit will be used for a medical, laboratory, industrial, educational, law administration or enforcement, or research purpose.

Subsection.Text: The manufacturer of a test kit may obtain a registration number for it by submitting to the Minister an application containing

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a detailed description of the design and construction of the test kit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a detailed description of the controlled drug and other substances, if any, contained in the test kit, including the qualitative and quantitative composition of each component; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the proposed use of the test kit.

Subsection.Text: The application must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed and dated by the person authorized by the applicant for that purpose; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include an attestation by that person that all of the information submitted in support of the application is correct and complete to the best of their knowledge.

Subsection.Text: The applicant must, not later than the date specified in the Minister’s written request to that effect, provide the Minister with any information or document that the Minister determines is necessary to complete the review of the application.

Section.Label: G.01.008
Section.Text: On completion of the review of the application for a registration number, the Minister must issue a registration number for the test kit, preceded by the letters “TK”, if the Minister determines that the test kit will only be used for a medical, laboratory, industrial, educational, law administration or enforcement, or research purpose and that it contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a controlled drug and an adulterating or denaturing agent that are combined in such a manner and in such a quantity, proportion or concentration that the preparation or mixture has no significant drug abuse potential; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: such small quantities or concentrations of any controlled drug as to have no significant drug abuse potential.

Section.Label: G.01.009
Section.Text: The Minister must cancel the registration number for a test kit if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the test kit is removed from the market by the manufacturer;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the test kit is used or is likely to be used for any purpose other than a medical, laboratory, industrial, educational, law administration or enforcement, or research purpose; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the cancellation is necessary to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a controlled drug from being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer may produce, assemble, sell, provide, transport, send, deliver, import or export a controlled drug if they comply with this Part and the terms and conditions of their dealer’s licence and any permit issued under this Part.
A licensed dealer may conduct an activity in relation to a controlled drug at their site only if the qualified person in charge or an alternate qualified person in charge is present at the site.
A licensed dealer must obtain a permit to import or export a controlled drug.
A licensed dealer may possess a controlled drug for the purpose of exporting it if they have obtained it in accordance with this Part.

Section.Label: G.02.002
Section.Text: The following persons may apply for a dealer’s licence:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an individual who ordinarily resides in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a corporation that has its head office in Canada or operates a branch office in Canada; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the holder of a position that includes responsibility for controlled drugs on behalf of the Government of Canada, the government of a province, a police force, a hospital or a university in Canada.

Section.Label: G.02.003
Section.Text: An applicant for a dealer’s licence must designate only one individual as the senior person in charge, who has overall responsibility for management of the activities with respect to controlled drugs that are specified in the licence application. The applicant may designate themself if the applicant is an individual.

Subsection.Text: An applicant for a dealer’s licence must designate only one individual as the qualified person in charge, who is responsible for supervising the activities with respect to controlled drugs that are specified in the licence application and for ensuring that those activities comply with this Part. The applicant may designate themself if the applicant is an individual.

An applicant for a dealer’s licence may designate an individual as an alternate qualified person in charge, who is authorized to replace the qualified person in charge when that person is absent. The applicant may designate themself if the applicant is an individual.
Only an individual who meets the following requirements may be designated as a qualified person in charge or an alternate qualified person in charge:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: they work at the site specified in the dealer’s licence;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: they

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: are a person entitled or, if applicable, registered and entitled by a provincial professional licensing authority or a professional association in Canada and entitled to practise a profession that is relevant to their duties, such as pharmacist, practitioner, pharmacy technician or laboratory technician,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: hold a diploma, certificate or credential awarded by a post-secondary educational institution in Canada in a field or occupation that is relevant to their duties, such as pharmacy, medicine, dentistry, veterinary medicine, pharmacology, chemistry, biology, pharmacy technician, laboratory technician, pharmaceutical regulatory affairs or supply chain management or security, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: hold a diploma, certificate or credential that is awarded by a foreign educational institution in a field or occupation referred to in subparagraph (ii) and hold

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: an equivalency assessment as defined in subsection 73(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: an equivalency assessment issued by an organization or institution that is responsible for issuing equivalency assessments and is recognized by a province;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: they have sufficient knowledge of and experience with the use and handling of the controlled drugs specified in the dealer’s licence to properly carry out their duties; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: they have sufficient knowledge of the provisions of the Act and this Part that are applicable to the activities specified in the dealer’s licence to properly carry out their duties.

Subsection.Text: An applicant for a dealer’s licence may designate an individual who does not meet any of the requirements of paragraph (3)(b) as a qualified person in charge or an alternate qualified person in charge if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: no other individual working at the site meets those requirements;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: those requirements are not necessary for the activities specified in the licence; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the individual has sufficient knowledge — acquired from a combination of education, training or work experience — to properly carry out their duties.

Section.Label: G.02.005
Section.Text: An individual is not eligible to be a senior person in charge, a qualified person in charge or an alternate qualified person in charge if, during the 10 years before the day on which the dealer’s licence application is submitted,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a designated substance offence or a designated criminal offence or a designated offence as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Cannabis Act, the individual

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: was convicted as an adult, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: was a young person who received an adult sentence, as those terms are defined in subsection 2(1) of the Youth Criminal Justice Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of an offence committed outside Canada that, if committed in Canada, would have constituted a designated substance offence or a designated criminal offence or a designated offence as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Cannabis Act,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the individual was convicted as an adult, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if they committed the offence when they were at least 14 years old but less than 18 years old, the person received a sentence that was longer than the maximum youth sentence, as that term is defined in subsection 2(1) of the Youth Criminal Justice Act, that could have been imposed under that Act for such an offence.

Subsection.Text: A person who intends to conduct an activity referred to in section G.02.001 must obtain a dealer’s licence for each site at which they intend to conduct activities by submitting an application to the Minister that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the licence is requested by

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: an individual, the individual’s name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a corporation, its corporate name and any other name registered with a province, under which it intends to conduct the activities specified in its dealer’s licence or by which it intends to identify itself, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the holder of a position described in paragraph G.02.002(c), the applicant’s name and the title of the position;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the municipal address, telephone number and, if applicable, the email address of the proposed site and, if different from the municipal address, its mailing address;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name, date of birth, telephone number and email address of the proposed senior person in charge;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to each of the proposed qualified person in charge and any proposed alternate qualified person in charge,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: their name, date of birth, telephone number and email address,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the title of their position at the site,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and title of the position of their immediate supervisor at the site,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: if applicable, their profession they practise that is relevant to their duties, the name of the province that authorizes them to practise it and their authorization number, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: their education, training and work experience that are relevant to their duties;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the activities that are to be conducted and the controlled drugs in respect of which each of the activities is to be conducted;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: if the licence is requested to manufacture or assemble a product or compound that contains a controlled drug, other than a test kit, a list that includes, for each product or compound,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the brand name of the product or the name of the compound,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the drug identification number that is assigned to the product under section C.01.014.2, if any,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the controlled drug in the product or compound,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the strength per unit of the controlled drug in it, the number of units per package and the number of packages,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is to be manufactured or assembled by or for another licensed dealer under a custom order, the name, municipal address and dealer’s licence number of the other licensed dealer, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: if the applicant’s name appears on the label of the product or compound, a copy of the inner label;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: if the licence is requested in order to produce a controlled drug other than a product or compound that contains a controlled drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the controlled drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity that the applicant expects to produce under their licence and the period during which that quantity would be produced, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is to be produced for another licensed dealer under a custom order, the name, municipal address and licence number of the other licensed dealer;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: if the licence is requested for an activity that is not described in paragraph (f) or (g), the name of the controlled drug for which the activity is to be conducted and the purpose of the activity;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: a detailed description of the security measures in place at the site, determined in accordance with the Security Directive; and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: a detailed description of the method for recording information that the applicant proposes to use for the purpose of section G.02.071.

Subsection.Text: An application for a dealer’s licence must be accompanied by the following documents:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the applicant is a corporation, a copy of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the certificate of incorporation or other constituting instrument, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any document filed with the province in which its site is located that states its corporate name and any other name registered with the province under which the applicant intends to conduct the activities specified in its dealer’s licence or by which it intends to identify itself;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: individual declarations signed and dated by each of the proposed senior person in charge, and qualified person in charge and any proposed alternate qualified person in charge, attesting that the person is not ineligible for a reason specified in section G.02.005;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a document issued by a Canadian police force in relation to each person referred to in paragraph (b), indicating whether, during the 10 years before the day on which the application is submitted, the person was convicted as specified in subparagraph G.02.005(a)(i) or received a sentence as specified in subparagraph G.02.005(a)(ii);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if any of the persons referred to in paragraph (b) has ordinarily resided in a country other than Canada during the 10 years before the day on which the application is submitted, a document issued by a police force of that country indicating whether in that period that person was convicted as specified in subparagraph G.02.005(b)(i) or received a sentence as specified in subparagraph G.02.005(b)(ii);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: declaration, signed and dated by the proposed senior person in charge, attesting that the proposed qualified person in charge and any proposed alternate qualified person in charge have the knowledge and experience required under paragraphs G.02.004(3)(c) and (d); and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: if the proposed qualified person in charge or any proposed alternate qualified person in charge does not meet the requirement of subparagraph G.02.004(3)(b)(i), either

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a copy of the person’s diploma, certificate or credential referred to in subparagraph G.02.004(3)(b)(ii) or (iii), or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a detailed description of the education, training and work experience that is required under paragraph G.02.004(4)(c), together with supporting evidence, such as a copy of a course transcript or an attestation by the person who provided the training.

Subsection.Text: The application must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed and dated by the proposed senior person in charge; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include an attestation by that person that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: all information and documents submitted in support of the application are correct and complete to the best of their knowledge, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: they have the authority to bind the applicant.

Subsection.Text: The applicant must, not later than the date specified in the Minister’s written request to that effect, provide the Minister with any information or document that the Minister determines is necessary to complete the review of the application.

Section.Label: G.02.007
Section.Text: Subject to section G.02.009, on completion of the review of the licence application, the Minister must issue a dealer’s licence, with or without terms and conditions, that contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licence number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the licensed dealer, their corporate name or the title of the position they hold;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the activities that are authorized and the names of the controlled drugs in respect of which each activity may be conducted;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the municipal address of the site at which the dealer may conduct the authorized activities;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the security level at the site, determined in accordance with the Security Directive;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the effective date of the licence;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the expiry date of the licence, which must be not later than three years after its effective date;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: any terms and conditions that the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe are necessary to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: ensure that an international obligation is respected,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: ensure conformity with the requirements associated with the security level that is referred to in paragraph (e), or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: reduce a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of a controlled drug being diverted to an illicit market or use; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: if the licensed dealer produces a controlled drug, the quantity that they may produce and the authorized production period.

Section.Label: G.02.008
Section.Text: A dealer’s licence is valid until the expiry date set out in the licence or, if it is earlier, the date of the suspension or revocation of the licence under section G.02.027 or G.02.028.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must refuse to issue a dealer’s licence if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant may not apply for a licence under section G.02.002;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: during the 10 years before the day on which the licence application is submitted, the applicant has contravened

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a provision of the Act, the Cannabis Act or their regulations, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a term or condition of a licence or permit issued to the applicant under any regulations made under the Act or issued to the applicant under the Cannabis Act or its regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: during the 10 years before the day on which the application is submitted, the proposed senior person in charge or qualified person in charge or any proposed alternate qualified person in charge was convicted as specified in subparagraph G.02.005(a)(i) or (b)(i) or received a sentence as specified in subparagraph G.02.005(a)(ii) or (b)(ii);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an activity for which the licence is requested would contravene an international obligation;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant does not have in place at the site the security measures set out in the Security Directive in respect of an activity for which the licence is requested;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the method referred to in paragraph G.02.006(1)(j) does not permit the recording of information as required under section G.02.071;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant has not complied with the requirements of subsection G.02.006(4) or the information and documents that they have provided are not sufficient to complete the review of the licence application;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the applicant has submitted false or misleading information or false or falsified documents in or in support of the licence application;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: information received from a competent authority or the United Nations gives the Minister reasonable grounds to believe that the applicant has been involved in the diversion of a controlled drug to an illicit market or use or has been involved in an activity that contravened an international obligation; or

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the issuance of the licence would likely create a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of a controlled drug being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must not refuse to issue a licence under paragraph (1)(b) or (h) if the applicant meets the following conditions, unless the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a controlled drug from being diverted to an illicit market or use:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant does not have a history of non-compliance with the Act, the Cannabis Act or their regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant has carried out, or signed an undertaking to carry out, the necessary corrective measures to ensure compliance with the Act, the Cannabis Act and their regulations.

Subsection.Text: Before refusing to issue a licence, the Minister must send the applicant a notice that sets out the Minister’s reasons and gives the applicant an opportunity to be heard.
To apply to renew a dealer’s licence, a licensed dealer must submit to the Minister an application that contains the information and documents referred to in subsections G.02.006(1) and (2).
The application must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed and dated by the senior person in charge of the site specified in the application; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include an attestation by that person that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: all of the information and documents submitted in support of the application are correct and complete to the best of their knowledge, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: they have the authority to bind the licensed dealer.

Subsection.Text: The licensed dealer must, not later than the date specified in the Minister’s written request to that effect, provide the Minister with any information or document that the Minister determines is necessary to complete the review of the application.
Subject to section G.02.013, on completion of the review of the renewal application, the Minister must issue a renewed dealer’s licence that contains the information specified in section G.02.007.
When renewing a dealer’s licence, the Minister may, if he or she has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so, add a term or condition to it or modify or delete one in order to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that an international obligation is respected;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: ensure conformity with the requirements associated with the security level specified in the licence or the new level required as a result of the licence renewal; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: reduce a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of a controlled drug being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Section.Label: G.02.012
Section.Text: A renewed dealer’s licence is valid until the expiry date set out in the licence or, if it is earlier, the date of the suspension or revocation of the licence under section G.02.027 or G.02.028.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must refuse to renew a dealer’s licence if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer may no longer apply for a licence under section G.02.002;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: during the 10 years before the day on which the renewal application is submitted, the licensed dealer has contravened

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a provision of the Act, the Cannabis Act or their Regulations, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a term or condition of a licence or permit issued to the dealer under a regulation made under the Act or issued to the dealer under the Cannabis Act or its regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: during the 10 years before the day on which the renewal application is submitted, the proposed senior person in charge or qualified person in charge or any proposed alternate qualified person in charge was convicted as specified in subparagraph G.02.005(a)(i) or (b)(i) or received a sentence as specified in subparagraph G.02.005(a)(ii) or (b)(ii);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an activity for which the renewal is requested would contravene an international obligation;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer does not have in place at the site the security measures set out in the Security Directive in respect of an activity for which the renewal is requested;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the method referred to in paragraph G.02.006(1)(j) does not permit the recording of information as required by section G.02.071;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has not complied with the requirements of subsection G.02.010(3) or the information or documents that they have provided are not sufficient to complete the review of the renewal application;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer has submitted false or misleading information or false or falsified documents in or in support of the renewal application;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: information received from a competent authority or the United Nations gives the Minister reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer has been involved in the diversion of a controlled drug to an illicit market or use or has been involved in an activity that contravened an international obligation; or

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the renewal of the licence would likely create a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of a controlled drug being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must not refuse to renew a licence under paragraph (1)(b) or (h) if the licensed dealer meets the following conditions, unless the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a controlled drug from being diverted to an illicit market or use:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer does not have a history of non-compliance with the Act, the Cannabis Act or their regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has carried out, or signed an undertaking to carry out, the necessary corrective measures to ensure compliance with the Act, the Cannabis Act and their regulations.

Subsection.Text: Before refusing to renew a licence, the Minister must send the licensed dealer a notice that sets out the Minister’s reasons and gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard.

Before making a change affecting any information referred to in section G.02.007 that is contained in their dealer’s licence, a licensed dealer must submit to the Minister an application to amend the licence that contains a description of the proposed amendment, as well as the information and documents referred to in section G.02.006 that are relevant to the proposed amendment.
The application must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed and dated by the senior person in charge of the site specified in the application; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include an attestation by that person that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: all of the information and documents submitted in support of the application are correct and complete to the best of their knowledge, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: they have the authority to bind the licensed dealer.

Subsection.Text: The licensed dealer must, not later than the date specified in the Minister’s written request to that effect, provide the Minister with any information or document that the Minister determines is necessary to complete the review of the application.
Subject to section G.02.017, on completion of the review of the amendment application, the Minister must amend the dealer’s licence.
When amending a dealer’s licence, the Minister may, if he or she has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so, add a term or condition to it or modify or delete one in order to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that an international obligation is respected;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: ensure conformity with the requirements associated with the security level specified in the licence or the new level required as a result of the amendment; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: reduce a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of a controlled drug being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Section.Label: G.02.016
Section.Text: An amended dealer’s licence is valid until the expiry date set out in the licence or, if it is earlier, the date of the suspension or revocation of the licence under section G.02.027 or G.02.028.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must refuse to amend a dealer’s licence if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an activity for which the licence amendment is requested would contravene an international obligation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer does not have in place at the site the security measures set out in the Security Directive in respect of an activity for which the licence amendment is requested;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the method referred to in paragraph G.02.006(1)(j) does not permit the recording of information as required by section G.02.071;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has not complied with the requirements of subsection G.02.014(3) or the information or documents that they have provided are not sufficient to complete the review of the amendment application;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer has submitted false or misleading information or false or falsified documents in or in support of the amendment application; or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the amendment of the licence would likely create a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of a controlled drug being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must not refuse to amend a licence under paragraph (1)(e) if the licensed dealer meets the following conditions, unless the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a controlled drug from being diverted to an illicit market or use:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer does not have a history of non-compliance with the Act, the Cannabis Act or their regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has carried out, or signed an undertaking to carry out, the necessary corrective measures to ensure compliance with the Act, the Cannabis Act and their regulations.

Subsection.Text: Before refusing to amend a licence, the Minister must send the licensed dealer a notice that sets out the Minister’s reasons and gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard.

Heading.TitleText: Changes Requiring Prior Approval by Minister

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer must obtain the Minister’s approval before making any of the following changes by submitting a written request to the Minister:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a change affecting the security measures at the site specified in the dealer’s licence;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the replacement of the senior person in charge;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the replacement of the qualified person in charge; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the replacement or addition of an alternate qualified person in charge.

Subsection.Text: The licensed dealer must provide the Minister with the following with respect to a change referred to in subsection (1):

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a change affecting the security measures in place at the site specified in the dealer’s licence;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the senior person in charge,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the information specified in paragraph G.02.006(1)(c), and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the declaration specified in paragraph G.02.006(2)(b) and the documents specified in paragraphs G.02.006(2)(c) and (d); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the qualified person in charge or an alternate qualified person in charge,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the information specified in paragraph G.02.006(1)(d), and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the declarations specified in paragraphs G.02.006(2)(b) and (e) and the documents specified in paragraphs G.02.006(2)(c), (d) and (f).

Subsection.Text: The licensed dealer must, not later than the date specified in the Minister’s written request to that effect, provide the Minister with any information or document that the Minister determines is necessary to complete the review of the application.
Subject to section G.02.020, on completion of the review of the application for approval of the change, the Minister must approve the change.
When approving a change, the Minister may, if he or she has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so, add a term or condition to the licence or modify or delete one in order to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that an international obligation is respected;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: ensure conformity with the requirements associated with the security level specified in the licence; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: reduce a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of a controlled drug being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must refuse to approve the change if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: during the 10 years before the day on which the application for approval of the change is submitted, the proposed senior person in charge or qualified person in charge or any proposed alternate qualified person in charge was convicted as specified in subparagraph G.02.005(a)(i) or (b)(i) or received a sentence as specified in subparagraph G.02.005(a)(ii) or (b)(ii);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has not complied with the requirements of subsection G.02.018(3) or the information or documents that they have provided are not sufficient to complete the review of the application for approval of the change;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer has submitted false or misleading information or false or falsified documents in or in support of the application for approval of the change; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the change would likely create a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of a controlled drug being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must not refuse to approve a change under paragraph (1)(c) if the licensed dealer has carried out, or signed an undertaking to carry out, the necessary corrective measures to ensure compliance with the Act, the Cannabis Act and their regulations, unless the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a controlled drug from being diverted to an illicit market or use.
Before refusing to approve a change, the Minister must send the licensed dealer a notice that sets out the Minister’s reasons and gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard in respect of them.
A licensed dealer must notify the Minister in writing before

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: making or assembling a product or compound that is not set out in the most recent version of the list referred to in paragraph G.02.006(1)(f) that has been submitted to the Minister; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: making a change to a product or compound that is set out in the list, if the change affects any of the information that has previously been submitted.

Subsection.Text: The notice must contain the information referred to in paragraph G.02.006(1)(f) that is necessary to update the list and be accompanied by the revised version of the list.

Section.Label: G.02.022
Section.Text: A licensed dealer must notify the Minister in writing within five days after a person ceases to act as the qualified person in charge or an alternate qualified person in charge.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer must notify the Minister in writing within 10 days after one of the following changes occurs:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a person ceases to act as the senior person in charge; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer ceases to manufacture or assemble a product or compound that is set out in the most recent version of the list referred to in paragraph G.02.006(1)(f) has been submitted to the Minister.

Subsection.Text: A notice submitted under paragraph (1)(b) must specify which information referred to in paragraph G.02.006(1)(f) is being changed and be accompanied by the revised version of the list.

A licensed dealer that intends to cease conducting activities at their site — whether on or before the expiry of their licence — must notify the Minister in writing to that effect at least 30 days before ceasing those activities.
The notice must be signed and dated by the senior person in charge and contain the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the expected date of the cessation of activities at the site;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the manner in which any remaining controlled drugs on the site as of that date will be disposed of by the licensed dealer, including

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if some or all of them will be sold or provided to another licensed dealer that will be conducting activities at the same site, the name of that dealer,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if some or all of them will be sold or provided to another licensed dealer that will not be conducting activities at the same site, the name of that dealer and the municipal address of their site, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if some or all of them will be destroyed, the date on which and the municipal address of the location at which the destruction is to take place;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the municipal address of the location at which the licensed dealer’s documents will be kept after activities have ceased; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name, municipal address, telephone number and, if applicable, the email address of a person who the Minister may contact for further information after activities have ceased.

Subsection.Text: After having ceased to conduct the activities, the licensed dealer must submit to the Minister a detailed update of the information referred to in subsection (2) if it differs from what was set out in the notice. The update must be signed and dated by the senior person in charge.

Heading.TitleText: Changes to Terms and Conditions of Licence

Section.MarginalNote: Addition of or modification to term or condition
Section.Label: G.02.025

Subsection.Text: The Minister may, at any time other than the issuance, renewal or amendment of a dealer’s licence, add a term or condition to it or modify one if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that an international obligation is respected;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: ensure conformity with the requirements associated with the security level specified in the licence; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: reduce a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of a controlled drug being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: Before adding a term or condition to a licence or modifying one, the Minister must send the licensed dealer a notice that sets out the Minister’s reasons and gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard.

Despite subsection (2), the Minister may add a term or condition to a licence or modify one without prior notice if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a controlled drug from being diverted to an illicit market or use.
The addition or modification of a term or condition that is made under subsection (3) takes effect as soon as the Minister sends the licensed dealer a notice that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sets out the reasons for the addition or modification;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, specifies the corrective measures that must be carried out and the date by which they must be carried out.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may delete a term or condition of a dealer’s licence that the Minister determines is no longer necessary.
The deletion takes effect as soon as the Minister sends the licensed dealer a notice to that effect.

The Minister must suspend a dealer’s licence without prior notice if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a controlled drug from being diverted to an illicit market or use.
The suspension takes effect as soon as the Minister sends the licensed dealer a notice that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sets out the reasons for the suspension;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, specifies the corrective measures that must be carried out and the date by which they must be carried out.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must reinstate the licence if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the suspension is no longer necessary.
Subject to subsection (2), the Minister must revoke a dealer’s licence if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer may no longer apply for a licence under section G.02.002;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer requests the Minister to do so or informs the Minister of the loss or theft of the licence or the actual or potential unauthorized use of the licence;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer ceases to conduct activities at their site before the expiry of their licence;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer does not take the corrective measures specified in an undertaking or notice;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has contravened

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a provision of the Act, the Cannabis Act or their regulations, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a term or condition of a licence or permit issued to the dealer under a regulation made under the Act or issued to the dealer under the Cannabis Act or its regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: during the 10 years before the day on which the licence is revoked, the senior person in charge, the qualified person in charge or any alternate qualified person in charge was convicted as specified in subparagraph G.02.005(a)(i) or (b)(i) or received a sentence as specified in subparagraph G.02.005(a)(ii) or (b)(ii);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer submitted false or misleading information or false or falsified documents in or in support of an application relating to the licence; or

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: information received from a competent authority or the United Nations gives the Minister reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer has been involved in the diversion of a controlled drug to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must not revoke a dealer’s licence for a ground set out in paragraph (1)(e) or (g) if the licensed dealer meets the following conditions, unless the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a controlled drug from being diverted to an illicit market or use:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer does not have a history of non-compliance with the Act, the Cannabis Act or their regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has carried out, or signed an undertaking to carry out, the necessary corrective measures to ensure compliance with the Act, the Cannabis Act and their regulations.

Subsection.Text: Before revoking a licence, the Minister must send the licensed dealer a notice that sets out the Minister’s reasons and gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard.

Section.Label: G.02.029
Section.Text: The licensed dealer must return the original of the licence to the Minister within 15 days after the effective date of the revocation.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer must submit to the Minister, before each importation of a controlled drug, an application for an import permit that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name, municipal address and dealer’s licence number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the controlled drug to be imported,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name, as specified in the dealer’s licence,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is a salt, the name of the salt,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its quantity, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a raw material, its purity and its anhydrous content;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the controlled drug is contained in a product to be imported,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the brand name of the product,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the drug identification number that has been assigned to the product under section C.01.014.2, if any, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the strength per unit of the controlled drug in the product, the number of units per package and the number of packages;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name and municipal address, in the country of export, of the exporter from whom the controlled drug is being obtained;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the customs office where the importation is anticipated; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: each proposed mode of transportation and any proposed country of transit or transhipment.

Subsection.Text: The application must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed and dated by the qualified person in charge or an alternate qualified person in charge; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include an attestation by that person that all of the information submitted in support of the application is correct and complete to the best of their knowledge.

Subsection.Text: The licensed dealer must, not later than the date specified in the Minister’s written request to that effect, provide the Minister with any information or document that the Minister determines is necessary to complete the review of the application.

Section.Label: G.02.031
Section.Text: Subject to section G.02.034, on completion of the review of the import permit application, the Minister must issue to the licensed dealer an import permit that contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the permit number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the information set out in subsection G.02.030(1);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the effective date of the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the expiry date of the permit, being the earlier of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a date specified by the Minister that is not more than 180 days after its effective date, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the expiry date of the dealer’s licence; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any terms and conditions that the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe are necessary to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: ensure that an international obligation is respected, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: reduce a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of a controlled drug being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Section.Label: G.02.032
Section.Text: An import permit is valid until the earliest of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the expiry date set out in the permit,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the suspension or revocation of the permit under section G.02.037 or G.02.038,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the suspension or revocation of the dealer’s licence under section G.02.027 or G.02.028, and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the suspension or revocation of the export permit that applies to the controlled drug to be imported and that is issued by the competent authority in the country of export.

Section.Label: G.02.033
Section.Text: If an import permit expires, the licensed dealer must return the original of the permit to the Minister within 15 days after its expiry.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must refuse to issue an import permit if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer is not authorized by their dealer’s licence to import the relevant controlled drug or their licence will expire before the date of importation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the importation would contravene an international obligation;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer does not have in place at the site the security measures set out in the Security Directive in respect of the importation;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has not complied with the requirements of subsection G.02.030(3) or the information or documents that they have provided are not sufficient to complete the review of the permit application;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer has submitted false or misleading information or false or falsified documents in or in support of the permit application;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has been notified that their application to renew or amend their licence will be refused;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the importation would contravene the laws of the country of export or any country of transit or transhipment; or

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the issuance of the permit would likely create a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of a controlled drug being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: Before refusing to issue the import permit, the Minister must send the licensed dealer a notice that sets out the Minister’s reasons and gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard.

Section.Label: G.02.035
Section.Text: The holder of an import permit must provide a copy of the permit to the customs office at the time of importation.

Section.Label: G.02.036
Section.Text: The holder of an import permit must provide the Minister, within 15 days after the day of release of the controlled drug specified in the permit in accordance with the Customs Act, with a declaration that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name and the numbers of their dealer’s licence and the import permit that applies to the controlled drug;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the controlled drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name, as set out in the dealer’s licence,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is a salt, the name of the salt, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its quantity;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the controlled drug is contained in a product that they have imported,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the brand name of the product,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the drug identification number that has been assigned to the product under section C.01.014.2, if any, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the strength per unit of the controlled drug in the product, the number of units per package and the number of packages; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the customs office from which the controlled drug was released and the date of the release.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must suspend an import permit without prior notice if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the dealer’s licence is suspended;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the suspension is necessary to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a controlled drug from being diverted to an illicit market or use; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the importation would contravene the laws of the country of export or any country of transit or transhipment.

Subsection.Text: The suspension takes effect as soon as the Minister sends the licensed dealer a notice that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sets out the reasons for the suspension;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, specifies the corrective measures that must be carried out and the date by which they must be carried out.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must reinstate the import permit if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the suspension is no longer necessary.
Subject to subsection (2), the Minister must revoke an import permit if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer requests the Minister to do so or informs the Minister of the loss or theft of the permit or the actual or potential unauthorized use of the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer does not carry out the corrective measures specified by the Minister under paragraph G.02.037(2)(c) by the specified date;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has contravened a term or condition of the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer submitted false or misleading information or false or falsified documents in or in support of the application for the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: information received from a competent authority or the United Nations gives the Minister reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer has been involved in the diversion of a controlled drug to an illicit market or use; or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the dealer’s licence has been revoked.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must not revoke an import permit for a ground set out in paragraph (1)(d) or G.02.028(1)(e) or (g) if the licensed dealer meets the following conditions, unless the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a controlled drug from being diverted to an illicit market or use:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer does not have a history of non-compliance with the Act, the Cannabis Act or their regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has carried out, or signed an undertaking to carry out, the necessary corrective measures to ensure compliance with the Act, the Cannabis Act and their regulations.

Subsection.Text: Before revoking an import permit, the Minister must send the licensed dealer a notice that sets out the Minister’s reasons and gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard.

Section.Label: G.02.039
Section.Text: If an import permit is revoked, the licensed dealer must return the original of the permit to the Minister within 15 days after the effective date of the revocation.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer must submit to the Minister, before each exportation of a controlled drug, an application for an export permit that contains the following information and document:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name, municipal address and dealer’s licence number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the controlled drug to be exported,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name, as specified in the dealer’s licence,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is a salt, the name of the salt,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its quantity, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a raw material, its purity and its anhydrous content;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the controlled drug is contained in a product to be exported,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the brand name of the product,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the drug identification number that has been assigned to the product under section C.01.014.2, if any, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the strength per unit of the controlled drug in the product, the number of units per package and the number of packages;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name and municipal address of the importer in the country of final destination;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the customs office where the exportation is anticipated;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: each proposed mode of transportation and any proposed country of transit or transhipment; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the import permit issued by the competent authority in the country of final destination that sets out the name of the importer and the municipal address of their site in that country.

Subsection.Text: The application must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed and dated by the qualified person in charge or an alternate qualified person in charge; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include an attestation by that person that, to the best of their knowledge,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the exportation does not contravene the laws of the country of final destination or any country of transit or transhipment, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: all of the information and documents submitted in support of the application are correct and complete.

Subsection.Text: The licensed dealer must, not later than the date specified in the Minister’s written request to that effect, provide the Minister with any information or document that the Minister determines is necessary to complete the review of the application.

Section.Label: G.02.041
Section.Text: Subject to section G.02.044, on completion of the review of the export permit application, the Minister must issue to the licensed dealer an export permit that contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the permit number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the information set out in paragraphs G.02.040(1)(a) to (f);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the effective date of the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the expiry date of the permit, being the earliest of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a date specified by the Minister that is not more than 180 days after its effective date,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the expiry date of the dealer’s licence, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the expiry date of the import permit issued by the competent authority in the country of final destination; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any terms and conditions that the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe are necessary to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: ensure that an international obligation is respected, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: reduce a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of a controlled drug being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Section.Label: G.02.042
Section.Text: An export permit is valid until the earliest of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the expiry date set out in the permit,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the suspension or revocation of the permit under section G.02.047 or G.02.048,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the suspension or revocation of the dealer’s licence under section G.02.027 or G.02.028, and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the expiry, suspension or revocation of the import permit that applies to the controlled drug to be exported and that is issued by the competent authority in the country of final destination.

Section.Label: G.02.043
Section.Text: If an export permit expires, the licensed dealer must return the original of the permit to the Minister within 15 days after its expiry.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must refuse to issue an export permit if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer is not authorized by their dealer’s licence to export the relevant controlled drug or their dealer’s licence will expire before the date of export;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the exportation would contravene an international obligation;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has not complied with the requirements of subsection G.02.040(3) or the information or documents that they have provided are not sufficient to complete the review of the permit application;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer has submitted false or misleading information or false or falsified documents in or in support of the permit application;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has been notified that their application to renew or amend their licence will be refused;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the exportation would not be in conformity with the import permit issued by the competent authority of the country of final destination;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the exportation would contravene the laws of the country of final destination or any country of transit or transhipment; or

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the issuance of the permit would likely create a risk to public health or safety, including the risk of a controlled drug being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: Before refusing to issue the export permit, the Minister must send the licensed dealer a notice that sets out the Minister’s reasons and gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard.

Section.Label: G.02.045
Section.Text: The holder of an export permit must provide a copy of the permit to the customs office at the time of exportation.

Section.Label: G.02.046
Section.Text: The holder of an export permit must provide the Minister, within 15 days after the day of export of the controlled drug specified in the permit, with a declaration that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name and the numbers of their dealer’s licence and the export permit that applies to the controlled drug;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the controlled drug,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name, as specified in the dealer’s licence,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is a salt, the name of the salt, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its quantity;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the controlled drug is contained in a product that they have exported,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the brand name of the product,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the drug identification number that has been assigned to the product under section C.01.014.2, if any, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the strength per unit of the controlled drug in the product, the number of units per package and the number of packages; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the customs office from which the controlled drug was exported and the date of export.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must suspend an export permit without prior notice if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the dealer’s licence is suspended;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the suspension is necessary to protect public health or safety, including to prevent a controlled drug from being diverted to an illicit market or use; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the exportation would contravene the laws of the country of final destination or any country of transit or transhipment.

Subsection.Text: The suspension takes effect as soon as the Minister sends the licensed dealer a notice that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sets out the reasons for the suspension;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: gives the dealer an opportunity to be heard; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, specifies the corrective measures that must be carried out and the date by which they must be carried out.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must reinstate the export permit if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the suspension is no longer necessary.
Subject to subsection (2), the Minister must revoke an export permit if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer requests the Minister to do so or informs the Minister of the loss or theft of the permit or the actual or potential unauthorized use of the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer does not carry out the corrective measures specified by the Minister under paragraph G.02.047(2)(c) by the specified date;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has contravened a term or condition of the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the licensed dealer submitted false or misleading information or false or falsified documents in or in support of the application for the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
